original: Val's Research Notes
string: 瓦尔的研究笔记

original:
Research Notes on the Manipulation of Reality Through Sound

(The pages are densely covered in Val's handwriting and appear to be his detailed field observations on the uses and affects of the Thu'um in comparison to the applications of Dwemer Tonal Architecture.)
string:
关于通过声音操纵现实的研究笔记

（这几页密密麻麻地写满了瓦尔的笔迹，似乎是他对吐姆的用途和影响与锻莫音调建筑的应用进行比较后得出的详细实地观察结果。

original: Conjuration Ethics
string: 幻术伦理

original:
Ethical Considerations in Summoning and Conjuration by Valerius Serano

Black soul gems... What happens to the soul? Is the person aware of what has happened? Slavery?? Can they still have an afterlife? White souls... Not sentient; simply death in another form or cruelty? Undead... What animates them? Similar concerns to black soul gems. Is there a difference between undead constructs and reanimating intact remains? Magical animation not the same as a soul. Bound objects... Only Daedra, but also not a voluntary bargain... Dwemer Constructs... A subset needing further consideration...
string:
召唤和施法中的道德考量 作者：塞拉诺·瓦列利乌斯

黑色灵魂宝石…灵魂会怎样？那个人知道发生了什么吗？被奴役？他们还能有来世吗？ 白人的灵魂…没有知觉；仅仅是另一种形式的死亡或残忍？ 亡灵…是什么让它们有生命？类似于黑色灵魂宝石的问题。不死生物与复活完整遗体之间有区别吗？魔法动画与灵魂不同。 绑定物体…只有大德拉，但也不是自愿交易… 锻莫建筑…需要进一步考虑的子集…

original: Black Book: Sailor's Bargain
string: 黑暗经书：水手的交易

original:
Sailor's Bargain by the Drowned

[pagebreak]

eneath the waves lies the deep, the cold, seek it out. Depths of the mind that the denizens know, did know, will know. Cast within, exhale, the deep, the dying of the light, the dying of breath, the dying of self...
string:
水手的交易 溺水者

[pagebreak]

波涛之下蕴藏着深邃和寒冷，去寻找吧。他们知道、曾经知道、将要知道的心灵深处。向内，呼气，深渊，光的消逝，呼吸的消逝，自我的消逝…

original: A Grandmotherly Letter
string: 一封来自祖母的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont">
My dear son,

I remember the day you were born like it was yesterday. I held you as a tiny baby in my arms, and my whole world changed for the better in that instant. Despite how tall you've managed to grow, and how you're long since grown up, you will always be that sweet little baby to me. Now that you have your own child, I hope you will experience all the same joy and richness in your life as she grows.

Give a big hug to Ravani for me, and tell her that I love her.

Love,
Grandma Elin.</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont">
我亲爱的儿子

我记得你出生的那一天，就像昨天一样。我把你这个小宝宝抱在怀里，那一瞬间，我的整个世界都变了。尽管你已经长高了，也早已长大成人，但对我来说，你永远是那个可爱的小宝宝。现在你也有了自己的孩子，我希望在她成长的过程中，你也能体验到同样的快乐和丰富的人生。

代我给拉瓦妮一个大大的拥抱，告诉她我爱她。

爱你的
奶奶伊琳。

original: Scrap of Paper
string: 一张废纸

original: Serano is to be captured alive and taken to the Sightless Pit. Your means and methods are unimportant. Get it done.
string: 要活捉塞拉诺，把他带到无眼之坑。你的手段和方法并不重要，完成任务。

original: A Joyous Letter
string: 一封快乐的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont">
My dear Valerius,

Congratulations on your recent marriage! My only son... married at last. Lady Mara be praised.

Now, I can only assume that in your haste to wed, you forgot I would not want to set foot on THAT ship? You and your father always did love that ship more than anything... I hope one day I will meet your beloved myself, because I have a thing or two to warn them about being married to a sailor!

I'm so sorry your father was... difficult... about your happiness. I know he would never have left either of you in peace. I wish... well, Tarek made his choices and my tears of sadness were done long ago. I'd rather spend my tears on happiness for your future!

Give Fathis my best as well as a hug. And, do visit me in Cyrodiil soon!

Best Wishes and Love,
Mother</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont">
亲爱的瓦列利乌斯

恭喜你新婚燕尔我唯一的儿子…终于结婚了。赞美玛拉女士

我只能假设你急着结婚 ，却忘了我不想踏上那艘船？和你父亲一直都很喜欢那艘船…我希望有一天我能见到你的爱人 因为我有一两件事可以提醒他们 不要嫁给水手

我很遗憾你父亲…对你的幸福…很难办。我知道他不会让你们平静地生活的我希望…塔里克做出了他的选择 我伤心的眼泪早就流干了我宁愿把眼泪花在你们未来的幸福上

代我向法提斯问好，并给他一个拥抱。还有，请尽快来赛罗迪尔看我！

最美好的祝愿和爱、
母亲</font>

original: Bounty for White River Watch
string: 白河望悬赏令

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont">BOUNTY

To all able-bodied men and women of Whiterun:

Brigands at White River Watch have been robbing travelers on the road. Any adventurers who kill these bandits shall be entitled to all the goods within the fort as a reward.

- Proventus Avenicci, by order of Jarl Balgruuf</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont">悬赏令

致白漫城所有健壮的男男女女

白河望的强盗在路上抢劫旅客。任何杀死这些强盗的冒险者都有权获得要塞内的所有物品作为奖励。

-普罗万图斯总管，奉领主巴尔古夫之命</font>

original: Tattered Journal
string: 破烂的日记

original:
Journal - Volume 4 Property of Fathis Indaryn

[pagebreak] 4E 198 - Solstheim I managed to remove the amulet. That burn on my chest is going to leave a nasty scar. The worst of the pain's faded, but the Prince's voice hasn't. I wish I'd never found the cursed thing. At first, it seemed simple enough to send Molag Bal a few souls from those merchant fetchers we were killing anyway. The perks were worth it. Tarek only ever cared about results, and most days Val doesn't seem much different. Of course he's 'Captain Serano' now. Bah. The problems started when I killed Zirik over a game of cards. The s'wit was cheating and thought I wouldn't notice. I just meant to give him a good beating, teach him a lesson, but I couldn't stop! The next thing I remember was Val pulling me off what was left of Zirik. He was angry, wanted to know what happened. But what could I have said? The next day, Molag Bal demanded my brother's soul, too. There was a time when me and Val always watched each other's backs. Swore we were brothers in all the ways that mattered, blood and Tarek's half-truths be damned. Then he was gone from the Rose for that year. It was just me left to deal with Tarek. I thought I could handle him as well as Val did, but I was wrong. And both of them forgot I existed the second Val set foot back on the ship. Sometimes, I just want to tell him the whole story. He's smart, he knows things. Maybe he could figure something out? If nothing else, no matter what he did, at least this nightmare would be over and I wouldn't owe Molag Bal a damn thing.
string:
期刊--第 4 卷 法提斯·因达伦的财产

[pagebreak] 4E 197 - 索瑟海姆 我设法取下了护身符，我胸口的烧伤会留下一道难看的疤痕。最严重的疼痛已经消失了，但声音还没消失。真希望我从来没找到过那该死的东西。 给莫拉格·巴尔送几个那些被我们杀死的可怜人身上的灵魂似乎很简单。问题是从我在牌局上杀了齐里克开始的。那个机灵鬼出老千，以为我不会注意到。我只是想狠狠揍他一顿，给他点教训，但我停不下来！接着我记得瓦尔把我从齐里克身上拉下来。他很生气，想知道发生了什么事…但我能说什么呢？ 第二天，莫拉格·巴尔也要了我哥哥的灵魂。

original: A Proud Letter
string: 一封骄傲的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont">
My dearest Valerius,

I am so proud to hear we have a COLLEGE STUDENT in the family! At Winterhold, no less! I always knew that you could do anything you wanted if you set your mind to it. You will make a skilled and wise mage some day, my son. I am so proud of you.

With all my love,
Mother</font>

我最亲爱的瓦列利乌斯

听说我们家出了个大学生，我感到非常自豪！而且还是在冬堡我一直都知道，只要你下定决心，你可以做任何你想做的事。有朝一日你会成为技艺精湛的睿智法师 我的孩子我为你感到骄傲

献上我全部的爱

My dear Valerius,

Thanks to Lady Mara, I've arrived safely at home. I wouldn't believe that you are married at last if I hadn't seen it myself! It was a wonderful ceremony and I was so glad to have met your beloved in person.

I'm so sorry your father was... difficult... about your happiness. I know he would never have left either of you in peace. I wish... well, Tarek made his choices and my tears of sadness were done long ago. I'd rather spend my tears on happiness for your future!

Please visit me in Cyrodiil soon... and maybe bring some grandchildren, too?

Best Wishes and Love,
Mother</font>

亲爱的瓦列利乌斯

我很遗憾你的父亲对你们的幸福…很…为难。我知道他不会让你们平静地生活的我希望…塔里克做出了他的选择。我的悲伤之泪早就流尽了，我宁愿把眼泪花在你们未来的幸福上

original: On the Nature of Nymics
string: 论尼米克斯的本质

original:
[pagebreak]

On the Nature of Nymics A Telvanni mage's thoughts on Daedric Nymics by Divayth Fyr

[pagebreak]

uring the course of my studies, I often find myself dealing with Daedric beings. In fact, I know of no living mortal better acquainted with Daedra than myself. Now, in some of the more backward realms of Tamriel, that might be taken as an admission of depraved intentions. After all, Daedric cultists are responsible for some of the worst villainy to be found in the world of mortals. To that charge, I would point out that I am selective about which Daedric powers I consult with, and I certainly do not worship any of them. Daedric beings are not evil as we mortals understand the concept simply because they are Daedra. Their evil emerges from the portfolios and concepts they embody. Which brings me to the fascinating and obscure topic of Daedra and their nymics. A Daedra's nymic�or incantatory true name, as it is sometimes thought of�is not a mere appellation. A mortal can change their name as easily as donning a new hat. Every day, someone fleeing a vengeful enemy or hoping to start over in a new land adopts a useful alias. Daedra, however, are defined by their true names. They cannot abandon or change them, any more than you could abandon your body or dismiss your consciousness. (Well, there are ways to do such things, but my point remains.) In fact, even when a Daedra's physical form is utterly annihilated, its nymic endures. This might lead you to think of a nymic as a soul of sorts, but that would be a serious misconception. A mortal soul can easily be moved from one housing to another with some rather elementary magic. And a mortal might choose to change their ways, abandoning old desires and ambitions to take on new ones. A nymic, however, can only be manifested again in its one changeless form. For example, a Daedric Prince such as Mehrunes Dagon cannot just choose to stop being a god of destruction. That element of his portfolio defines him for all time. If destroyed, his nymic will eventually reconstitute exactly as he was before. Therefore, a nymic might best be thought of as a pattern or formula that defines the being created when it manifests itself from the eternal chaos of Oblivion. Now, this is where the subject becomes really interesting. With the right sort of magic, you can edit the pattern. Alter the nymic and you alter the Daedra defined by it. A truly capable mage who learns a Daedra's complete nymic could change its loyalties, limit its powers, anchor it into a different physical form (such as an object of some kind), or simply disperse it altogether. Obviously, the more powerful the Daedra and the more complex the nymic, the more difficult it is to carry out such alterations. But that is why all Daedra fear the possibility of an enemy learning their nymic. And why they guard them so preciously.
string:
[pagebreak]

论尼米克的本质 一位泰瓦尼法师对迪德拉尼米克的思考 作者 迪维斯·菲尔

[pagebreak]

在我的研究过程中,我经常会遇到迪德拉生物。事实上,我知道没有哪位凡人比我更了解迪德拉。现在,在塔姆瑞尔的一些较为落后的地区,这可能被视为一种堕落意图的承认。毕竟,达德里克崇拜者是世界上最糟糕的恶行之一的责任方。 对此指控,我会指出我在咨询哪些迪德拉力量时非常挑剔,而且我绝不崇拜任何一位。迪德拉生物并非我们凡人所理解的邪恶,仅仅因为它们是迪德拉而已。它们的邪恶源于它们所体现的职责和概念。这就引出了一个迷人且晦涩的话题:迪德拉及其尼米克。 迪德拉的尼米克——或称为咒语真名,正如有时所认为的那样——并非仅仅是个称谓。凡人可以像换帽子一样轻易更改自己的名字。每天都有逃离报复性敌人的人或希望在新土地上重新开始的人采用一个实用的化名。然而,达德拉以其真名为定义。他们无法放弃或改变它们,就像你不能放弃身体或抛弃意识一样。(当然,有方法可以做到,但我的观点仍然成立。)事实上,即使迪德拉的肉体被彻底消灭,它的尼米克也会存续。 这可能让你把尼米克视为某种灵魂,但那将是一个严重的误解。凡人灵魂可以很容易地用一些相当基础的魔法从一个居所转移到另一个。而凡人也可能选择改变自己的方式,放弃旧有的欲望和抱负,去承担新的。 然而,尼米克只能以其唯一不变的形式再次显现。例如,像梅鲁涅斯·大衮这样的迪德拉君王并不能仅凭意愿停止成为毁灭之神。他的职责元素定义了他永远。若被摧毁,他的尼米克最终会完全恢复到原来的模样。因此,尼米克最好被视为一种模式或形式，定义了当它从无尽混沌的湮灭显现时所创造的存在。 现在,这里主题变得非常有趣。有了合适的魔法,你可以编辑图案。改变尼米克就能改变由其定义的迪德拉。一位真正称职的巫师,如果学会了迪德拉完整的尼米克,便可更改它的忠诚、限制其力量、将其锚定到不同的物理形态(例如某种物体),或直接将其散解。显然,迪德拉越强大、尼米克越复杂,执行此类改变就越困难。 但正因如此,所有迪德拉都害怕敌人学会他们的尼米克,并因此把它们视为珍宝加以守护。

original: A Simple Letter
string: 一封简单的信

original:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont">
My dear Valerius,

I received your letter and as always, I'm relieved to know that you are alive and safe. My deepest condolences for the loss of your friend and shipmate, Fathis. I know you two were once close, even if things had changed in recent years.

While at the Temple, I prayed to Lady Mara that Fathis find the peace in his afterlife that he never had while he was alive.

Now, as you no doubt remember because I've told you many times, I am well aware of how you get your wealth and I will not accept blood money. That part of my life is long past. Accordingly, I've donated the latest gold you sent to the orphanage.

Please do write more often, and perhaps come for a visit? It's been too long.

With all of my love and affection,
Mother</font>
string:
<font face="$HandwrittenFont">
亲爱的瓦列利乌斯

我收到了你的来信，得知你还活着，而且平安无事，我如释重负。我对你的朋友法提斯的死表示最深切的哀悼。我知道你们曾经很要好，尽管近年来情况有所改变。

你肯定还记得，因为我已经告诉过你很多次，我很清楚你的财富是怎么来的，我不会接受血债血偿。我的那段生活早已成为过去。因此，我把你最近送来的金子捐给了孤儿院。

在神庙里，我祈祷法提斯能在来世找到他生前从未有过的平静。我惊愕地收到了来自玛拉女士本人的启示！我不知道这意味着什么，但你的朋友没有来世。一定是出了什么事，我想你应该知道。

请常写信给我，或许还能来看看我？好久不见了

带着我所有的爱和深情
母亲</font>

Journal - Volume 6 Property of Fathis Indaryn

Do NOT read - ARNE THIS MEANS YOU! [pagebreak] 4E 201 - at sea I've had about all I can take of 'Captain Serano.' He's always had to do things his own way, but enough is enough! Instead of raiding, he has us climbing through collapsing ruins, fighting draugr and haunted Dwemer machines, just to collect some stupid bauble we only get paid for months later. I don't care if it is more gold, it's hard work. Dangerous, too. What's wrong with some honest piracy for a change? I miss the old days when we would just kill some merchants, take their cargo, and burn the ship to the water line. Maybe ransom a few of the wealthy types and let the rest float home in a rowboat. Simple. Quick. Profitable. Anway, I've got my own problems. Val's not like he used to be. Can't talk to him anymore. He's gone soft and it's going to get us all sent to the headsman's block or worse. Something has to be done about it. It's risky, but I'll have to find the old captain; he's the only one that can manage it. I heard he was in Solitude recently...

请勿阅读--阿恩，这是说你！ [pagebreak] 4E 201 - 在海上 塞拉诺船长一直是个怪人，但已经够了！如果不是爬过坍塌的废墟与尸鬼搏斗，不是与闹鬼的锻莫机器搏斗，那就是一些毫无价值的小玩意儿，船长只能在几个月后才给我们报酬。我才不管那是不是更多的金币，那是艰苦的工作。换换口味，做个诚实的海盗不好吗？我很怀念以前的日子，我们杀了一些商人，拿走他们的东西，然后把他们的船烧成灰烬。简单。快速。有利可图 再说，我也有自己的问题 瓦尔跟以前不一样了 再也不能和他说话了 我想知道老船长-- 不，太危险了，甚至不能写信。我听说他最近在独孤城…

original: A Summoner's Guide to Nymics
string: 召唤者的尼米克斯指南

original:
[pagebreak]

A Summoner's Guide to Nymics by Cipher Sethali An overview of nymics in relation to Daedra and summoning

[pagebreak]

very arcane student knows that Daedra are perilous to deal with. Only the bravest heroes or most accomplished mages dare face a powerful Daedra in battle. But each Daedra possesses a secret vulnerability that can deliver it into the hands of the clumsiest apprentice: its nymic, or true name. Armed with knowledge of a Daedra's nymic, a mortal can imprison, banish, or compel a Daedra who otherwise could crush its summoner like an insect. In general, simple-minded Daedra have but a single nymic. Daedra of stronger will and purpose have two, three, or even more nymics. A mortal mage must make use of each one in order to bend the Daedra to his or her will. The portions of a nymic are as follows. The first and simplest nymic is the protonymic. Some scholars believe the protonymic is a description of kindred or species for creatures who lack the self-awareness to identify themselves as individuals. This seems doubtful, however. Surely, not all daedrats possess the same name. More sophisticated Daedra possess a neonymic as well as a protonymic. Creatures such as Dremora, Skaafin, or Watchers can be checked (or angered) by the use of their protonymic alone, but a summoner must also use the creature's neonymic to be certain of banishing it. In addition, many intelligent Daedra also possess tribunymics and hieronymics that indicate the creature's affiliations and its rank. To a Daedra, these are more than mere titles; they are integral parts of the creature's identity. Whether a mortal summoner strictly needs these nymics is a rather murky question, but it's best to assume that one should learn everything that can be known about a Daedra before one attempts to use its nymic. It's rumored that Daedric Princes possess nymics beyond the protonymic and neonymic. These serve as additional layers of protection against adversaries who think to compel such a being to do their bidding. If these nymics exist, they are certainly powerful and guarded with extreme care. Finally, let your humble scribe add a warning: To use a nymic is to make an enemy. Daedra bitterly resent those who exercise power over them in this way. In fact, it's exceedingly dangerous to even write a Daedra's nymic. Should that Daedra learn even part of its name has been recorded somewhere, it will stop at nothing to destroy the writing and punish the mortal who dared to set it down.
string:
[pagebreak]

召唤师的尼米克指南 作者：赛法·塞萨利 关于尼米克与迪德拉及召唤术的关联概述

[pagebreak]

每个奥术学徒都深知，与迪德拉打交道是极其危险的。唯有最勇敢的英雄或最精通的法师，才敢在战场上直面强大的迪德拉。但每只迪德拉都藏着致命的弱点，足以让最笨拙的学徒将其擒获——那就是它的真名：尼米克。 掌握了迪德拉的尼米克知识后，凡人便能囚禁、驱逐或胁迫迪德拉——否则这些迪德拉足以像碾死昆虫般摧毁召唤者。通常而言，头脑简单的迪德拉仅有一条尼米克。意志更坚强、目标更明确的迪德拉则拥有两条、三条甚至更多尼米克。凡人法师必须逐一利用这些尼米克，才能迫使迪德拉屈从于己意。 尼米克的组成部分如下。 最原始且最简单的命名法是原生命名法。部分学者认为，原生命名法是对缺乏自我意识、无法将自身识别为个体的生物所做的物种或种类描述。然而这种观点似乎值得商榷——毕竟并非所有迪德拉都拥有相同的名称。 更高级的迪德拉既拥有原名，也拥有新名。诸如魔人、斯卡芬或守望者之类的生物，仅使用其原名便可对其施加控制（或激怒），但召唤者必须同时使用该生物的新名，才能确保将其驱逐。 此外，许多智慧的迪德拉还拥有表明其所属阵营与等级的"三名"与"位名"。对迪德拉而言，这些远非单纯的头衔，而是构成其身份认同的核心要素。凡人召唤者是否必须严格遵循这些名号尚存争议，但最佳做法是：在尝试运用迪德拉名号前，务必尽可能全面掌握该迪德拉的所有信息。 据传，迪德拉君王拥有超越原名与新名的额外名号。这些名号构成额外的防护层，抵御企图胁迫此类存在为己效力的敌人。倘若这些名号确有其事，它们必然威力非凡且受到严密守护。 最后，容卑微的撰稿人提醒一句：使用尼米克即招致仇敌。迪德拉对以这种方式掌控其力量者怀有刻骨仇恨。事实上，仅仅书写迪德拉的尼米克便已极其危险。倘若某位迪德拉察觉其名号的任何部分被记录于世，它必将不惜一切代价摧毁记录，并惩罚胆敢书写的凡人。

original: Yes, fellow Nightingale?
string: 嗯，夜莺同袍？

original: What is it?
string: 什么？

original: Where would I go to join up?
string: 我应该去哪加入？

original: Well I can't just tell that to any skeever that washes up.
string: 嗯，我不能就这样告诉所有自己跑来的恶鼠。

original: From the look of you, I'm guessing you're more looking to cause some trouble for the Horkers.
string: 从你的样子看来，我想你是来找我们的麻烦。

original: Care to take a look around? This is not, I dare say, the Solitude botanical gardens. Have you any idea where you are? Where you truly are?
string: 想四处看看吗？我敢说这可不是独孤城的植物园。知道自己在哪儿吗？到底在哪儿啊？

original: Welcome to the deceptively verdant mind of the Emperor Pelagius III. That's right! You're in the head of a dead, homicidally insane monarch.
string: 欢迎来到皇帝佩拉吉奥斯三世这颗稚嫩的心灵。没错！你在一个死了的，疯子皇帝的脑子里。

original: Now, I know what you're thinking. Can I still rely on my swords and spells and sneaking and all that nonsense? Sure, sure. Or... you could use...
string: 我知道你在想什么。我还能依靠剑和魔法还有那些小花招吗？当然，当然。或者…你还可以用…

original: The Wabbajack! Huh? Huh? Didn't see that coming, did you?
string: 瓦巴杰克！嗯？嗯？没料到吧？是不是？

original: I once captained a ship called the Argent Raptor. She struck an iceberg and went down, just north of Windhelm.
string: 我曾经是银色猛禽号的船长。她撞上冰山，在风舵城北面沉没了。

original: I take it you never used the Pilgrim's Path.
string: 我猜你从未走过“朝圣之路”吧。

original: It wasn't created for the Nightingales. It was created to test those who wished to serve Nocturnal in other ways.
string: 因为它并非为了夜莺而建。而是用来试炼那些希望以其他方式服务诺克图娜尔的人。

original: As a consequence, I have no knowledge of what you'll be facing.
string: 因此，我也不知道你会面对什么。

original: Karliah-
string: 卡莱亚-

original: Tell me about Nocturnal.
string: 告诉我关于诺克图娜尔的事。

original: You have nothing to fear from me. (Persuade)
string: 你不必怕我。（说服）

original: Listen, lad. There's one last piece of business we need to settle before we go after Mercer... the leadership of the Guild.
string: 听着，小子。在我们对付墨瑟前还有最后一件事要解决……关于公会的领导权。

original: Listen, lass. There's one last piece of business we need to settle before we go after Mercer... the leadership of the Guild.
string: 听着，姑娘。在我们对付墨瑟前还有最后一件事要解决……关于公会的领导权。

original: I have two others that wish to transact the Oath; to serve you both in life and in death.
string: 我和另外二人希望宣读誓言，此生来世都为您效忠。

original: I have another that wants to transact the Oath; to serve you both in life and in death.
string: 我还有另一位想要办理誓约;愿在生与死中为你们服务。

original: There's no going back?
string: 没法后悔吗？

original: Once the Oath has been struck, the terms are binding.
string: 一旦誓约生效，条款就具有约束力了。

original: Knowing this, are you ready to undergo the ceremony?
string: 知道这些后，准备好接受仪式了吗？

original: Yes?
string: 嗯？

original: What about you? Are you ready to transact the Oath with Nocturnal?
string: 你呢？你准备好和诺克图娜尔交换誓言了吗？

original: Now that you've transacted the Oath, it's time to reveal the final piece of the puzzle to you; Mercer's true crime.
string: 现在你宣誓完毕，也是时候向你解释谜题的最后一部分了，墨瑟的真正罪行。

original: It's time to reveal the final piece of the puzzle to you; Mercer's true crime.
string: 是时候向你揭示谜题的最后一块了;墨瑟的真实罪行。

original: Yes, I am sure. I will give you a good death.
string: 没错，我确定。我会让你死得体体面面的。

original: Hmm. We shall see.
string: 嗯。那就看看吧。

original: Where did you come from?
string: 你是从哪儿来的？

original: Where am I? You! Out with it, then.
string: 我这是在哪里？你！快说。

original: You... You are not Aren, are you? Has he sent you in his place?
string: 你…不是阿冉？是他派你来的？

original: Have you returned, Aren? My old friend?
string: 你回来了啊，阿冉？老朋友？

original: Wo meyz wah dii vul junaar?
string: 沃 梅兹 瓦 蒂依 维尔 琼那？

original: Then let's get to it.
string: 那我们出发吧。

original: I've been pouring over the plans you brought us, and I'm convinced the Eyes of the Falmer are in the dwarven ruins at Irkngthand.
string: 我一直在看你带回来的计划书，伐莫之眼应该就在矮人遗迹厄金坦德里。

original: Karliah and I will meet you there. Prepare yourself, lad. This will be a fight to remember!
string: 我和卡莱亚去那里等你。自己做好准备吧，小子。这将是难忘的一战！

original: I've been pouring over the plans you brought us, and I'm convinced the Eyes of the Falmer are in the dwarven ruins at Irkngthand.
string: 我一直在看你带回来的计划书，伐莫之眼应该就在矮人遗迹厄金坦德里。

original: Karliah and I will meet you there. Prepare yourself, lass. This will be a fight to remember!
string: 我和卡莱亚去那里等你。自己做好准备吧，姑娘。这将是难忘的一战！

original: No, it's not right.
string: 不，这样不对。

original: Look. Everyone in the Guild admires what you've done. Maybe they won't come out and simply tell you, but I promise you it's true.
string: 听着。公会所有人都很欣赏你所做的一切。也许他们不会直截了当跟你说，但我保证这是真的。

original: And now they know Mercer never genuinely cared about the Guild. He lacked the loyalty you obviously possess.
string: 现在他们知道了墨瑟从未真正关心过公会。他缺乏你这样明显的忠诚。

original: I can't think of anyone better.
string: 我想不出更好的人选了。

original: I don't know what to say.
string: 我不知道该说什么。

original: Well, we have a bit of an errand to run before your coronation, so don't get sentimental on me now.
string: 好吧，在你接任前咱们还有些事要办，所以现在先别对着我多愁善感了。

original: Me? What about you?
string: 我？那你呢？

original: I've been at this game a long time, my friend. A long time. I've stolen trinkets from nobles and framed priests for murder.
string: 我干这行很久了，朋友。很长时间。我偷过贵族的饰品还诬陷过祭司谋杀。

original: I'm good at what I do, maybe even one of the best. But it's all I know.
string: 我很擅长这行的工作，也许还是最好的那种。但这是我的极限了。

original: I've never been one to lead. Never desired it, never cared for it. Don't want it.
string: 我从没当过领袖。也从没这样想过，从来没有。一点也不想干。

original: A drinking contest? You don't stand a chance!
string: 比酒量？你赢不了我！

original: Ha! We'll see about that. This is a special brew, very strong stuff. Let's get started.
string: 哈！我们走着瞧吧。这可是特制的烈酒。我们开始吧。

original: Agna once told me there is a secret room deeper in where they buried disgraced members of the family. Maybe that will get us into the main chamber...
string: 阿格娜告诉过我，在更深的地方有个秘密房间，那里埋葬了名誉扫地的家族成员们。也许那里能让我们进入主墓室…

original: All right, hand over your valuables, or I'll gut you like a fish.
string: 好了，把值钱的东西都交出来，不然我像宰鱼一样把你剁了。

original: This is fun.
string: 很有趣。

original: Very well. I name your initiates Nightingale and I restore your status to the same, Karliah.
string: 很好。我给予你的新加入者夜莺之身份，并恢复你地位，卡莱亚。

original: And in the future, I'd suggest you refrain from disappointing me again.
string: 希望以后你别再让我失望了。

original: Very well. I name your initiate Nightingale and I restore your status to the same, Karliah.
string: 很好。我给予你的新加入者夜莺之身份，并恢复你地位，卡莱亚。

original: And in the future, I'd suggest you refrain from disappointing me again.
string: 希望以后你别再让我失望了。

original: May I ever return to Nightingale Hall?
string: 我还能再去夜莺大厅吗？

original: Yes. Now that you're a Nightingale, you may consider this your home.
string: 可以。既然你已经成为夜莺了，这里就是你的家。

original: You'll find that this place offers many things that will help you in your endeavors as well as a wealth of information for you to learn.
string: 你会发现这里能够给你许多帮助，还有丰富的知识供你学习。

original: Once the Skeleton Key has been restored to the Twilight Sepulcher, I'll make this place my home as well.
string: 万能钥匙还回黄昏坟墓之后，我也会在这里安家的。

original: Yes.
string: 没错。

original: You'll find that this place offers many things that will help you in your endeavors as well as a wealth of information for you to learn.
string: 你会发现这里能够给你许多帮助，还有丰富的知识供你学习。

original: Once the Skeleton Key has been restored to the Twilight Sepulcher, I'll make this place my home.
string: 万能钥匙还回黄昏坟墓之后，我也会在这里安家的。

original: I don't feel stronger.
string: 我没有感觉到变强啊。

original: With the Skeleton Key missing from the Twilight Sepulcher, I'm afraid Mercer's seen to it that none of us can benefit from Nocturnal's gifts.
string: 黄昏坟墓的万能钥匙不见了，恐怕墨瑟已经害得我们没人能从诺克图娜尔的赐福中获益了。

original: I guess we're Nightingales now.
string: 咱们现在是夜莺了吧。

original: Aye, and some of what Karliah said is starting to make sense.
string: 是啊，卡莱亚的话开始说得通了。

original: Mercer may have damaged our reputation and raided our coffers, but this goes well beyond even his twisted form of larceny.
string: 墨瑟虽然损害了咱们的声誉，还窃取了资金，但这和他扭曲了盗窃的形式比起来，简直微不足道。

original: Old Delvin kept calling it a curse and we all laughed at him. Looks like the joke's on us.
string: 老戴尔文一直说这是诅咒，我们都嘲笑他。现在看来可笑的是我们。

original: Aye, and some of what Karliah said is starting to make sense.
string: 是啊，卡莱亚的话开始说得通了。

original: Mercer may have damaged our reputation and raided our coffers, but this goes well beyond even his twisted form of larceny.
string: 墨瑟虽然损害了咱们的声誉，还窃取了资金，但这和他扭曲了盗窃的形式比起来，简直微不足道。

original: Delvin kept calling it a curse and we all laughed at him. Looks like the joke's on us.
string: 戴尔文一直说这是诅咒，我们都嘲笑他。现在看来可笑的是我们。

original: I guess you're a Nightingale now.
string: 我猜你现在是夜莺了。

original: Where will you be from now on?
string: 你今后去哪儿？

original: I've decided to make my home at Nightingale Hall. Since it's your home as well, I hope to see you and Brynjolf there.
string: 我决定在夜莺大厅安家。而且那里也是你们的家，希望你和布林乔夫也常回去看看。

original: Of course, I may visit some of Skyrim's cities to "acquire" things from time to time. Can't afford to get rusty, now can we?
string: 当然，我也会时不时拜访天际各城去“获取”些东西。总不能让手艺生疏了，对吧？

original: I've decided to make my home at Nightingale Hall. I hope to see you and Brynjolf there.
string: 我决定把家设在夜莺大厅。我希望在那里见到你和布里恩约夫。

original: Of course, I may visit some of Skyrim's cities to "acquire" things from time to time. Can't afford to get rusty, now can we?
string: 当然，我也会时不时拜访天际各城去“获取”些东西。总不能让手艺生疏了，对吧？

original: Yes, Nightingale, what is it?
string: 嗯，夜莺，怎么了吗？

original: What is it?
string: 什么？

original: It's been returned to the Sepulcher.
string: 被送回坟墓了。

original: That's it then. After all of those years of helplessly watching the Guild decline.
string: 这样就好。无助地看着公会衰落了这么多年。

original: But enough of that... I'm confident that with you in charge, we'll soon have more gold than we could possibly spend.
string: 但已经到头了……相信在你的领导下，咱们的金子很快就要多得花不完了。

original: That's it then. After all of those years of helplessly watching the Guild decline.
string: 这样就好。无助地看着公会衰落了这么多年。

original: But enough of that... I'm confident that we'll soon have more gold than we could possibly spend.
string: 但别再说这些了......我确信我们很快就会拥有比花费更多的金币。

original: About the secrecy of the Nightingales...
string: 关于夜莺的秘密……

original: I think by now, most within the Guild are well aware of what transpired between Mercer Frey and ourselves.
string: 我想公会里大多数人都知道我们和墨瑟·弗雷之间发生了什么。

original: The notion that the Nightingales are a fictive group has long since passed.
string: 夜莺是虚构团体的观念早已成为过去。

original: If you wish to wear your Nightingale Armor within the Guild, I'm certain that no one would give it a second thought.
string: 就算你想在公会里穿上夜莺的护甲，也不会有人在意的。

original: There's an inn at Kynesgrove - the Braidwood. I hear they serve a nice dark ale. Nothing on the Sleeping Giant, of course.
string: 在凯娜之林有家辫枝旅店，听说那里的黑麦芽酒不错。当然啦，比不上我们沉睡巨人。

original: I'm glad you were willing to trust me. I know it probably wasn't the best way to introduce myself. But old habits... you know.
string: 很高兴你愿意信任我。我知道这样做自我介绍很不好。但你知道…积习难改啊。

original: I hope you're Dragonborn, I really do. But we'll find out soon enough.
string: 我真希望你是龙裔。我们很快就有机会证明了。

original: We may both end up dead, but at least it gets me out of Riverwood. I don't really think I'm cut out for the quiet life.
string: 也许我们活不下来。但至少它让我有机会离开河木镇。我真的不适合平静的生活。

original: Remember, we're not looking for trouble. We need to get to Kynesgrove as fast as we can.
string: 记住，不要去自寻麻烦。我们得尽快赶到凯娜之林。

original: Better to stick together. I don't want you to get yourself killed before we even get there.
string: 最好走的近一点。我可不希望你在到达前就被杀哦。

original: Can't you just get the guard to find Crescius?
string: 你就不能让卫兵去找克雷修斯吗？

original: Um, I prefer to handle these things on my own.
string: 嗯，这些事情我宁愿自己来。

original: Look, if you see Crescius, tell him to give me that pickaxe back and I'll pay you for the trouble.
string: 听着，要是你看到克雷修斯，跟他说把鹤嘴锄还给我，我会付你跑路费的。

original: Geldis Sadri wants you to try his new drink.
string: 吉迪斯·萨德利希望你尝尝他新酿的酒。

original: I sure would! It's been ages since I had a good Sujamma.
string: 我当然会，我已经很久没有喝到美味的苏贾玛了。

original: Would you like to try Geldis' new drink?
string: 您想尝尝吉迪思的新饮料吗？

original: You should follow me.
string: 你应该跟我走。

original: (hiss!)
Hitting that cold water is going to wake me up faster than a cup of coffee!
string: 冲进那冷水将比一杯咖啡更快唤醒我!

original: I really need to learn Alteration magic, because a Slowfall spell would be reassuring. Heh heh heh, eh... Too late now!
string: 我真的需要学习变形魔法,因为慢落咒语会让人安心。呵呵,呃......现在太迟了!

original: Diving is more fun than walking, especially from this 'towering' height.
string: 潜水比走路更有趣,尤其是从这“高耸”的高度。

original: It's not the fall, it's the sudden stop on the rocks; that's the trick with this dive.
string: 不是跌倒,而是岩石上的突然停顿;那才是这次跳水的诀窍。

original: A good liar never retreats; he doubles down.
string: 一个好骗子永不退缩;他会加倍努力。

original: Ahh... The sign of true compromise will be when everyone's unhappy. Good luck.
string: 啊…当每个人都不开心时，才是真正妥协的标志。祝你好运。

original: I think the Bronze Horse looks a bit like Windward. We don't have to sell it. We could display it in the Grotto.
string: 我觉得青铜马有点像迎风。我们不必卖掉它。可以把它展示在石窟里。

original: Someone's gotta touch the orb. If you're not touching it, then I'm touching it.
string: 有人必须触碰那个球体。如果你没有触碰,那就是我在触碰。

original: Maybe we shouldn't have touched it.
string: 也许我们本不该触碰它。

original: About Refugee's Rest...
string: 关于难民休息处...

original: I suppose my grandparents came through here after the Red Year with other refugees.
string: 我想我的祖父母是在红年后与其他难民一起经过这里的。

original: I don't know much about their story, aside from passing mentions my father made. He was born later, in Windhelm.
string: 关于他们的故事,我只知道我父亲提到的一些零星信息。他后来出生在温德赫尔姆。

original: Do you wish you knew more of their story?
string: 你想不想知道更多他们的故事?

original: I'm not sure I have the right. This place represents everything my father wanted to forget.
string: 我不确定自己是否有权利。这地方代表着我父亲想要遗忘的一切。

original: And me? I'm not even a full Dunmer.
string: 至于我?我甚至不是完整的达恩梅尔人。

original: What did your father tell you about your family history?
string: 你的父亲对你的家族历史说了什么?

original: I know my grandparents were Buoyant Armigers.
string: 我知道我的祖父母是活泼的徽章持有人。

original: When the Tribunal vanished, they were left with nothing. They never recovered a sense of purpose. They just existed in the Gray Quarter.
string: 当审判席消失时,他们什么都没有留下。他们从未恢复过目标感,只是在灰民区里存在。

original: Their lungs had been ravaged by ash, so they died from an illness before I was born.
string: 他们的肺被灰烬摧残,导致他们在我出生前因病去世。

original: I think my father was ashamed of them.
string: 我觉得我的父亲对他们感到羞愧。

original: I think it's important for you to know where you came from.
string: 我认为了解自己的来历很重要。

original: Heh, you know me well. I don't want to accept my father's story as the only story our family has. Maybe I don't have to.
string: 呵,你很了解我。我不想把父亲的故事当作我们家族唯一的故事。也许我不必如此。

original: I don't want to accept my father's story as the only story our family has. Maybe I don't have to.
string: 我不想把父亲的故事当作我们家族唯一的故事。也许我不必如此。

original: Our people have already lost so much. Don't lose your heritage, too.
string: 我们的人民已经失去了太多。不要也失去你的传承。

original: It's hard to honor my ancestors when I don't know who they were. I don't even have a finger bone to place in a shrine.
string: 当我不知道他们是谁时,尊敬祖先变得很困难。我甚至没有一根手指骨可以放在祭坛上。

original: You're not your father. You should decide for yourself.
string: 你不是你的父亲,你应该自己决定。

original: Tarek didn't exactly leave me anything to be proud of. I wouldn't know where to begin.
string: 塔雷克并没有给我留下值得自豪的东西。我也不知道从哪里开始。

original: Perhaps they should be forgotten. You can't live in the past.
string: 也许他们应该被遗忘。你不能活在过去。

original: True, but Dunmer should respect and honor their ancestors. How can I do that if I don't know who they were?
string: 确实,但丹莫应该尊重和纪念他们的祖先。如果我不知道他们是谁,我怎么做到呢?

original: In any case, we have our present concerns to deal with first.
string: 不管怎样,我们首先要处理当下的问题。

original: Woah! Ha ha! I can't believe that summon spell worked...
string: 哇哦！哈哈！我真不敢相信那个召唤咒语起作用了…

original: I know what I should do, but I just can't.
string: 我知道我该怎么做，但就是做不到。

original: Do whatever you think is best; I won't judge you.
string: 做你认为最好的事，我不会评判你。

original: About your fighting style...
string: 关于你的战斗方式…

original: Fight in your usual style.
string: 用你一贯的风格战斗。

original: You got it.
string: 你做到了。

original: It's what I do best!
string: 这是我最擅长的！

original: As long as you don't expect me to fight fair.
string: 只要你不指望我公平战斗。

original: I'd like you to fight as a mage.
string: 我希望你能以法师的身份战斗。

original: Hah! What, you think I went to the College of Winterhold or something?
string: 哈！怎么，你以为我上过冬堡学院什么的？

original: Sorry, uh, I can only cast with my left hand. I never got the knack with my right.
string: 对不起，呃，我只能用左手投。我从来没掌握过右手的诀窍。

original: Look, I can get by with a few things, but I'm no proper mage.
string: 听着，我可以应付一些事情，但我不是真正的法师。

original: I'll do my best.
string: 我会全力以赴。

original: That's outside my comfort zone...
string: 这超出了我的舒适范围…

original: ...but practice makes perfect.
string: …但熟能生巧。

original: My apologies in advance for, uh, any collateral damage.
string: 对于任何附带损害，我预先表示歉意。

original: Let's talk strategy...
string: 让我们来谈谈策略…

original: Let's talk about relaxing...
string: 让我们来谈谈放松…

original: That's all.
string: 这是全部了。

original: Let me know if you want to discuss it again.
string: 如果你想再讨论这个问题，请告诉我。

original: That'll do.
string: 可以了。

original: I need you to do something...
string: 我需要你做一件事…

original: I don't need anything else right now.
string: 我现在什么都不需要了。

original: I made coffee.
string: 我煮了咖啡。

original: This is why I love you.
string: 这就是我爱你的原因。

original: All I need now is a sweetroll...
string: 我现在只需要一个甜面包卷…

original: Thank the gods!
string: 感谢神灵！

original: Azura bless you.
string: 阿祖拉保佑你。

original: Praise Kynareth.
string: 赞美凯娜瑞丝！

original: I think I can function now.
string: 我想我现在可以正常工作了。

original: I hope it's strong.
string: 我希望它很结实。

original: I need you to fight quietly. No spells.
string: 我要你安静地战斗，不要使用咒语。

original: All right, but no promises if things get ugly.
string: 好吧，但如果情况不妙就不保证了。

original: I'm not sure what the point of that is once we're spotted, but you're the captain.
string: 我不知道一旦我们被发现了这样做有什么意义，但你是船长。

original: If you insist, but that's asking me to fight with one hand tied behind my back.
string: 如果你坚持，但这是要我背着一只手去战斗。

original: You got something with a sharp edge I can borrow? I'd like to clean up on the way back to civilization.
string: 你有锋利的东西可以借我吗？我想在回文明世界的路上清理一下。

original: Stealing research notes? Hnh! I'd like to see Nirya try that on me.
string: 偷研究笔记？呃啊！我倒想看看尼尔雅怎么对付我！

original: Oh? What are you working on?
string: 你在忙什么？

original: Oh... uh, this and that. Ah, just some... stuff.
string: 哦…呃，这个那个。啊，只是一些…东西。

original: We should get some sleep; tomorrow will be a busy day.
string: 我们应该睡一觉，明天会很忙。

original: Yeah, sure thing. I'll see you in the morning.
string: 好的，没问题明早见。

original: It's time to wake up. We've got a lot to do today.
string: 该起床了。我们今天有很多事情要做。

original: Ugh... I was up all night working on something. Let me sleep...
string: 唉…我整晚都在忙。让我睡会儿吧…

original: Val, get up! You're late for class!
string: 瓦尔，起来！你上课要迟到了！

original: I need coffee... there's some stuff around the room...
string: 我需要咖啡…房间里有些东西…

original: If you ever loved me, you'd get me a coffee... there's some stuff around the room...
string: 如果你爱我，你会给我一杯咖啡…房间里有些东西…

original: Okay. It'll be ready in a few minutes.
string: 好的，马上就好。

original: I think I'm in love with you...
string: 我想我爱上你了…

original: You're the love of my life...
string: 你是我一生的挚爱…

original: I'll do it, but I'm gonna complain the whole time.
string: 我会做的，但我会一直抱怨。

original: Wake me up when you're done...
string: 做完了叫醒我…

original: But you adore me. I'm a delight...
string: 但你喜欢我我很讨人喜欢…

original: On your feet, Valerius! I'm not your mother.
string: 站起来，瓦列利乌斯！我不是你妈妈。

original: Remember that time you made me hunt pirates for the godsdamned East Empire Company? I'm calling in that favor, and I. Want. A. Coffee.
string: 还记得那次你让我为该死的东帝国公司猎杀海盗吗？我想请你帮个忙，我想要一杯咖啡？

original: Fine, I'll make my own damn coffee! You don't have to be so mean about it.
string: 好吧，我自己煮该死的咖啡！你不用这么刻薄吧？

original: Let me just get the beans and prep the grinder...
string: 让我先去拿豆子，然后准备磨豆机…

original: Add some milk...
string: 加点牛奶…

original: ...there. I'm ready to go. I guess.
string: 好了，我准备好了。我想也是。

original: Here's your coffee.
string: 你的咖啡。

original: Praise Kynareth...
string: 赞美凯娜瑞丝…

original: Thank you. I'm not exactly a morning person.
string: 谢谢。我不是一个爱早起的人。

original: Why were you up all night anyway?
string: 你为什么整晚没睡？

original: Well... I had this idea for a new Conjuration spell. I just couldn't stop thinking about it.
string: 嗯…我想到了一个新的召唤系咒语。我一直绞尽脑汁在想。

original: It's a Bound Shield. I tested it last night, and it really works! Maybe you'd like to try it?
string: 这是一个束缚护盾。我昨晚测试过了，真的很有效！也许你想试试？

original: I did. Did you want to talk?
string: 我做了。你想聊聊吗?

original: I've been trying to please him my whole damn life. I used to think, if I could just show him I was good enough that he'd care. I lived for those moments when he would approve of me, when he would accept me.
string: 我整个人生都在试图取悦他。我曾经想,如果能让他觉得我是值得关心的人,他就会在乎。我活着是为了那些他认可我的时刻,那些他接受我的时刻。

original: Not for long with those wounds. You okay?
string: 那些伤口不会持续太久。你还好吗?

original: I've been trying to please him my whole damn life. I used to think, if I could just show him I was good enough that he'd care. I lived for those moments when he would approve of me, when he would accept me.
string: 我整个人生都在试图取悦他。我曾经想,如果能让他觉得我是值得关心的人,他就会在乎。我活着是为了那些他认可我的时刻,那些他接受我的时刻。

original: Your father sounds awful.
string: 你的父亲听起来很糟糕。

original: Yeah, well... He didn't really love me, he just liked that I made him look good. I was so angry. It was easier that way. Everything was supposed to be different once I became captain. Instead, it made me miserable.
string: 嗯,好吧......他并不真正爱我,他只是喜欢我让他看起来更好。我很生气。那样更容易。一切本该在我成为船长后不同。但却让我痛苦不堪。

original: That was his idea of tough love, I suppose.
string: 我想那是他所谓的严厉爱。

original: Yeah, well... He didn't really love me, he just liked that I made him look good. I was so angry. It was easier that way. Everything was supposed to be different once I became captain. Instead, it made me miserable.
string: 嗯,好吧......他并不真正爱我,他只是喜欢我让他看起来更好。我很生气。那样更容易。一切本该在我成为船长后不同。但却让我痛苦不堪。

original: I'm going to look around the library. I promise I'll be careful.
string: 我要去图书馆看看。我保证我会小心的。

original: It's not you I'm worried about.
string: 我不是担心你。

original: What do you want? Are you looking for any specific volumes?
string: 您想要什么？您是否在寻找任何特定的数量？

original: Well then look. Look all you want. You need a book? You talk to me. I don't care if you wrote it yourself.
string: 那就看吧。想看就看吧。你需要一本书吗？你跟我说，我不管你是不是自己写的。

original: Word travels fast around here. Disrupt my Arcanaeum, and I will have you torn apart by angry atronachs.
string: 这里的消息传得很快。破坏我的秘藏馆，我就用愤怒的召唤元素把你撕成碎片！

original: That can be arranged!
string: 这可以安排！

original: Hah! Mostly lies... Did Enthir put you up to this?
string: 哈！大部分都是谎言…是恩希尔让你这么做的吗？

original: Uh, okay... an apprentice here at the College. Well, isn't that interesting. You didn't die!
string: 呃，好吧…学院的学徒。很有趣吧，你没死。

original: By a Daedric Prince no less! You have a death wish? I can't ignore that.
string: 而且还是由一个大魔王所为，你想死吗？我不能无视这一点。

original: I'll let you stay... this time.
string: 我会让你留下来…这一次。

original: Just browsing.
string: 只是浏览。

original: As much as I appreciate a Conjuration lesson-
string: 虽然我很欣赏魔术课。

original: -even you have to admit I've put more books in here over the years than I've taken out.
string: -即使是你也不得不承认，这些年我放进去的书比拿出来的多。

original: Ha ha ha ha! Matter of fact, I'm a student at the College now.
string: 哈哈哈哈！事实上，我现在是学院的学生。

original: Why does everyone keep saying that to me?
string: 为什么每个人都这么对我说？

original: I took instruction where I could find it - from any source that was helpful. Of course there was a price.
string: 我从任何有帮助的渠道获得指导。当然，这是有代价的。

original: Keep away from that! It's locked for a reason.
string: 离它远点，上锁是有原因的。

original: I try to make sure as much knowledge is available as possible-
string: 我努力确保提供尽可能多的知识--

original: Trust like that is not freely given.
string: 这样的信任不是随便能给予的。

original: That's a work of art right there. The College is always searching for more of Shalidor's Writings. Masterful!
string: 这就是一件艺术品。学院一直在寻找更多沙利多的作品。大师之作。

original: Well... I... Fine. Thank you.
string: 嗯…我…好吧，谢谢。

original: So, Urag... when are you gonna let me into that restricted case behind your desk? I have a project I'm working on, and I'm getting tired of looking in the kids' section.
string: 那么，乌拉格…你打算什么时候让我进你桌子后面的禁闭室？我在做一个项目，我已经厌倦了在儿童区找东西。

original: Heh, and why is that exactly? It's not for safety.
string: 这到底是为什么呢？这不是为了安全。

original: The College has had apprentices go missing. How many this year? It's at least four, and that's just from Phinis's students.
string: 学院曾有学徒失踪。今年有多少？至少四个，这还只是菲尼斯的学生。

original: 'A mage is only as good as what he knows,' isn't that right?
string: “法师的能力取决于他所掌握的知识”，不是吗？

original: There's always a price, and I brought payment.
string: 代价总是有的，我带来了付款。

original: It's yours, in exchange for my unrestricted access to the library. With no hassles.
string: 这是你的。作为交换，我可以不受限制地使用图书馆，没有任何麻烦。

original: About Urag...
string: 关于乌拉格…

original: Him? All librarians are the same. They want more books.
string: 他？所有图书管理员都一样。他们想要更多的书。

original: You sure figured out how to get on his good side.
string: 你真会讨好他。

original: That orc will talk about Shalidor to anyone who will listen. Enthir had a particularly rare volume stashed away, and he owed me a favor.
string: 那个兽人会对任何愿意听的人谈论沙利多。恩希尔藏了一卷特别稀有的书，他欠我一个人情。

original: I can't believe you gave him that book of Shalidor's writings for free.
string: 真不敢相信你把那本沙利多的著作免费送给了他。

original: Free? I bought all the access I want to the Arcanaeum of the College! You can't put a price on that.
string: 免费的吗？我买了所有我想要的进入学院秘藏馆的权限！这可是无价之宝啊。

original: Since when are you the 'teacher's pet,' Valerius?
string: 你什么时候成了“老师的宠物”了，瓦列利乌斯？

original: Heh, don't come crying to me for help when you're begging for research scraps.
string: 嘿，别在乞讨研究废料时向我求救。

original: What did he mean about a Daedric Prince?
string: 他说的迪德拉王子是什么意思？

original: Haah. You see these tattoos on my right arm? They're not just for show.
string: 哈。看到我右臂上的纹身了吗？它们可不是摆设。

original: I've bargained with every one of those Daedra and more. And this isn't the place for this conversation.
string: 我跟所有的大魔头都讨价还价过，甚至更多这里不是谈话的地方。

original: I had a lot of professional dealings with Enthir. He has deep pockets and access to the best library in the north.
string: 我和恩希尔有很多专业上的往来。他腰缠万贯，拥有北方最好的图书馆。

original: For my own curiosity, and because I owed a debt to a Daedric Prince, I was willing to bring him whatever he needed.
string: 出于我的好奇心，也因为我欠了一位迪德拉王子的债，我愿意把他需要的任何东西带给他。

original: Urag knows a lot more about Hermaeus Mora than I gave him credit for, and he never much liked me as a result.
string: 乌拉格对赫麦尤斯·莫拉的了解比我想象的要多得多，因此他一直都不太喜欢我。

original: That said, he never caught me 'borrowing' his books without a library card, so sometimes the truth can be a convenient distraction.
string: 尽管如此，他从未发现我在没有借书证的情况下“借”过他的书，所以有时真相会让人很容易分心。

original: How does he know about you and Hermaeus Mora?
string: 他怎么知道你和赫麦尤斯·莫拉的事？

original: Wait, Val-
string: 等等，瓦尔。

original: Later, I promise.
string: 稍后，我保证。

original: About Enthir...
string: 关于恩希尔…

original: Enthir was always a good buyer for me. Paid well, wanted interesting stuff, and didn't ask questions.
string: 对我来说，恩希尔一直是个好买家。出价高，想要有趣的东西，而且不问问题。

original: Hello, Enthir. I figured I'd run into you around the College eventually.
string: 你好，恩希尔。我想我最终会在学院里遇到你。

original: Ha ha ha! No. I'm actually here to study if you can believe it.
string: 不不，如果你相信的话，我其实是来学习的。

original: Oh come on, it's still me. Even if I'm just a student... for now.
string: 拜托，我还是我即使我只是个学生…暂时的。

original: I know, I said it would be a cold day in Oblivion before I set foot in here as an apprentice...
string: 我知道，我说过在我以学徒身份踏入这里之前，湮灭会是一个寒冷的日子…

original: Well, maybe I finally realized you have a point. I'm never going to learn to cast properly with both hands if I don't, 'take it more seriously.'
string: 也许我终于明白你说的有道理。如果我不“认真对待”，就永远学不会用双手正确地投掷。

original: I think we both know I have that covered.
string: 我想我们都知道我有这个能力。

original: It's a good thing, too, because I might die of boredom waiting for some of the other students to catch up.
string: 这也是件好事，因为等其他同学跟上来，我可能会无聊死。

original: Hello! This is unexpected!
string: 你好！这真是出乎意料！

original: Congratulations on your wedding. I'm so happy for both of you.
string: 恭贺新婚了。真为你们感到高兴。

original: I'm assuming you're here for more than a social call... nothing illegal I hope? Heh heh.
string: 我猜你来这里不仅仅是为了社交…我希望没有什么违法的事情吧？嘿嘿。

original: Well now... this is unexpected!
string: 现在…这真是出乎意料！

original: This is going to be terrible for business.
string: 这对企业来说是非常糟糕的。

original: As you've said countless times before. You my friend, need practice.
string: 你已经说过无数次了，我的朋友，你需要练习。

original: Good, concentration is paramount when dealing with magical forces.
string: 很好，在与魔法力量打交道时，集中注意力是最重要的。

original: Let me give you a bit of advice: a sufficient explanation will cover almost anything.
string: 让我给你一点建议：充分的解释几乎可以涵盖一切。

original: Ha ha ha ha! I should have expected as much. Students are an unfortunate necessity of a college.
string: 哈哈哈哈！我早该料到的。学生是一所大学不幸的必需品。

original: Good luck. I'll be here if you need me.
string: 祝你好运。如果你需要帮助，就来我这儿。

original: No, and DON'T ask me again.
string: 不，别再问我了。

original: All right, if that's what you really want. Can't blame a guy for tryin'.
string: 好吧，如果这是你真正想要的。不能责怪一个人的尝试。

original: Why are you here? Let me guess, you have some 'business' to discuss? Very subtle.
string: 你为什么来这里？让我猜猜，你有什么“生意”要谈吗？非常含蓄。

original: Certainly didn't anticipate that.
string: 这当然是我始料未及的。

original: I see. This is a noble goal.
string: 我明白了。这是一个崇高的目标。

original: A standard spell for one skilled in Destruction magic is the Firebolt. Would you mind showing me?
string: 对于精通毁灭魔法的人来说，一个标准的咒语就是“火焰弹”。你能给我演示一下吗？

original: Hm. Certainly. I can teach you.
string: 嗯。当然可以。我可以教你。

original: I think you'll be a superb addition to the College. If you need any help with Destruction spells, please let me know.
string: 我想你会成为学院的优秀一员。如果你在毁灭法术方面需要任何帮助，请告诉我。

original: Ha ha. No, not anymore. I'd like to study at the College.
string: 哈哈！不，不再是了。我想去学院学习。

original: I'm self-taught, but there's magic I just haven't been able to understand on my own. I wanna change that.
string: 我是自学成才的，但有些魔法我自己无法理解。我想改变这种状况。

original: Uhm, do you have a spell book I could study for a minute?
string: 你有咒语书吗？

original: This is a lot easier with a reference book. I've got it now.
string: 有了参考书就容易多了。我现在有了。

original: How are you settling in at College?
string: 你在学院适应得怎么样？

original: Not too bad. They managed to find a room for me on the same floor as you. Let's have a look!
string: 还不错。他们给我找了个和你同一层的房间。我们去看看吧。

original: I feel more nervous about my first class than I did before my first battle.
string: 上第一节课时，我感觉比第一次战斗前还紧张。

original: Give me a minute to change; I'll feel more comfortable in some kind of armor instead of these robes.
string: 给我点时间换衣服，穿上盔甲会比这身长袍更舒服。

original: I guess I should practice combat with spells, too. Let me know if you want me to change strategy.
string: 我想我也应该练习用法术战斗。如果你想让我改变策略，请告诉我。

original: Ready to go? I need your help.
string: 准备好了吗？我需要你的帮助。

original: Born ready.
string: 生来就准备好了。

original: Always!
string: 向来如此！

original: Absolutely.
string: 当然。

original: Yeah, let's get out of here.
string: 是的，让我们离开这里。

original: Let's get under way.
string: 让我们开始吧。

original: Let's see what kind of trouble we can get in to.
string: 看看我们能惹出什么麻烦来。

original: Definitely; I was getting bored.
string: 当然了，我都快无聊死了。

original: Wait here.
string: 在这里等着。

original: Aye.
string: 好啦。

original: Follow me. Quietly.
string: 跟我来。别出声。

original: Born ready.
string: 生来就准备好了。

original: Ready to go?
string: 准备出发了吗？

original: Always!
string: 向来如此！

original: Ready to go?
string: 准备出发了吗？

original: Absolutely.
string: 当然。

original: Ready to go?
string: 准备出发了吗？

original: Yeah, let's get out of here.
string: 是的，让我们离开这里。

original: Ready to go?
string: 准备出发了吗？

original: Let's get under way.
string: 让我们开始吧。

original: Ready to go?
string: 准备出发了吗？

original: Let's see what kind of trouble we can get in to.
string: 看看我们能惹出什么麻烦来。

original: Ready to go?
string: 准备出发了吗？

original: Definitely; I was getting bored.
string: 当然，我开始感到无聊了。

original: Ready to go?
string: 准备出发了吗？

original: Buy a sailor a drink first, then I'll see about stickin' around.
string: 先给水手买杯酒，然后我再看看能不能留下来。

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: Our first round's on you, right?
string: 第一轮算你的，对吧？

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: Time for some serious drinking!
string: 是时候痛饮一番了！

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: I wonder if the food's any good here? Only one way to find out!
string: 不知道这儿的食物好不好吃？试试就知道了！

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: I'll get us some food. I don't suppose they serve Kwama eggs?
string: 我去弄点吃的来…这儿该不会有卡瓦玛蛋吧？

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: Try not to start trouble until I've finished my first drink?
string: 在我喝完第一杯酒之前，尽量不要惹麻烦？

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: Are you sure I should leave you unsupervised?
string: 你确定我应该让你一个人呆着吗？

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: Are you sure I should leave you unsupervised?
string: 你确定我应该让你一个人呆着吗？

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: Are you sure I should leave you unsupervised?
string: 你确定我应该让你一个人呆着吗？

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: Are you sure I should leave you unsupervised?
string: 你确定我应该让你一个人呆着吗？

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: Are you sure I should leave you unsupervised?
string: 你确定我应该让你一个人呆着吗？

original: Let's rest here.
string: 我们在这里休息吧。

original: Don't do anything I wouldn't do.
string: 不要做我不会做的事。

original: You're gonna leave me unsupervised?
string: 你要把我一个人留在这儿？

original: Don't have too much fun without me.
string: 没有我，别玩得太开心了。

original: Right here? I'm gettin' bored already.
string: 就在这里？我已经觉得无聊了。

original: I hate waiting.
string: 我不喜欢等待。

original: I hate waiting.
string: 我不喜欢等待。

original: As you wish.
string: 如你所愿。

original: As you wish.
string: 如你所愿。

original: Hey, Val-
string: 嗨，瓦尔-

original: Let me see your things.
string: 让我看看你的东西。

original: Can I have some of that gold you're carrying?
string: 能把你身上的金币给我一些吗？

original: What's mine is yours, love.
string: 我的就是你的，亲爱的。

original: I hope you appreciate how much I trust you, Aelyn.
string: 艾琳，希望你能明白我对你的信任有多深。

original: I hope you appreciate how much I trust you, Aelyn.
string: 艾琳，希望你能明白我对你的信任有多深。

original: I hope you appreciate how much I trust you, Aislinn.
string: 希望你能明白我对你的信任有多深，阿斯林。

original: I hope you appreciate how much I trust you, Alannah.
string: 阿兰娜，希望你能明白我对你的信任有多深。

original: I hope you appreciate how much I trust you, Alannah.

original: I'll see you around.
string: 那就再见吧。

original: Fair winds and following seas.
string: 风和日丽，风平浪静。

original: Stay out of trouble. Can't promise I will.
string: 别惹麻烦，我可不敢保证。

original: I'm only leaving so you'll miss me.
string: 我走了，你会想我的。

original: You know where to find me- NO, not the Solitude jail.
string: 你知道去哪里找我--不，不是孤独监狱。

original: Huh, that's odd. I already know this spell.
string: 奇怪，我已经会这个咒语了。

original: You've got this.
string: 你已经得到了这个。

original: I guess watching me cast that ward spell so often paid off!
string: 我想，看我经常施展守护咒，应该有收获吧！

original: Ugh, that went right down my shirt!
string: 唉，直接掉进我的衬衫里了！

original: Ow! I guess I deserved that.
string: 嗷！我想这是我活该。

original: Heh heh heh heh heh! You got me! Good throw.
string: 你打到我了！扔得好！

original: Ah! It's in my hair!
string: 在我头发里！

original: Ah! It's in my hair!
string: 在我头发里！

original: Hey! I didn't throw it at you that hard.
string: 嘿，我可没那么用力扔你。

original: Right back at ya!
string: 你回来啦！

original: Are you sure you wanna challenge me?
string: 你确定要挑战我吗？

original: I'll get you back when you least expect it.
string: 我会在你最意想不到的时候救你回来。

original: Don't start something you can't finish...
string: 不要开始你无法完成的事情…

original: I don't like to lose!
string: 我不喜欢输！

original: You can wear some of the Deathbrand Armor.
string: 你可以穿上一些死亡烙印盔甲。

original: Excellent!
string: 太好了！

original: They'll be calling this the Serano Armor soon enough.
string: 他们很快就会叫它“塞拉诺装甲”了。

original: A quick death is too good for you. Suffer and die slowly.
string: 这么快的死去太便宜你了了。你要忍受痛苦，慢慢死去。

original: Uhh. Does it feel like 'justice' to you? Gah! You don't know what game you're playing.
string: 你觉得这是“正义”吗？嘎嘎！你不知道你在玩什么游戏。

original: That's all.
string: 就是这样。

original: Suit yourself.
string: 随你便。

original: No worries.
string: 不用担心。

original: Unh. It's about time- What?
string: 啊什么？

original: Oh, it's you.
string: 啊，是你啊。

original: You're supposed to be dead.
string: 你应该已经死了。

original: Well I am! Pht, no thanks to you.
string: 我就是菲特，不用谢你。

original: What, no witticisms?
string: 什么，没有俏皮话？

original: We fought, you won. Begones, eh?
string: 我们打了一架，你赢了再见了，嗯？

original: You have got to be kidding me.
string: 你一定是在跟我开玩笑。

original: Missed me, did ya? Heh ha ha ha ha ha ha ha hah hah!
string: 想我了吧？

original: (put the soul gem back)
string: （把灵魂宝石放回去）

original: Hey. Hey! Hey! Heeey! Hey! You're just going to leave me here?! Argh, damn you to the foulest depths of Oblivion, you miserable fetcher!
string: 你就这么把我扔在这儿？去你妈的湮灭之海吧！你这个可悲的捞尸者。

original: The last time we met, you wanted me dead.
string: 我们上次见面时，你想要我死。

original: I was only testing you! I had to make sure the Serano family line was in good hands.
string: 我只是在考验你。我必须确保塞拉诺家族的血脉得到妥善传承。

original: I was only testing you! We have to be careful about the quality of our associates.
string: 我只是在考验你！我们必须注意同事的素质。

original: I had a little... mishap, just a miscalculation really, after our last meeting.
string: 上次见面后，我出了点…意外，其实就是计算错误。

original: I killed you.
string: 我杀了你。

original: Well of course. You passed the test! You're with my son after all, and he's a fine judge of character.
string: 当然，你通过测试了。毕竟你和我儿子在一起。他很会看人的。

original: Well of course. You passed the test! My son's always been good at recruitment.
string: 当然，你通过测试了。我儿子一直很擅长招聘。

original: Well of course. You passed the test! My son's always been good at recruitment.
string: 当然，你通过测试了。我儿子一直很擅长招聘。

original: I defeated you.
string: 我打败了你。

original: I hope we can put this unfortunate business behind us.
string: 我希望我们能把这件不幸的事抛在脑后。

original: Of course! We are 'family' now, after all.
string: 当然！毕竟我们现在是“一家人”了。

original: Of course, shipmate! We're like family in this business.
string: 当然，船友！在这个行业里，我们就像一家人。

original: I'm going to find someplace very unpleasant to leave this soul gem.
string: 我要找个非常不愉快的地方留下这块灵魂宝石。

original: Careful now... whoever holds this soul gem has a bit of influence over me. The boy's made a lot of enemies over the years.
string: 小心点…持有这块灵魂宝石的人对我有点影响力。这孩子这些年树敌不少。

original: It would be a crying shame if I fell into the wrong hands.
string: 如果我落入坏人之手，那就太可惜了。

original: I hate you.
string: 我恨你。

original: Is that any way to talk to your father-in-law? Heh heh heh heh heh heh hm...
string: 你就这么跟你岳父说话的吗？

original: Aw, is that any way to talk to your new shipmate? Heh heh heh heh heh heh!
string: 噢，你就这样跟你的新船友说话吗？

original: (unceremoniously drop the soul gem)
string: （毫不客气地扔掉灵魂宝石）。

original: Oh, you miserable swab! Don't just leave me here!
string: 哦，你这可悲的东西，别把我丢在这儿！

original: No risk, no reward! I can help you!
string: 无风险，无回报！我可以帮你。

original: How did you end up in a soul gem anyway?
string: 你到底是怎么进入灵魂宝石的？

original: I made a small Daedric bargain as an insurance policy, in the event of my untimely death.
string: 我做了一个小小的迪德拉交易，作为我英年早逝时的一份保险。

original: Oh here we go again. Come back to beg my forgiveness have you?
string: 又来了。又来求我原谅了？

original: This was a bad idea. (drop gem)
string: 这是一个坏主意。（掉落宝石）

original: The Daedra take you, then!
string: 魔神带走你吧。

original: What was the price?
string: 价格是多少？

original: What did it cost you.
string: 花了多少钱？

original: The amulet cursed by Molag Bal. You gave it to him.
string: 被莫拉格·巴尔诅咒的护符是你给他的。

original: You failed. Fathis has the Dark Rose now, and we're doing just fine in spite of you.
string: 你失败了。黑玫瑰号现在在法提斯手里，尽管你不在，我们也过得很好。

original: Mua hahahahahaha hah hah hah...
string: 唔啊…哈哈哈哈…哈…哈…哈…

original: Oh, it didn't cost me anything. Now Fathis? It cost him everything.
string: 哦，我没花什么钱。那法提斯呢？这让他失去了一切。

original: Me? Oh, heh, no. I just helped certain information come his way. The doing of it was all him.
string: 我？不是我只是帮他获得了一些信息。都是他自己做的。

original: See? All's well that ends well!
string: 看到了吗？皆大欢喜！

original: Pht, I always said that raising you two boys would be the death of me.
string: 菲特，我总是说，抚养你们两个孩子会要了我的命。

original: Now that I've had a heart-to-heart with my boy, let's get a move on, eh?
string: 既然我已经和我的孩子谈了心，那我们就开始行动吧，嗯？

original: Apparently, I have to follow the orders of whoever is holding my soul gem there.
string: 显然，我必须听从在那里保管我的灵魂宝石的人的命令。

original: But I'm certain we can come to a better long-term arrangement!
string: 但我相信，我们可以达成一个更好的长期安排！

original: I'd like you to stay here when we're not traveling together.
string: 当我们不一起旅行时，我希望你能住在这里。

original: Cozy. Feels like I'm back on the Dark Rose as one of the crew. I hope nobody snores.
string: 舒适。感觉像是回到了黑玫瑰号,成了船员之一。我希望没人打鼾。

original: Are you sure? You're gonna get lonely all by yourself in the Safe House.
string: 你确定吗?你会独自在安全屋里感到孤单。

original: I could get used to this kind of luxury.
string: 我可能会习惯这种奢华。

original: Home is where the heart is.
string: 家是心之所在。

original: I appreciate it.
string: 谢谢。

original: Any port in a storm.
string: 风暴中的任何一个港口。

original: Might as well, not like I've got anywhere else to go.
string: 也好，反正我也没别的地方可去。

original: No.
string: 不是。

original: Negative.
string: 否定。

original: Absolutely fucking not.
string: 绝对不行。

original: Hah! Not in your lifetime. The interior decor leaves a lot to be desired.
string: 哈哈!在你的有生之年不会的。内部装饰让人失望。

original: Could we get some light?
string: 能给我们点光吗？

original: No problem.
string: 没问题。

original: You got it.
string: 你做到了。

original: We don't need your light spell anymore.
string: 我们不再需要你的光之咒语了。

original: The Daedra aren't good or evil by our standards, they just are. Take the Star, for example. Black souls, white souls, neither... you got to decide.
string: 按照我们的标准，“迪德拉”没有善恶之分，他们就是这样。以阿祖拉之星为例：黑色的灵魂，白色的灵魂，都不是…你得自己决定。

original: House of Troubles? More like House of Fashion Troubles! ...Hey, you know this is serious right? We need to get outta here immediately...
string: 麻烦之家？更像是“时尚烦恼之家”！嘿，你知道这很严重吧？我们得马上离开这里…

original: I don't care what miracle you work, Pelagius' mind will never recover from this... creature's horrendous lack of fashion sense.
string: 我不管你创造了什么奇迹，佩拉吉斯的头永远也不会从这个…缺乏时尚感的怪物身上恢复过来。

original: What a dump. The Empire's sure got their work cut out for them.
string: 真是个垃圾场。帝国的人的工作还真不是盖的。

original: Good to see you again.
string: 很高兴再次看到你。

original: Pht. You look like shit.
string: 你看起来糟透了。

original: Hm, I like that...
string: 嗯，我喜欢…

original: Wow, I am likin' what I see!
string: 哇，我喜欢我所看到的一切！

original: Nice! I had a few great nights in Stros M'Kai that started this way.
string: 不错！我在斯特罗斯·迈凯度过的几个美好夜晚都是这样开始的。

original: Looking good!
string: 看起来不错！

original: Wow!
string: 哇！

original: Is that an invitation?
string: 这算是邀请吗？

original: Is that an invitation?
string: 这算是邀请吗？

original: Well aren't you a handsome fella.
string: 你真是个帅小伙。

original: I don't want to keep you from living your best life, but you might want to put on some pants for now.
string: 我不想阻止你过最好的生活，但你现在可能需要穿上裤子。

original: See anything you like?
string: 有喜欢的东西吗？

original: I don't blame you for starin'.
string: 我不怪你发呆。

original: I hope you're happy, because I'm freezin' my ass off.
string: 我希望你开心，因为我快冻僵了。

original: That's a good look.
string: 真好看。

original: Love?
string: 亲爱的？

original: Five more minutes...
string: 再等五分钟…

original: I'm up! I'm up! Kind of.
string: 我起来了！我起来了！算是吧。

original: I'll rise, but I won't shine.
string: 我会崛起，但我不会发光。

original: (groan)
string: （呻吟声）

original: In my defense, you left me unsupervised.
string: 我得为自己辩解一下，是你没管我。

original: In my defense, you left me unsupervised.
string: 我得为自己辩解一下，是你没管我。

original: Take a screenshot, it'll last longer... wait, that's not how I meant it!
string: 截图吧，这样能保存更久…等等，我不是这个意思！

original: I'm going to have helmet hair.
string: 我要有头盔发型了。

original: Will you please take that thing off already?
string: 你能把那东西拿下来吗？

original: Why do you insist on wearing that... thing?! It is not a hat!
string: 你为什么坚持戴着那个…东西？这不是帽子啊。

original: I feel like I could take on anything while I'm wearing this armor - and look good doing it!
string: 我觉得穿上这身盔甲，我可以和任何东西战斗，而且还很帅！

original: Ah, this gear's so... restrictive... I can barely move! I prefer light armor if you've got any to spare.
string: 啊，这装备太…限制性了… 我几乎动不了，如果你有多余的我更喜欢轻型盔甲。

original: That weapon is not subtle.
string: 那把武器并不低调。

original: Chaurus shell armor. Really?
string: 查鲁斯外壳装甲。真的吗？

original: If you wanted to see some skin, you could have just asked.
string: 如果你想看我的皮肤，你可以直接问我。

original: Nice legs! I would have joined the Forsworn a while ago if I knew that's what you were going to wear.
string: 美腿！如果我知道你要穿这身衣服，我早就加入弃誓者 了。

original: Good morning, Aelyn.
string: 早上好，艾琳。

original: Good morning, Aislinn.
string: 早上好，阿斯林。

original: Good morning, Alannah.
string: 早上好，阿兰娜。

original: Good morning, Aris.
string: 早上好，阿里斯。

original: Good morning, Bree.
string: 早上好，布里。

original: Good morning, Cyndrian.
string: 早上好，辛德里安。

original: Good morning, Cyr.
string: 早上好，希尔。

original: Good morning, Dahlia.
string: 早上好，达丽亚。

original: Good morning, Elise.
string: 早上好，伊利丝。

original: Good morning, Illia.
string: 早上好，伊利亚。

original: Good morning, Inula.
string: 早上好，伊努拉。

original: Good morning, Jacek.
string: 早上好，雅斯克。

original: Good morning, Joseph.
string: 早上好，约瑟夫。

original: I'm not sure what it says about me, but I kinda like that you're always on the edge of violence. It's like being around a storm that's about to break. Never a dull moment!

original: I'm only mostly dead... still slightly alive.

original: I'm out of crossbow bolts!
string: 弩箭用完了！

original: Face us on the ground, coward!
string: 趴在地上面对我们，懦夫！

original: Worthless fetcher!
string: 没用的混蛋！

original: You're outmatched.
string: 你输了。

original: Try again, s'wit!
string: 再试一次，笨蛋！

original: You'll have to do better.
string: 你必须做得更好。

original: You backstabbing traitor!
string: 你这背后捅刀子的叛徒！

original: Look out! Wolves!
string: 小心！狼来了！

original: Another damn bear!
string: 又一只该死的熊！

original: You're gonna be dinner!
string: 你会成为晚餐！

original: Look out for that steam!
string: 当心蒸汽！

original: I hate these things!
string: 我恨这些东西！

original: Falmer... I hate these guys.
string: 伐莫…我讨厌这些家伙。

original: Argh, blue fuckin' goblins...
string: 这该死的蓝皮地精…

original: You can die screaming!
string: 你可以惨叫着死去！

original: Prepare to die.
string: 准备受死吧！

original: You're already dead.
string: 你已经死了。

original: You think you're somebody, huh?
string: 你以为你是个人物？哈？

original: You've seen your last sunrise.
string: 这是你最后一次看到日出。

original: I'll see you in Oblivion!
string: 我们湮灭中见！

original: Not today.
string: 今天不行。

original: Try me.
string: 尝试我。

original: Run, coward.
string: 跑吧，胆小鬼。

original: If you run you'll just die tired.
string: 如果你跑的话，你只会累死。

original: Show yourself, coward.
string: 现身吧，胆小鬼。

original: Well, that wasn't a complete disaster.
string: 好吧，这还不算是一场彻底的灾难。

original: Well you're gonna be dinner.
string: 那你就当晚餐吧。

original: No one will remember your name.
string: 没有人会记得你的名字。

original: Now to collect the loot!
string: 现在去收集战利品吧！

original: To the victor goes the spoils.
string: 胜者为王，败者为寇。

original: Worthless fetcher.
string: 没用的混蛋。

original: That takes care of that.
string: 这样就没问题了。

original: Good enough.
string: 就这样吧。

original: Pathetic.
string: 可悲。

original: It's beautiful here. Peaceful.
string: 这里很美。也很安宁。

original: It's beautiful here. Peaceful. I'm glad I'm seeing it with you.
string: 这里很美。也很安宁。我很高兴和你一起欣赏。

original: Are you feeling okay? You don't look well.
string: 你还好吗？你看起来不太好。

original: Damnit, that stings! Ah! Watch where you step.
string: 该死的，好痛！小心脚下。

original: That racist piece of trash needs his face rearranged.
string: 那个种族歧视的垃圾需要重新整容。

original: I've had about all I can take of this n'wah. Excuse me for a minute.
string: 我受够这个贱种了…失陪一下。

original: I've had about all I can take of this n'wah. Excuse me for a minute.
string: 我受够这个贱种了…失陪一下。

original: I read somewhere that you should live your life by a compass, not by the clock. Seemed like good advice to me.
string: 我曾在某处读到过这样一句话：人的一生应该以指南针为指南，而不是以时钟为指南。对我来说，这似乎是个不错的建议。

original: I can navigate by the stars, but it's a lot easier with a compass and a map.
string: 我可以靠星星导航，但有了指南针和地图就容易多了。

original: Always respect the weather when you're on the water. Keep an eye on the clouds and the horizon.
string: 在水上航行时，一定要尊重天气。留意云层和地平线。

original: You can tell how deep the water is by its color. With a good eye, you can keep your ship from running aground, even in unfamiliar waters.
string: 您可以通过水的颜色来判断水有多深。只要有一双慧眼，即使在不熟悉的水域，也能保证船只不搁浅。

original: Mind the boom when we come about!
string: 我们来的时候，请注意繁荣！

original: If you're feeling seasick, just look at the horizon for a bit. Or, uh, lean over the side.
string: 如果你晕船，就看看地平线。或者，呃，靠在船舷上。

original: It's important to consider the wind and the current when plotting your course.
string: 在规划航线时，考虑风向和水流非常重要。

original: When you trim the sails, make sure the canvas is taut. It it's loose, that's called luffing and it will cost you speed.
string: 修帆时要确保帆布绷紧。如果帆布松弛，那就叫变幅，会影响速度。

original: Every line, sail, and wooden part on a ship has a special name. I had to learn them all when I first went to sea.
string: 船上的每一条线、每一张帆、每一个木制部件都有一个特殊的名字。我第一次出海时，不得不把它们都学会。

original: If you only learn how to tie one sailing knot, learn the bowline.
string: 如果你只学打一个帆船结，那就学弓形绳结吧。

original: If you make me go into combat without any pants, so help me Azura, I will find a way to banish you to the worst plane of Oblivion imaginable!
string: 如果你让我不穿裤子就上战场，那么我发誓阿祖拉，我会想办法把你放逐到想象中最糟糕的湮灭位面！

original: I like your fire wyrm. Can we name it?
string: 我喜欢你的火巫妖。能给它起个名字吗？

original: If this gets me killed at least I'll die knowing you had a good view.
string: 如果这会害死我，至少我死的时候会知道你看得很清楚。

original: I'm not shy, but this view is supposed to be for your eyes only. In private.
string: 我并不害羞，但这里的景色应该仅供你观赏。私下里。

original: Look, I've been arrested for a lot of things, but public indecency wasn't one of them. Until today, apparently.
string: 听着，我因为很多事被捕过，但公然猥亵不在其中。显然，直到今天。

original: Ahh, you're lucky I have a thing for being the center of attention.
string: 啊，你真幸运，我喜欢成为众人瞩目的焦点。

original: Can I borrow a shirt or somethin'?
string: 我能借件衬衫什么的吗？

original: This gear smells like an old boot.
string: 这玩意儿闻起来就像一只旧靴子。

original: I feel itchy all of a sudden. I hope this gear doesn't have fleas.
string: 我突然觉得痒痒的。我希望这个齿轮上没有跳蚤。

original: This armor's makin' my skin crawl.
string: 这套盔甲让我毛骨悚然。

original: That's a good look. Not a lot of protection, but it makes the view from back here much nicer!
string: 看起来不错。虽然保护作用不大，但从后面看风景更美了。

original: Ugh, gross.
string: 唉，真恶心。

original: Oh come on. We already killed it once.
string: 得了吧。我们已经杀过一次了。

original: I feel the same way when you wake me up early.
string: 当你早早叫醒我时，我的感觉和那东西一样。

original: I could use a nap.
string: 我需要打个盹儿。

original: I would kill for a coffee.
string: 我真想喝杯咖啡。

original: Not that the sunrise isn't beautiful (yawn) but I'm more of a sunset kind of guy.
string: 并不是说日出不美，但我更喜欢日落。

original: Gorgeous aurora tonight.
string: 今晚的极光美极了。

original: It's beautiful here!
string: 这里真美。

original: Gorgeous aurora tonight.
string: 今晚的极光美极了。

original: Gorgeous aurora tonight. We should stop for a bit and take in the view.
string: 今晚的极光美极了。我们应该停下来欣赏一下。

original: Gorgeous aurora tonight. We should stop for a bit and take in the view.
string: 今晚的极光美极了。我们应该停下来欣赏一下。

original: We should stop for a bit and take in the view.
string: 我们应该停下来欣赏一下美景。

original: It's beautiful here.
string: 这里真美。

original: There's no such thing as bad weather, only bad clothing.
string: 没有糟糕的天气，只有糟糕的衣服。

original: There's an old sailor's saying: if you don't like the weather, just wait a minute.
string: 水手有句老话：如果你不喜欢天气，就等一等。

original: I don't think this is what anyone meant by, "Red sky at night, sailor's delight."
string: 我不认为这就是大家所说“夜晚的红天，水手的喜悦”。

original: And all I ask is a windy day with the white clouds flying...
string: 我只求有一个风和日丽、白云飘飘的日子…

original: I've always liked the fog. Makes surprise attacks much easier.
string: 我一直很喜欢雾。这让突袭变得更容易。

original: I'm freezing my ass off.
string: 我快冻死了。

original: Nice to be on land and not have to worry about ice in the rigging.
string: 能踏上陆地可真不赖，再也不用操心索具上结冰了。

original: I love looking at the stars. They're as beautiful in Skyrim as they are at sea.
string: 我喜欢看星星，天际里的星星和海上的星星一样美丽。

original: I love looking at the stars.
string: 我喜欢看星星。

original: The tide and good weather wait for no one; it's nice to be on the road.
string: 潮汐和好天气不等人，上路真好。

original: I like civilization. It has good food, clean clothes, dry buildings, and hot baths. All the things I don't have on my ship. This place is like my ship.
string: 我就喜欢文明世界。有可口的食物、干净的衣服、干燥的屋子，还有热水澡 —— 这些在我的船上全没有。可这地方，简直跟我的船一个德性。

original: I hope you know where you're going; I'm not great at navigating without sight of the horizon.
string: 我希望你知道你要去哪里；我不擅长在看不到地平线的情况下导航。

original: It's actually not that cold here.
string: 实际上，这里并不冷。

original: It's nice and warm here. We should have a soak.
string: 这里又暖和又舒服。我们应该泡个澡。

original: It's nice and warm here.
string: 这里很暖和。

original: Don't pay full price for anything in here.
string: 不要花全价购买这里的任何东西。

original: I think I've been in this one- no wait, I was mistaken. Honestly, they all start to look the same after a while.
string: 我想我以前也遇到过这种情况--不，等等，我弄错了。老实说，时间长了，它们看起来都差不多。

original: The animal symbols in these ruins represent the Nord Pantheon from the Merethic Era. Some also represent the Divines, but not all.
string: 这些遗迹中的动物符号代表了神话纪元的诺德万神殿。有些还代表神灵，但不是全部。

original: The snake carvings are a depiction of Orkey, one of the Testing Gods. So be on your guard.
string: 这些蛇的雕刻是对谋划之神奥基的描绘。所以要提高警惕。

original: How long does someone have to be dead exactly before it's considered archaeology instead of grave robbing?
string: 一个人到底死了多久才算考古而不是盗墓？

original: Ow! I just hit my head.
string: 嗷！我刚刚撞到头了。

original: Don't rush. There are traps everywhere.
string: 别冲动。到处都是陷阱。

original: If I were a draugr, do you think I'd still look good?
string: 如果我是一个亡灵,你觉得我还会好看吗?

original: If I were a draugr, do you think I'd still look good?
string: 如果我是一个亡灵,你觉得我还会好看吗?

original: I have some free advice: Don't get stepped on.
string: 我有一些免费建议： 不要被人踩在脚下。

original: Oh look. A cave. In a country full of caves. Let me say something pithy.
string: 噢，看。一个山洞。在一个充满洞穴的地方。让我说几句精辟的话。

original: Incredible!
string: 难以置信！

original: I never had much use for ore. Weighs too much, slows the ship down. Might as well sign my own death warrant.
string: 矿石对我来说没什么用，太重了，会拖慢船的速度。还不如签下我自己的死刑令。

original: Raw ore's never worth the effort; bad profit to weight ratio.
string: 矿石从来都不值得花力气；利润与重量的比率很低。

original: I wonder if this place is named after House Redoran?
string: 不知道这个地方是不是以瑞多然家族的名字命名的？

original: I'd rather die than be treated like livestock by vampires.
string: 我宁愿死，也不愿意被吸血鬼当成牲畜。

original: These bandits are just pirates who can't sail. Worthless.
string: 这些强盗只是不会航海的海盗。不值一提。

original: I've dealt with these types my whole life. Don't feel badly about killing any of them.
string: 我一辈子都在和这种人打交道。杀了他们中的任何一个，都不会感到难过。

original: What kind of sorry excuse for a sailor gets their ship trapped in a cave?!
string: 什么样的水手会把自己的船困在山洞里？

original: I love these ruins; You never know what you might find.
string: 我喜欢这些废墟，你永远不知道自己会发现什么。

original: Ah, the thrill of discovery!
string: 啊，探索的快感！

original: I wonder if I could reverse engineer one of these machines?
string: 不知道我能不能逆向设计出一台这样的机器？

original: By Kynareth, it's loud in here. I guess the Dwemer weren't much for peace and quiet.
string: 以凯娜雷特之名,这里太吵了。我想大卫尔人不怎么喜欢安静。

original: Chaurus... why did it have to be chaurus?
string: 查鲁斯…为什么非得是查鲁斯？

original: Falmer. I hate these guys.
string: 伐莫…我讨厌这些家伙。

original: What the...? I think I see one of my anchors over there in a pile.
string: 怎么…？我想我看到我的一个锚在那边的一堆东西里。

original: Bitey little fetchers...
string: 这些小混蛋…

original: I threw a Riekling off the Rose once. So satisfying. I swear, that little guy- must have went twenty yards.
string: 有一次，我把一只蓝客灵扔下“黑玫瑰”太爽了。我发誓，那个小家伙一定跑了二十码。

original: I hate seeing any ship like this... unless I was the one who sank her!
string: 我讨厌看到这样的船…除非是我把它击沉的！

original: I must go down to the seas again, to the lonely sea and sky...
string: 我必须再次下海，回到那孤独的大海和天空之间…

original: If I drown in this heavy armor, you're gonna give me mouth-to-mouth, right?
string: 如果我被这厚重的盔甲淹死，你会给我人工呼吸吧？

original: And all I ask is a tall ship and a star to steer her by...
string: 我所要求的只是一艘高大的船和一颗为它掌舵的星星…

original: I've seen bilgewater that's cleaner than this place.
string: 我见过比这地方还干净的地下水。

original: It'll be good to warm up. I can barely feel my fingers.
string: 暖和一下也好，我的手指几乎没知觉了。

original: Ah, good time to thaw out my face... and my ass.
string: 啊，解冻我的脸…还有我的屁股的好时候。

original: We should stop for a hot meal.
string: 我们应该停下来吃一顿热饭。

original: This is my kind of dive. We should stop for a drink, see what we can learn.
string: 这才是我喜欢的潜水方式。我们应该停下来喝一杯，看看能学到什么。

original: Have you ever had the Morag Tong sent after you? It's not fun.
string: 你有没有被莫拉格堂派人追杀过？那可不好玩。

original: Do you think Odahviing would carry me sometime? Flying must be incredible.
string: 你觉得傲达维英有一天会带我飞吗？飞行一定很不可思议。

original: Are you willing to share any of those sweetrolls you're carrying?
string: 你愿意和我分享你带的那些甜面包卷吗？

original: (innocent humming)
string: 哼-哼哼…

original: (innocent humming)
string: （天真无邪的哼唱）

original: (innocent humming)
string: （天真无邪的哼唱）

original: What are you makin' this time? I know just enough about alchemy to be dangerous.
string: 你这次要做什么？我对炼金术的了解足以让我变得危险。

original: I never much cared for Black Soul Gems. Call me superstitious, I know coming from me right? But it seems like bad luck to wear an enchantment someone died for.
string: 我从来都不太喜欢“黑色灵魂宝石”。你可以说我迷信，我知道这是我说的，对吧？但戴上别人为之而死的魔法似乎不吉利。

original: What are you making this time?
string: 你这次又要做什么？

original: Oh, and what are you workin' on over there?
string: 哦，你在忙什么呢？

original: You're doing a fine job! Uh, I'll just be... supervising. Yeah, that's what I'm doin'.
string: 你做得很好呃，我只是… 监督。是啊，这就是我在做什么。

original: If these chaurus eggs hatch in my pocket, I swear by Mephala I am holding you personally responsible.
string: 如果这些查鲁斯蛋在我的口袋里孵化，我以梅法拉的名义发誓，我会让你负个人责任。

original: Damn, you look fierce as a wolf. Uh. Just don't eat anyone we like.
string: 该死，你看起来像狼一样凶猛。呃。别吃我们喜欢的人。

original: You're... still, you, right?
string: 你…仍然是你，对吗？

original: Heimskr's preaching is almost enough to make me want to join the Thalmor.
string: 海姆斯科的说教几乎足以让我想加入梭默。

original: Don't get distracted by the books.
string: 不要被书本分散注意力。

original: Stay away from the water.
string: 远离水。

original: When we fight them, kill the original Seekers first. The others that appear are just illusions.
string: 当我们与他们战斗时，先杀死最初的探索者。其他出现的只是幻象。

original: This place is a maze...
string: 这个地方就像一个迷宫…

original: Nice place you have here.
string: 你这地方真不错。

original: Nice place you have here.
string: 你这地方真不错。

original: Nice place you have here.
string: 你这地方真不错。

original: It's good to be home.
string: 能回到家真好。

original: It's good to be home.
string: 能回到家真好。

original: It's good to be home.
string: 能回到家真好。

original: I'm surprised - and relieved - to find a place to stay out here.
string: 能在这里找到住处，我感到很惊讶，同时也松了一口气。

original: It's not much, but it's a roof over our heads.
string: 虽然钱不多，但我们有房住。

original: Well, the food's tolerable and the beds are clean, but the company's much better at the Cornerclub.
string: 食物还可以忍受，床铺也很干净，但街角酒吧的同伴要好得多。

original: Stupid candle... it's nothing special. They probably took an enchanted one from some ruin. You never see those go out, either.
string: 愚蠢的蜡烛…没什么特别的。他们可能从某个废墟里拿了根附魔的你也从没见过它熄灭。

original: I don't like spending money here. We should head to the Cornerclub instead.
string: 我不喜欢在这里花钱。我们应该去街角酒吧。

original: The Dunmer here might take a while to warm up to you, but it's worth the effort.
string: 这里的暗精灵可能需要一段时间才能对你产生好感，但这是值得的。

original: The drinks might not be fancy, but the atmosphere makes up for it.
string: 这里的饮料可能并不高档，但氛围却能弥补这一点。

original: The music here is pretty good thanks to the Bards College nearby.
string: 由于附近有吟游诗人学院，这里的音乐相当不错。

original: Watch your coin purse.
string: 小心你的零钱包。

original: It smells like Imperial Legion in here. I've lost my appetite.
string: 这里一股帝国军团的味道。我没胃口了。

original: Did you know they used to force accused criminals to fight in the Pit? Barbarians.
string: 你知道吗，他们以前会逼那些嫌犯去兽坑里搏斗…真是野蛮。

original: Augh! For a second there I thought it was real chaurus.
string: 呃啊！刚才那一瞬间我还以为是真的查鲁斯呢…

original: Ahh! Stupid plushie! Looks real.
string: 蠢玩偶！太像真的了。

original: Shit! It hatched! I knew this was going to happen! Godsdamnit, fucking die already!
string: 该死!它孵化了!我就知道会发生这种事!天哪,快点去死吧!

original: Karliah needs to return it.
string: 卡莱亚需要归还它。

original: You're gonna have your hands full keeping the Guild in line, but this is a good start.
string: 你要忙着让公会保持秩序,但这已经是个不错的开始。

original: Brynjolf's still gonna have his hands full keeping the Guild in line, but this is a good start.
string: 布林乔夫也要忙着让公会保持秩序,但这已经是个不错的开始。

original: Dead draugr... someone's been here recently. Wanna head inside and find some trouble? Nothing else out here but ice and mudcrabs.
string: 尸鬼…最近有人来过这里。想进去找点麻烦吗？这里除了冰和泥蟹之外什么都没有。

original: Next you're gonna want me to carry everything.
string: 接下来你会让我拿所有东西。

original: Of course.
string: 当然。

original: As you wish.
string: 如你所愿。

original: I'll make a trophy out of your fangs!
string: 我要用你的尖牙做个战利品！

original: Overgrown grasshopper!
string: 长不大的蚂蚱！

original: Die, you ankle-biting blue vermin!
string: 去死吧，你们这些咬人脚踝的蓝色害虫！

original: Filthy rodent!
string: 肮脏的老鼠！

original: Piece of junk!
string: 垃圾！

original: Die screaming!
string: 尖叫着死去吧！

original: Die!
string: 死吧！

original: Huah!
string: 啊哈！

original: Hrah!
string: 哈啊！！

original: To Oblivion with you!
string: 你去死吧 ！

original: Daedra take you!
string: 迪德拉带走你！

original: Do you know anything about organized pirates raiding near Windhelm?
string: 你知道有组织的海盗在风舵城附近袭击的事情吗？

original: Don't look at me. The Dark Rose always operated independently.
string: 别看我。黑玫瑰一直独立运作。

original: Don't look at me. The Dark Rose always operated independently.
string: 别看我。黑玫瑰一直独立运作。
