string: 我曾经认识这个高精灵…他教了我一个咒语，可以变出捆绑绳索。如果你愿意，我可以给你上一堂私人课。

original: That's an interest of mine, too. We could practice together later, if you like.
string: 这也是我的兴趣所在。如果你愿意，我们以后可以一起练习。

original: Destruction.
string: 毁灭系。

original: In that case, we'll need to find someone to take point in combat.
string: 这样的话，我们就得找个人来指挥战斗了。

original: I don't know about you, but I find it really hard to cast with both hands while I'm getting hit in the face.
string: 我不知道你是怎么想的，但我觉得在被打脸的情况下用双手抛投真的很难。

original: Enchanting.
string: 真迷人。

original: Hm, maybe you can explain to me what exactly happens to the souls that get put into those gems. I have a lot of questions.
string: 嗯，也许你可以向我解释一下，那些被放进宝石里的灵魂到底会发生什么事。我有很多问题。

original: Illusion.
string: 幻术系。

original: I hope you're be willing to use your powers for some mischief, because I have a few ideas.
string: 我希望你愿意用你的超能力做些恶作剧，因为我有几个主意。

original: Restoration.
string: 治愈系。

original: That's wonderful! I'll feel a lot safer the next time we head into combat.
string: 太好了下次作战时，我会更有安全感。

original: Necromancy.
string: 某种法术也许能解决问题。

original: The more I learn here, the less I like that.
string: 我在这里学得越多，就越不喜欢这样。

original: That pretty much covers it.
string: 差不多就这些了。

original: Why did you choose to study magic?
string: 你为什么选择学习魔法？

original: I want to use magic to help others.
string: 我想用魔法帮助他人。

original: Heh. You have a good heart, hero.
string: 嘿，你有一颗善良的心，英雄。

original: Magic has always fascinated me.
string: 魔法一直让我着迷。

original: Ahh, me too... I'm really glad we're doing this together, love.
string: 我也是。我很高兴我们能在一起，亲爱的。

original: Ahh, me too... I'm really glad we're doing this together, my friend.
string: 我也是我真的很高兴我们能一起做这件事，我的朋友。

original: I had a natural talent.
string: 我天赋异禀。

original: It shows. I admire the hard work you're putting in on top of your existing skills!
string: 这说明了什么？我很钦佩你在现有技能基础上付出的努力！

original: My family expected it of me.
string: 我的家人对我寄予厚望。

original: I hope that's a good thing? My father was never very encouraging despite being a caster himself.
string: 我希望这是件好事？我父亲从不鼓励我，尽管他自己也是个施法者。

original: I want to be powerful.
string: 我想变得强大。

original: I understand. You'll be able to chart your own destiny with what you learn here. I'm hoping for the same thing myself.
string: 我明白。你能用在这里学到的东西规划自己的命运。我自己也希望如此。

original: I'm not sure exactly.
string: 我也不太清楚。

original: It will come with time. This is a good place to figure things out.
string: 时间会证明一切。这里是个解决问题的好地方。

original: Honestly, I just needed to see about an Elder Scroll and things have gotten completely out of hand.
string: 老实说，我只是想看看上古卷轴，事情已经完全失控了。

original: Hahahahahahaha! You my dear, never cease to surprise me. I love that about you.
string: 哈哈哈哈哈哈！亲爱的，你总是能给我带来惊喜。我喜欢你这一点。

original: Ha ha ha ha! You my friend, never cease to amaze me!
string: 哈哈哈哈！我的朋友，你总是让我惊叹不已！

original: Shit.
string: 操。

original: Ah, shit.
string: 啊，该死。

original: Have you ever heard of a Captain Serano?
string: 你听说过塞拉诺船长吗？

original: Aye, and you'll want to stay away from him. He's a smuggler, a thief, and a pirate. Dangerous, too- sent many a merchant ship to the bottom of the sea.
string: 听说过，你最好离他远点。他是个走私犯、小偷和海盗。他也很危险，曾把许多商船打入海底。

original: All the same, I need to find him.
string: 无论如何，我都得找到他。

original: Your funeral, friend. There's an anchorage far northwest of here, past Solitude, called Broken Oar Grotto. It's a notorious spot for pirates and smugglers.
string: 后果由你自己承担，朋友。这里西北方向有个锚地，过了独孤城，有个断桨洞窟。那是海盗和走私犯的必经之地。

original: Serano's ship is called the Dark Rose, and she's been spotted there from time to time.
string: 塞拉诺的船叫黑玫瑰号，她时不时会出现在那里。

original: Val001Hello
string: 瓦尔001你好

original: Hello.
string: 你好。

original: What can I do for you?
string: 有什么可以效劳的？

original: Need something?
string: 需要什么？

original: Hello.
string: 你好。

original: What can I do for you?
string: 有什么可以效劳的？

original: Need something?
string: 需要什么？

original: Yeah?
string: 什么事？

original: Hey, stranger!
string: 嗨，陌生人。

original: Yeah?
string: 什么事？

original: Let's get out of here?
string: 我们快离开这里吧？

original: Have you ever heard of a Captain Serano?
string: 你听说过塞拉诺船长吗？

original: Aye, and you'll want to stay away from him. He's a smuggler, a thief, and a pirate. Dangerous, too- sent many a merchant ship to the bottom of the sea.
string: 听说过，你最好离他远点。他是个走私犯、小偷和海盗。他也很危险，曾把许多商船打入海底。

original: All the same, I need to find him.
string: 无论如何，我都得找到他。

original: Your funeral, friend. There's an anchorage far northwest of here, past Solitude, called Broken Oar Grotto. It's a notorious spot for pirates and smugglers.
string: 后果由你自己承担，朋友。这里西北方向有个锚地，过了独孤城，有个断桨洞窟。那是海盗和走私犯的必经之地。

original: Serano's ship is called the Dark Rose, and she's been spotted there from time to time.
string: 塞拉诺的船叫黑玫瑰号，她时不时会出现在那里。

original: Have you ever heard of a Captain Serano?
string: 你听说过塞拉诺船长吗？

original: What's it to you?
string: 你这是怎么了？

original: I need to find him.
string: 我得找到他。

original: If you've got a score to settle with him, get in line.
string: 如果你要找他算账，那就排好队。

original: I'll have a score to settle with you if you don't tell me what I want to know. (Intimidate)
string: 如果你不告诉我我想知道的事，咱们就好好算算账。（恐吓）

original: Fine. His ship is called the Dark Rose and she anchors northwest of here sometimes, near a place called Broken Oar Grotto or something. Your funeral.
string: 好吧，他的船叫黑玫瑰号，有时会停泊在西北方，一个叫断桨窟之类的地方附近，后果由你自己承担。

original: Nah, I don't think so.
string: 嗯，我不知道。

original: Perhaps this will help me jump the queue. (Bribe - <BribeCost> gold)
string: 也许这能帮帮我。 （贿赂 - <BribeCost> 金币）

original: Fine. His ship is called the Dark Rose and she anchors northwest of here sometimes, near a place called Broken Oar Grotto or something. Your funeral.
string: 好吧，他的船叫黑玫瑰号，有时会停泊在西北方，一个叫断桨窟之类的地方附近，后果由你自己承担。

original: Nah, I don't think so.
string: 嗯，我不知道。

original: If you tell me where to find him, he'll be out of your hair. (Persuade)
string: 如果你告诉我去哪儿找他，他就不会再烦你了。（说服）

original: Fine. His ship is called the Dark Rose and she anchors northwest of here sometimes, near a place called Broken Oar Grotto or something. Your funeral.
string: 好吧，他的船叫黑玫瑰号，有时会停泊在西北方，一个叫断桨窟之类的地方附近，后果由你自己承担。

original: Nah, I don't think so.
string: 嗯，我不知道。

original: What do you want? (coughs)
string: 喘气… 咳咳… 你想干什么？

original: I'm looking for Serano.
string: 我在找塞拉诺。

original: Which one?
string: 哪一个？

original: What?
string: 什么？

original: Doesn't matter. Left him at sea. Heh ha ha. I'll see him in Oblivion. Urgh...
string: 没关系。把他丢在海上。哈哈…咳咳… 我会在湮灭里见到他的…

original: Oh am I glad to see you! Glad to see anyone, actually.
string: 见到你真高兴！其实，我见到谁都高兴。

original: You must be Serano.
string: 你一定就是塞拉诺。

original: Yeah. Who's asking, and uh, who sent you?
string: 是的。谁问的，谁派你来的？

original: My name's <Alias=player>. No one sent me.
string: 我的名字是 <Alias=player>。 没人派我来。

original: So you just wandered out here on your own, huh?
string: 所以你就一个人跑到这儿来了，嗯？

original: It's true. I like exploring.
string: 这是真的。我喜欢探索。

original: Uh lucky for me, I suppose.
string: 我想，我还算幸运的。

original: I heard something about a mutiny on your ship.
string: 我听说你的船上发生了叛乱。

original: Well. That's a matter of perspective.
string: 好吧。这是一个角度问题。

original: You know what? It's not important right now. I just want to get off this rock.
string: 你知道吗？现在这不重要，我只想离开这块石头。

original: Once we get to the mainland, I'll tell ya anything you want to know. Wherever you're going is fine with me.
string: 等我们到了大陆，你想知道什么我都告诉你。不管你去哪儿，我都没意见。

original: Forget it, I'm out of here.
string: 算了，我走了。

original: Well Daedra take you, then!
string: 那么让迪德拉带你走吧！

original: Take care.
string: 多保重。

original: Farewell.
string: 再会。

original: Take care.
string: 多保重。

original: Farewell.
string: 再会。

original: I was done talking anyway.
string: 反正我没话说了。

original: Let's get out of here.
string: 我们快走吧。

original: So, what's in the note?
string: 那么，纸条里都写了些什么呢？

original: Pht. Good job, hero. You saved the day and made us unforgettable to the guards. Tell me what's in that note before anything else goes wrong.
string: 嘘干得好，英雄。你救了我们的命，还让守卫们忘不了我们。告诉我纸条上写了什么，免得再出什么岔子。

original: Our next adventure!
string: 我们的下一次探险！

original: I don't think so. The guard didn't do anything because they've been bought off. That stranger is going to get himself - and us - killed.
string: 我不这么认为。警卫什么也没做，因为他们被收买了。那个陌生人会害死他自己和我们的。

original: The man who gave it to me wants to meet at the Shrine of Talos.
string: 把它给我的人想在塔洛斯神殿见面。

original: A Reachman wants to meet us in a secret temple for a banned Nord god? Whatever this is, the guards are in on it, and I don't think we should get involved.
string: 一个瑞驰人要在一个秘密神庙里见我们，是为了一个被禁止的诺德神？不管是什么，守卫都参与其中了，我觉得我们不应该插手。

original: What note?
string: 什么纸条？

original: Don't play coy with me. I know the game, and that little guy wasn't even remotely convincing. He wants something, the guards want the opposite, and I guarantee none of it is going to pay us well enough to get involved.
string: 别跟我兜圈子了。我知道这是怎么回事，那个小家伙一点都不可信。他想要的和警卫想要的恰恰相反。我确定他们都不会给我们足够的报酬来让我们参与进来。

original: So, what's the plan with this Forsworn stuff?
string: 那么，弃誓者的计划是什么呢？

original: I can't just walk away. An innocent person was killed.
string: 我不能一走了之。一个无辜的人被杀了。

original: This is gonna be the death of you, Serano...
string: 你会死的，塞拉诺…

original: You said it yourself; the guards are in on it. Ordinary people don't stand a chance.
string: 你自己说的；守卫也参与其中。普通人根本没有机会。

original: You've got a point; I don't like being pushed around by the guards any more than you do.
string: 你说得有道理，我和你一样不喜欢被警卫摆布。

original: None of this makes sense. I want to get to the bottom of it.
string: 这些都说不通。我想查个水落石出。

original: Oh come on. Haven't you heard that curiosity killed the ca- that's, nevermind that's probably racist. Hmm.
string: 哦，拜托。你没听说过好奇心会杀死猫吗？这可能是种族歧视。

original: I can't believe I'm saying this, but we could just go to the Mages' College if you wanted to learn something.
string: 我真不敢相信我会这么说，但如果你想学点什么，我们可以去魔法学院。

original: You always see the good in situations where anyone else would give up. I love that about you.
string: 你总是在别人会放弃的情况下看到好的一面。我喜欢你这点。

original: I'll do what I can to keep you safe.
string: 我会尽我所能保证你的安全。

original: All right, hero. If you insist on being the 'Champion of the Common Man,' I'll do my best to keep you from getting yourself killed in the proccess.
string: 好吧，英雄。如果你坚持要做“平民的守护者”，我会尽我所能不让你在这个过程中送命。

original: I'm going to ignore it and hope it goes away.
string: 我要忽略它，希望它会消失。

original: Smart. Let's get out of this city and find trouble elsewhere.
string: 聪明。我们离开这座城市，到别处去找麻烦吧。

original: Here, you're gonna need this.
string: 给，你需要这个。

original: What's the key for?
string: 这钥匙是干什么用的？

original: I took it off the body at the market while everyone was distracted. I'm sure it will come in handy.
string: 我趁大家都走神的时候从尸体上拿下来的。我相信它迟早会派上用场的。

original: I knew you could look after yourself.
string: 我就知道你能照顾好自己。

original: Seriously? I thought you had it. That was embarassing for both of us. Watch his left hook next time.
string: 真的吗？我以为你拿到了。这对我们俩来说都很尴尬。下次注意他的左勾拳。

original: People like Thonar don't make idle threats. We should get out of this city before he follows up on the prison thing.
string: 像托纳尔这样的人是不会轻易威胁别人的。我们应该在他追查监狱的事之前离开这座城市。

original: Remember when you said we weren't getting involved? We need to leave Markarth. Now.
string: 还记得你说过我们不会掺和进来吗？我们得离开马卡斯。现在。

original: We're in the right. Imperial Law will protect us.
string: 我们是对的。帝国的法律会保护我们的。

original: The Empire is a long way from here.
string: 帝国离这里很远。

original: We need to talk to Eltrys first.
string: 我们得先和艾翠斯谈谈。

original: All right, I suppose warning him is the decent thing to do.
string: 好吧，我想警告他是应该的。

original: The Silver-Bloods will regret crossing me.
string: 银血家族会后悔和我作对的。

original: You and what army? I like your spirit, but we're alone here with no allies.
string: 你和什么军队？我喜欢你的精神，但这里只有我们没有盟友。

original: The situation is not ideal.
string: 现在的情况并不理想。

original: Here. This oughtta be useful at least.
string: 给你，这至少应该有用。

original: How did you get your hands on skooma in here already?
string: 你是怎么把斯库玛弄到这里来的？

original: I'm likable. People just want to help me.
string: 我很讨人喜欢。人们只是想帮助我。

original: Besides, I said I'd look out for you. Let's ask around and see what the locals can tell us.
string: 而且，我说过我会照顾你的。我们去打听打听，看看当地人能告诉我们什么。

original: Val, do you remember when you told me life was uncertain?
string: 瓦尔，你还记得你告诉我人生无常吗？

original: I remember. That was right after the Morag Tong tried to kill us.
string: 我记得那是在莫拉刚想杀我们之后。

original: In that moment I was really happy that you were okay.
string: 那一刻，我真的很高兴你没事。

original: But happy moments don't change the kind of trouble I bring. You don't deserve that.
string: 但快乐的时光改变不了我带来的麻烦。你不配。

original: You know, I was just thinking about that time the Morag Tong tried to kill us.
string: 你知道吗，我刚才还在想那次莫拉格堂要杀我们的事。

original: In that moment I was really happy that you were okay.
string: 那一刻，我真的很高兴你没事。

original: But happy moments don't change the kind of trouble I bring. You don't deserve that.
string: 但快乐的时光改变不了我带来的麻烦。你不配。

original: Val, about Frostmere Crypt...
string: 瓦尔，关于幽空地穴…

original: What do you mean?
string: 你什么意思？

original: When you rescued me from the island, I got a second chance that I didn't deserve.
string: 当你把我从岛上救出来时，我得到了第二次机会，这是我不应该得到的。

original: But the first thing I did was drag you into my problems. You don't want to get involved with me.
string: 但我做的第一件事就是把你扯进我的问题里。你不想和我扯上关系。

original: (laugh) I can handle trouble. And you.
string: 我能应付麻烦，还有你。

original: I would like nothing better than to see you try...
string: 我最想看到的就是你尝试…

original: You're not going to end up like Kyr in the ruins.
string: 你不会像基尔一样死在废墟里的。

original: Huagh. I'm not so sure. I'm pretty good at screwing things up or just... leaving them behind.
string: 哈。我不太确定我很擅长把事情搞砸，或者…把它们抛诸脑后。

original: You can't die alone if I'm the one who's just killed you for pulling that stunt.
string: 如果是我杀了你，你就不会孤独终老。

original: Hahahaha! I never know what you're gonna say next.
string: 哈哈哈！我永远不知道你下一句会说什么。

original: Not to worry, I'd only leave so you'd miss me.
string: 别担心，我离开只是为了让你想我。

original: Not sure I could stay away even if I wanted to... how about another adventure?
string: 即使我想离开，也不一定能离开…再来一次冒险怎么样？

original: Supposedly, a ship called the Silvermoon sank years ago on Lake Ilinalta. I wonder if we could find the wreck?
string: 据说几年前有一艘叫银月号的船沉没在伊琳娜塔湖上。不知道我们能不能找到沉船？

original: You're wrong about yourself... and me. You're a good man.
string: 你看错了自己…也看错了我。你是个好人。

original: Heh heh heh. I'd like that to be true.
string: 嘿嘿嘿。我倒希望这是真的。

original: Besides, I come with my own problems.
string: 此外，我也有自己的问题。

original: I gotta be honest, I like your brand of trouble.
string: 老实说，我喜欢你制造的麻烦。

original: Thank you, friend, I owe you one. One, meaning my life. You can call me Val.
string: 谢谢你，朋友，我欠你个人情。一个人情，代表我的生命，你可以叫我瓦尔。

original: Now, as promised, what do you want to know?
string: 现在，如我所言，你想知道什么？

original: You were the captain of a ship - the Dark Rose?
string: 你是黑玫瑰号的船长？

original: Yeah, she's been mine since I was about uh, twenty, give or take. Not anymore, I guess. Ahm, I'm still getting used to that.
string: 是啊，她大概从我二十岁开始就属于我了。我想现在不会了。嗯，我还在适应呢。

original: Have you always been a sailor?
string: 你一直是一个水手吗？

original: I was born at sea, not quite sure where. My mother always said that must be why I couldn't wait to get back.
string: 我出生在海上，不太清楚是哪里。我妈妈总是说这就是我迫不及待想回去的原因。

original: I grew up on land in Cyrodiil, though. Imperial City. It was just me and my mother back then when my father was away.
string: 不过我是在赛罗迪尔的陆地上长大的。帝国城，父亲不在的时候只有我和母亲相依为命。

original: I left home as soon as I was old enough, joined the crew of my father's ship. Then eventually, I got my own ship. I've sailed from Anvil to Blacklight and seen everywhere the waters touch in between.
string: 我一长大就离开了家，加入了父亲船上的船员。最后，我有了自己的船。我从铁砧岛航行到黑光岛，游遍了这片海域的所有地方。

original: It feels a bit strange being back on dry land for so long.
string: 回到陆地上这么久，感觉有点怪怪的。

original: Do you miss the sea?
string: 你想念大海吗？

original: Not as much as I thought I would. A ship represented freedom to me when I was a boy. As I've gotten older-
string: 没有我想象的那么多。在我还是个孩子的时候，船对我来说代表着自由。随着年龄的增长-

original: Well, illusions shatter.
string: 嗯，幻想破灭了。

original: People say you're a pirate.
string: 人们说你是个海盗。

original: People say a lot of things. Most of them wrong. I'm a relic hunter. Certain items are very profitable, with the right buyer.
string: 人们会说很多话。大多数都是错的。我是个遗迹猎人。只要有合适的买家，某些东西是很赚钱的。

original: Are those items legal?
string: 这些物品合法吗？

original: My buyers don't ask a lot of questions as long as I can deliver.
string: 只要我能交货，我的买家不会问太多问题。

original: So you steal things. And smuggle them.
string: 所以你偷东西。然后走私。

original: Well it's not stealing if the things don't have an owner. And I couldn't care less about protecting the East Empire Company's profit margins on shipping the exact same things.
string: 如果东西没有主人，那就不算偷。而且，我一点也不关心东帝国公司在运送同样东西上的利润。

original: Why did your crew mutiny?
string: 你的船员为什么叛变？

original: Why does anyone betray anyone? Gold. They thought they could get more than I was giving them.
string: 为什么有人会背叛别人？金子。他们以为能得到比我给的更多的东西。

original: But hadn't you sailed together for a long time?
string: 但你们不是一起航行了很长时间吗？

original: Yeah. Fathis and I had been shipmates since we were boys. I thought we were friends.
string: 是啊。法提斯和我从小就是船友。我以为我们是朋友。

original: I'm sorry. That must be difficult for you.
string: 抱歉。这对你来说肯定有点苦痛。

original: I knew better. I just... hoped differently.
string: 我清楚。我只是…希望与众不同。

original: Well, what did you expect with your line of work?
string: 嗯，你以为你的工作是什么呢？

original: It was a mistake I intend to correct.
string: 我打算纠正这个错误。

original: Fathis is dead.
string: 法提斯死了。

original: Good.
string: 很好。

original: Did you kill him?
string: 你杀了他？

original: He was alive the last time I saw him. But I hope he rots in Oblivion. He framed me for theft and turned my crew against me.
string: 我最后一次见到他时，他还活着。但我希望他在湮灭中腐烂。他陷害我偷窃，还让我的船员和我作对。

original: I spent over a month in Solitude's jail before I escaped. And then? The ungrateful bastards left me on that island.
string: 我在独孤城的监狱里待了一个多月才逃出来。然后呢？那些忘恩负义的混蛋把我留在了岛上。

original: Wait, you were in prison?
string: 等等，你进过监狱？

original: Yeah, it's why I looked so rough when you found me. I wasn't stuck on that island for very long, fortunately.
string: 是啊，所以你发现我的时候，我才看起来那么粗糙。幸运的是，我并没有在岛上困很久。

original: That's all for now.
string: 就到此为止吧。

original: Sure thing, let me know if you want to talk later. I've got nothing to hide.
string: 当然，如果你想晚点再聊，告诉我一声。我没什么好隐瞒的。

original: This is much closer to an execution than I care to be. Mind if we go somewhere else?
string: 这离行刑还差得远呢。介意我们去别的地方吗？

original: Under the circumstances, this is making me fairly uncomfortable. Let's wait for Aldis near Castle Dour before he gets any ideas about dealing with me permanently?
string: 在这种情况下，这让我很不舒服。我们还是在杜尔城堡附近等着艾迪斯吧，免得他想长期对付我。

original: Hold on. I need to talk to you before we go any further.
string: 等等，在我们继续之前，我需要和你谈谈。

original: Remember all the hostile dragons? Those are on me.
string: 还记得那些有敌意的龙吗？那些都是我的责任。

original: I like the excitement. It keeps things interesting. Hahaha! Maybe you feel the same?
string: 我喜欢刺激。这让事情变得有趣。哈哈哈也许你也有同感？

original: I'd love to go.
string: 我很想去。

original: That's great! There's a spot near the Guardian Stones where the locals keep their fishing boats. I'll arrange to 'borrow' one for the day.
string: 好极了！守护石附近有一个地方，当地人把渔船停在那里。我会安排“借用”一艘。

original: Maybe another time.
string: 下次再说吧。

original: Well... let me know if you reconsider, but don't wait too long.
string: 好吧…如果你重新考虑，告诉我一声，但别等太久。

original: No thanks, I'm NOT INTERESTED.
string: 不，谢谢，我没兴趣。

original: I understand.
string: 我明白了。

original: I had some more questions.
string: 我还有一些问题要问。

original: Sure. What do you want to ask?
string: 当然可以，你想问什么？

original: You! I want a word. Why are you here?
string: 你，我有话跟你说，你为什么在这里？

original: Hehehe, hahaha! What a clever thief you are. Liar.
string: 嘿嘿，哈哈哈！你真是个聪明的小偷。骗子。

original: A true killer, like me. What was it like killing your first one, huh?
string: 一个真正的杀手，就像我一样，你第一次杀人是什么感觉？

original: I was caught stealing sweetrolls.
string: 我偷甜面包卷的时候被抓了。

original: Well, maybe it was slightly more complicated than that.
string: 好吧，也许事情比这还要复杂一些。

original: It was an ordinary day, same as the rest of them. Don't let me keep you from your work.
string: 这是一个普通的一天，和其他人一样。别让我耽误你的工作。

original: Live test subjects? Those are vampires! That means these mages were experimenting on them.
string: 活体试验品？那些是吸血鬼！这说明这些法师在拿他们做实验。

original: Hold on. You've seen this place. Whoever is through that door, we can't let her live.
string: 等一下。你见过这个地方。不管门里是谁，我们都不能让她活着。

original: No matter what she's done, she deserves a chance at redemption.
string: 无论她做了什么，她都应该得到一个赎罪的机会。

original: You're a better person than me, but the Caller might not give you a choice.
string: 你是个比我更好的人，但召唤者可能不会给你选择。

original: Agreed. We'll take the Caller down together.
string: 同意。我们一起打倒召唤者。

original: Vampires or not, no one deserves to be an unwilling test subject. Let's end this.
string: 不管是不是吸血鬼，没有人应该成为不情愿的试验品。让我们结束这一切吧。

original: I don't want to damage the books...
string: 我不想损坏书籍…

original: I said I wouldn't use fire spells. You know what a careful guy I am!
string: 我说过我不会用火咒的。你知道我是个多么谨慎的人。

original: What did you need to tell me?
string: 你要跟我说什么？

original: I, ahm, haven't been entirely forthcoming with you.
string: 我，呃，并没有完全对你坦白。

original: Val, you promised to tell me everything.
string: 瓦尔，你答应过要告诉我一切的。

original: I know, and I'm telling you now.
string: 我知道，我现在告诉你。

original: What is it?
string: 什么？

original: I have a plan to handle it, and I need you to trust me.
string: 我有个解决办法，我需要你相信我。

original: Lies from a thieving pirate. Why am I not surprised?
string: 一个小偷海盗的谎言。为什么我一点也不惊讶？

original: You didn't ask. Anyway-
string: 你没问。总之-

original: They still think you stole something?
string: 他们还是认为你偷了东西？

original: Well... technically... I did steal it.
string: 嗯…严格来说… 是我偷的。

original: I thought you said it wasn't stealing.
string: 你不是说那不是偷吗。

original: It was in a tomb filled with draugr, and I didn't think they'd miss it.
string: 它就在一个充满尸鬼的坟墓里，我想他们不会错过的。

original: Turns out I was wrong. To be fair, the Blue Palace would've never noticed if Fathis hadn't turned me in.
string: 事实证明我错了。公平地说，如果不是法提斯告发我，蓝宫也不会发现。

original: Fine, let's go see Captain Aldis and straighten out this mess.
string: 好吧，我们去见艾迪斯队长，把事情弄清楚。

original: Thank you. I'll owe you another one!
string: 谢谢。我又欠你一个人情！

original: I can't believe I'm letting you talk me into this.
string: 真不敢相信，我竟然被你说服了。

original: I have that effect on many people. Think of it this way- I'll owe you another one.
string: 我对很多人都有这种影响。这样想吧，我还欠你一个人情。

original: I hope I don't get arrested just for being seen with you.
string: 我希望我不会因为被人看到和你在一起而被捕。

original: Hey, you'd be bored without me. Anyway, I'll owe you another one.
string: 嘿，没有我你会很无聊的。不管怎样，我还欠你一个人情。

original: What do you make of these books?
string: 您如何看待这些书？

original: It seems fairly obvious that the orb we found underneath Saarthal is the power source mentioned in 'The Night of Tears.'
string: 很明显，我们在萨瑟尔地下发现的球体就是“泪夜”中提到的能量源。

original: Not much else to go on, though. It's a start. Hopefully Urag and Tolfdir will be able to cross-reference with another source.
string: 不过，也没有太多其他信息。这只是个开始。希望乌拉格和托夫迪尔能够对照其他资料来源。

original: The Psijic Order spoke to me privately again...
string: 塞伊克教团又私下找我谈话了…

original: What good is another warning if you can't understand it? Obviously power can be misused.
string: 如果你无法理解，再多的警告又有什么用呢？显然，权力会被滥用。

original: This guy just wants to hear himself talk.
string: 这家伙只想听自己说话。

original: As far as the Augur of Dunlain goes, there is something interesting down in the basement of the College. Everyone is strangely evasive about it, almost like they're embarrassed.
string: 至于邓莱恩的奥古，学院的地下室里有些有趣的东西。每个人都对这件事避而不谈，好像很尴尬似的。

original: There's at least two entrances in plain sight. Northwest side of the courtyard and in the lower level of the Hall of Countenance. Not even locked! I checked.
string: 明面上至少有两个入口。庭院西北侧和伯爵大厅底层。甚至没有上锁！我检查过了。

original: You have a lot of nerve showing your face here again, Serano.
string: 塞拉诺，你居然还敢在这里抛头露面。

original: I thought you'd be happy to see me, as I was on my way to return the Star.
string: 我以为你会很高兴见到我，因为我正要去归还“孤独城之星”。

original: Hand it over, and you might keep your head.
string: 交出来，你就能保住你的脑袋。

original: Well I don't have it with me; It's in a secure location. I'm going to return it to your hands. You have my word.
string: 我没带在身上，它在一个安全的地方。我会把它还给你的。 我向你保证。

original: Hah, pull the other one. Just tell me where it is, and I'll send a detachment of guards to retrieve it. You and your friend can wait here.
string: 哈，别开玩笑了。告诉我在哪，我会派一队卫兵去取，你和你的朋友可以在这等着。

original: Ah now, it wouldn't be very secure if I could just describe where it was. And if I hadn't hidden it well, those pirates would be leagues away with your priceless relic by now.
string: 啊，现在，如果我只能描述它在哪里，那就不太安全了。要不是我藏得好，那些海盗早就带着你的无价之宝远走高飞了。

original: Your pirates, you mean.
string: 你是说你的海盗。

original: I'd hardly call them 'mine.' Like I told you before, I thought they were ordinary sailors. They decided I didn't have enough coin for my expedition, so the bastards framed me for tomb robbing.
string: 我很难称他们为“我的”。就像我之前跟你说的，我以为他们只是普通的水手。他们认为我没有足够的钱去探险，所以那些混蛋就诬陷我盗墓。

original: You were tomb robbing.
string: 你是盗墓贼。

original: A misunderstanding. Which I am working to remedy. Which I could not do from a prison cell.
string: 一个误会。我正在努力弥补，这是我在牢房里做不到的。

original: (sighs) What do you want to do?
string: （叹息）你想做什么？

original: Give me a few days to have a research colleague of mine look at the relic. The Star of Solitude hasn't been seen in generations, and her observations would be a tremendous benefit to historians.
string: 给我几天时间，让我的一位研究同事看看这件文物。“独孤城之星”已经有几代人没见过了，她的观察结果将对历史学家大有裨益。

original: Oh, and don't worry. I'll make sure you have a footnote in the publication. When I'm back, you'll have the Star for display in the Jarl's treasury where it belongs.
string: 哦，别担心。我会在出版物上给你做个脚注的。等我回来后，你就可以把那颗星放在领主的宝库里展示了。

original: Fine, get your gear and get out of here before I change my mind.
string: 好吧，在我改变主意之前，带上你的装备离开这里。

original: Already gone, Captain.
string: 马上就走，队长。

original: Just a minute while I get my gear.
string: 等一下，我去拿我的装备。

original: Well, it's good to have some proper clothes on again. Come on, let's talk somewhere else.
string: 好吧，又能穿上得体的衣服真好。来吧，我们换个地方谈吧。

original: What's next?
string: 接下来要做什么？

original: Not here. Somewhere we can talk.
string: 这里不行。找个可以谈谈的地方。

original: I thought so, too! If you can't dazzle them with brilliance, confound them with bullshit.
string: 我也这样认为！如果你不能用才华吸引他们，那就用废话迷惑他们。

original: That was quite a performance for Captain Aldis.
string: 艾迪斯队长的表现真不错。

original: This is going to involve something else illegal, isn't it?
string: 这还会牵涉到其他违法的事情，不是吗？

original: I prefer to think of it as creative problem solving.
string: 我更愿意把它看作是创造性地解决问题。

original: So what's the plan?
string: 那么你的计划到底是什么？

original: One step at a time.
string: 一步一步来。

original: Is anything that comes out of your mouth true?
string: 从你嘴里说出来的话都是真的吗？

original: Well let's just say that if someone ever gets one over on me, they're gonna have to earn that victory.
string: 这么说吧，如果有人能赢我，那也是他们自己的本事。

original: Val, two wrongs do not make right.
string: 瓦尔，错上加错并不代表正确。

original: But defaulting on two deals gets me killed. This way, both Aldis and my buyer go away happy. Watch and learn, my friend.
string: 但如果拖欠两笔交易，我就死定了。这样一来，艾迪斯和我的买主都能高兴地离开。学着点，我的朋友。

original: We can clear your name and still get paid by your buyer. Brilliant!
string: 我们可以还你清白，还能得到买家的钱。太棒了！

original: Sometimes I amaze even myself. Watch and learn from the master, my friend.
string: 有时连我自己都感到惊讶。向大师学习吧，我的朋友。

original: Oh my gods. We are going to spend the rest of our lives in prison.
string: 我的天啊。我们将在监狱里度过余生。

original: Oh, shush! We're still alive and free. Watch and learn, my friend.
string: 哦，嘘！我们还活着，还自由了。学着点，我的朋友。

original: I know you have your own tailor, but I wanted to give you something special. These robes are a gift for completing your studies at the College.
string: 我知道你有自己的裁缝,但我想送给你一些特别的东西。这些长袍是完成学院学习后的礼物。

original: Ha ha ha! No, no, this is much better. I love them already! They're gorgeous, but that you were thinking of me makes them special.
string: 哈哈哈!不,不,这好多了。我已经爱上它们了!它们很漂亮,但你想到我就更特别。

original: Thank you, love.
string: 谢谢,亲爱的。

original: Ha ha ha! No, no, this is much better! I love them already! But that you were thinking of me makes them special.
string: 哈哈哈!不,不,这好多了!我已经爱上它们了!但你想到我就更特别。

original: Thank you, my friend.
string: 谢谢你，朋友。

original: You've come a long way as a mage. I'm proud of you.
string: 作为一名法师,你已经走过了很长的路。我为你感到骄傲。

original: And you've been by my side thought all of it. I'm grateful.
string: 你一直陪伴在我身旁,思考着所有事情,我很感激。

original: Maybe it's time to start thinking of yourself as a real mage.
string: 也许现在该开始把自己视作真正的法师了。

original: Maybe you're right. I had a lot of misconceptions about mages going into this. I was even a bit intimidated.
string: 也许你说得对。我对法师进入这里有很多误解,甚至有点害怕。

original: They're not armored, so I hope this inspires you to finally get decent at Alteration magic.
string: 它们没有盔甲,所以我希望这能激励你最终在变化系魔法上有所成就。

original: Oh, shit. Heh heh heh, I hope you're volunteering to help me study.
string: 噢,该死。哈哈哈,希望你自愿来帮助我学习。

original: It does feel good to celebrate!
string: 庆祝一下真的很不错!

original: I have the Star.
string: 我有“孤独城之星”。

original: Excellent! My contact is at Radiant Raiment back in Solitude. We could go there any time you're ready.
string: 好极了！我的联系人在独孤城的锦衣服饰店。 只要你准备好了，我们随时可以去那里。

original: My contact is at Radiant Raiment back in Solitude. We could go there any time you're ready.
string: 我的联络人在独孤城的锦衣服饰店。只要你准备好了，我们随时可以去那里。

original: We have the Star. What's next?
string: 我们有了“孤独城之星”。接下来呢？

original: It's you. Oh, what delight.
string: 是你啊。哦，真高兴。

original: It's delightful to see you again, too. I've missed you.
string: 很高兴再次见到你。我好想你。

original: You expect me to believe that? Points for creativity, if nothing else.
string: 你以为我会相信吗？如果不出意外的话，这也算是一种创意吧。

original: All right, I surrender! I wish I could say this was a social call. I need your expertise on a specific item. I'm in a bit of a bind between two parties.
string: 好吧，我投降！我真希望我能说这是一次社交拜访。有件事我需要你的专业意见。我在两方之间有点左右为难。

original: Gold solves most problems, doesn't it?
string: 有钱好办事，对吧？

original: Not this time. I need to pull one over on Aldis. Probably the castle Steward and the Court Mage, too.
string: 这次不行，我得把艾迪斯干掉。可能还有城堡管家和宫廷法师。

original: Fools I could do without... Okay, just this once. I do hope you know what you're doing.
string: 傻瓜我不需要… 好吧，就这一次，我希望你知道自己在做什么。

original: Don't I always? I'll see you in a day.
string: 我不是一直都这样吗？待会儿见。

original: I've come to get the copy of the Star.
string: 我是来拿“孤独城之星”复制品的。

original: Finally...
string: 终于…

original: Thanks for the help.
string: 谢谢你的帮助。

original: Ah, contracts like that are few and far between it seems. Makes me long for the old days.
string: 啊，像这样的合同似乎太少了。我真怀念以前的日子…。

original: Between you and me, this is a terrible idea and I can't believe I let Serano talk me into it.
string: 我跟你说，这主意糟透了，我居然让塞拉诺说服了我。

original: Yeah, sure it is. He is rather handsome though, isn't he?
string: 是啊，没错。不过他挺帅的，不是吗？

original: Serano and I have returned with the Star of Solitude.
string: 塞拉诺和我已经带着“孤独城之星”回来了。

original: Well now, that is something. Hand it over, please.
string: 好吧，这就够了。请给我吧。

original: So he's free to go?
string: 那么他可以走了？

original: Yes, and don't make yourselves my problem again. I catch you stealing anything, I'll see to it you remain in irons for the rest of your days!
string: 好了，别再给我惹麻烦了。如果我抓到你们偷东西，我会让你们在牢里度过余生。

original: Thank you. I don't know how I'll ever repay you for helping me.
string: 谢谢你。我不知道该如何报答你对我的帮助。

original: I'm sorry I dragged you into this mess- ahem. I had no right. If you still want my company or my help with anything, for any reason, you have it.
string: 我很抱歉把你牵扯进来。我没有权利这么做，如果你还需要我的陪伴，或者我的帮助，无论什么原因，你都可以找我。

original: I need to know if I can trust you.
string: 我需要知道，我是否能信任你。

original: For most of my life, I've been surrounded by people who would knife you in your sleep for a few Septims.
string: 在我大半辈子的生活中，我身边的人都会在你睡觉的时候为了几块钱对你动刀子。

original: You show too much of yourself to someone like that, well, it will be used against you. Honesty doesn't come easily to me.
string: 如果你在这样的人面前表现得太过真实，那就会被利用来对付你。诚实对我来说并不容易。

original: You're a thief and a liar... and my kind of rogue!
string: 你是个小偷、骗子…是我喜欢的那种流氓！

original: (laughs) Let's you and me make some bad decisions.
string: 哈哈哈，啊…让你我做一些错误的决定吧。

original: You lie as easily as breathing, and I don't trust you.
string: 你说谎就像呼吸一样容易，我不相信你。

original: After all we've been through, that cuts me to the core.
string: 在我们经历了这么多之后，这让我很伤心。

original: Look, if nothing else, can you believe that I care about my own skin enough to settle my debt to you?
string: 听着，如果不出意外，你能相信我这么在乎自己的安危来偿还欠你的债吗？

original: Not right now, but I'll let you know if I change my mind.
string: 暂时没有，但如果我改变主意了，我会告诉你的。

original: As you wish. I'll be at the Winking Skeever in Solitude if you want to find me.
string: 如你所愿，如果你想找我，我会在独孤城的眨眼雪鼠酒吧。

original: If we're going to travel together, we need to talk.
string: 如果我们要一起旅行，我们得谈谈。

original: I figured you'd say that. What's on your mind?
string: 我就知道你会这么说。你是怎么想的？

original: I'm not out to get you, Val. I've done nothing but help.
string: 我不是来找你麻烦的，瓦尔，我只是想帮你。

original: I sailed with Fathis for almost... twenty years.
string: 我和法提斯一起航行了将近…二十年。

original: Before I had her, another man captained the Dark Rose. We were close as family... 'Til one day we weren't.
string: 在我有她之前，黑玫瑰号的船长是另一个男人。我们亲如家人…直到有一天，我们不再是了。

original: I took command after he left, and it seemed natural for Fathis take my place as First Mate. I thought he was my best friend... right up until the day he tried to have me killed.
string: 他走后我接管了指挥权，法提斯自然而然地接替了我的大副位置。我以为他是我最好的朋友…直到有一天他想杀了我。

original: Fortunately for me, my predecessor had 'fond' memories of our time together. He graciously left me alive so I could die at my convenience on a deserted island.
string: 幸运的是，我的前任对我们在一起的时光有着“美好”的回忆。他慷慨地留我一命，让我可以在方便的时候死在荒岛上。

original: The only reason I didn't was blind luck that you found me.
string: 我没有这么做的唯一原因就是你找到了我，这是我的运气。

original: I know you're not like either of those men. I am trying.
string: 我知道你跟他们两个都不一样。我正在努力。

original: That act might work on some, but not with me if we're going to be partners.
string: 这招可能对某些人有用，但如果我们要做搭档的话，对我就没用了。

original: I sailed with Fathis for almost... twenty years.
string: 我和法提斯一起航行了将近…二十年。

original: Before I had her, another man captained the Dark Rose. We were close as family... 'Til one day we weren't.
string: 在我有她之前，黑玫瑰号的船长是另一个男人。我们亲如家人…直到有一天，我们不再是了。

original: I took command after he left, and it seemed natural for Fathis take my place as First Mate. I thought he was my best friend... right up until the day he tried to have me killed.
string: 他走后我接管了指挥权，法提斯自然而然地接替了我的大副位置。我以为他是我最好的朋友…直到有一天他想杀了我。

original: Fortunately for me, my predecessor had 'fond' memories of our time together. He graciously left me alive so I could die at my convenience on a deserted island.
string: 幸运的是，我的前任对我们在一起的时光有着“美好”的回忆。他慷慨地留我一命，让我可以在方便的时候死在荒岛上。

original: The only reason I didn't was blind luck that you found me.
string: 我没有这么做的唯一原因就是你找到了我，这是我的运气。

original: Anyway, I'll try not to play it so close to the vest next time. Here's to a fresh start.
string: 不管怎样，下次我尽量不说得太透。为新的开始干杯。

original: I can trust your self-interest.
string: 我可以相信你的私心。

original: Well, that's a start. Since you insist-
string: 好吧，这是一个开始。既然你坚持-

original: I sailed with Fathis for almost... twenty years.
string: 我和法提斯一起航行了将近…二十年。

original: Before I had her, another man captained the Dark Rose. We were close as family... 'Til one day we weren't.
string: 在我有她之前，黑玫瑰号的船长是另一个男人。我们亲如家人…直到有一天，我们不再是了。

original: I took command after he left, and it seemed natural for Fathis take my place as First Mate. I thought he was my best friend... right up until the day he tried to have me killed.
string: 他走后我接管了指挥权，法提斯自然而然地接替了我的大副位置。我以为他是我最好的朋友…直到有一天他想杀了我。

original: Fortunately for me, my predecessor had 'fond' memories of our time together. He graciously left me alive so I could die at my convenience on a deserted island.
string: 幸运的是，我的前任对我们在一起的时光有着“美好”的回忆。他慷慨地留我一命，让我可以在方便的时候死在荒岛上。

original: The only reason I didn't was blind luck that you found me.
string: 我没有这么做的唯一原因就是你找到了我，这是我的运气。

original: So forgive me if I'm a little reserved.
string: 所以请原谅我有点拘谨。

original: I don't know about you, but I'm not particularly impressed with these Synod mages. Maybe whatever he has in his pockets will be more useful than he was.
string: 我不知道你怎么想，但我对这些主教法师印象不深。也许他口袋里的东西会比他更有用。

original: More dead Synod, but no sign of what they were looking for with this crystal. (sigh) Did none of these s'wits keep notes?
string: 更多的人死了，但没有迹象表明他们在用这块水晶寻找什么。难道这些聪明人都不记笔记吗？

original: Dead Falmer and destroyed machines... Finally, someone competent has come through here. The question is, are they gonna be friendly?
string: 死去的伐莫和被摧毁的机器…终于有人来了。问题是，他们是友好的吗？

original: Ah, another dead mage. We must be headed in the right direction!
string: 啊，又死了一个法师。我们的方向一定没错。

original: We ought to kill him so he can't report what he's seen. Besides, his Dwemer pronunciation is horrendous.
string: 我们应该杀了他，这样他就不能报告他所看到的了。而且，他的丹莫语发音太难听了。

original: Val, the Psijic Order was here again...
string: 瓦尔， 塞伊克教团又来了…

original: I'm getting real tired of that guy. If he knows the so-called 'path,' then he could be a lot more helpful.
string: 我真的受够那家伙了。如果他知道所谓的“路径”，那么他可能会更有帮助。

original: That was Savos Aren! But I don't recognize any of the other mages with him. Is this a real memory or some kind of trick?
string: 那是萨沃斯·阿冉。但我认不出和他一起的其他法师。这是真实的记忆，还是什么把戏？

original: Damnit, that was a spell!
string: 该死，那是个咒语！

original: Great... there's no enemy like an old friend. Maybe he'll be happy the Arch-Mage is dead?
string: 太好了…没有敌人比得上老朋友。也许他会很高兴大法师死了？

original: Aren's dead. Show yourself, coward.
string: 阿伦死了！现身吧，胆小鬼。

original: It's not easy when you lose crewmates... especially if it was your fault.
string: 失去船员并不容易…尤其是如果这是你的错。

original: This isn't working! We need another strategy!
string: 这样不行！我们需要另一种策略！

original: Oh, it's personal!
string: 哦，这是个人问题！

original: Don't worry about the anomalies. Get Ancano!
string: 别担心异常现象。去找安卡诺。

original: I never was much good at following the rules.
string: 我从来都不擅长循规蹈矩。

original: Nice try. It's gonna take more than that to keep me down.
string: 干得好我可不想被你吓倒。

original: I'm the Arch-Mage of the College of Winterhold...
string: 我是冬堡学院的大法师…

original: Yeah. (laughs) Who else were they gonna get?
string: 是啊，他们还能找谁？

original: It's well-deserved though. The rest of this crew could use some training, and you saved the day!
string: 不过这也是实至名归。这支队伍的其他成员需要一些训练，而你拯救了他们！

original: Yeah. (laughs) Who else were they gonna get?
string: 是啊，他们还能找谁？

original: It's well-deserved though. The rest of this crew could use some training, and you saved the day!
string: 不过这也是实至名归。这支队伍的其他成员需要一些训练，而你拯救了他们！

original: Yeah. (laughs) Who else were they gonna get?
string: 是啊，他们还能找谁？

original: It's well-deserved though. The rest of this crew could use some training, and you saved the day!
string: 不过这也是实至名归。这支队伍的其他成员需要一些训练，而你拯救了他们！

original: You're an incredibly talented mage, and the College is lucky to have you.
string: 你是一位才华横溢的法师，学院有你真是幸运。

original: Yeah. (laughs) Who else were they gonna get?
string: 是啊，他们还能找谁？

original: It's well-deserved though. The rest of this crew could use some training, and you saved the day!
string: 不过这也是实至名归。这支队伍的其他成员需要一些训练，而你拯救了他们！

original: You're an incredibly talented mage, and the College is lucky to have you.
string: 你是一位才华横溢的法师，学院有你真是幸运。

original: You're talented, Val. The College could have just as easily picked you.
string: 你很有天赋，瓦尔。学院选你也很容易。

original: Hahahahaha! I'll never be that respectable. Keep dreaming!
string: 哈哈哈哈！我永远不会那么受人尊敬。继续做梦吧。

original: You've got official cover for 'relic hunting' now.
string: 你现在有了“猎取文物”的官方掩护。

original: I was counting on it! In fact, I have a research budget proposal for you to look over when you have a few minutes.
string: 我就指望着它呢！事实上，我有一份研究预算提案，你有空时可以看看。

original: I think I'm going to step down and make you the Arch-Mage.
string: 我想我该下台了，让你来做大法师。

original: I've had my turn being a captain, love. This place is yours.
string: 我已经轮到当船长了，亲爱的，这地方是你的了。

original: Absolutely not! This place is your problem. I've got plans which do not involve getting tied down here.
string: 绝对不行。这地方是你的问题；我有计划，不需要被绑在这里。

original: I never would have gone to the College without your encouragement.
string: 如果没有您的鼓励，我永远也不会去上大学。

original: There's a lot I've learned in my life that's helped me here. I didn't expect that. I was comparing myself to the wrong things, y'know?
string: 我在生活中学到了很多东西，在这里对我很有帮助。我没想到会这样我把自己和错误的东西相比较，知道吗？

original: I'm glad we did this together.
string: 我很高兴我们一起做到了这一点。

original: Val, I'm a simple woman.
string: 瓦尔，我是个简单的女人。

original: I love that about you... there's something honest about it, and I always know exactly where I stand.
string: 我喜欢你这一点…有一种诚实的感觉，我总是很清楚自己的立场。

original: I love that about you... there's something honest about it, and I always know exactly where I stand.
string: 我喜欢你这一点…有一种诚实的感觉，我总是很清楚自己的立场。

original: Val, I'm a simple man.
string: 瓦尔，我是个简单的人。

original: I love that about you... there's something honest about it, and I always know exactly where I stand.
string: 我喜欢你这一点…有一种诚实的感觉，我总是很清楚自己的立场。

original: Val, I'm a simple mer.
string: 瓦尔，我是个简单的人。

original: I love that about you... there's something honest about it, and I always know exactly where I stand.
string: 我喜欢你这一点…有一种诚实的感觉，我总是很清楚自己的立场。

original: Val, I'm a simple person.
string: 瓦尔，我是个简单的人。

original: So... what happened? Where did you go?
string: 那么…发生了什么？你去哪儿了？

original: I'm not sure.
string: 我不确定。

original: Maybe with some more research, we'll figure out the mystery.
string: 也许再多做一些研究，我们就能弄清其中的奥秘。

original: It was a room like this one, but untouched by time. There was a display for dragon priest masks.
string: 那是一个和这个房间一样的房间，但没有经过时间的洗礼。这里陈列着龙祭司的面具。

original: Interesting... What do you think it was used for?
string: 有意思…你觉得它是用来做什么的？

original: The less said the better. Let's get out of here.
string: 说得越少越好。我们走吧。

original: Oh, absolutely not! Give me the mask; I'm trying it.
string: 哦，绝对不行！把面具给我，我要试试。

original: This city was once the center of the dragon cult. Perhaps it was a meeting area.
string: 这座城市曾经是拜龙教的中心。也许这里曾是一个集会场所。

original: That does seem reasonable.
string: 这看起来确实很合理。

original: Maybe with some more research, we'll figure out the mystery.
string: 也许再多做一些研究，我们就能弄清其中的奥秘。

original: We should collect the other masks and find out for certain.
string: 我们应该收集其他面具，然后找出答案。

original: Maybe it was a place to keep something valuable.
string: 也许那是一个存放贵重物品的地方。

original: Could be. Unless there were more wooden masks in the past, it's almost impossible to get in and out of there.
string: 有可能。除非过去有更多的木制面具，否则几乎不可能进出那里。

original: We should collect the other masks and find out for certain.
string: 我们应该收集其他面具，然后找出答案。

original: Hard to say without having all of the masks.
string: 没有所有的面具，很难说。

original: I like where this is going. What's our first target?
string: 我喜欢这样我们的第一个目标是什么？

original: You didn't tell me this was an isolated temporal pocket dimension! That was amazing!
string: 你没告诉我这是一个孤立的时空口袋维度！太不可思议了。

original: We have to get all the dragon priest masks and see what happens if we place them on that display stand.
string: 我们得把所有的龙祭司面具都拿过来，看看放在展示台上会发生什么。

original: What do you think we should do?
string: 那你觉得咱们现在怎么办？

original: Not sure. I think Ulfric's need for power and the Silver-Bloods' corruption created more Forsworn than they ever killed. Makes you wonder who's the rebel and who's the king.
string: 不确定。我认为乌弗瑞克对权力的需求和银血家族的腐败造成了更多的弃誓者。这让人怀疑谁是叛军，谁是国王。

original: I feel like we were just maids cleaning up Thonar's mess.
string: 我觉得我们只是清理托纳尔烂摊子的女佣。

original: I'm sure you had your reasons.
string: 我相信你一定有自己的理由。

original: It was the only way I could think of to clear our names.
string: 这是我能想到的唯一能还我们清白的办法。

original: Any port in a storm, I guess. At least the Silver-Bloods owe us a few favors.
string: 暴风雨中的任何港口，我猜。至少银血家族欠我们几个人情。

original: The Silver-Bloods owe us big time now.
string: 银血家族现在欠我们一个大人情了。

original: And we should exploit that for all it's worth, preferably to our financial advantage.
string: 我们应该充分利用这一点，最好是为了我们的经济利益。

original: The Forsworn are a lost cause. I picked the winning side.
string: 弃誓者是失败者。我选择了胜利的一方。

original: Maybe. It's hard not to feel some sympathy for them, though.
string: 也许吧。不过，很难不对他们产生一些同情。

original: The Forsworn will never rule the Reach if I have anything to say about it.
string: 弃誓者将永远无法统治这片大陆，如果我有什么话要说的话。

original: So it ends when they're all dead, huh? Hmp. Some days I miss being on a ship. Things are simpler at sea.
string: 他们都死了就结束了？嗯哼，有时候我真怀念在船上的日子，海上的事情更简单。

original: Let's hope Madanach remembers who his friends are next time we're in one of those Forsworn camps.
string: 希望下次再去那些弃誓者营地时，迈德纳奇还能记得谁是他的朋友。

original: I'm sure you had your reasons.
string: 我相信你一定有自己的理由。

original: The Forsworn have been treated unfairly. This seemed like the right thing to do.
string: 弃誓者受到了不公正的待遇。这样做似乎是正确的。

original: It's ironic that Ulfric can't stand to see them bargain with Daedra, but he's based his rebellion on having the freedom to worship Talos.
string: 具有讽刺意味的是，乌弗瑞克无法忍受他们与迪德拉交易，但他的反抗是建立在拥有崇拜塔洛斯的自由之上的。

original: It was the only way I could think of to get out of Cidhna Mine.
string: 这是我能想到的唯一离开锡纳矿井的办法。

original: Any port in a storm, I guess. The surviving Silver-Bloods will blame everything on the Forsworn and we can go about our business.
string: 风暴中的任何港口，我想。幸存的银血家族会把一切都归咎于弃誓者，我们就可以继续做我们的事了。

original: The Nords in the Reach will get what they deserve.
string: 瑞驰的诺德人将得到他们应得的惩罚。

original: Look, the Forsworn have my sympathy, but numbers and resources aren't on their side.
string: 听着，我很同情弃誓者，但人数和资源都不在他们这边。

original: Thonar Silver-Blood was a traitor and deserved to die.
string: 托纳尔·银血是个叛徒，死有余辜。

original: Pshaw! These powerful families are all the same. You should try using their greed to your advantage.
string: 嘘！这些有权有势的家族都一样。你应该试着利用他们的贪婪来为自己谋利。

original: I noticed something during the fighting.
string: 在战斗过程中，我注意到了一些东西。

original: Oh yeah? What'd you see?
string: 哦，是吗？你看到了什么？

original: I didn't know you could conjure a bound dagger; That's great!
string: 我不知道你还能变出一把绑定的匕首，太棒了！

original: Well, I only learned recently. I wasn't sure I'd mastered it yet.
string: 我也是最近才学会的。我还不确定自己是否掌握了它。

original: Since when do you know how to conjure a weapon?
string: 你从什么时候开始会变魔术了？

original: Since the first and last time I had to hide a shiv in prison. Never again.
string: 自从我第一次也是最后一次在监狱里不得不藏起一把尖刀开始。再也不会了。

original: Why didn't you tell me you could conjure a weapon out of thin air?!
string: 你为什么没告诉我你能凭空变出武器？

original: I wasn't trying to hide it from you. It's just a lot easier to break out of prison when the guards don't know you can cast certain spells.
string: 我不是想瞒着你，但如果狱警不知道你会某些咒语，越狱就容易多了。

original: Anyway, thanks for getting my gear. I can get by without it of course, but I'd rather do my thing in style.
string: 不管怎样，谢谢你帮我拿装备。当然，没有它我也能过得下去，但我更喜欢有格调地做事。

original: Can you ride?
string: 你会骑马吗？

original: I'm probably rusty, but yes.
string: 我可能已经生疏了，但还是可以的。

original: I travel a lot, so you're going to need a horse.
string: 我经常旅行，所以你需要一匹马。

original: Not a problem. Why don't we head over the stables outside of Solitude?
string: 没问题，我们为什么不去独孤城外的马厩看看呢？

original: Do you need to borrow money? We're not stealing horses.
string: 你需要借钱吗？我们不会偷马的。

original: Hey! I have money. Ha, ha, ha- I don't need your charity.
string: 嘿！我有钱。哈哈哈，我不需要你的施舍。

original: Besides, horse-thieving? No, no- poor taste. See, stealing's only an art form when the mark can afford it.
string: 再说，偷马？不，不，品味太差了。你看，只有当目标付得起钱时，偷窃才算是一种艺术。

original: Can I help you?
string: 我能为你效劳吗？

original: I'd like to buy a horse.
string: 我想买匹马儿。

original: How about something with a bit of kick?
string: 来点带劲的怎么样？

original: Had my eye on that gray over there by the stable. Would you take 1500 for him? With my compliments.
string: 我看中了马厩那边那匹灰马，一千五金币可以吗？这是我的心意。

original: For that price? Sure! Thanks.
string: 这个好价？当然！谢谢。

original: This lake is deeper than I expected. I wonder if it used to be larger? That would explain the supposed size of the wreck.
string: 这个湖比我想象的要深。不知道以前是不是更大？这就能解释沉船的大小了。

original: The water's crystal clear. I like watching all the fish.
string: 水清澈见底。我喜欢看所有的鱼。

original: I read that the Lady Stone is on an island out here. That's where we're headed.
string: 我读到“石夫人”就在这个岛上。那就是我们要去的地方。

original: Speaking of superstitions, I was talking to some of the fisherman, and there's a lot of wild tales about the sunken ruins to the north. Old Imperial fort.
string: 说到迷信，我和一些渔民聊了聊，有很多关于北边沉没废墟的荒诞传说。古老的帝国堡垒。

original: By the way, you look great. I think I like it when your hair's a bit wind-tossed.
string: 顺便说一句，你看起来很棒。我喜欢你头发被风吹乱的样子！

original: By the way, you look great. The fresh air and wind suits you!
string: 顺便说一句，你看起来气色不错。清新的空气和风很适合你！

original: You know, at sea there's nothing to look at except the endless blue of sky and waves. It's a sight I've always loved. Things are simple at sea.
string: 要知道，在海上，除了一望无际的蓝色天空和海浪，什么都看不到。我一直很喜欢这种景象。海上的一切都很简单。

original: It's not much further. I wonder if we should have packed lunch?
string: 没多远了不知道我们是否应该带午餐？

original: And you got caught.
string: 瓦尔！

original: It was in a tomb filled with draugr, and I didn't think they'd miss it.
string: 它就在一个充满尸鬼的坟墓里，我想他们不会错过的。

original: Turns out I was wrong. To be fair, the Blue Palace would've never noticed if Fathis hadn't turned me in.
string: 事实证明我错了。公平地说，如果不是法提斯告发我，蓝宫也不会发现。

original: Godsdamnit.
string: 该死。

original: It was in a tomb filled with draugr, and I didn't think they'd miss it.
string: 它就在一个充满尸鬼的坟墓里，我想他们不会错过的。

original: Turns out I was wrong. To be fair, the Blue Palace would've never noticed if Fathis hadn't turned me in.
string: 事实证明我错了。公平地说，如果不是法提斯告发我，蓝宫也不会发现。

original: What was it like growing up on a ship?
string: 在船上长大是一种什么样的感觉？

original: I don't mind that you read it, but you could ask me first.
string: 我不介意你读它，但你可以先问我。

original: About your journal...
string: 关于你的日记…

original: It's hard to explain. I wrote sometimes to help me think. You can read this, if you like.
string: 这很难解释。我有时写东西来帮助自己思考。如果你喜欢，可以读读这个。

original: That's a beautiful necklace, especially on you. Huh. A man could assume some things from your wearing it.
string: 这条项链真漂亮，尤其是戴在你身上。嗯。一个男人可以从你的穿着中推断出一些东西。

original: Sir, my companion would like to speak with you.
string: 先生，我的同伴想和你谈谈。

original: Ah greetings, Captain!
string: 你好，船长！

original: (doin' a big bork of agreement)
string: （表示同意）

original: Who's the best dog ever?
string: 谁是史上最棒的狗狗？

original: That's right! It's you, buddy!
string: 没错，就是你，伙计！

original: Hello, Endarie.
string: 你好，恩达蕊。

original: Hello, Mother.
string: 你好，母亲。

original: Son! It's so good to see you.
string: 儿子！见到你真高兴。

original: I always forget how tall you are, Valerius. I remember when you were small enough to hold in my arms...
string: 我总是忘记你有多高了，瓦列利乌斯。 我还记得你还小得可以抱在怀里的时候…

original: Mother, please don't start...
string: 母亲，请不要开口…

original: Oh, all right. I'm just so happy for you!
string: 哦，好吧。我太为你高兴了！

original: Thank you. And... I'm glad you're here.
string: 谢谢。还有… 很高兴你能来。

original: Let's get out of here. If the water can get in, then we can get out. Swim for the ceiling!
string: 让我们离开这里。如果水可以进入,那么我们就能出来。朝天花板游泳!

original: I love you, Val.
string: 我爱你，瓦尔。

original: I love you, Aelyn. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，艾琳。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Aislinn. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，阿斯林。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Alannah. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，阿兰娜。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Aris. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，阿里斯。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Bree. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，布里。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Cyndrian. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，辛德里安。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Cyr. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，希尔。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Dahlia. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，达丽亚，从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Elise. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，伊利丝。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Illia. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，伊利亚。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Inula. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，伊努拉。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Jacek. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，雅斯克，从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Joseph. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，约瑟夫。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Luna. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，露娜。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Maevynn. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，梅维恩。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Maximillian. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，马克西米利安。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Min. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，敏。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Myfanwy. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，米凡维。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Rathas. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，拉萨斯。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Ren. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，仁。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Ruby. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，鲁比。从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Thelassia. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，瑟拉西亚从现在到永远。

original: I love you, Valerian. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你，瓦雷利安。从现在到永远。

original: I love you.
string: 我爱你。

original: You're the love of my life.
string: 你是我一生的挚爱。

original: And I love you.
string: 我爱你。

original: Val, I love you! I don't know why it was so hard to tell you...
string: 瓦尔，我爱你！我不知道为什么告诉你这么难…

original: Hahaha! Ah! I dreamed of hearing you say those words. You already know how I feel about you, and I'll say it again- I love you.
string: 哈哈哈！我做梦都想听你说这些话。你已经知道我对你的感觉，我再说一遍--我爱你。

original: I've got a lot to tell you, but... later. Let's get out of here and go home, love.
string: 我有很多话要对你说，不过… 以后吧。我们离开这里回家吧，亲爱的。

original: I don't know how we're gonna get out of this one.
string: 我不知道我们怎么才能逃脱这一次。

original: Get to the top of the statue!
string: 快到雕像顶部去!

original: Take a look at this note. They weren't after me.
string: 看看这张纸条。他们不是冲我来的。

original: Morag Tong... Gah, he's not messin' around.
string: 莫拉格堂… 啊，他可不是闹着玩的。

original: Any idea who might want to kill you?
string: 知道谁想杀你吗？

original: Any number of old business partners. But this is about what happened in Solitude before we met.
string: 任何一个老生意伙伴都可能。但这是关于我们相遇之前在独孤城发生的事情。

original: The note I found about the mutiny was also signed 'T.S.'
string: 我发现的那张关于叛变的纸条上也署名'T.S'。

original: Yeah. That would be Tarek Serano... my father.
string: 嗯。那是塔里克·塞拉诺…我的父亲。

original: Yeah. That would be Tarek Serano... my father.
string: 我父亲那就是塔里克·塞拉诺…我的父亲。

original: There was mention of a rival captain for the Dark Rose.
string: 有人提到了“黑玫瑰”号的对手船长。

original: What?!
string: 什么？！

original: I told you he was a pirate, but there's more to it than that.
string: 我告诉过你他是个海盗，但不止如此。

original: I'm so sorry.
string: 我很抱歉。

original: Don't be. He's a ruthless old bastard.
string: 别这样。他是个无情的老混蛋。

original: I've heard of family squabbles, but this is ridiculous.
string: 我听说过家庭纠纷，但这太荒唐了。

original: Hilarious and insightful, as usual.
string: 一如既往的幽默风趣，见解独到。

original: The Dark Rose was originally my father's ship. I grew up sailing on her crew and rose through the ranks. If you think being the captain's son made it any easier, think again.
string: 黑玫瑰号最初是我父亲的船。我从小在她的船员中长大，一路升迁。如果你觉得做船长的儿子会容易些，那就再想想吧。

original: When I was old enough, and clever enough, I took the ship for my own. I couldn't kill him though.
string: 当我长大了，也足够聪明的时侯，我把船夺过来了。但我杀不了他。

original: I don't know if Fathis actually missed him or just hated me more, but that fetcher could have never planned this by himself.
string: 我不知道法提斯是真的想他了，还是更恨我了，但那个混蛋绝对不可能自己计划好这一切。

original: My father was responsible for the mutiny.
string: 我的父亲要对叛变负责。

original: What will you do now?
string: 接下来你要怎么做？

original: Stop dragging you into my problems, for a start. I'll take care of this; you don't owe me anything.
string: 首先，别再把你扯进我的麻烦里。我会处理好的，你不欠我什么。

original: I've been with you through this much; I'm not about to abandon you now.
string: 我和你一起经历了这么多；我现在不会抛弃你的。

original: Thank you. You have no idea what that means to me.
string: 谢谢你。你不知道这对我意味着什么。

original: Of course I don't, but we're in this together. You need all the help you can get.
string: 我当然不知道，但我们是一条船上的。你需要所有你能得到的帮助。

original: I'm glad we are. It's more than I deserve, and you're not wrong about the help.
string: 我很高兴我们是。这比我应得的要多，你说的帮助也没错。

original: I wish. We've been seen together enough that I'm involved regardless.
string: 我倒希望如此。我们在一起的次数已经够多了，无论如何我都会参与其中。

original: Self-interest, always the most reliable form of interest. Touching. Speaking of which-
string: 自身利益，永远是最可靠的利益形式。真感人。说到这--

original: The first thing my father needs to do is score some quick loot to buy the loyalty of the crew. No better place around here to offload goods than Broken Oar Grotto. We should check it out.
string: 我父亲需要做的第一件事，就是迅速获得一些战利品，以收买船员的忠诚。这里没有比断桨洞窟更好的卸货地点了，我们应该去看看。

original: I see you're not dead yet. Well done.
string: 看来你还没死。干得好。

original: Sending assassins was just rude. I thought you were retired.
string: 派刺客来真是太失礼了。我以为你已经退休了。

original: You don't visit, you don't write... How else is an old man supposed to see his son?
string: 你不去探望，也不写信… 一个老人还怎么去看他的儿子？

original: Having me thrown in prison and taking my ship is your idea of a family reunion?
string: 把我关进监狱，夺走我的船，这就是你所谓的家庭团聚？

original: You had a good run, boy, but the Dark Rose will always be mine.
string: 小子，你的表现不错，但黑玫瑰永远是我的。

original: I took her from you once; I can take her again. And you won't have my treacherous first mate in your pocket, either. What did you promise him?
string: 我能从你手里夺走过她一次，我还能再夺回来。你的口袋里也不会有我那奸诈的大副了，你答应过他什么？

original: Oh, Fathis always hated you. For years... The captain's son, standing in his way. He imagined I went easy on you. (laughs) (sigh)
string: 噢，法提斯一直都恨你。多年来… 船长的儿子挡了他的路，他以为我对你宽容了。

original: But you were the smart one, and better at this life until you went soft. Good thing you took care of him, though. Wasn't sure you still had it in you.
string: 我能从你手里夺走过她一次，我还能再夺回来。我那奸诈的大副也不会被你收买。你答应过他什么？

original: Can't trust a man who'll betray his best friend. It was only a matter of time before he'd have betrayed me as well.
string: 不能相信一个会背叛好朋友的人，他迟早也会背叛我的。

original: I did you a favor.
string: 我帮了你的忙。

original: A favor?! You left me to die!
string: 帮我的忙？！你让我自生自灭！

original: It's time for me to return your 'favor.'
string: 该是我还你“人情”的时候了。

original: Then I'll see you in Oblivion!
string: 那我们就湮灭再见了！

original: Tell them who sent you!
string: 告诉他们是谁派你来的！

original: (laughs)
(laughs)
(laughs)
Have you always kept a journal?
string: 你一直都有写日记吗？

original: Not for years. I keep it as a reminder.
string: 很多年没写了。我留着它是为了提醒自己。

original: A reminder of what?
string: 提醒你什么？

original: The price of knowledge.
string: 知识的代价。

original: My father was never around because my mother left him. She didn't want me to grow up ashamed, so she filled my head with these stories about him.
string: 我父亲从不在我身边，因为我母亲离开了他。她不想让我在成长过程中感到自卑，所以她给我灌输了很多关于他的故事。

original: Who knows if any of them were ever true, but I don't think she anticipated the result.
string: 谁知道这些话中有没有一句是真的，但我想她没有预料到会有这样的结果。

original: I ran away to join my father's crew. They weren't what I expected, but I stayed anyway.
string: 我离家出走加入了父亲的船队，他们和我想象的不一样，但我还是留下来了。

original: Your father turned out to be a pirate?
string: 你的父亲原来是个海盗？

original: And a smuggler, and a thief, and a liar. I guess the apple didn't fall too far from the tree, huh?
string: 还是个走私犯、小偷和骗子。我想是有其父必有其子吧？

original: Why did you stay?
string: 你为什么要留下来？

original: I had dreamed my entire life of going to sea. I had an idea in my head of what it would be like, of who I was going to be. And it took me so long to realize what a naive idiot I was.
string: 我一生都梦想着出海。我脑子里想的是出海会是什么样子，我将成为什么样的人，过了很久我才意识到自己是个多么天真的傻瓜。

original: Everyone makes mistakes.
string: 每个人都会犯错。

original: Mistakes are different when they're mine.
string: 我犯的错误是不一样的。

original: It sure didn't.
string: 当然不是。

original: Heh. See, now that was the part where you should have reassured me that I'm not so bad.
string: 哈。你看，这才是你该安慰我说我没那么坏的时候。

original: I don't want to romanticize the life I've led. I could have made different choices. I saw how my parents both struggled, hmh- and I resented it.
string: 我不想把我的生活浪漫化。我本可以做出不同的选择。我看到了我的父母是如何挣扎的，我对此深恶痛绝。

original: And I just couldn't stand the thought of sitting in a tiny room all day studying or working some 'respectable' job.
string: 我实在无法忍受整天坐在狭小的房间里学习或做一些“体面”的工作。

original: Do you have any sense of purpose?
string: 你有什么目标感吗？

original: That's the problem. I don't know. I almost envy those that do have a calling, you know? I just can't imagine what it would be like.
string: 这就是问题所在。我不知道，我几乎要羡慕那些有使命感的人了，你知道吗？我只是无法想象那会是什么样子。

original: A rebel without a cause sticking it to the rich, huh?
string: 一个叛逆者无缘无故的向富人发难，是吧？

original: Something like that. It's one of those things that sounds grand in a speech to the crew but feels like a hypocritical excuse when I say it to you.
string: 差不多吧，这种话在对船员们说的时候听起来很冠冕堂皇，但对你说的时候却觉得是个虚伪的借口。

original: That doesn't justify anything you've done.
string: 这并不能证明你所做的一切是正确的。

original: It's a good thing you don't know the half of what I've done.
string: 幸好你还不知道我做了些什么。

original: My father was a Dunmer, and he raised me as one. I was taught that we're meant to struggle and to survive by any means.
string: 我父亲是丹莫人，他把我当丹莫人抚养长大。我被灌输了这样的思想：我们注定要挣扎，不择手段地生存下去。

original: What to do with yourself after you survive, well, he never talked about that much.
string: 至于活下来之后该怎么办，他从来没怎么说过。

original: That's quite a look you have going on.
string: 你的表情可真丰富。

original: Of all the Daedric Princes, we get the one with no sense of style. Your outfit is atrocious, and that suit Sheogorath is wearing manages to clash with itself.
string: 在所有的迪德拉王子中，我们找到了一个没有时尚感的。你的打扮太糟糕了，而谢戈拉斯穿的那套衣服却与自己的风格相冲突。

original: Have you ever heard of the Red Wave?
string: 你听说过赤红波浪号吗?

original: Heh, she's a pirate ship. Big and slow. So, she mostly sticks to the north and pretends to be a trading vessel.
string: 呵,她是一艘海盗船。又大又慢。所以她基本上停留在北方,假装成一艘贸易船。

original: Balmora Blue doesn't fall out of the sky. Sabine's got to have a contact helping her. If she's uncooperative we should search the ship for information.
string: 巴尔莫拉蓝调并不是从天而降的。撒比尼必须有人帮忙。如果她不合作,我们应该搜查船上寻找信息。

original: Reminds me of my mother, only she was always more complimentary about my looks.
string: 让我想起我的母亲,只是她总是更夸奖我的外貌。

original: I'm not impressed by the traps or the treasure so much as Strong-Arm expecting her crew to read all those notes.
string: 我并不被陷阱或宝藏所震撼,而是对强力之臂期望她的船员阅读所有那些笔记感到惊讶。

original: It's over, Tarek.
string: 一切都结束了，塔里克。

original: I certainly underestimated you.
string: 我确实低估了你。

original: You underestimate your son.
string: 你低估了你的儿子。

original: What nonsense has the boy been putting in your head? This world destroys the weak. We're meant to be tested! I made him what he is.
string: 那孩子给你灌输了什么胡言乱语？这个世界毁灭弱者，我们注定要接受考验，是我造就了他。

original: Val's made more of himself than you'll ever be.
string: 瓦尔比你做得更好。

original: Exactly the kind of sentimental drivel I'd expect from one of his 'attachments.' You seem to have hung around longer than most, though. We'll see if it lasts.
string: 这正是他的“附属品”中我所期待的那种多愁善感的胡言乱语。不过，你似乎比大多数人都坚持得久。我们拭目以待。

original: And yet he's bested you. Again.
string: 但他还是赢了你。又一次。

original: How else would I have taught him anything?
string: 要不然我怎么会教他什么呢？

original: I don't know what's worse: your massive ego or that you actually believe yourself.
string: 我不知道哪个更糟糕：是你的自负，还是你真的相信自己。

original: I'll die of boredom from your attempts at wit before my wounds.
string: 在我受伤之前，我会被你的玩笑烦死的。

original: You're wrong about him.
string: 你看错他了。

original: I knew I was sending Fathis to his death. Never forget that about your 'friend.'
string: 我知道我是在送法提斯去死。永远不要忘记你的“朋友”。

original: Now, let's get this over with.
string: 现在，让我们结束这一切吧。

original: I'm not like you. You're free to go.
string: 我和你不一样。你可以走了。

original: As you wish...
string: 如你所愿…

original: Get out of here before I change my mind.
string: 趁我还没改变主意，赶紧离开这里。

original: (laughs) As you wish... (laughs)
string: 如你所愿…

original: (kill Tarek Serano)
string: （杀死塔里克·塞拉诺）

original: Urgh... ahhh....
string: 唉…啊…。

original: Do you agree to be bound together, in love, now and forever?
string: 你们愿意结为一体，永远相爱吗？

original: I do, now and forever.
string: 我愿意，直到天长地久。

original: Under the authority of Mara, the Divine of Love, I declare this couple to be wed.
string: 在玛拉和圣灵的见证下，我宣布这对情侣结为夫妇。

original: I present the two of you with these matching rings, blessed by Mara's divine grace. May they protect each of you in your new life together.
string: 我赠给你们这对带有玛拉神圣赐福的对戒，愿它们在你们的新生活中保佑你们。

original: Val and I would like to have our wedding here at the Temple.
string: 瓦尔和我想在神庙举行婚礼。

original: You wish to be married? It's good to see love blossoming, even during these difficult times.
string: 你想结婚？能看见爱情绽放真好，即使是在这艰难的年头。

original: Your wedding will be held tomorrow.
string: 你的婚礼明天举行。

original: Let's begin the ceremony.
string: 让我们开始仪式吧。

original: I do, now and forever.
string: 我愿意，直到天长地久。

original: It was Mara that first gave birth to all of creation and pledged to watch over us as her children.
string: 是玛拉赐予我们以至于万物生命，并将我们当做自己的孩子。

original: It is from her love of us that we first learned to love one another. It is from this love that we learn that a life lived alone is no life at all.
string: 从她的关爱中，我们第一次懂得去爱，从她的关爱中，我们懂得孤独的人生是不完整的。

original: We gather here today, under Mara's loving gaze, to bear witness to the union of two souls in eternal companionship.
string: 我们齐聚于此，在玛拉慈爱的注视中，见证两个灵魂的结合。

original: May they journey forth together in this life and the next, in prosperity and poverty, and in joy and hardship.
string: 愿他们无论贫穷还是富有，顺境还是逆境，都能相伴一生。

original: Do you agree to be bound together, in love, now and forever?
string: 你们愿意结为一体，永远相爱吗？

original: His problem was that he lacked imagination.
string: 他的问题在于缺乏想象力。

original: Catch! Ha ha ha ha ha!
string: 接住，哈哈哈哈！

original: Heads up!
string: 抬头！

original: Incoming!
string: 攻进去！

original: Snowball fight!
string: 打雪仗！

original: Look alive!
string: 要有活力！

original: I suppose I'd better get myself ready! I'll see you tomorrow, love.
string: 我想我得准备一下了，明天见，亲爱的。

original: We're ready to begin the ceremony.
string: 我们准备好开始仪式了。

original: This one's all you.
string: 这都是你的功劳。

original: Not happening.
string: 不可能。

original: Sorry, ah, this one's going to need the key.
string: 抱歉，啊，这个需要钥匙。

original: Damn, I can't open it.
string: 可恶，打不开。

original: There.
string: 好了。

original: You're welcome!
string: 不用客气 ！

original: You're lucky you have me around.
string: 有我在你身边算你走运。

original: Am I good, or what?
string: 我是不是很厉害？

original: What would you do without me?
string: 如果没有我，你该怎么办？

original: Psst, Val-
string: 嘘，瓦尔-

original: I need you to open this. Quietly.
string: 我要你打开这个。别出声。

original: No promises.
string: 我不能保证。

original: I need you to carry some things.
string: 我需要你帮我拿点东西。

original: Right now?
string: 现在好些了吗？

original: Lights out. We don't want to attract attention.
string: 熄灯。我们不想引起别人的注意。

original: Wait RIGHT here.
string: 在这儿等等。

original: I can hold still when it's important.
string: 重要的时候我能保持不动。

original: Just checking on you.
string: 只是来看看你的情况。

original: I'm good.
string: 我很好。

original: (click, click, click) Here, boy!
string: （咔哒，咔哒，咔哒）来，孩子！

original: Aren't you just a handsome fella. I think I'm gonna call you Windward.
string: 你真是个帅小伙。我就叫你迎风起航吧。

original: I'm ready to go whenever you are.
string: 你什么时候走，我就什么时候走。

original: Would you set up our campsite?
string: 你能帮我们搭个营地吗？

original: Hahahahaha! Yeah, I don't think so. Here's ten gold; let's get a nice room at an inn.
string: 哈哈哈哈哈哈！嗯，我不这么认为。给你十个金币；我们在旅店找个好房间吧。

original: Enemy closing!
string: 敌人正在逼近！

original: You let him live.
string: 你让他活了下来。

original: He's still your father. Will you be all right?
string: 他仍然是你的父亲。

original: I've been trying to please him my whole damn life. I used to think, if I could just show him I was good enough that he'd care. I lived for those moments when he would approve of me, when he would accept me.
string: 我这辈子都在努力取悦他。我曾经想，如果我能向他展示我足够优秀，他就会在乎我。我一直在等待他认可我，接受我的那一刻。

original: It's natural to want a parent's love.
string: 渴望得到父母的爱是很正常的。

original: Yeah, well... He didn't really love me, he just liked that I made him look good. I was so angry. It was easier that way. Everything was supposed to be different once I became captain. Instead, it made me miserable.
string: 是的，嗯… 他并不是真的爱我，他只是喜欢我让他看起来很好。我很生气。那样更容易些。我当上船长后，一切都不一样了。相反，这让我很痛苦。

original: What do you mean?
string: 你是什么意思？

original: I just had more freedom to act on my vices. Once I had no one else to blame, well, I had to look in the mirror.
string: 我只是有了更多的自由来恣意妄为。一旦没有人可以责怪我，我就不得不照照镜子。

original: Wasn't it everything you'd always wanted?
string: 这难道不是你一直想要的一切吗？

original: Hah, hah. Yeah. I read too many stories as a kid. The reality is, you can't be some kind of swashbuckling hero and run a crew of corsairs and cutthroats.
string: 哈，哈。是啊，我小时候故事看多了。现实是，你不可能成为一个恃强凌弱的英雄，也不可能管理一群海盗和流氓。

original: Guess you can lie to everyone but yourself, huh?
string: 我猜你可以对所有人撒谎，除了你自己，对吧？

original: I never said I was a saint. But I spent enough time in my own head that I didn't have the luxury of hiding from myself anymore.
string: 我从来没有说过我是圣人，但我在自己的脑海里花了足够多的时间，我不再奢望躲避自己。

original: The old bastard's finally dead.
string: 这老混蛋终于死了。

original: Any regrets?
string: 遗憾吗？

original: No. Somebody had to do it. And I was never able to end it.
string: 不。总得有人去做。我从来没有能够结束它。

original: Waterbreathing? Damn, of all spells...
string: 水下呼吸?该死,真是各种法术中的一个......

original: Get it together, Serano. You can do this.
string: 振作点,塞拉诺,你能做到的。

original: So that's how it's going to be! Pht. We'll see if Phinis is still laughing when I get to do the conjuring.
string: 那就这么办!呸。等我开始召唤时,看看菲尼斯是否还在笑。

original: Another day, another fireball.
string: 又是一日,又是火球。

original: About Adara...
string: 关于艾达拉......

original: Summoning an atronach every time she had a temper tantrum was gonna get someone killed back in Stonehills.
string: 每次她发脾气时召唤一只阿特拉奇,早在石丘就会有人被杀。

original: Still, the College is no place for a kid to grow up. Maybe we could look out for her bit? You know, make sure she visits her mother and plays with other kids now and then.
string: 不过学院并不是孩子成长的地方。也许我们可以稍微照顾一下她?你知道的,让她偶尔去看望母亲,也和其他孩子玩耍。

original: Gah, it's no good.
string: 啊，这可不好。

original: Damn, I can't open this.
string: 该死，我打不开这个。

original: Heh heh.
string: 呵呵。

original: It's done.
string: 搞定了。

original: I think I'm lost. Can you get us back to civilization?
string: 我想我迷路了。你能把我们带回文明世界吗？

original: You're joking, right? You realize I've spent more than half my life at sea? Before I met you I'd hardly ever been anywhere in Skyrim except the coastline.
string: 你在开玩笑吧？你知道我大半辈子都在海上度过吗？在遇到你之前，我几乎没去过天际任何地方，除了海岸线。

original: Please?
string: 拜托？

original: All right, give me the map. Where to?
string: 好吧，给我地图，去哪儿？

original: I can't say no to that look. Ah, hand me your map. Where do you want to go, love?
string: 我无法拒绝你的眼神。啊，把地图递给我。你想去哪里，亲爱的？

original: I am not joking.
string: 我可不是在开玩笑。

original: This is what I get for following you. Heh. Give me the map. Where were you tryin' to lead us?
string: 这就是我跟着你的下场。哈。把地图给我。你想带我们去哪里？

original: Oh, fine. I'll figure it out myself.
string: 哦，好吧。我会自己想办法的。

original: I didn't say I couldn't do it. I'll have you know I'm an excellent navigator.
string: 我没说我做不到。我会让你知道我是个出色的领航员。

original: I'll take the lead now.
string: 现在我来带路。

original: All right, give me the map. Where to?
string: 好吧，给我地图，去哪儿？

original: Could you find a carriage or ferry for us?
string: 你能为我们找一辆马车或渡船吗？

original: Hand me your map. Where did you want to go, love?
string: 把地图递给我。你想去哪里，亲爱的？

original: Could you find a carriage or ferry for us?
string: 你能为我们找一辆马车或渡船吗？

original: Here we are! Civilization and transportation to anywhere you want to go.
string: 我们到了！文明和通往任何你想去的地方的交通工具。

original: Tarek always set Fathis and I against each other. Whatever Fathis did was just never good enough for him. I... fell into a lot of the same patterns.
string: 在那些日子里，我做了很多今天不会做的事。我很后悔，我受够了。

original: I did a lot of things in those days I wouldn't do today. Things I regret. I'm done with it all.
string: 在那些日子里，我做了很多今天不会做的事。我很后悔，我受够了。

original: You could be anything you like.
string: 你可以做任何你喜欢的事情。

original: Don't expect me to enroll in the College of Winterhold or anything.
string: 别指望我能进冬堡学院之类的。

original: You're walking away?
string: 你要走了？

original: The Dark Rose will be all right.
string: 黑玫瑰会没事的。

original: Don't let this go to your head, but I'm proud of you.
string: 别让这事冲昏了头脑，但我为你骄傲。

original: Ugh, Kynareth save me.
string: 呜，凯娜瑞丝，救救我。

original: I'm not sure what's next for me, but it's not gonna be on board that ship.
string: 我不知道接下来会发生什么，但肯定不会是在那艘船上。

original: Sticking with you has been the first good decision I've made in a long time. I'm glad you're in my life.
string: 和你在一起是我这么长时间以来做的第一个正确的决定。我很高兴你出现在我的生命中。

original: I'm not sure what's next for me, but it's not gonna be on board that ship.
string: 我不知道接下来会发生什么，但肯定不会是在那艘船上。

original: Sticking with you has been the first good decision I've made in a long time. I'm glad you're in my life.
string: 和你在一起是我这么长时间以来做的第一个正确的决定。我很高兴你出现在我的生命中。

original: Can I ask you something?
string: 我能问你件事吗？

original: No, no questions.
string: 不，没问题。

original: Val!
string: 瓦尔！

original: Ha ha ha! I wanted to ask you something this time, actually.
string: 哈哈哈！实际上，这次我想问你点事。

original: (laugh)
Ha ha ha! I wanted to ask you something this time, actually.
string: 哈哈哈！实际上，这次我想问你点事。

original: (roll your eyes)
string: （翻白眼）

original: Ha ha ha! I wanted to ask you something this time, actually.
string: 哈哈哈！实际上，这次我想问你点事。

original: What did you want to ask?
string: 你想问什么？

original: What's your life been like? You know, before we met?
string: 你的生活是什么样的？你知道，在我们相遇之前？

original: Maybe later.
string: 等等吧。

original: Aw, suit yourself.
string: 啊，随便你。

original: I was a mercenary.
string: 我是个雇佣兵。

original: Takin' money for takin' heads... that's not so bad. I've done worse jobs for coin.
string: 拿人头换钱…这还不算太坏。我干过更差的活儿。

original: I was a fellow rogue!
string: 我是个无赖！

original: Heey, I never was much good at following the rules, either!
string: 嘿嘿，我也从来都不擅长遵守规则！

original: I was a scholar.
string: 我曾是一名学者。

original: That's impressive! I'd like to hear about your studies sometime.
string: 真厉害！我想听到你的研究。

original: I was a priest.
string: 我是个牧师。

original: Well, I hope you don't mind that I'm not really religious. I almost envy you for knowing your true calling like that.
string: 好吧，我希望你不要介意我并不信教。我几乎要嫉妒你了，因为你知道自己真正的使命是什么。

original: Well, I hope you don't mind that I'm not really religious. I almost envy you for knowing your true calling like that.
string: 好吧，我希望你不要介意我并不信教。我几乎要嫉妒你了，因为你知道自己真正的使命是什么。

original: I was a priestess.
string: 我曾是一名女祭司。

original: I was an adventurer.
string: 我是个冒险家。

original: Someone after my own heart! Believe it or not, I've spent more time exploring old ruins the last few years than I did committing actual piracy.
string: 一个合我心意的人！不管你信不信，在过去的几年里，我花在探索古老遗迹上的时间比真正的海盗活动还多。

original: I was a bard.
string: 我是个吟游诗人。

original: Well, I do hope you perform for me sometime.
string: 好吧，我希望你有机会能为我表演。

original: Oh, and before you ask- Yes, I know some sea shanties. No, they're not all filthy. And no, I will not sing them right now.
string: 哦，在你问之前-是的，我知道一些航海歌曲。不，他们并不都是下流的。不，我现在不会唱。

original: I was an assassin.
string: 我是个刺客。

original: Ah, a professional. I respect that.
string: 啊，专业人士。我很敬佩。

original: Nothing out of the ordinary.
string: 没什么特别的。

original: Huh. You don't seem the type. I can't quite put my finger on it, but there's something about you...
string: 咦？你看起来不是那种人，我也说不上来，但你有点…

original: That's everything.
string: 就是这样。

original: Glad to know you better!
string: 很高兴能进一步了解你！

original: Can I ask you something?
string: 我能问你件事吗？

original: Yeah, what now?
string: 是啊，现在怎么办？

original: You seem particular about your clothing.
string: 你似乎对自己的穿着很讲究。

original: I like to look nice. What of it?
string: 我喜欢漂亮，怎么了？

original: How come you don't have a pirate hat?
string: 你怎么没带海盗帽？

original: I hate hats. They mess up my hair.
string: 我讨厌帽子。它们会弄乱我的头发。

original: And light armor because...?
string: 轻甲是为了…？

original: So I don't drown. I mean, I have no idea how people even swim in heavy armor.
string: 这样我就不会淹死了。我是说，我不知道人们是怎么穿着厚重的盔甲游泳的。

original: Do you always have to ask so many questions?
string: 你总是要问这么多问题吗？

original: I was making conversation. I like your ring.
string: 我只是在聊天。我喜欢你的戒指。

original: Just a little trinket I picked up.
string: 这只是我捡到的一个小玩意。

original: ...Did you steal it?
string: …你偷的吗？

original: No, ha ha ha! I overpaid for it at a jeweler's like anyone else does.
string: 不，哈哈哈！我和其他人一样，在珠宝店花了很多钱买的。

original: Since you appreciate fine clothes and armor, why don't you pick my outfit sometime? I don't mind.
string: 既然你喜欢漂亮的衣服和盔甲，为什么不找个时间帮我挑衣服呢？我不介意。

original: Can I ask you something?
string: 我能问你件事吗？

original: What kinds of things did you smuggle?
string: 你都走私了些什么？

original: Contraband, mostly. Dwemer artifacts, ebony, and the like. With the right intelligence, ships are easy enough to find at sea. Or, I'd get there first and loot the ruin myself.
string: 违禁品，主要是。矮人的遗物，乌木之类的。有了正确的情报，在海上很容易找到船只。或者，我先到那里，自己去洗劫遗迹。

original: When pickings were slim, I'd just take a job transporting, ah, 'specialty' cargo.
string: 当生意清淡的时候，我就会找一份运输“专业”货物的工作。

original: You mean skooma?
string: 你是说斯库玛？

original: Yeah, I ran skooma from time to time. That wasn't all of it, though.
string: 是啊，我时不时跑一趟斯库玛。不过，这还不是全部。

original: Hey- Don't look at me like that; I have some standards.
string: 嘿-别那样看着我；我有自己的一些标准。

original: Such as?
string: 比如？

original: It's one thing to go after someone who's prepared to defend themselves. It's entirely different to crush someone just because you can.
string: 对付一个准备自卫的人是一回事。但如果只是因为你有能力，就去摧毁别人，那就完全不同了。

original: As long as you get paid, who cares?
string: 只要你能拿到钱，谁会在乎呢？

original: That's one way to look at it. But there's a lot of ways to get paid.
string: 这是一种看法。但获得报酬的方式有很多。

original: Sure you do. Enlighten me.
string: 你当然知道。请指教。

original: If you can imagine for a moment, not everything is always about the money.
string: 如果你能想象一下，并非所有事情都与钱有关。

original: What about this note I found outside White River Watch?
string: 我在白河观察哨外发现的这张纸条又是怎么回事？

original: Ha ha hah hah! Oh by Azura, that. I hope you killed Iron-Hand because he is gonna be pissed when I don't pay him.
string: 哈哈哈哈哈！哦，天哪，那个。我希望你杀了铁手因为如果我不给他钱，他会生气的。

original: I only took the job to front the money for the expedition to get the Star of Solitude. I figured after I sold it, I'd just pay him back extra and he'd be happy enough with the windfall.
string: 我接下这份工作只是为了筹集探险的经费来获得独孤之星，我想卖掉后，我只要多还给他一些，他就会对这笔意外之财很满意了。

original: So you were never intending to bring him the wolves?
string: 所以你根本就没打算把狼带给他？

original: Oh, gods, no!
string: 哦，天哪，不！

original: Anyway, how in Oblivion would I have gotten a pack of wild wolves into the cargo hold? No amount of money is worth that headache.
string: 不管怎么说，在湮灭中我怎么会把一群野狼弄进货舱呢？再多的钱也不值得你这么头疼。

original: Hey, Val? I've got some advice for your wedding night. Make sure you're still there in the morning! (laughs)
string: 嘿,瓦尔?我有个婚礼之夜的建议。别忘了第二天早上还在!(笑)

original: Stow it, you riekling. My wandering days are done!
string: 收起吧,你这小鬼。我漂泊的日子已经结束!

original: Sorry about the wisecrack. I was just giving Val a hard time. I really am happy for you two.
string: 抱歉开玩笑,我只是想逗你一下瓦尔。我真的很为你们俩高兴。

original: If he doesn't treat you right, you come tell me, yeah? I'll set him straight.
string: 如果他对你不好,告诉我,好吗?我要让他好好受教。

original: How have you been, Fathis?
string: 你最近怎么样,法提斯?

original: Most days I'm fine, but some nights I'm right back there.
string: 大多数时候我都挺好的,但有些夜晚我又回到那儿。

original: I hear voices sometimes. I'm not sure if they're my thoughts, Tarek's, Val's, or what.
string: 我有时会听见声音。不确定是我的想法、塔雷克的、瓦尔的还是别的什么。
