original: I have good days and bad days. I wish I could forget the bad days - and the things that caused them - but I can't.
string: 我有好日子也有坏日子。我希望能忘记那些坏日子——以及导致它们的事——但做不到。

original: I had to flog one of the crew yesterday for disrespect. That scurvy fetcher vomited on my new coat!
string: 昨天我不得不惩罚一名船员,因为他无礼。那只肮脏的贪婪者在我的新外套上呕吐!

original: Don't look at me like that. Val would have thrown him overboard.
string: 别那样看我。瓦尔本会把他扔进水里。

original: I burned a Thalmor ship to the waterline the other day. So satisfying!
string: 前几天我把一艘梭默船烧到水线,真是太爽了!

original: The East Empire Company had the nerve to some adventurers after us. Adeventurers! Can you believe it?
string: 东帝国公司竟敢在我们之后挑衅冒险家们。冒险家们!你能相信吗?

original: Bah! Their standards are really slipping. We made short work of them.
string: 哼!他们的标准真的滑落了。我们轻而易举地解决了他们。

original: I need Val to teach me some of these stupid big words the merchants use in their documents. What�s an 'annualized rate of return?'
string: 我需要瓦尔教我商人文件里那些愚蠢的大词。什么是‘年化收益率’?

original: What's a "per capita?"
string: 什么是“按人口?”

original: I'm still trying to get the crew sobered up from our last round of shore leave.
string: 我还在努力让船员们从上一次岸边休假中恢复过来。

original: Being the captain has really improved my popularity with the tavern wenches, if you know what I mean.
string: 当船长真的提升了我在酒馆姑娘中的人气,如果你懂我的意思的话。

original: I'm happy that I'm getting to know you better. You're important to Val, and that makes you important ot me.
string: 我很高兴能更好地了解你。你对瓦尔很重要,这也使你对我重要。

original: I have some things to sell.
string: 我有些东西要卖。

original: And I have some buyers with no questions about the origin of those items.
string: 而且我有一些买家完全不问这些物品的来源。

original: Remember, blood washes off but I can't sell damaged goods.
string: 记住,血液会冲掉,但我不能卖损坏的货物。

original: We ship all over Tamriel. Speedy delivery and no questions asked.
string: 我们在塔姆瑞尔各地发货,快速送达,无需任何询问。

original: I've got plenty of lemons! A lemon a day keeps the scurvy away.
string: 我有很多柠檬!每天吃一个柠檬能防止坏血病。

original: No questions. No credit. No refunds.
string: 不提问。不提供信用。不退款。

original: You're pretty good with magic!
string: 你很擅长魔法！

original: Well thanks. You're rather formidable, yourself!
string: 嗯 谢谢，你也挺厉害的。

original: How did you learn spell casting?
string: 你是如何学会施法的？

original: I taught myself, mostly. I watched the weather patterns over the ocean, read any books I could find.
string: 我主要是自学。我观察海洋上空的天气状况，阅读我能找到的任何书籍。

original: And you're still in one piece? I'm impressed.
string: 你还完好无损？真厉害。

original: Well, I'm hopeless at Alteration magic. You gotta to fake yourself out, believe your own lie as it were. Phh, I could never get the knack.
string: 好吧，我对变换系魔法一窍不通。你得欺骗自己，相信自己的谎言。呃，我永远也学不会。

original: But I do wish I knew more about Conjuration...
string: 但我确实希望能多了解一些“魔法”知识…

original: Maybe you could ask one of the Court Mages about it?
string: 也许你可以问问宫廷法师？

original: Phht, you're kidding, right? A guy like me?
string: 哼，你在开玩笑吧？像我这样的人？

original: Dawnstar, the docks
string: 晨星城，码头

original: Windhelm, the docks
string: 风舵城，码头

original: Solitude, the docks
string: 独孤城，码头

original: Markarth
string: 马卡斯

original: Whiterun
string: 白漫城

original: Solitude
string: 独孤城

original: Windhelm
string: 风舵城

original: Riften
string: 裂谷

original: Lakeview Manor
string: 湖景庄园

original: Windstad Manor
string: 风城庄园

original: Heljarchen Hall
string: 赫雅根庄园

original: I'm not scared... well maybe a little!
string: 我不害怕…也许有一点害怕！

original: I'll fight you! ...When I'm older.
string: 我会和你决斗！…等我长大了。

original: Pick on someone your own size!
string: 找一个和你个头差不多的人！

original: Filthy n'wah! Pick on someone your own size!
string: 肮脏的贱民！有种挑个跟你一样大的打！

original: My companion would like to ask your advice about magic. He's self-taught.
string: 我的同伴想向您请教有关魔法的问题。他是自学成才的。

original: My companion would like to ask your advice about magic.
string: 我的同伴想向您请教有关魔法的问题。

original: My companion would like to ask your advice about magic.
string: 我的同伴想向您请教有关魔法的问题。

original: By the gods, is that the Voice?
string: 神啊，那是吼声吗？

original: What? No, I was just asking about-
string: 天哪，这就是“吼声”吗？

original: Okay, got it.
string: 好的，知道了。

original: So, Farengar wasn't the most inspiring example...
string: 所以，法伦加并不是最激励人的例子…

original: No. No, he wasn't. I appreciate what you're trying to do for me, but I'm never gonna fit in with a bunch of mages hanging around in a library all day.
string: 不，不，他不是。我很感激你为我所做的一切，但我永远也无法融入一群整天泡在图书馆里的法师们。

original: Although, I guess I've done all right so far.
string: 不过，我想我到目前为止做得还不错。

original: Maybe Wylandriah wasn't the best choice to ask...
string: 也许问维兰瑞亚并不是最好的选择…

original: I thought she was fun.
string: 我觉得她很有趣。

original: Apparently. Was the flirting really necessary?
string: 显然。调情真的有必要吗？

original: She started it. It was just meaningless banter, don't worry about it.
string: 是她先开始的，那只是无意义的戏谑，不用担心。

original: So, about Wuunferth...
string: 那么，关于巫恩菲斯…

original: He wasn't at all what I expected. He was interesting to talk to, and I wouldn't mind spending more time with him.
string: 他和我想象的完全不一样。和他聊天很有意思，我不介意和他多相处一段时间。

original: Thanks, uh... for encouraging me.
string: 谢谢你，呃…谢谢你鼓励我。

original: Hm. You didn't die.
string: 嗯。你没有死。

original: Hilarious. I still have all ten fingers and both eyes, too.
string: 搞笑。我的十个手指和两只眼睛都还在。

original: Well, I'm afraid I'm not much good at teaching. If you've got the aptitude, you should try your luck at the College of Winterhold.
string: 嗯，恐怕我不太擅长教书。如果你有这个天赋，你应该去冬堡学院试试运气。

original: Farengar, if I wanted to sit around at a boring College, I'd already be there.
string: 法伦加，如果我想待在无聊的大学里，我早就去了。

original: Fancy yourself the adventuring type, eh?
string: 你觉得自己是冒险家吗？

original: What a waste! I prefer my books.
string: 真是浪费！我更喜欢我的书。

original: Remember, your mind is the best weapon you have.
string: 记住，你的头脑是你最好的武器。

original: Yeah, yeah... you sound like my mother, you know that? I'll see myself out.
string: 是啊，是啊…你的口气就像我妈，你知道吗？我自己出去。

original: That's not something you see every day!
string: 那可不是每天都能见到的… ！

original: Hello.
string: 你好。

original: Hmm? Sorry, I was lost in thought. So many details to work out.
string: 嗯？抱歉，我一时想不起来了。还有很多细节要处理。

original: I know this looks bad!
string: 我知道这看上去很糟糕！

original: And what are you workin' on? A little organization and we'll get you shipshape in no time.
string: 你在忙什么呢？稍微整理一下，我们很快就会把你弄好的。

original: All right. I have a plan. To experiment on you. Let me explain!
string: 好的。我有个计划。在你身上做个实验。听我解释！

original: Ah, I see. Well, uh, while I'm as curious as the next man, I'm gonna have to pass. Just for today. Busy schedule.
string: 啊，我明白了。好吧，呃，虽然我和其他人一样好奇，但我还是不去了。就今天，日程很忙。

original: You look like you've seen your share of adventure. What'd you like to know?
string: 你看起来经历过不少冒险。你想知道什么？

original: Y'know anything about Clairvoyance spells? That might be of mutual benefit under the disorganized circumstances, sigh...
string: 你知道鹰眼术吗？在这种混乱的情况下，这可能对双方都有好处，唉…

original: I can certainly try.
string: 我当然可以试试。

original: Huh. You know you've got a certain fire in your eyes... and that silly grin you get when you've done something wrong.
string: 嗯，你知道你的眼睛里有一团火…还有你做错事时傻笑的样子。

original: If you can see all that about me, then you already know we'd end badly, my dear.
string: 如果你能看清我的一切，那你就已经知道我们的结局会很糟糕， 亲爱的。

original: (laughs) Oh you are terrible. You do know that, right?
string: 哦，你太可怕了。你知道的，对吧？

original: So you do.
string: 你还真搞定了啊。

original: Nooo, uh, it's fine. Really. Sorry to bother you.
string: 不，没事的。真的。抱歉打扰你了。

original: Hmph. It's intriguing the way certain materials are more or less receptive to the force of lightning, is it not?
string: 嗯。某些材料或多或少能承受闪电的力量，这很有趣，不是吗？

original: Yeah... It's like there are channels or obstructions in the materials. Lightning flows through silver like water but gets stuck in glass.
string: 是啊…就好像材料中存在通道或障碍物。闪电像水一样流过银器，却被玻璃卡住了。

original: I had you figured for a mage.
string: 我还以为你是个法师呢。

original: I think you've mistaken me for someone else. What does a master mage even study?
string: 我想你认错人了。法师到底学的是什么？

original: Whatever I don't already know. Power is the crux of this world.
string: 不管我还不知道什么。力量是这个世界的关键。

original: Huh. You're more practical than I expected.
string: 哈。你比我想象的更实际。

original: Thank you for your time. I mean it.
string: 谢谢你抽出时间。我是认真的。

original: You seem uncomfortable here.
string: 你在这儿好像不舒服。

original: I can't hide much from you, can I? Hunh. The Dunmer faith isn't well understood in Skyrim, and the people tend to have certain expectations of me since I'm a Nord.
string: 我瞒不了你什么，对吧？在天际中，丹莫的信仰并不为人所理解，因为我是一名诺德人，所以人们往往会对我抱有某些期待。

original: Do you follow any of the Divines?
string: 你信仰神灵吗？

original: Akatosh
string: 阿卡托什。

original: Some of the older mer back in Cyrodiil used to talk about the day the Avatar of Akatosh took shape over the Temple of the One. It's hard to imagine that kind of sacrifice.
string: 在赛洛迪尔的一些年长的人曾经谈论过阿卡托什的化身在真神之殿上成形的那一天。这种牺牲是难以想象的。

original: Arkay
string: 阿尔凯。

original: I suppose you know the legend, then, that Arkay asked for that job? Hunh, better man than me...
string: 我想你知道那个传说吧，阿尔凯找我做那份工作？哼，比我强的人…

original: Dibella, naturally!
string: 自然是迪贝拉！

original: Really? Now you got me curious.
string: 真的吗？这下我可好奇了。

original: Julianos
string: 尤里安诺斯。

original: I can see why; you strike me as wiser than most.
string: 我知道为什么，因为你比大多数人都要聪明。

original: Kynareth, or Kyne to some.
string: 凯娜瑞丝，也有人称之为凯娜。

original: The goddess of the wind, the patron of sailors, and the only Divine that's ever had my devotion.
string: 风之女神，水手的守护神，也是我唯一虔诚信仰的神。

original: Lady Mara
string: 玛拉女士。

original: My mother follows Mara, too. She always said not to live with regrets for decisions you made to the best of your ability from a place of love... I think she meant my father.
string: 我母亲也信仰玛拉，她总是说，不要为你所做的决定而后悔，尽你所能，从爱的角度出发… 我想她指的是我父亲。

original: Stendarr
string: 斯丹达尔。

original: Oh, for the love of Azura, really?! I hope you're still gonna speak to me after this conversation.
string: 哦，看在阿祖拉的份上，真的吗！我希望这次谈话之后你还会跟我说话。

original: Given recent events, I've felt drawn to Talos.
string: 鉴于最近发生的事儿，我觉得自己被塔洛斯吸引了。

original: Can't say I ever understood going to war over a dead guy, but he certainly was a great man. Maybe divinity is just the legacy we leave behind.
string: 我不明白为什么要为一个死人开战，但他确实是个伟人。也许神性只是我们留下的遗产。

original: Now that surprises me. Are we gonna be avoiding Thalmor patrols or hunting them down?
string: 真是出乎我的意料。我们是要躲避梭默的巡逻队，还是要追捕他们？

original: Zenithar. I wasn't planning on adventuring forever, you know.
string: 泽尼撒尔。你知道，我没打算永远冒险下去。

original: The God of Commerce is probably not my biggest fan. I'll make exceptions for your trading ships, of course.
string: 商业之神可能不太喜欢我。当然，你的商船除外。

original: No, not the Aedra.
string: 不，我不信圣灵。

original: You mean the Daedric Princes, huh? I was raised to use caution when dealing with the House of Troubles, buuut that doesn't mean a bargain can't be struck now and then.
string: 那你是信迪德拉王子吗？我从小就养成了与动乱之屋打交道时小心谨慎的习惯，但这并不意味着偶尔不能讨价还价。

original: I'm not particularly religious.
string: 我不信教。

original: Fair enough. I was raised in the New Temple faith myself, and I think most sailors acquire a certain... respect for Kynareth, but I'm not devout.
string: 当然可以，我是在新圣殿信仰中长大的，我想大多数水手都对凯纳瑞丝怀有某种…敬意，但我并不虔诚。

original: That's all I have to say about worship.
string: 我们来谈点别的吧。

original: As you wish.
string: 如你所愿。

original: You've mentioned the Dunmer faith before...
string: 你之前提到过丹莫人的信仰…

original: Azura, Boethiah, and Mephala I know well. My father worships in the New Temple faith and raised me the same.
string: 阿祖拉、波耶希亚、梅法拉我都很熟悉。我父亲信奉新圣殿教，他也是这么教我的。

original: Does that mean you're a Daedra worshipper?
string: 所以你是迪德拉的崇拜者？

original: Aedra and Daedra are two sides of the same coin. I was taught to view them with respect, not fear or reverence. The Daedra aren't good or evil. They are the way they are... because they're us. Or we're them. Manifestations of the mortal psyche, maybe.
string: 圣灵和魔神是一枚硬币的两面。我被教导要尊重他们，而不是恐惧或敬畏。迪德拉没有善恶之分，他们是这样的… 因为他们就是我们。或者说，我们就是他们。也许是凡人心理的体现。

original: What? Why are you lookin' at me like that?
string: 怎么了？你为什么那样看着我？

original: I don't hold them in fear or reverence, if that's what you mean. I think the Good Daedra provide a philosophy for how to live your life.
string: 如果你是这个意思的话，我对他们并不感到恐惧或崇敬。我认为“善神”提供了一种生活哲学。

original: It's a balance. Follow them too deeply, and you lose yourself to the extremes. Neglect their teachings entirely, and you're vulnerable.
string: 这是一种平衡。追随他们太深，就会迷失自我，走向极端。完全忽视他们的教诲，你就会变得脆弱。

original: You could be anything you want, you know. Even a scholar.
string: 你可以做任何你想做的事，你知道吗？甚至做个学者。

original: Now you sound like my mother. Anyway, who says I'm not?
string: 现在你说话像我妈了。不管怎样，谁说我不会？

original: The only difference between a scholar's research and tomb robbing is writing it down.
string: 学者的研究和盗墓的唯一区别就是把它写下来。

original: I thought you dropped out of school!
string: 我以为你退学了！

original: Uh, formal school, sure. There's a lotta downtime on a ship and plenty of places to store books.
string: 嗯，正规学校，当然。船上有很多空闲时间，有很多地方可以储存书籍。

original: Two words: Daedra. Worship.
string: 两个字：迪德拉。崇拜。

original: Now you sound like my mother. Anyway, would you really mind if I did?
string: 现在你说话像我妈了。不管怎样，你真的介意我这么做吗？

original: Eat your vegetables! You need to be strong to swing a sword.
string: 多吃蔬菜！挥剑需要力量。

original: Enh, if I have to...
string: 恩，如果我不得不…

original: Focus on your studies. Adventurers have to be clever as well as strong.
string: 专注于你的学习。冒险家必须既聪明又坚强。

original: That's what Papa said, too. Adventurin' sounds like more fun than reading the Anuad though.
string: 爸爸也是这么说的，不过冒险听起来比读神话世纪读本有趣多了。

original: Practice hiding with your friends. You can sneak into all kinds of dangerous places without ever having to fight.
string: 和你的朋友一起练习躲藏。你可以潜入各种危险的地方，而无需战斗。

original: Good idea! I'm going to be the hide-and-seek Champion of Skyrim!
string: 好主意！我要成为天际的捉迷藏冠军！

original: Of course we can keep him. He's adorable!
string: 我们当然可以留下他。他很可爱！

original: Yay! He can sleep in my room and... I'll call him... Chompy!
string: 耶！他可以睡在我的房间里… 我会叫他… 小咬牙！

original: Um, I guess?
string: 嗯，我想是吧？

original: Thank you! I promise to take good care of him
string: 谢谢你！我保证好好照顾他。

original: He won't be so stinky after I give him a bath! ...Probably.
string: 我给他洗完澡后，他就不会那么臭了！…也许吧。

original: Absolutely not! It smells terrible. Put it back where you found it.
string: 绝对不行！味道太难闻了。放回你发现它的地方。

original: Awww... Well, what if- what if he lived outside?
string: 啊… 如果-如果他住在外面呢？

original: Would you like a hug?
string: 你想要一个拥抱吗？

original: Chompy would like a hug, too.
string: 小咬牙也想要一个拥抱。

original: You give the best hugs!
string: 你给了我最棒的拥抱！

original: Absolutely!
string: 当然 ！

original: Of course, Mama!
string: 当然，妈妈！

original: Of course, Papa!
string: 当然，爸爸！

original: I made something for you. It's a gift.
string: 我为你做了点东西。这是一份礼物。

original: This is incredible! Y-you made this for me because I left the Dark Rose?
string: 太不可思议了！这是你为我做的，因为我离开了黑玫瑰号？

original: Your ship was your home. I know she meant a lot to you.
string: 你的船就是你的家，我知道她对你很重要。

original: Aelyn... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 艾琳…我爱死它了。这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Aislinn... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 阿斯林…我爱死它了。这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Alannah... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 阿兰娜…我--我喜欢它。这对我的意义无法用言语表达！谢谢你。

original: Aris... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 阿里斯…我-我爱死它了。这对我的意义无以言表！谢谢你。

original: Bree... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 布里…我爱死它了。这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Cyndrian... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 辛德里安…我爱死它了。这对我的意义，远非言语所能表达！谢谢你。

original: Cyr... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 希尔…我爱死它了。这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Dahlia... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 达丽亚…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Elise... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 伊利丝…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Illia... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 伊利亚…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Inula... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 伊努拉…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Jacek... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 雅斯克…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Joseph... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 约瑟夫…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Luna... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 露娜…我爱死它了。这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Maevynn... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 梅维恩…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Maximillian... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 马克西米利安…我爱死它了。这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Min... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 敏…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Myfanwy... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 米凡维…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Rathas... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 拉萨斯…我爱死它了。这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Ren... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 仁…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Ruby... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 鲁比…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Thelassia... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 瑟拉西亚…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: Valerian... I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you.
string: 瓦雷利安…我爱死它了，这对我的意义远非言语所能表达，谢谢你。

original: I- I love it. This means more to me than words can possibly say! Thank you, my friend.
string: 我--我爱它。这对我的意义无法用言语表达！谢谢你，我的朋友。

original: Can I ask you something?
string: 我能问你件事吗？

original: Anything.
string: 随便问。

original: About Fathis...
string: 关于法提斯…

original: You had to pick that, huh?
string: 你非得选这个吗，嗯？

original: He was your friend.
string: 他是你的朋友。

original: Was. I don't miss him, if that's what you were wondering.
string: 曾经是，如果你想知道的话，我并不想念他。

original: Tell me a good memory you have of him.
string: 说说你对他的美好回忆吧。

original: I know what you're trying to do. Uurgh. Fine.
string: 我知道你想干什么。呃。好吧。

original: Maybe it will help.
string: 或许会有帮助。

original: There was one shore leave down in Hammerfell where we decided we were going to learn to pick pockets. We got pretty good in crowds, working together.
string: 有一次在落锤省上岸后，我们决定去学扒窃。我们在人群中配合默契。

original: So, we got the bright idea to try our newfound skills on my father. (laughs) Obviously, Fathis and I spent the next three months on dogwatch.
string: 于是，我们灵机一动，想在我父亲身上试试我们的新技能。哈哈哈，哈哈哈… 显然，法提斯和我在接下来的三个月里都在看狗。

original: You fought each other outside Solitude.
string: 你们在独孤城外互相厮杀。

original: (sigh) I'd just managed to escape from prison. He'd come there to kill me.
string: 唉… 我刚刚成功越狱，他是来杀我的。

original: I was unarmed and badly outnumbered, hnh. But I managed to stab him with his own sword before the mutineers with him took me down.
string: 我手无寸铁，寡不敌众。但我还是用他自己的剑刺伤了他，然后和他一起的叛变者就把我放倒了。

original: They got cold feet and hauled me back unconscious to face Tarek instead of killing me outright.
string: 他们临阵退缩了，把昏迷不醒的我拖回去面对塔里克，而不是直接杀了我。

original: You know the rest.
string: 剩下的你都知道了。

original: Did you mean for him to die?
string: 你想让他死吗？

original: No. Yes. I was angry. I wanted revenge for his betrayal.
string: 不，是的。我很生气，我想报复他的背叛。

original: But Fathis was my brother, too. I would have given him a healing potion or something, at least not let him die alone in a ditch on the side of the road...
string: 但法提斯也是我的兄弟啊。如果是我，我会给他一剂治疗药剂什么的，至少不会让他孤零零地死在路边的沟里…

original: What happened afterward wasn't under your control.
string: 之后发生的事不是你能控制的。

original: I'm the captain of a ship. Everything that happens on board is my responsibility. I was complacent, arrogant...
string: 我是一艘船的船长。船上发生的一切都是我的责任。我自满、傲慢…

original: I should have seen it coming years before. I held the sword, and his death is my fault.
string: 我早该料到会这样…我拿着剑，他的死是我的错。

original: (hug Val)
string: （拥抱瓦尔）

original: I killed my brother...
string: 我杀了我的兄弟…

original: Fathis chose his own path.
string: 法提斯选择了他自己的路。

original: I tell myself that, too. Maybe in time I'll believe it.
string: 我也这样告诉自己。也许到时候我会相信的。

original: (buy Val a drink)
string: （请瓦尔喝一杯）

original: Yeah... right... to absent friends.
string: 对…对…对不在的朋友。

original: Val, do you ever think about you and me?
string: 瓦尔，你想过我们俩吗？

original: Huh? Oh! Oh yeah, I was just thinking about you.
string: 哦！对了，我刚刚还在想你呢。

original: I've been readin' this book, 'Lost Legends.' I was hoping we could investigate a few of the ruins it mentions sometime. What do you think?
string: 我一直在读这本《失落的传说》，我希望有机会能调查一下书中提到的遗迹，你觉得怎么样？

original: Sounds interesting, but dangerous. I'll feel safer with you along.
string: 听起来很有趣，但很危险，有你在，我会觉得更安全。

original: I think it'll be exciting - in a good way!
string: 我认为这会令人兴奋--从好的方面来说！

original: Anything to get your nose out of that book.
string: 只要能把你的鼻子从书里挪出来就行。

original: Hey now, I like this book!
string: 嘿，我喜欢这本书！

original: Never mind. FOREVER.
string: 永远不要在意。

original: Oh, okay. Mm hm. Yeah, mm hm.
string: 哦，好的。嗯嗯。是的，嗯哼。

original: No need to assume anything. It simply has helpful enchantments.
string: 不需要做任何假设。它只是有帮助的魔法。

original: I'll admit that was not one of my assumptions.
string: 我承认这不是我的假设。

original: You can assume I wanted to get your attention.
string: 你可以认为我是想吸引你的注意。

original: You've had it since the moment I first saw you. All you had to do was ask.
string: 从我第一次见到你的那一刻起你就有了。你只要开口就行了。

original: You can assume whatever you'd like, but it'd probably be wrong.
string: 你可以假设任何你想要的，但它可能是错误的。

original: Haha! I can assume an awful lot.
string: 哈哈！我可以假设很多事情。

original: Dibella doesn't only celebrate beauty, Val. She also holds sacred the gifts of friendship.
string: 迪贝拉不仅赞赏美丽，瓦尔，她也珍视友谊的馈赠。

original: I know, and I do. Uh- value our friendship, that is. Ahem. I'm sorry; I shouldn't have assumed you wanted more.
string: 我知道，我也知道。嗯，就是珍惜我们的友谊。我很抱歉；我不该以为你还想要更多。

original: It was unexpected, but not unwelcome.
string: 这出乎意料，但并非不受欢迎。

original: Really? Heh heh. In that case, I'll try not to get ahead of myself next time.
string: 真的吗？嘿嘿。既然如此，下次我就尽量不自作主张了。

original: You seemed distracted. I wasn't sure.
string: 你好像走神了。我不确定。

original: I was mostly distracted by you. Now that you have my undivided attention, what do you plan to do with it?
string: 我主要是被你分心了。现在我的注意力都集中在你身上了，你打算怎么做？

original: You can kiss me, if you want.
string: 你可以吻我，如果你想的话。

original: I'll kiss you any time you like. I might even be a gentleman about it.
string: 只要你愿意，我随时都可以吻你。在这方面，我甚至可能是一个绅士。

original: I hope that last part is a lie.
string: 我希望最后那句是谎话。

original: It is if you want it to be.
string: 只要你愿意，它就是。

original: Then put your hands on me like an honest man.
string: 那就像个诚实的人一样把手放在我身上。

original: Well... As you wish, love... hm hm...
string: 好吧…如你所愿，亲爱的…

original: You know what they say about assumptions.
string: 你知道他们是怎么说假设的吧。

original: ...Are you calling me an ass?
string: …你是在说我是个混蛋吗？

original: If the shoe fits...
string: 如果合适的话…

original: Forget I said anything.
string: 忘了我刚才说的话吧。

original: I thought I'd make you breakfast today.
string: 我想我今天应该给你做早餐。

original: Thank you. You're adorably sweet.
string: 谢谢你！你太可爱了。

original: Sweet, huh? Well that's a first.
string: 不错吧？这是第一次。

original: Now you... you remind me of the first rays of sun that break through the clouds after a storm.
string: 现在的你…让我想起了暴风雨过后冲破云层的第一缕阳光。

original: I was up early, so I made you breakfast.
string: 我起得早，所以给你做了早餐。

original: I didn't know you could cook.
string: 我不知道你还会做饭。

original: There's a lot of things you don't know about me.
string: 你不了解我的事情还多着呢。

original: Such as?
string: 比如？

original: I've never made anyone breakfast before, you know, the morning after.
string: 我以前从没给人做过早餐，你知道的，就是第二天早上。

original: The food is delicious. Thank you.
string: 食物非常美味。谢谢。

original: Oh, I'm glad you liked it.
string: 哦，我很高兴你喜欢它。

original: Do we have to start so early? I'd literally kill for a coffee.
string: 我们一定要这么早开始吗？我真想喝杯咖啡。

original: You are a pain in my ass.
string: 你真让我头疼。

original: You adore me. I'm a delight!
string: 你喜欢我。我很讨人喜欢！

original: I tolerate you because you owe me.
string: 我容忍你，是因为你欠我的。

original: Oh come on, you keep me around because I'm fun. You'd be hopelessly bored without me.
string: 拜托，你把我留在身边是因为我很有趣。没有我你会无聊到无可救药的。

original: Maybe a little.
string: 也许只有一点。

original: Ha ha hah! I knew it. I even made you breakfast.
string: 哈哈哈！我就知道。我甚至给你做了早餐。

original: (cheers)
string: (干杯)

original: (cheers)
string: (干杯)

original: (cheers)
string: (干杯)

original: Hm? What do you want?
string: 嗯？你想要什么？

original: Looks like a ring. Shame it's missing the gemstone.
string: 看起来像个戒指。可惜没找到宝石。

original: What? How did you get it?!
string: 怎么啦？你怎么拿到的？！

original: Must have fallen out of your pocket. Huh. You're lucky I found it for you before someone walked off with it. I'm sure it's valuable.
string: 一定是从你口袋里掉出来的。嗯。算你走运，是我在被人偷走之前帮你找到的。我肯定它很值钱。

original: I see... I'm not sure what happened.
string: 原来如此…我不确定发生了什么。

original: Now if you'll excuse me.
string: 我还有事要忙…

original: What's that grin for?
string: 你咧嘴笑什么？

original: Here, just a little something I picked up.
string: 这是我捡到的一个小玩意儿。

original: Did you steal this from Nazeem?
string: 这是从纳齐姆那里偷来的吗？

original: If I did, he certainly won't miss it.
string: 如果是我偷的，他肯定不会错过的。

original: Besides... It'll look better on you, anyway.
string: 而且… 反正你戴起来会更好看。

original: You're incorrigible.
string: 你真是无可救药。

original: I like to think it's part of my charm!
string: 我认为这是我魅力的一部分！

original: I can't accept this. You should return the gem, or donate it to the Temple.
string: 我不能接受，你应该把宝石还回去，或者捐给神殿。

original: As you wish. Spoken like my better half as usual, love.
string: 如你所愿，说得像我的另一半，亲爱的。

original: Why don't you have it made into something for me?
string: 为什么不给我做点什么呢？

original: As you wish, love.
string: 如你所愿，亲爱的。

original: You can lie to everyone else, but not to me.
string: 你可以骗其他人，但不能骗我。

original: What if I said I was sorry?
string: 如果我说对不起呢？

original: Are you?
string: 是吗？

original: Maybe. Though... I'd rather make it up to you.
string: 也许吧。不过… 我宁愿补偿你。

original: You should return the gem, or donate it to the Temple.
string: 你应该归还宝石，或者把它捐给神殿。

original: As you wish. Spoken like my better half as usual, love.
string: 如你所愿，说得像我的另一半，亲爱的。

original: Why don't you have it made into something for me?
string: 为什么不给我做点什么呢？

original: As you wish, love.
string: 如你所愿，亲爱的。

original: Godsdamnit, tell me the truth for once.
string: 该死的，告诉我一次真相吧。

original: Hah. What, you want me to walk the straight and narrow? Confess all my sins and repent? I got news for you - I am not that guy.
string: 哈。怎么，你想让我走正道？承认我所有的罪过并忏悔？我告诉你，我不是那种人。

original: But I'm trying to be.
string: 但我正在努力做到。

original: Trying and failing. I don't know what I expected from an honorless pirate.
string: 尝试却失败了，我不知道对一个毫无荣誉感的海盗还有什么期待。

original: So that's how it is, huh? I see.
string: 原来如此，是吧？我明白了。

original: You see nothing. Don't you understand why I want better from you?
string: 你什么都没看到，难道你不明白我为什么想要你做得更好吗？

original: I thought you weren't interested in me like that.
string: 我还以为你对我没兴趣呢。

original: I'm not interested in being another notch on your bedpost.
string: 我没兴趣成为你床柱上的另一个角色。

original: Hah! But you are interested.
string: 哈！但你有兴趣。

original: Don't be insufferable. I was just starting to like you.
string: 不要让人无法忍受。我才开始喜欢上你。

original: If you let me, I could make it up to you.
string: 如果你愿意，我可以补偿你。

original: You should return the gem, or donate it to the temple.
string: 你应该归还宝石，或者把它捐给神殿。

original: As you wish. Spoken like my better half as usual, love.
string: 如你所愿，说得像我的另一半，亲爱的。

original: Why don't you have it made into something for me?
string: 为什么不给我做点什么呢？

original: As you wish, love.
string: 如你所愿，亲爱的。

original: I'd like to change your outfit.
string: 我想给你换套衣服。

original: All right, you've got pretty good taste.
string: 好吧，你的品味还真不错。

original: Make sure I look good!
string: 一定要我看起来很好！

original: Sure.
string: 当然。

original: Okay.
string: 好的。

original: We should color-coordinate our looks.
string: 我们应该协调我们的视觉颜色。

original: If you put us in matching outfits, one of us is gonna have to change.
string: 如果你让我们穿情侣装，我们中的一个就得换衣服。

original: Do I get to pick your outfit one of these days?
string: 哪天我能帮你挑件衣服吗？

original: I like your style.
string: 我喜欢你的风格。

original: As you wish.
string: 如你所愿。

original: I'd like you to wear your regular outfit.
string: 我希望你能穿上你平时的衣服。

original: Sometimes it's good to stick with the classics.
string: 有时，坚持经典也是件好事。

original: You look great, we're done.
string: 你看起来不错，我们完事了。

original: I always look good.
string: 我一直都很帅。

original: It is me we're talking about.
string: 我们在说的是我。

original: I like it!
string: 我喜欢这里！

original: Thanks!
string: 谢啦！

original: Could you wear something casual?
string: 能不能换件衣服？

original: Oh, are we takin' a break?
string: 哦，我们要休息一下吗？

original: I hope this means we get to relax for a bit, too.
string: 我希望这意味着我们也能放松一下。

original: I'd prefer to give you new equipment by trading.
string: 我更愿意通过交易给你新的装备。

original: (cheers)
string: (干杯)

original: (cheers)
string: (干杯)

original: (cheers)
string: (干杯)

original: Have you had lovers in the past? A partner?
string: 你过去有爱人吗？搭档？

original: Plenty, but not anyone I ever missed.
string: 很多，但没有一个是我想念的。

original: That sounds lonely.
string: 这听起来很孤独。

original: Look, I was never in one place for very long, and-
string: 听着，我从来没有在一个地方呆过很长时间，而且--

original: Aughhh... It was always easier to sail away than deal with anything more complicated.
string: 唉…比起处理更复杂的事情，出海总是更容易。

original: Would you just sail away from me if things get 'complicated?'
string: 如果事情变得“复杂”了，你会离开我吗？

original: What has to be complicated? We enjoy each other's company.
string: 有什么好复杂的？我们享受彼此的陪伴。

original: Oh. I see.
string: 哦。我懂了。

original: Uh, that didn't come out right. Look, I was never in one place for very long, and-
string: 呃，我没说对。听着，我从来没有在一个地方待过很长时间，而且-

original: Phwoo... It was always easier to sail away than deal with anything more complicated. Hah. It wasn't something I cared about- until I met you.
string: 噗…出海航线总是比处理更复杂的事情容易。在遇到你之前，我并不在乎这些。

original: So, what is this thing with us then?
string: 那么我们之间是什么关系呢？

original: Complicated. In a way I never knew I needed. I'm not going anywhere.
string: 很复杂。以一种我从不知道我需要的方式。我哪儿也不去。

original: Somehow I'm not surprised...
string: 我倒是不觉得奇怪…

original: You're going to get judgemental now? I didn't want anything more complicated, and I never hid that from anyone.
string: 你现在要评头论足了？我不想要更复杂的东西，我从未对任何人隐瞒过这一点。

original: I didn't know you back then.
string: 那时候我还不认识你。

original: So, is that all love is to you, a complication?
string: 对你来说，爱情就是这样的复杂吗？

original: Maybe. What's it mean to you?
string: 也许吧，它对你意味着什么？

original: 'Love' is a waste of time.
string: “爱”是在浪费时间。

original: So waste your time on me. It's only complicated if we keep making it that way.
string: 那就把时间浪费在我身上吧，如果我们继续这样做，事情只会变得更复杂。

original: Then what is this thing between us?
string: 那我们之间到底是什么关系？

original: Does it matter, love? If it doesn't have a name it can't end badly.
string: 这有关系吗，亲爱的？如果它没有名字，它就不会有糟糕的结局。

original: About us...
string: 关于我们…

original: What about us? Huh, an Amulet of Mara... is that for me?
string: 那我们呢？嗯，玛拉的护身符…是给我的吗？

original: Yes. I wanted you to know that I'm interested in you.
string: 是的。我想让你知道我对你很感兴趣。

original: I'd be lying if I said I didn't feel something, or I didn't wonder if- Look, I don't want to toy with you. I'm not the marrying type.
string: 如果我说我没有感觉，那我就是在撒谎，或者我不觉得-听着，我不想和你开玩笑。我不是那种会结婚的人。

original: Sort of. I had to get your attention somehow.
string: 差不多吧。我总得想办法引起你的注意。

original: Ah, I think you know how to get my attention. Anyway love, I don't know how to say this, but I'm not the marrying type. I'd be lying if I said I didn't want anything... I- I care about you, deeply.
string: 啊，我想你知道怎么引起我的注意了。总之，亲爱的，我不知道该怎么说，但我不是那种要结婚的人，如果我说我什么都不想要，那是在撒谎… 我很在乎你。

original: It's for someone else.
string: 这是给别人的。

original: Oh, uh... ahem. My mistake.
string: 哦，呃…咳。我的错。

original: What about what we already have?
string: 那我们已经有的呢？

original: Us, together? It feels right. You've been by my side in a way no one else ever has.
string: 我们，在一起吗？感觉不错。你一直在我身边，无人能及。

original: You love me? Truly?
string: 你爱我吗？真的吗？

original: Truly, deeply, I love you.
string: 我真的，深深地爱着你。

original: I love you, Val.
string: 我爱你，瓦尔。

original: We'll be wing and wing, heh heh, sailing downwind.
string: 我们将展翅高飞，顺风航行。

original: I'm not asking you to marry me. But don't toy with me.
string: 我不是在向你求婚，但别玩弄我。

original: What are you talking about? I haven't hidden the way I feel about you.
string: 你在说什么？我没有隐藏我对你的感觉。

original: You haven't exactly told me, either.
string: 你也没告诉我。

original: I've never been this close to anyone before. You want promises? From me?
string: 我从来没有和任何人如此亲近过。你想要承诺？从我这里？

original: Yes, it matters a lot to me. Can you give me your promise that you'll stay?
string: 是的。你的承诺对我很重要。

original: I can't give you what's already been stolen. You know, you made off with my heart a while ago, love.
string: 我不能给你已经被偷走的东西。 你知道吗，不久前你偷走了我的心，亲爱的。

original: Please be serious.
string: 请认真一点。

original: I've never been more serious in my life. I love you.
string: 我这辈子从没这么认真过。我爱你。

original: I love you, Val.
string: 我爱你，瓦尔。

original: Then chart your course with me, and you'll never feel the cold at night.
string: 那就跟我一起走，你永远不会感到夜晚的寒冷。

original: Of course it's for you! We don't have to marry, but I want to know if you'll just be gone one morning or-
string: 当然是为了你！我们不一定要结婚，但我想知道，你会不会在某天早上就走了。

original: You think that I'd just- What do you want from me? Promises? I'm a thief, an honorless pirate, remember?
string: 你觉得我会-你想从我这里得到什么？承诺吗？我是个贼，一个无耻的海盗，记得吗？

original: Well, I was wrong. And I want to know if you'll stay by my side. For good.
string: 嗯，我错了。我想知道你是否会留在我身边。永远。

original: You really mean that?
string: 你是认真的吗？

original: Of course I do... Val, I love you.
string: 那是当然… 瓦尔，我爱你。

original: I love you, too. And... I'm not going anywhere.
string: 我也爱你。还有… 我哪儿也不去。

original: I can't promise it will be peaceful or perfect, but I guarantee it will never be boring.
string: 我不能保证它完美无缺，但我保证它绝不会无聊。

original: I don't think love is meant to be perfect.
string: 我不认为爱就是完美的。

original: I just know that I love you exactly the way you are, right here and now, and that I'll still love you from each day to the next no matter what changes they bring.
string: 我只知道，我爱的就是此时此刻的你。无谓时光流转，我依然爱你。

original: MY outfit? Have you checked yours?
string: 我的衣服？你检查过你的衣服吗？

original: Yeah, I hate hats. This one is clammy and smells like cheese.
string: 检查了，我讨厌帽子。这顶帽子黏糊糊的，闻起来像奶酪。

original: At least I'm not stuck wearing a gaudy, cheap, posh-vomit suit that screams, 'new money.' Ugh!
string: 至少我不会穿着华丽、廉价、装腔作势的衣服，嘴里喊着“新贵”！

original: You know what, forget it. I got nothing. I'll just keep an eye on things here.
string: 算了，算了吧。我什么也没得到。我就在这儿看着吧。

original: Am I still wearing the hat?! Wait, I don't want to know. Just... Hnnnnh... You take it. Take it!
string: 我还戴着帽子吗？等等，我不想知道，只是…唔…你拿着，拿着！

original: The Wabba-what?! Oh no. This is like that dream I had where everything was sweetrolls...
string: 瓦巴什么？什么？这就像我做的那个梦，梦里一切都是甜面包卷…

original: (As you gaze at Val, the pirate hat you wear speaks clearly in both of your minds...)
string: （当你们注视着瓦尔时，你们戴的海盗帽在你们俩的脑海中清晰地表达着…）。

original: Val Fact! Every year for his birthday, his mother sends him a box of strawberry danishes. They are his very favorite food... and he refuses to share any of them.
string: 瓦尔的事实！每年他过生日的时候，他妈妈都会给他寄一盒草莓面包。这是他最喜欢的食物…但他拒绝与人分享。

original: Val Fact! He knows far more about tying knots than is strictly necessary for sailing.
string: 瓦尔的事实！他对绳结的了解远远超过航海所需的知识。

original: Val Fact! He has a heart with 'Mom' tattooed somewhere on his body.
string: 瓦尔的事实！他身上某处纹有一颗写着“妈妈”的心。

original: Val Fact! As a schoolboy prank, he once stole Lucien Flavius' lunch money. Every day. For a year.
string: 瓦尔的事实！作为一个小学生的恶作剧，他曾经偷过卢西恩·弗拉维乌斯的午餐费。每天都偷，整整一年。

original: Val Fact! The structural columns of Hermaeus Mora's Endless Library are primarily composed of the near-infinite books about mortal copulation. It would be faster to ask the pirate which ones he hasn't read.
string: 瓦尔的事实！赫麦尤斯·莫拉的无尽图书馆的结构柱主要是由几乎无穷无尽的关于凡人交配的书籍组成的。如果能问问海盗他还没读过哪些书，那就更快了。

original: Val Fact! He once broke up with a Khajiit woman by telling her he was, quote, 'more of a dog person.'
string: 瓦尔的事实！他曾和一个卡吉特女人分手，告诉她自己“更喜欢狗”。

original: Val Fact! He was born under the sign of the Steed. Save a horse, ride a pirate, am I right?
string: 瓦尔的事实！他生于骏马星座。救一匹马，骑一个海盗，我说的对吗？

original: Val Fact! He once took a bad trip on skooma that involved a talking chaurus.
string: 瓦尔的事实！他有一次在斯库玛上出了差错，被一只会说话的查鲁斯缠住了。

original: Val Fact! Since he has no permanent address, Val's mother receives and forwards all his 'fan' mail. It's almost all love letters!
string: 瓦尔的事实！由于瓦尔没有固定地址，他的母亲会接收并转发他所有的“粉丝”信件。几乎全是情书！

original: Val Fact! All pirates have the same favorite letter. Would you like to know what it is?
string: 瓦尔的事实！所有海盗都有一个最喜欢的字母。想知道是什么吗？

original: Val Fact! Serano has his underwear drawer perfectly organized and sorted by color. They're all blue.
string: 瓦尔的事实！塞拉诺的内衣抽屉井井有条，按颜色分类。它们都是蓝色的。

original: Val Fact! Have you heard about his Spellknight in High Rock? Old flame. The first time they lay together, Val cried!
string: 瓦尔的事实！你听说过他在高岩城的法术骑士吗？旧情人？他们第一次躺在一起时，瓦尔哭了！

original: Val Fact! It takes him hours to get those 'effortless' beachy waves.
string: 瓦尔事实！他花了好几个小时才能让那些‘轻松’的海滩波浪出现。

original: Val Fact! He once stole a crown while on a three day bender in Stros M'kai. When the guards tried to take it back, he insisted it was his and yelled, 'I'm the princess!'
string: 瓦尔事实！他曾在斯卓·米'凯度过三天狂欢时偷走一顶王冠。当守卫试图夺回时,他坚持说那是他的,并大喊:‘我是公主!’

original: (The hat is silent... for now.)
string: （帽子沉默了…暂时）。

original: That's an exaggeration; I let Fathis have one. I'll let you have one, too. Next year.
string: 这有点夸张；我让法提斯有一个。我也会给你一个。明年吧。

original: Yeah, guilty!
string: 是啊，有罪！

original: What? I do not!
string: 怎么了？

original: Hunh! A baseless accusation.
string: 哼！毫无根据的指控。

original: This is exactly why I hate hats.
string: 这就是我讨厌帽子的原因。

original: As if that hasn't provided you with a few benefits.
string: 好像这没给你带来什么好处似的。

original: I didn't say- Argh, that's taken out of context!
string: 我可没说-啊，这是断章取义！

original: Eh, the hat isn't wrong. Let's call it an open offer!
string: 帽子没有错。我们就叫它“公开报价”吧！

original: Oh gods, the horror... no...!
string: 天哪，太可怕了…不…！

original: I'm not even going to dignify that with a reply.
string: 我甚至不打算用回答来敷衍你。

original: Don't say it. Don't say it!
string: 别说了，别说了！

original: Cerulean, teal, and navy are clearly separate colors. There is a difference.
string: 天蓝色、茶色和海军蓝显然是不同的颜色。两者是有区别的。

original: Hey! I am not a crier.
string: 我不爱哭。

original: I do not- Look, just appreciate the end result, okay?
string: 我不- 看,先欣赏最终效果,好吗?

original: Yeah yeah, and I'm a damsel in distress, too. Can't a guy feel fancy now and then?
string: 对啊,对,我也是个受困的少女。难道男人不能偶尔感到高贵吗?

original: What's the matter, got nothing else to say? That's right, you don't. It's because you're a stupid fuckin' hat whose only apparent purpose for existing is to judge me and laugh at my expense!
string: 怎么了，无话可说了？没错，你没有。因为你就是一顶蠢帽子。你存在的唯一目的就是评判我，嘲笑我。

original: Honestly, I think that still makes you a fan!
string: 老实说，我觉得这样你还是个粉丝！

original: Let's skip the chat. Your past is your past.
string: 让我们跳过聊天。你的过去就是你的过去。

original: Eh, don't say I didn't warn you.
string: 呃，别说我没提醒过你。

original: It's time to sleep.
string: 该睡觉了。

original: Sweet dreams.
string: 做个好梦。

original: Sweet dreams.
string: 做个好梦。

original: Good night.
string: 晚安。

original: Good night.
string: 晚安。

original: Sleep well.
string: 好好睡一觉。

original: Sleep well.
string: 好好睡一觉。

original: Then you're the tiniest dragon I've ever seen.
string: 那你就是我见过的最迷你的龙了。

original: Come on, Dragonfly, let's meet my partner.
string: 来吧，小龙，来见见我的搭档。

original: Somethin's off about that Cicero guy. No way he's an actual jester.
string: 那个西塞罗有点不对劲，他不可能是真的小丑。

original: I realize Cicero is up to something... but was it really necessary to involve the guards?
string: 我知道西塞罗在打什么主意…但真的有必要把卫兵牵扯进来吗？

original: That's enough. Unless you 'Battle-Borns' care to prove yourselves worthy of the name.
string: 够了。除非你们这些“战狂”想证明自己配得上这个名字。

original: Avulstein needs information about his brother. Any ideas?
string: 阿武斯特恩需要他兄弟的信息，有什么主意吗？

original: Simple. Jon Battle-Born. He's the easy mark. Well, maybe the youngest kid, but that hardly seems sporting.
string: 简单。乔·战狂。他很容易上当，好吧，也许是最小的孩子，但这看起来没什么可能。

original: Absolutely not. We're not blackmailing anyone.
string: 绝对不行。我们不能敲诈任何人。

original: Sure, we could just ask nicely for incriminating evidence. Pshaw. Let me know if you have a better idea.
string: 当然，我们可以客气地要求提供罪证。哈。如果你有更好的主意就告诉我。

original: We need evidence of the affair.
string: 我们需要这件事的证据。

original: He's probably carrying something on him. Easy enough to check his pockets.
string: 他可能带着什么东西。检查他的口袋很容易。

original: Just say the word when we're nearby and I can make the grab.
string: 我们在附近的时候，你只要说句话，我就能抢到。

original: Wait, you considered using Lars against his own family?!
string: 等等，你想利用拉尔斯对付他的家人吗！

original: I wasn't gonna go through with it!
string: 我本来不想这么做的！

original: I'm a professional; I have standards.
string: 我是专业的；我有自己的标准。

original: What's your plan?
string: 你的计划是？

original: I'm not sure if you've been paying attention, but Jon's head over heels in love with Olfina Gray-Mane. So, we're gonna blackmail him into helping us.
string: 我不知道你有没有注意到，乔迷上了奥菲娜·灰鬃。所以我们要勒索他让他帮我们。

original: There's Jon Battle-Born. See what he has on him.
string: 这是乔·战狂。看看他身上有什么。

original: It's as good as done. Make some kinda distraction, will ya?
string: 就这么定了，转移一下注意力，好吗？

original: What House is your Dunmer family from?
string: 你的暗精灵家族来自哪个家族？

original: No one, these days. Before the Red Year changed everything, supposedly the Seranos served House Indoril.
string: 现在没人了在“红色之年”改变一切之前，据说塞拉诺家族为因多里尔家族服务。

original: My father was born in Windhelm, though, and he never wanted to talk about it much.
string: 虽然我父亲出生在风舵城，但他从不愿意多谈这件事。

original: What House does your family serve? Or maybe they're Ashlanders?
string: 您的家人是哪家的成员？或者他们是阿什兰人？

original: No one, these days. Before the Red Year changed everything, supposedly the Seranos served House Indoril.
string: 现在没人了在“红色之年”改变一切之前，据说塞拉诺家族为因多里尔家族服务。

original: My father was born in Windhelm, though, and he never wanted to talk about it much.
string: 虽然我父亲出生在风舵城，但他从不愿意多谈这件事。

original: Redoran.
string: 瑞多然。

original: Your house seems like it's single-handedly kept Morrowind together in recent years.
string: 你的家族似乎是这些年来晨风的唯一支柱。

original: Telvanni.
string: 泰尔瓦尼。

original: Interesting! Do you think you'll have your own wizard tower some day?
string: 真有趣。你觉得有一天你会拥有自己的魔法塔吗？

original: Sadras.
string: 萨德拉斯。

original: An upstart, huh? Well, watch your back around the other Houses.
string: 后起之秀？好吧，在其他院子里小心点。

original: Indoril.
string: 因多里尔。

original: I always wondered if my grandparents left Indoril or were kicked out. I... I guess it doesn't matter.
string: 我一直在想，我的祖父母是离开了因多里尔，还是被赶了出来。我…我想这并不重要。

original: Dres.
string: 德雷斯。

original: Gah. Slavers. I know all the Houses have a history with it, but Dres is the one that still does it... trust me.
string: 嗨。奴隶贩子。我知道所有的家族都有这么做的历史，但德雷斯是唯一一家还在这么做的…相信我。

original: Hlaalu.
string: 哈拉鲁。

original: I always admired that commitment to getting rich. How the mighty have fallen...
string: 我一直很钦佩这种致富的决心。强者是如何堕落的…

original: Dagoth.
string: 达戈斯。

original: Wow. I would not admit that to people.
string: 哇，我可不会向别人承认这一点。

original: Ashlanders.
string: 阿什兰。

original: I always wondered... if I made a pilgrimage into the wastes, do you think the Wise Women would even speak to me? I feel like I'd still be seen as an Outlander.
string: 我一直在想…如果我去荒原朝圣，你觉得女巫们会跟我说话吗？我觉得我还是会被视为外乡人。

original: I have no House.
string: 我没有房子。

original: No shame in that. We have the freedom to make our own way in this world.
string: 这并不丢人。我们有在这个世界上闯荡的自由。

original: Hello!
string: 你好 ！

original: Hey, you dropped this.
string: 嘿，你掉了这个。

original: Don't get familiar, pirate.
string: 别太熟悉了，海盗。

original: Ha ha ha ha. I'll behave... until you tell me otherwise.
string: 哈哈哈哈！我会听话的…除非你告诉我不听话。

original: Or, you could follow my lead.
string: 或者，你也可以学我。

original: Let's see if I got this... Uh, I been working on fire spells. Say, you think anyone's still left alive in there?
string: 让我们看看我能不能做到… 我一直在研究火系法术。喂，你觉得里面还有活着的人吗？

original: I- ah... I'll give you a chance.
string: 我--啊…我给你个机会。

original: Darling, a chance is all I ever needed.
string: 亲爱的，我只需要一个机会。

original: Excellent! The Dwemer machines will keep the Falmer busy while we sneak outta here.
string: 太好了！锻莫的机器会让梭默忙不过来，我们趁机溜出去。

original: Let's see, high damage coefficient... carry the one... no provision for stack overflow..
string: 让我们看看，高伤害系数…携带一个…没有堆栈溢出的规定。

original: The s'wit took some lazy shortcuts...
string: 笨蛋们走了一些偷懒的捷径…

original: This Khajiit fetcher is going to get someone killed!
string: 这个卡吉特混蛋会害死人的！

original: What do you suggest?
string: 你有什么建议？

original: Other than not gettin' involved with J'zargo's class project? Give me a few of the scrolls; I'll fix them.
string: 除了不参与扎格的课堂项目之外？给我几个卷轴，我会修好它们的。

original: Thank you. (give scrolls)
string: 谢谢。（给卷轴）

original: There! Now the spell won't include yours truly in the blast radius.
string: 好了，现在咒语的爆炸范围不会包括你了。

original: I'm sure it'll be fine. You worry too much.
string: 我肯定会没事的。你担心得太多了。

original: Ah, Boethiah inspire me... I'm gonna need it.
string: 啊，波耶希亚激励着我… 我需要它。

original: What are you, an expert mage now?
string: 你现在成了法师专家？

original: Just a guy who wants to stay out of the blast radius. Now give me those scrolls.
string: 我只是想远离爆炸范围。现在把卷轴给我。

original: They canceled the Burning-of-King-Olaf Festival? That's too bad; I always enjoy the spiced wine.
string: 他们取消了“火烧奥拉夫节”？太可惜了，我一直都很喜欢香料酒。

original: They canceled the Burning-of-King-Olaf Festival? That's too bad. There was this bard I met once, he was something else- Ahem, well, not important...
string: 他们取消了“火烧奥拉夫节”？太遗憾了 我曾经见过一个吟游诗人，他很特别--咳，好吧，不重要…

original: King Olaf really did sentence a bard to death over a poem! Elisif doesn't seem that vindictive, does she?
string: 奥拉夫国王真的因为一首诗判了一个吟游诗人死刑！艾利西弗看起来没那么记仇吧？

original: What is Viarmo thinking? Those rhyming couplets are out of place and blatantly modern compared to the original verse.
string: 维阿墨在想什么？与原诗句相比，这些押韵的对联显得格格不入，而且明显是现代的。

original: I thought it was the bard who was supposed to suffer for their art, not the listeners.
string: 我以为应该为他们的艺术受苦的是吟游诗人，而不是听众。

original: Lost instruments, lost festival, lost poetry! Why are bards all so absent-minded?
string: 失落的乐器、失落的节日、失落的诗歌！ 为什么游吟诗人都如此心不在焉？

original: This seems more like rivalry between the bards than real theft; not many buyers out there for non-magical instruments.
string: 这似乎更像是吟游诗人之间的竞争，而不是真正的盗窃；非魔法乐器的买家并不多。

original: Yeah, I hate working for musicians. The pay is always terrible. 'But Val, think of the exposure. It'll be good for your brand,' they say. Bah.
string: 是啊，我讨厌为音乐家工作，薪水总是很低。“但是瓦尔，想想曝光率吧。这对你的名声有好处，”他们说。呸。

original: Free food, free drinks, and a beautiful night in good company! The only thing that could make it better would be some dancing.
string: 免费的食物、免费的饮料，还有一个美好的夜晚！唯一能让它变得更好的就是跳舞。

original: We're members of the Bards College now!
string: 现在我们是吟游诗人学院的成员了！

original: Just goes to show that you don't need some college to teach you the value of art... or even how to play an instrument, apparently.
string: 这恰恰说明，你并不需要学院来教你艺术的价值…甚至显然不需要教你如何演奏乐器。

original: Oh I don't know, I bet you have a lovely singing voice.
string: 哦，我不知道，我敢打赌，你的歌声一定很动听。

original: Hah! Sorry to disappoint you, but I have a voice for shouting orders on the deck of a ship in a storm. That doesn't exactly translate to ballads.
string: 哈！抱歉让你失望了，但我的嗓音适合在暴风雨中的甲板上大声发号施令。它并不适合唱民谣。

original: It's a good thing, because I can't carry a tune in a bucket.
string: 这是件好事，因为我在水桶里是唱不出曲子的。

original: Don't sell yourself short. You can get better at anything if you practice.
string: 不要妄自菲薄。只要多加练习，任何事情都能做得更好。

original: What? No more poetry from the day-dreaming pirate?
string: 什么？做白日梦的海盗不再写诗了？

original: I'm starting to regret ever letting you read my journal.
string: 我开始后悔让你看我的日记了。

original: Speak for yourself! My musical talents are impossible to ignore.
string: 说说你自己吧！我的音乐天赋是不可忽视的。

original: In that case, how about a private performance later?
string: 如果是这样的话，稍后进行一场私人表演如何？

original: Sure, sure. When do I get to see you perform, anyway?
string: 嗯，嗯。我什么时候能看你表演？

original: What do you say - think we can make the leap? I dove off the mast of the Rose dozens of times.
string: 你说呢-你觉得我们能成功吗？我从黑玫瑰号的桅杆上跳下了几十次。

original: I'll be right back. Don't mind me.
string: 我马上就回来。别管我。

original: Here, I took care of it. This is for Brenuin because he was kind to the girl.
string: 给你，我已经处理好了。这是给布瑞纽恩的，因为他对那个女孩很好。

original: I'm not sure about just taking that Argonian Ale...
string: 我不确定要不要只喝亚龙人麦酒…

original: Ahem. Well, this is awkward. Here.
string: 咳咳。好吧，这太尴尬了。给你。

original: Oh, where did you manage to find that?
string: 哦，你从哪儿找到的？

original: Uh, maybe it's best you don't worry about the details.
string: 呃，也许你最好不要操心那些细节问题。

original: I guess I'll add that Dibellan Mark to my collection!
string: 我想我要把迪贝拉的印记加到我的收藏里！

original: Hahahahaha, I learn something new about you every day.
string: 哈哈哈，我每天都能从你身上学到新的东西。

original: Seriously, Val?! With Haelga of all people.
string: 真的吗，瓦尔？！偏偏和哈尔加一起。

original: Let Haelga live her life, sheesh!
string: 让哈尔加过她自己的生活吧，啧啧！

original: I can't believe Brand-Shei turned out to be the last surviving member of the Telvanni family, and you framed him for theft!
string: 真不敢相信布兰德·谢原来是泰瓦尼家族最后的幸存者，而你却诬陷他偷窃！

original: I do feel badly about that.
string: 我对此确实感到很遗憾。

original: Don't lose any sleep over it. It was just business.
string: 别难过。这只是生意。

original: ...and got him thrown in prison, too!
string: …还害他进了监狱！

original: Ha ha ha hah! He'll probably blame Brynjolf for the whole ordeal.
string: 哈哈哈哈！他可能会把整个事件归咎于布林约夫。

original: That's right. Try not to get on my bad side, Serano.
string: 没错。别惹我，塞拉诺。

original: Now that feels kinda personal.
string: 这听起来有点私人恩怨。

original: Most of the Dunmer I sailed with were Houseless. Some had been kicked out in disgrace, or at least their families had been.
string: 和我一起航行的暗精灵大多是无家可归者。有些人被耻辱地赶出了家门，至少他们的家人是这样。

original: Wherever you come from, you can always make something of yourself.
string: 无论你来自哪里，你总能成就自己。

original: I guess that Aerin guy is Mjoll's follower... I'm a better companion than him, right?
string: 我猜那个叫艾灵的家伙是穆月尔的追随者… 我是一个比他更好的同伴，对吧？

original: I've got to admit that I find Wylandriah's absent-mindedness a little charming... Except for that time she summoned a dremora without the ward.
string: 我得承认，我觉得维兰瑞亚心不在焉的样子有点迷人… 除了那次她在缺乏守卫的情况下召唤了一只魔人。

original: Sibbi won't be in that jail cell for long. If we do manage to find his fiancee, it should be to tell her to keep running. Far away from him.
string: 西比不会在牢房里待太久的。如果我们找到了他的未婚妻，应该让她继续逃亡，离他远远的。

original: About the Temple Ancestral Tomb...
string: 关于先祖圣殿坟墓…

original: The Priests really let the place go.
string: 祭司们真的让这个地方消失了。

original: There was a time when House Indoril - they're pretty much the same at the Temple these days - would have had their own fighters to handle a few ash spawn.
string: 曾经有一段时间，因多瑞尔家族--如今他们在神庙里都差不多--会有自己的战士来对付一些灰烬魔的。

original: I wonder where the ash spawn came from.
string: 我想知道灰烬魔怪是从哪里来的。

original: You know, I think those ash spawns are constructs, not summons.
string: 嗯，我认为那些灰烬魔怪是构造物，而不是召唤物。

original: I'm surprised you took such an interest.
string: 我很惊讶你会这么感兴趣。

original: I may not be devout, but I'm not completely lacking in respect.
string: 我可能不是虔诚的教徒，但我并不完全缺乏尊重。

original: I was wondering if you knew much about your Dunmer ancestors.
string: 我想知道你是否了解你的丹莫祖先。

original: Not really. I, uh, don't exactly look the part enough to be asking around.
string: 不太了解。我，呃，看起来不太适合到处打听。

original: My father told me that they served House Indoril before the Red Year. Buoyant Armigers to Lord Vivec himself, if you can believe it.
string: 我父亲告诉我，他们在“红年”之前曾为因多里尔家族效力。如果你相信的话，博雅剑骑士属于维威克领主本人。

original: Supposedly, there's a Serano family tomb somewhere in Morrowind.
string: 据说，在晨风的某个地方有一座塞拉诺家族的坟墓。

original: Or there was. At any rate, it's probably buried under hundreds of feet of ash by now.
string: 或者曾经有过。无论如何，它现在可能已经被埋在几百英尺深的火山灰下了。

original: Any advice?
string: 有什么建议吗？

original: Maybe... Let me see that explorer's journal.
string: 也许… 让我看看探险家的日志。

original: Hang on; Let me find it.
string: 等等，让我找找。

original: Here. (show Ulyn's journal)
string: 在这儿。（显示尤霖的日志）

original: Ah! There is a pattern. The resonator values keep going up by one as you go down the line. Start with three, then four, then six, nine, and so on up to eighteen.
string: 啊！这是有规律的。谐振器的值沿着线一直上升1。从3开始，然后是4，然后是6，9，以此类推，直到18。

original: As long as you watch the indicator lights and don't overcharge the boilers, we should be fine. Eh, probably. Keep in mind this is theoretical.
string: 只要你们注意观察指示灯，不要给锅炉过度充电，我们就不会有事。嗯，可能吧。记住，这只是理论上的。

original: I gotta admit, these Dwemer spiders are kinda cute when they're not trying to rip you apart.
string: 我得承认，这些锻莫蜘蛛不把你撕成碎片的时候还挺可爱的。

original: Wow... I didn't expect to see you wearing the Star. I could get used to that look on you.
string: 哇…我没想到你会戴着孤独城之星。我乐于品味这个造型。

original: The Star looks even better on you than I imagined... I could get used to that look.
string: 孤独城之星在你身上比我想象的还要好看…我乐于品味这个造型。

original: Oh, I just wanted to make sure I wouldn't lose it.
string: 哦，我只是想确保我不会把它弄丢了。

original: That's very considerate of you.
string: 你考虑得真周到。

original: I think it suits me!
string: 我觉得这很适合我！

original: If only I had time to properly appreciate it.
string: 要是我有时间好好欣赏它就好了。

original: Look but don't touch, pirate.
string: 可以看，但不要碰，海盗。

original: Oh, I'm happy to look.
string: 哦，我很乐意看看。

original: We should head to Radiant Raiment and meet my contact.
string: 我们应该去锦衣服饰店见我的联系人。

original: I hope you can part with the Star when the time comes.
string: 我希望到时候你能和那颗星分开。

original: I thought you were going to sell this necklace.
string: 我还以为你要卖掉这条项链呢。

original: How could I? It reminds me of the day we met.
string: 我怎么能这样？这让我想起了我们相遇的那天。

original: I found you on a deserted island. That can't have been a good day!
string: 我在一个荒岛上找到了你。那一定是糟糕的一天！

original: It's a metaphor! I'm trying to be romantic... work with me here, love!
string: 这是一个比喻！我想浪漫一点…和我一起工作吧，亲爱的！

original: And they say crime doesn't pay...
string: 他们还说犯罪没有回报…

original: I may have a thing for you wearing expensive, stolen jewelry... and nothing else?
string: 我可能喜欢你戴着昂贵的偷来的珠宝…而不戴其他东西？

original: What would have happened if I hadn't found you?
string: 如果我没有找到你，会发生什么呢？

original: Nothing I want to talk about, love. There wasn't a happy ending for me on that island.
string: 我没什么想说的，亲爱的。我在那座岛上的结局不会很圆满。

original: Your scrolls still damaged me! You couldn't have fixed that, too?
string: 你的卷轴还是伤害了我，你就不能把那个也修好吗？

original: They did? Whoops. I might have forgotten a detail or two...
string: 有吗？哎呀。我可能忘了一两个细节…

original: Oh! That was more than I expected.
string: 哦！这比我预想的要好得多。

original: Well, you have your answer.
string: 好吧，你有答案了。

original: I'm not some one-night stand you can just cast aside.
string: 我可不是什么酒馆里的小姑娘，你可以把我丢在一边。

original: I never thought of you that way. I'd like to think of you as mine.
string: 我从没那样想过你，我愿意把你当成我的人。

original: 'Yours' to do with as you wish? I'm your equal, not your property.
string: “你的”就可以随心所欲吗？我也不是你的财产。

original: Godsdamnit! You think so little of me? I sailed with pirates, not a pack of wild animals.
string: 天啊！你这么瞧不起我？我和海盗一起航行，而不是一群野兽。

original: And I love you...
string: 我爱你…

original: Val, I...
string: 瓦尔，我…

original: You don't have to say anything.
string: 你什么都不用说。

original: I only want to hear it if you mean it.
string: 我只想听你的真心话。

original: Sounds exciting! I'd love to go together.
string: 听起来很刺激！我很乐意一起去。

original: Really? Well that's great!
string: 真的吗？那太好了！

original: I don't think that's how you pronounce 'Nerevarine.'
string: 我觉得“Nerevarine”不是这么发音的。

original: Fine. Let's hear you say it then.
string: 好吧。那就听你说一遍吧。

original: Well, they were the reincarnation of Indoril Nerevar, so you say it just like 'Nerevar' then add '-ine.' Nerevarine. Easy!
string: 他们是因多里尔·尼瑞瓦的转世，所以说起来就像 "尼瑞瓦"，然后再加上"-ine"。Nerevarine。很简单！

original: Haaah... You know, I read a book about this person. Once. I didn't exactly sit through the extended lecture series.
string: 哈哈…你知道吗，我读过一本关于这个人的书。读过一次，我并没有耐心坐在那里听系列讲座。

original: Uh... actually, let me hear you say it again?
string: 呃…其实，让我听你再说一遍？

original: Hah! You don't know how to say it, either!
string: 哈！你也不知道怎么说！

original: It's 'nair-eh-VAR-reen,' not 'nare-EV-uh-reen.'
string: 是“nair-eh-VAR-reen”，而不是“nare-EV-uh-reen”。

original: I honestly can't hear the difference, and I don't appreciate the mocking tone.
string: 老实说，我听不出来有什么区别，也不喜欢这种嘲讽的语气。

original: Hey listen... Don't laugh, but I was thinking about takin' a few classes while we're here.
string: 嘿，听着…别笑，我想在这里上几堂课

original: You gotta be kidding me. The Psijic Order 'knew' what would happen, couldn't be bothered to lift a finger, and then took the Eye while explaining nothing!
string: 开什么玩笑？塞伊克教团“知道”会发生什么，却懒得动一根手指头，然后在什么都不解释的情况下夺走了“眼”！

original: Hey, college boy.
string: 嘿，大学生。

original: Hey, college gal.
string: 嘿，大学女孩。

original: Hey, college boy.
string: 嘿，大学生。

original: Hey, college gal.
string: 嘿，大学女孩。

original: I don't mind being here for a bit, but could we go back to Solitude soon? I have some unfinished business.
string: 我不介意在这里待一段时间，但我们能不能尽快回独孤城？我还有些事情没做完。

original: I'm sorry. I was curious about you.
string: 抱歉。我对你很好奇。

original: It's okay, no really. I hope I'll get to know you better, too.
string: 没关系，真的。我希望我也能更好地了解你。

original: You again.
string: 又是你？

original: What do you want?
string: 你想要什么？

original: Me again.
string: 还是我。

original: You're not still after Serano, are you? Look, if you're wanting to cause him trouble, I'm glad to help out, but I already told you everything I had to say.
string: 你不是还在追杀塞拉诺吧？听着，如果你想给他找麻烦，我很乐意帮忙，但我已经把该说的都告诉你了。

original: You look like the kind of person who might have information.
string: 你看起来就像那种可能掌握情报的人。

original: I might.
string: 也许吧。

original: That was a good start, but I need more information. Some of the Dark Rose's crew may have been in the city recently.
string: 这是一个好的开始，但我需要更多的信息。黑玫瑰号上发生了叛变。我想知道谁参与了。

original: Hm, I might know something... but information doesn't come free. Tell you what, buy a lady a drink; then we'll talk.
string: 嗯，我可能知道些什么…但信息不是免费的。这样吧，请女士喝一杯，然后我们再谈。

original: I'm looking for a ship called the Dark Rose. I need to find her captain. Some of the crew may have been in the city recently.
string: 一艘叫黑玫瑰的船上发生了叛变。我想知道谁参与了。

original: Well... You don't look like a guard and I do owe Serano a 'favor,' but information doesn't come free. Tell you what, buy a lady a drink; Then we'll talk.
string: 嗯… 你看起来不像守卫，我欠塞拉诺一个“人情”。但情报不是免费的，这样吧，请女士喝一杯，然后我们再谈。

original: I hope this jogs your memory.
string: 希望这能唤起你的回忆。

original: Indeed it does.
string: 的确如此。

original: Well?
string: 状况如何？

original: You know the Dark Rose is Val Serano's ship, right?
string: 你知道黑玫瑰号是瓦尔·塞拉诺的船，对吧？

original: Crafty sonofabitch could teach Molag Bal how to scheme. Whatever you think you're getting out of this, he's four moves ahead and you haven't even figured out what game you're playing. Trust me.
string: 这个狡猾的家伙可以教莫拉格·巴尔怎么算计人了。不管你觉得你能从中得到什么，他已经领先你四步了，而你甚至还没搞清楚你在玩什么游戏，相信我。

original: You said you had information.
string: 你说你有信息。

original: The advice was kindly meant and freely given.
string: 这些建议都是善意的，也是免费的。

original: Anyway, there was a full-on brawl a few nights ago at the base of the arch. Bunch of lowlifes from the docks and an escaped prisoner.
string: 总之，几天前的晚上，在拱门的底部发生了一场大斗殴。一群码头上的小混混和一个逃犯。

original: Right outside the gate, so the guards couldn't be bothered. Not sure if it was your guy, but 'respectable' types use the main gate after dark.
string: 就在大门外，所以守卫也懒得管。不知道是不是你的人，但“有头有脸”的人天黑后都会走正门。

original: Now leave me alone unless you're bringing me another bottle... or Serano's head in a bag.
string: 现在别来烦我，除非你再给我拿一瓶酒…或者塞拉诺的人头。

original: What is it? You keep looking my way.
string: 怎么了？你一直往我这边看。

original: Forgive me for staring.
string: 请原谅我盯着你看。

original: Do I have something on me?
string: 我身上有什么吗？

original: No, you look great. I-
string: 不，你看起来很好。我-

original: See anything you like?
string: 有喜欢的东西吗？

original: Well quite a lot, actually. I-
string: 嗯，实际上有很多。我-

original: Paint a portrait; It'll last longer.
string: 画一幅肖像画，这样能保存得更久。

original: Ah, well you do make a stunning portrait. In fact, I-
string: 啊，你的肖像确实很迷人。事实上，我-

original: Did you hear something? We should keep moving. Eh, this place isn't safe.
string: 你听到什么了吗？我们应该继续走。这地方不安全。

original: You've got some dirt on your cheek. Here, I'll get it.
string: 你脸上沾了些灰尘。来，我来擦。

original: There. All clean.
string: 好了。干净了。

original: I broke a boot lace.
string: 我弄断了鞋带。

original: I could probably splice it. Here, let me see.
string: 我可以把它拼接起来。来，让我看看。

original: Thank you. I'd have just knotted it back together.
string: 谢谢。我会把它重新打个结。

original: Oh, with the right skills and a little patience, things last longer.
string: 哦，有了正确的技能和一点耐心，东西就能用得更久。

original: Could you check my other boot lace, too? It looks worn.
string: 你能检查一下我另一只靴子的鞋带吗？看起来已经磨损了。

original: Of course. Anything else while I'm down here?
string: 当然可以。我在这里还有什么事吗？

original: You're pretty good with knots.
string: 你很擅长打结。

original: I wouldn't be much of a sailor if I wasn't, but I'm a man of many talents, what can I say?
string: 如果不是，我就不是个好水手，但我是个多才多艺的人，我能说什么呢？

original: Is that so?
string: 是吗？

original: Well, I had to learn how first. And practice.
string: 好吧，我得先学会怎么做，还要练习。

original: Anyway, let's get going. We shouldn't linger.
string: 不管怎样，我们走吧。我们不应该逗留。

original: Buy me dinner first, then we'll see.
string: 先请我吃顿饭，然后再说吧。

original: Oh darling, just name the time and place.
string: 亲爱的，说个时间和地点吧。

original: Just what are you implying?
string: 你在暗示什么？

original: Nothing.
string: 没什么。

original: That's quite a boast. I'm going to need a demonstration to believe it.
string: 你可真会吹牛。我得亲眼看看才能相信。

original: Well buy me dinner first, then we'll see.
string: 那就先请我吃饭，然后再看吧。

original: Just what are you implying?
string: 你在暗示什么？

original: Nothin'.
string: 没什么。

original: Keep your hands to yourself, pirate.
string: 别乱动，海盗。

original: Ha ha ha! I'll behave until you tell me otherwise.
string: 哈哈哈！在你没告诉我之前，我会乖乖听话的。

original: What do you mean?
string: 你是什么意思？

original: Uh, never mind.
string: 呃，没关系。

original: Looking forward to it! Just warn me next time.
string: 非常期待！下次提醒我一下。

original: You know, despite my reputation, half the time I'm making this up as I go along.
string: 你知道，尽管我名声在外，但有一半时间我都是在瞎编。

original: I've seen the Pale Lady myself.
string: 我亲眼见过苍白女士。

original: Oh, you've already been? I hope you'll tell me about it sometime.
string: 哦，你已经见过了？希望有机会能跟我说说。

original: It's unusual to see a hardened fighter spooked like that. You feelin' all right about this?
string: 一个久经沙场的战士被吓成这样是很不寻常的，你还好吗？

original: Okay, I guess...
string: 还好吧，我猜…

original: Stick by me. I'll protect you.
string: 跟着我，我会保护你的。

original: We'll be fine as long as we stick together.
string: 只要我们团结在一起，就不会有问题。

original: We'll be wing and wing.
string: 我们将会展翅高飞。

original: Don't tell me you're worried? I'll protect you.
string: 别告诉我你在担心？我会保护你的。

original: Hunh. I do feel safer with you watchin' my back.
string: 嗯。有你在背后看着我，我确实觉得更安全。

original: Hey, I wanna talk to you before we go in.
string: 嘿，我想在进去之前和你谈谈。

original: Do you suppose that was Aumriel?
string: 你觉得那是奥姆瑞尔吗？

original: No way to know for certain.
string: 我们无法确定。

original: I suppose not. Not without further research, anyway.
string: 我想不是。总之，没有进一步的研究是不行的。

original: I think she could have been a snow elf.
string: 我觉得她可能是一个雪精灵。

original: I wonder if she chose this fate or was she trapped?
string: 我不知道她是自己选择了这样的命运，还是被困在了这里？

original: This adventure seems to have left us more questions than answers.
string: 这次探险给我们留下的问题似乎比答案更多。

original: Yeah...
string: 是啊…

original: It's wondrous here, all the same. Hm. I'm glad we saw it together. Will you keep the blade?
string: 这里的一切都很奇妙。嗯，我很高兴我们一起看到了。你会留着这把刀吗？

original: It's better to leave the sword here.
string: 还是把剑留在这里吧。

original: It does seem fitting, doesn't it? Maybe some things are better left in the past.
string: 这似乎很合适，不是吗？也许有些事情还是留在过去比较好。

original: I'll keep it. It's safe to take the sword now that she's been banished.
string: 我知道，现在她被放逐了，可以放心拿剑了。

original: I'm certain you'll put it to good use. Or make a tidy profit!
string: 我相信你会好好利用它的。或者用它大赚一笔！

original: You're not interested in the treasure?
string: 你对宝藏不感兴趣吗？

original: A sword wasn't what I was after on this trip.
string: 我此行的目的并不是为了一把剑。

original: Before we go, I wanted to ask you something.
string: 走之前，我想问你一件事。

original: Come here for a second.
string: 过来一下。

original: Hold up; Something's off with your boot.
string: 等等，你的靴子有点问题。

original: Hey, ah- heh heh, never mind.
string: 嘿，啊--嘿嘿，算了。

original: What's the matter?
string: 怎么了？

original: Just thinking about Kyr. Dying alone in the dark without a soul to come looking for him.
string: 我只是在想凯尔。孤独地死在黑暗中，没有一个人来找他。

original: Wait, please? I just need a moment to collect my thoughts.
string: 等一下，好吗？我只是需要一点时间来整理一下思绪。

original: Wisps! Weapons ready and look alive.
string: 小精灵！武器准备就绪，看起来很有活力。

original: That bothers you?
string: 这让你很困扰？

original: Him? No. It's just, that coulda easily been me. I lost count of the number of times I've been wounded in some skirmish and treated myself in secret because I couldn't afford to look weak.
string: 他？不，那很可能是我。我已经数不清自己有多少次在小冲突中受伤并偷偷地治疗自己了，因为我不能让自己显得软弱。

original: I trust you.
string: 我信任你。

original: I will do everything in my power to deserve it.
string: 我将尽我所能，让自己配得上它。

original: I hope you would trust me.
string: 我希望你能相信我。

original: I do trust you. With everything.
string: 我相信你，相信你的一切。

original: Well, we have each other now.
string: 好了，我们现在有彼此了。

original: That we do. I don't want anything to ever change that.
string: 是的，我不希望任何事情改变这一点。

original: You didn't have anyone you could trust.
string: 你没有可以信赖的人。

original: No.
string: 不。

original: I suppose you know that she's one of the charges of the Warrior. The Redguards I sailed with liked to make offerings to them, and believed it brought luck to the ship.
string: 我想你应该知道她是勇士号的祭品之一。和我一起航行的红卫人喜欢向它们献祭，并相信这会给船带来好运。

original: They told me that my being born under the Steed was lucky too, but I always thought was idle superstition.
string: 他们告诉我，我出生在骏马下也很幸运，但我一直认为那只是空洞的迷信。

original: Sounded like a bunch of nonsense to me. Might be worth exploring, though.
string: 在我看来，这简直是一派胡言。不过也许值得一探究竟。

original: But, the scenery here is unexpectedly more interesting...
string: 但是，这里的风景却意外地更加有趣。

original: What in Oblivion? I think this is the fighting pit Iron-Hand wanted me to get them the wolves for. Look, I couldn't care less about the skooma - everyone waters it down anyway - but we're putting an end to the pit fights.
string: 湮灭中的什么？我想这就是铁手让我给他们弄狼的斗兽场。听着，我可不在乎什么斯库玛--反正大家都把它当水喝了--但我们要结束坑里的争斗。

original: That bandit was quick to jump ship from anywhere, including her supposed friend the Khajiit. An occupational hazard I'm too familiar with.
string: 那个强盗很快就会从任何地方跳船，包括她所谓的朋友卡吉特人，这种职业病我太熟悉了。

original: Can you read those word walls? You were staring at it for a long time.
string: 你能看懂那些字墙吗？你盯着它看了很久。

original: You didn't hear it? Or see the glow?
string: 你没听到吗？或者没有看到光芒？

original: No, nothing.
string: 没有，什么都没有看到。

original: I heard chanting, then just a single word.
string: 我听到了诵经声，然后就只听到了一个词。

original: I know enough to read the gist of the inscriptions. I've always thought they're just memorial stones, but clearly there's more to them than that. You're full of surprises!
string: 我知道的足够读懂碑文的大意。我一直以为它们只是纪念碑，但显然它们的意义不止于此。你真是充满了惊喜！

original: I'd like to buy a boat.
string: 我想买一艘船。

original: I've got one for sale if you're interested. It's the one with the blue sails out in the harbor.
string: 如果你感兴趣的话，我有一个可以卖。就是那艘在港口挂着蓝帆的船。

original: I'll take it. (5000 gold)
string: 我买了。（5000 金币）

original: Then come back when you have coin.
string: 等你拿到钱后再回来。

original: Excellent. She's all yours. I'll have her sent around to your new anchorage.
string: 好极了。她归你了，我会把她送到你的新锚地的。

original: Not right now.
string: 等会儿。

original: Sure thing. Let me know if you change your mind.
string: 没问题，如果你改变主意了，告诉我一声。

original: I think this simple letter is for you.
string: 我想这封信是写给你的。

original: It is. Thank you.
string: 是的。谢谢！

original: So, about that letter...
string: 那么，关于那封信…

original: I have questions.
string: 我有问题。

original: I figured you would. Well, ask away.
string: 我知道你会问的。好吧，问吧。

original: Your first name is Valerius?!
string: 你的名字是瓦列利乌斯？

original: Yes, and I hate it. Please for the love of the Nine do not call me that name.
string: 是的，我讨厌它。看在九圣灵的份上，请不要叫我这个名字。

original: I had no idea you wrote to your mother.
string: 我不知道你给你母亲写过信。

original: Well, yeah. Sure, I left home and didn't look back, but we aren't estranged.
string: 是的，当然，我离开了家，再也没有回头，但我们并没有疏远。

original: Her name's Elin. She translates books for the various academics in the Imperial City.
string: 她叫伊琳，她为帝都的各种学术机构翻译书籍。

original: Are you going to be okay? About Fathis?
string: 我们该拿法提斯怎么办？

original: (sigh) It's still bothering me that I wasn't able to give Fathis a proper cremation.
string: 你觉得和迪德拉王子打交道怎么样？

original: I know the guards wouldn't have put him in the Hall of the Dead, but Solitude has a pauper's graveyard just outside. I'd feel a lot better if I could pay my respects. What do you say? I'd appreciate having you with me.
string: 我知道守卫不会把他关进亡者之厅。但独孤城外面有个贫民墓地。如果我能去祭奠一下，我会感觉好很多。怎么样？如果你能和我在一起，我会很感激的。

original: Of course I won't.
string: 我当然不会。

original: Thank the gods.
string: 谢天谢地。

original: Ok, Valerius.
string: 好吧，瓦列利乌斯。

original: Uargh! Why are you like this?
string: 啊！你怎么这样？

original: I'm close with my mother, too.
string: 我和妈妈关系也很好。

original: In that case, I hope they never meet. I'd never hear the end of it from my mother about how your mother doesn't have half the troubles with her child that she does.
string: 这样的话，我希望他们永远不要见面。 我永远也听不到我妈妈说，你妈妈和她孩子之间的麻烦事还不及她的一半。

original: My mother and I aren't close.
string: 我妈妈和我并不亲近。

original: Oh, I'm sorry for that. I get a lot of disapproving lectures, but... we still care for each other very much.
string: 哦，我很抱歉。我得到了很多不赞同的训斥，但是…我们仍然非常关心对方。

original: I'm still trying to imagine young 'Valerius' who ran away with the pirates sending letters home to his mother.
string: 我仍在努力想象，年轻的“瓦列利乌斯”与海盗们私奔后，给母亲寄家书的情景。

original: Oh, stow it already. I'm never going to hear this end of this, am I?
string: 哦，算了吧。我永远也听不到这个结局了，对吧？

original: I'm ready to go get your Black Book.
string: 我准备好去拿你的黑暗经书了。

original: Good, let's get to the Rose immediately.
string: 很好，我们马上去黑玫瑰上吧。

original: Return the Spring Rain to Safe Harbor.
string: 把春雨号带回到安全的港湾。（沉船）

original: My boy, I knew you'd be back.
string: 我的孩子，我就知道你会回来的。

original: You can pipe down and sit in the hold for this trip, or you can disembark now. Which will it be?
string: 你可以在这趟旅程中闷闷不乐地坐在船舱里，也可以现在就下船。你选哪个？

original: Ungrateful whelp. You won't sail with your own father? It'll be just like old times.
string: 忘恩负义的小杂种。你不和你父亲一起出海吗？就像以前一样。

original: I'm captain here because I'm the best man by a long sea mile. Now get off my ship.
string: 我是这里的船长，因为我是最棒的人。 现在滚下我的船。

original: Care to do the honors?
string: 你愿意为我们唱一首歌吗？

original: What in Dagon's name are you doing here?!
string: 你在这里做什么？

original: Hey, it's been a while, Jena. You still looking for that white knight and coming in second best?
string: 嘿，好久不见，耶娜。你还在找那个白马王子吗？ 还在找第二名？

original: It'll be a cold day in Oblivion before I go along with any of your plans again, Serano.
string: 就算湮灭里的天再冷，我也不会同意你的计划，塞拉诺。

original: Fine, have it your way.
string: 好吧，随你便吧。

original: Care to do the honors?
string: 你愿意为我们唱一首歌吗？

original: The word is given- Let's go rescue Fathis!
string: 命令已经下达--我们去营救法提斯！

original: Damn right.
string: 说得太对了。

original: Please take us back to the island.
string: 请带我们回岛上吧。

original: Make sail! Lay aloft, you fetchers!
string: 扬帆！起航吧，你们这群混蛋！

original: I have a surprise for you.
string: 我有一个惊喜要给你。

original: Well that's nice of you and I like surprises, but what are we doing all the way out here? And uh, whose boat is this?
string: 你真好，我喜欢惊喜，但我们大老远跑来干嘛？还有，这是谁的船？

original: Oh I like surprises, but what are we doing all the way out here? And honey, whose boat is this?
string: 哦，我喜欢惊喜，但我们大老远跑到这里来干什么？亲爱的，这是谁的船？

original: That's the surprise - she's yours!
string: 这就是惊喜--它是你的！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Aelyn!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，艾琳！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Aislinn!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，阿斯林！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Alannah!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，阿兰娜！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Aris!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，阿里斯！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Bree!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，布里！

string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，辛德里安！

string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，希尔！

string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，达丽亚！

string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，伊利丝！

string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，伊利亚！

string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，伊努拉！

string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，雅斯克！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Joseph!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，约瑟夫！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Luna!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，露娜！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Maevynn!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，梅维恩！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Maximillian!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，马克西米利安！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Min!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，敏！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Myfanwy!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，米凡维！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Rathas!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，拉萨斯！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Ren!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，仁！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Ruby!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，鲁比！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Thelassia!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，瑟拉西亚！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you, Valerian!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢你，瓦雷利安！

original: No... for me? Hah hah, this is amazing! Thank you!
string: 不…给我？这太棒了！谢谢！

original: There's a peace on the open water you can't find anywhere else. Ask me any time you want to go sailing.
string: 在开阔的水面上，有一种别处找不到的宁静。想出海的话，随时问我。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Aelyn... Thank you.
string: 艾琳…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Aislinn... Thank you.
string: 阿斯林…谢谢你。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Alannah... Thank you.
string: 阿兰娜…谢谢。

original: Aris... Thank you.
string: 阿里斯…谢谢。

string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

string: 布里…谢谢你。

string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

string: 希尔…谢谢你。

original: Elise... Thank you.
string: 伊利丝…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Illia... Thank you.
string: 伊利亚…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Inula... Thank you.
string: 伊努拉…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Jacek... Thank you.
string: 雅斯克…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Joseph... Thank you.
string: 约瑟夫…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Luna... Thank you.
string: 露娜…谢谢你。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Maevynn... Thank you.
string: 梅维恩…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Maximillian... Thank you.
string: 马克西米利安…谢谢你。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Min... Thank you.
string: 敏…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Myfanwy... Thank you.
string: 米凡维…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Rathas... Thank you.
string: 拉萨斯…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Ren... Thank you.
string: 仁…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Ruby... Thank you.
string: 鲁比…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Thelassia... Thank you.
string: 瑟拉西亚…谢谢。

original: For me? I never imagined that anyone would understand me so well.
string: 对我？我从没想过有人会如此理解我。

original: Valerian... Thank you.
string: 瓦雷利安…谢谢。

original: For me? This is amazing! Love... thank you.
string: 给我吗？这太棒了！亲爱的…谢谢。

original: Wait until you feel the wind in your hair on the open water. It's a feeling of peace I can't describe. I'll take you sailing any time you like.
string: 等到你在开阔的水面上感受到风吹动你的头发。那种平静的感觉，我无法形容。我随时都可以带你去出海。

original: You need healing, drink this. (give potion)
string: 你需要治疗，喝下这个。（给药水）

original: You heard the man. Time to go! (Heave overboard)
string: 你们都听到了。该走了！（跳下船）

original: Wha- Let go of me you- wahhh!
string: 放开我，你--哇哦！

original: Get your filthy hands off of me! Woah, ah, ahh---!
string: 把你的脏手拿开！哇，啊，啊 - -！

original: Wait! I found something in the vomit or... whatever this is. Ugh.
string: 等等，我在呕吐物里发现了一些东西…不管是什么。呃。

original: I can't begin to guess how his journal ended up in here, but this is Fathis' handwriting.
string: 我无法猜测他的日记怎么会出现在这里，但这是法提斯的笔迹。

original: He wrote about finding a relic cursed by Molag Bal. Wait, wait- I know that place. We went there years ago, but I had no idea what he'd found!
string: 他在信里说找到了被莫拉格·巴尔诅咒的遗迹。等等，我知道那个地方。我们几年前去过，但我不知道他找到了什么。

original: I could take us there with the Dark Rose whenever you give the word. Let's get out of here. There's nothing further to be learned.
string: 只要你一声令下，我就能带着黑玫瑰去那里。我们走吧，没什么好学的了。

original: Will you tell me about one of your adventures?
string: 能给我讲讲你的冒险经历吗？

original: All right. Get comfortable.
string: 好吧。放松点。

original: All right.
string: 好的。

original: Tell me something I don't know about you.
string: 告诉我一些我不知道的关于你的事。

original: A bedtime story? Heh. All right, get comfortable.
string: 睡前故事？哈。好了，放松点。

original: Will you tell me a story?
string: 你能给我讲个故事吗？

original: Was there something in particular you wanted to know?
string: 你有什么特别想知道的吗？

original: I find that hard to believe.
string: 我觉得很难相信。

original: Ha ha hah! I can see why, but it's true.
string: 哈哈哈！我知道为什么，但这是事实。

original: Whatever for?
string: 为什么？

original: You're tellin' me. Getting out was a lot harder than joining, too.
string: 是你告诉我的。离开也比加入难多了。

original: You did not.
string: 你并没有。
