original: I absolutely did, and I have the tattoos to prove it.
string: 我绝对做到了，我有纹身可以证明这一点。

original: Well let's hear it!
string: 好吧…说来听听。

original: When I was about fifteen, I hit my first big growth spurt and was pretty full of myself. I was already convinced I was the smartest one on the ship and was generally a pain in the ass.
string: 大约 15 岁那年，我迎来了人生中的第一次快速成长期，那时的我非常自负。我已经确信自己是船上最聪明的人，而且总的来说是个讨厌鬼。

original: I got on my father's last nerve over something... stupid. Get this- I woke up one morning after a night ashore, and the Dark Rose was long gone.
string: 我因为一件…蠢事惹恼了我父亲。我在岸上过了一夜，有天早上醒来，发现黑玫瑰号早就不见了。

original: My father had left a note. He said I was to, humph, 'learn self-discipline in a manner of my choosing' and not to come back until I did.
string: 我父亲留下了一张字条。他说我要“以我自己选择的方式学会自律”，在我学会之前不要回来。

original: You must have been in a desperate situation.
string: 你一定是走投无路了吧。

original: Yes and no. I'd have done it anyway.
string: 是，也不是。无论如何我都会这么做的。

original: I've been looking forward to this one.
string: 我一直很期待这一次。

original: Yeah, well not all stories get a happy ending.
string: 是啊，并不是所有的故事都能有个美好的结局。

original: I admit you're braver than I thought.
string: 我承认你比我想象中勇敢。

original: My ethics are questionable, not my courage, thank you.
string: 我的道德有问题，但我的勇气没问题，谢谢。

original: I was twenty, and was by then First Mate on the Rose. With both my father and I planning operations, we had an embarrassment of riches. But it was never enough for him, and if I'm being honest, not for me either.
string: 那年我 20 岁，是黑玫瑰号的大副。由于我和父亲都在策划行动，我们的财富多得让人发窘。但这对他来说永远不够，老实说，对我来说也不够。

original: The money, the lifestyle it bought... None of it meant anything. I felt empty and restless.
string: 金钱、生活方式… 都毫无意义，我感到空虚和不安。

original: Can I ask you something?
string: 我能问你件事吗？

original: I'd rather ask you something this time.
string: 这次我想问你点事。

original: Go ahead.
string: 继续。

original: Where are you from?
string: 你是从哪里来的？

original: Maybe later.
string: 等等吧。

original: Suit yourself.
string: 随你便。

original: I grew up in Skyrim.
string: 我是在天际长大的。

original: This province suits you. How'd you end up back in Skyrim?
string: 这个省很适合你。你是怎么回到天际的？

original: Nowhere in particular; I've lived all over.
string: 没有什么特别的地方，我住过很多地方。

original: Hmh, we've got that in common. I haven't had a proper home in years. How'd you end up in Skyrim?
string: 嗯，我们有共同点。我已经很多年没有像样的家了，你怎么会在天际？

original: Somewhere else.
string: 在别的地方。

original: Huh, I should have guessed that. How'd you end up in Skyrim?
string: 我早该想到的，你怎么会在天际？

original: I was at Helgen when it was destroyed by a dragon.
string: 海尔根被巨龙摧毁时，我就在那里。

original: That must have been a sight. What was it like?
string: 那一定很壮观。是什么样的？

original: Terrifying! I'd rather change the subject.
string: 太可怕了！我还是换个话题吧。

original: The important thing is you are alive and free. My curiosity can wait.
string: 重要的是你还活着，自由自在。我的好奇心可以等等。

original: It was like nothing I've ever seen. The dragon was enormous and could cast spells.
string: 这是我从未见过的。这条龙很大，会施法。

original: I almost wish I'd seen it... ah, curiosity's gonna be the death of me.
string: 我真希望我看过它…啊，好奇心会害死我的。

original: Between everything being on fire and running for my life, I didn't catch many details.
string: 由于所有东西都着火了，我又在逃命，所以我没有捕捉到很多细节。

original: Heh, ha ha ha ha! I guess I can't blame you for that. My curiosity will have to just go unsatisfied.
string: 呵，哈哈哈哈！我想这不能怪你。我的好奇心只能得不到满足了。

original: I've been hired to retrieve some sort of 'Dragonstone' from Bleak Falls Barrow.
string: 我受雇从荒瀑古坟取回某种“龙石”。

original: A dangerous, half-collapsed, Nordic ruin probably crawling with draugr. I hope the pay is good.
string: 一个危险的、半坍塌的诺德废墟，可能充满了尸鬼。希望报酬不错。

original: Jarl Balgruuf himself wants this thing.
string: 巴尔古夫领主本人也想要这个东西。

original: Say no more. I'm in!
string: 别再说了。我加入！

original: Nice. Let's get this Dragonstone back to Whiterun and get paid! I wonder what it says?
string: 很好。让我们把龙石送回白漫，然后拿钱吧！不知道上面写了什么？

original: I'd be really excited if I weren't also convinced that we're going to die.
string: 如果我不相信我们会死，我会很兴奋的。

original: Talk to me when you get a moment.
string: 有空的时候跟我聊聊。

original: Why in Dagon's name do the Greybeards live so far up a mountain?
string: 以大衮之名，灰胡子为什么要住在这么远的山上？

original: Did Kynareth bless us? I feel peaceful.
string: 凯纳瑞丝祝福我们了吗？我感觉很平静。

original: When the Greybeards teach you their understanding of a word, are they sharing a piece of their soul with you?
string: 当灰胡子向你传授他们对一个词的理解时，他们是在与你分享他们的灵魂吗？

original: Can I see the note? Does it say anything about the Horn?
string: 我能看看纸条吗？上面有没有提到“号角”？

original: This cloak and dagger routine is getting ridiculous.
string: 这种伪装和匕首的把戏越来越可笑了。

original: Hey, I need to talk to you.
string: 喂，我有话跟你说。

original: Come see me before you go.
string: 走之前来看看我吧。

original: Watch yourself; we picked up a tail.
string: 小心点；我们发现了一个尾巴。

original: The view from here is breathtaking... Here, we should take some time to appreciate it before we head down.
string: 这里的景色美不胜收… 在这里，我们应该花点时间欣赏一下，然后再下山。

original: This carving is beyond price. Do you think we could break it down and move it? Ha ha! I'm kidding, I'm kidding!
string: 这个雕刻太贵了。你觉得我们能把它拆了搬走吗？哈哈！我开玩笑的，我开玩笑的！

original: I'm not sure so it bodes well for us that our two main allies can't stand each other.
string: 我不确定，所以我们的两个主要盟友无法忍受对方，这对我们来说是个好兆头。

original: I wonder what's over there by that sun-like structure?
string: 我想知道在那个像太阳一样的建筑旁边有什么？

original: Eh, it's not bad! Well, I'm not saying I'd like to build a Sun's Height getaway here, but the mushrooms are actually quite nice.
string: 嗯，还不错！好吧，我不是说我想在这里建一个太阳高度的度假胜地，但这里的蘑菇其实很不错。

original: Huh. Interesting.
string: 咦？有意思。

original: When I was a boy, I used to pretend I was Olaf One-Eye trappin' the dragon. And now look! Never imagined I'd be doing it for real.
string: 当我还是个孩子的时候，我常常假装自己是独眼奥拉夫。现在看来，从没想过我会真的这么做！

original: Don't leave yet! I need to give you something.
string: 先别走！我有东西要给你。

original: Hey, Dragonslayer! Let's talk.
string: 嘿，屠龙者！我们谈谈。

original: We should help Malborn out. It's not right for Delphine to just leave him high and dry like this. Makes you wonder if everyone else is just as expendable to her.
string: 我们应该帮助马伯恩。戴尔芬这样把他晾在一边是不对的。让人不禁怀疑其他人对她来说是不是都一样可有可无。

original: The mudcrabs down here don't seem to be aggressive. I wonder why? Maybe I can find a small one... keep it as a pet. They're really pretty.
string: 这里的泥螃蟹似乎并不凶猛。不知道为什么？也许我能找到一只小的…把它当宠物养着。它们真的很漂亮。

original: Dragonborn! Did- did you know?
string: 龙裔！你、你知道吗？

original: No, stupid of me to ask that. How could you have possibly known...
string: 不，我不该这么问。你怎么可能知道…

original: Um, ahem... H-how do you feel?
string: 嗯… 你、你感觉怎么样？

original: Okay, I think.
string: 还好吧，我觉得。

original: Well, there's no rush to figure it all out immediately. Uh, let's get back to Whiterun.
string: 好吧，不用急着马上搞清楚。我们回白漫吧。

original: We slew a dragon! I feel great!
string: 我们杀死了一条龙！我感觉棒极了！

original: Yeah, we did! There oughta be some reward for that. Heh heh ha ha! Let's get back to Whiterun.
string: 是的，我们做到了！我们应该为此得到一些奖励。呵呵呵！我们回白漫吧。

original: Too early to tell.
string: 现在下结论还为时尚早。

original: Oh cheer up, it looked really impressive! Heh heh. Let's get back to Whiterun.
string: 哦，振作点，看起来真的很厉害！嘿嘿。我们回白漫吧。

original: I'm a Thane of Whiterun.
string: 我是白漫城的武卫。

original: Oh. Impressive title. Should make it easier to avoid jail at least.
string: 哦。令人印象深刻的头衔。至少能让你更容易躲过牢狱之灾。

original: Strategic and smart.
string: 有战略眼光。

original: In Riften, you're either in Maven's good graces or you're in prison.
string: 在裂谷，你要么得到玛雯的青睐，要么就会被关进监狱。

original: I'm a Thane of the Rift.
string: 我是裂谷城的武卫。

original: Well that's one way to stay off of Captain Aldis's shit list.
string: 这也是不被艾迪斯队长列入黑名单的一个办法。

original: I'm a Thane of Haafingar.
string: 我是海芬加的武卫。

original: Thane of a skeever hole of a town in a frozen, stinkin' swamp. Great job.
string: 一个冰天雪地、臭气熏天的沼泽里的小镇的镇长。干得好。

original: I'm a Thane of Hjaalmarch.
string: 我是希雅陲的武卫。

original: More like the Thane of 'not much.'
string: 更像是“不多”的塞恩。

original: I'm a Thane of Winterhold
string: 我是冬堡的武卫。

original: Excellent, you'll be running the place in no time! The Jarl sure isn't.
string: 好极了，你马上就能管理这个地方了！领主肯定不会介意的。

original: I'm a Thane of Falkreath.
string: 我是佛克瑞斯的武卫。

original: Think that will keep the Silver-Bloods off our backs?
string: 你觉得这样就能让银血家族远离我们吗？

original: I'm a Thane of the Reach.
string: 我是瑞驰的武卫。

original: You know, just once, I would like to get the title of Thane out of all this work!
string: 你知道，就这一次，我想从这一切工作中得到男爵的头衔！

original: I'm a Thane of the Pale.
string: 我是苍白领的武卫。

original: I wish that fancy little title of yours meant that you could convince the Jarl to allow better housing for the Dunmer and the Argonians!
string: 我真希望你那华丽的小头衔意味着你能说服领主，让暗精灵和阿尔贡人有更好的住处！

original: I'm a Thane of Windhelm.
string: 我是风舵城的武卫。

original: If you're nice to me, I'll let you be my next housecarl.
string: 如果你对我好点，我就让你做我的下一任管家。

original: Hah! I'll vanquish your enemies, but don't expect me to babysit your stuff.
string: 哈！我会消灭你的敌人，但别指望我会照看你的东西。

original: Heh heh heh! I'll vanquish your enemies, but don't expect me to babysit your ass.
string: 嘿嘿嘿！我会消灭你的敌人，但别指望我会照顾你的背后。

original: What can I do for you today?
string: 我今天能为你做些什么？

original: Hello.
string: 你好。

original: Hello.
string: 你好。

original: Watching you learn dragon speech so quickly has been incredible.
string: 看着你这么快就学会了龙语，真是不可思议。

original: Are you ready to go get the Horn?
string: 你准备好去拿号角了吗？

original: Yeah, it should be interesting. Strange errand, though. Do you suppose the next Dragonborn to come along will have to go put the horn back?
string: 是啊，应该会很有趣。不过是个奇怪的差事。你觉得下一个龙裔会把号角放回去吗？

original: Hnh, still, I'm looking forward to seeing this tomb.
string: 不过，我还是很期待看到这座古墓。

original: I can't wait to see the Tomb of Jurgen Windcaller.
string: 我迫不及待地想去看看约根·唤风之墓。

original: I'm looking forward to it, too. I wonder, however, what other treasures might be hidden inside?
string: 我也很期待。不过，我想知道里面可能还藏着什么宝藏？

original: We could make a tidy profit. What the Greybeards don't know won't hurt them.
string: 我们可以大赚一笔。灰胡子不知道的事对他们没有坏处。

original: I can't believe I have to get some useless horn for the Greybeards before they'll teach me more.
string: 真不敢相信，在灰胡子教我更多东西之前，我还得给他们弄些没用的角。

original: I've no doubt the Greybeards have plenty more to teach you, but retrieving this horn does seem like a red herring. You suppose the next Dragonborn to come along will have to put it back?
string: 我毫不怀疑灰胡子还有很多东西要教你，但取回这只角似乎是个障眼法，你觉得下一个龙裔会把它放回去吗？

original: Hnh, still, I'm looking forward to seeing this tomb.
string: 不过，我还是很期待看到这座古墓。

original: Here, take a look at the note.
string: 来，看看这张纸条。

original: Huh, ha ha ha heh! Okay, this is something I would do if I was expecting an ambush. Or a betrayal.
string: 哈，哈哈哈！好吧，如果我知道有埋伏，我就会这么做。或者是背叛。

original: But everyone you know is out to get you.
string: 但你认识的每个人都想干掉你。

original: Guess I'm not paranoid then. I'll watch your back at this meeting.
string: 看来我不是多疑了。我会在这次会面上保护你的。

original: About the Greybeards' ceremony...
string: 关于灰胡子的仪式…

original: Go on.
string: 继续。

original: I'm not sure I'm worthy of all this.
string: 我不确定我是否值得拥有这一切。

original: Never forget who and what you are. You're the Dragon of the North. The Greybeards may have recognized it in you, but they didn't give it to you.
string: 永远不要忘记你是谁…你是谁啊，你是北境之龙！灰胡子可能已经认识到了你的身份，但他们并没有赋予你。

original: This power must be for some purpose.
string: 这种力量一定是有目的的。

original: I hope for your sake that it doesn't require that sort of sacrifice that was asked of Martin Septim.
string: 我希望你不要像马丁·塞普汀那样做出牺牲。

original: I always knew I was destined for greatness.
string: 我一直都知道，我注定要成就一番事业。

original: If I were a better Nord I'd kneel. Fortunately for your ego, I'm not.
string: 如果我是一个更好的诺德人，我会下跪。幸运的是，我不是。

original: I don't like you going in alone. It's a close haul, and there's no leeway.
string: 我不喜欢你一个人去。这是一场惊险的的战斗，没有回旋余地。

original: You're worried about me?
string: 你在担心我？

original: Of course I am. I've heard about the Thalmor and what they do to their captives.
string: 当然了。我听说过梭默他们是怎么对待俘虏的。

original: Delphine is a Blade, so naturally she's fixated on the Thalmor. There has to be other possibilities we haven't considered.
string: 戴尔芬是刀锋战士，所以她自然会盯上梭默。肯定还有其他我们没有考虑到的可能性。

original: I don't like it either, but we need information.
string: 我也不喜欢这样做，但我们需要信息。

original: I realize this, but the plan is too narrow.
string: 我意识到了这一点，但这个计划过于狭隘。

original: Delphine is a Blade, so naturally she's fixated on the Thalmor. There has to be other possibilities we haven't considered.
string: 戴尔芬是刀锋战士，所以她自然会盯上梭默。肯定还有其他我们没有考虑到的可能性。

original: You worry too much.
string: 你担心得太多了。

original: I'm a careful guy, what can I say. You don't worry enough sometimes.
string: 我是个细心的人，怎么说呢。有时候你担心得还不够。

original: Delphine is a Blade, so naturally she's fixated on the Thalmor. There has to be other possibilities we haven't considered.
string: 戴尔芬是刀锋战士，所以她自然会盯上梭默。肯定还有其他我们没有考虑到的可能性。

original: We don't have any other leads.
string: 我们没有其他线索了。

original: I know; you're right.
string: 我知道，你是对的。

original: Just remember that Delphine's loyalty is going to be to her cause first, not to you personally, no matter what she says. And she's used to calling her own shots. So don't get caught.
string: 请记住，不管戴尔芬说什么，她首先忠于的是她的事业，而不是你个人。而且她习惯了自己做主。所以别被她抓住把柄。

original: The Thalmor will never know I was there.
string: 梭默永远不会知道我在那里。

original: Yeah. That's the spirit.
string: 嗯。就是这种精神。

original: I know you'll come for me if I do.
string: 我知道如果我这么做，你会来救我的。

original: I'd give my life for you if I had to. But... sigh, let's just hope it doesn't come to that?
string: 如果有必要，我愿意为你献出生命 但是…唉，但愿不会走到那一步吧？

original: Good thing I'm planning to kick their asses.
string: 好在我正打算好好教训他们一顿。

original: You realize this is exactly why they regard us Nords as barbarians, yeah?
string: 你知道这正是他们视我们诺德人为野蛮人的原因吧？

original: And to think people call me a Nord barbarian.
string: 想想看，人们还叫我诺德野蛮人呢。

original: I'd feel better if you were coming to watch my back.
string: 如果你来帮我照看后方，我会感觉好些。

original: Yeah, me too, given Delphine's questionable fashion sense. But two of us would attract more attention. This plan here depends on surprise and stealth.
string: 是啊，我也是，戴尔芬的时尚品味有问题。但我们两个人会更引人注意，这个计划要靠出其不意和隐秘行事。

original: I'll meet you back in Riverwood when I'm done.
string: 等我办完事就回河木镇找你。

original: I consider that a promise.
string: 我认为这是一种承诺。

original: Hey, handsome. About the Embassy...
string: 嘿，帅哥。关于大使馆…

original: Hey, gorgeous.
string: 嗨，美女。

original: Hey yourself.
string: 嘿，你自己。

original: Hey there. About the Embassy...
string: 你好。关于大使馆…

original: I knew you'd miss me enough to come back alive. How'd it go?
string: 我就知道你会想我想到活着回来。怎么样了？

original: I knew you'd miss me enough to come back alive. How'd it go?
string: 我就知道你会想我想到活着回来。怎么样了？

original: The Thalmor didn't know what hit them.
string: 梭默不知道自己中了什么邪。

original: That's fantastic! What did you learn?
string: 那太棒了！你学到了什么？

original: Moderate disaster.
string: 温和的灾难。

original: That good, huh? Did you learn anything useful?
string: 很好，是吧？你学到了什么有用的东西吗？

original: I almost didn't make it.
string: 我差点没成功。

original: Let's not split up again. Did you learn anything?
string: 我们不要再分开了。你学到了什么吗？

original: The Thalmor don't know anything about the dragons, but someone named Esbern in Riften might.
string: 梭默不知道龙的事，但裂谷城里一个叫伊思本的人可能知道。

original: In that case, we need to find Esbern before the Thalmor get the wind back in their sails.
string: 既然如此，我们就得在梭默恢复元气之前找到伊思本。

original: Any idea how this thing works?
string: 知道这东西怎么用吗？

original: This machine seems meant to focus light by moving the lenses. Damned if Septimus didn't make some sense. Start with the cube; move the 'glow.'
string: 这台机器似乎是通过移动镜片来聚焦光线的。塞普汀默斯说得还真有道理。从立方体开始，移动“发光体”。

original: Die, dragon!
string: 去死吧，巨龙！

original: Keep him grounded!
string: 让他落下来！

original: The Blades insist I kill Paarthurnax.
string: 刀锋战士坚持要我杀死帕图纳克斯。

original: I warned you Delphine would put her own cause first. What are you going to do?
string: 我警告过你戴尔芬会把自己的利益放在第一位的，你打算怎么办？

original: The Blades are right. Paarthurnax must be slain.
string: 刀锋战士是对的，必须杀死帕图纳克斯。

original: Thousands of years contemplating the Way of the Voice alone on a mountain isn't enough repentance for you? Some of the dragons flying overhead don't even attack us.
string: 几千年来独自在山上思考“吼声之道”，对你来说还不够忏悔吗？有些从头顶飞过的龙甚至不会攻击我们。

original: Just remind me to never get on your bad side.
string: 提醒我千万别跟你过不去。

original: Paarthurnax has been a faithful ally and I won't harm him.
string: 帕图纳克斯一直是我忠实的盟友，我不会伤害他。

original: I'm relieved to hear it. The Blades are playing their old zero-sum game, but Paarthurnax? He changed the equation with that Way of the Voice. As long as they're stuck in the past, they're no help to you.
string: 听到这个消息我就放心了。刀锋战士在玩他们那套零和游戏，但是帕图纳克斯？他用“吼声之道”改变了等式，只要他们还停留在过去，他们就帮不了你。

original: That's unfair. Dragons are a threat to mortals.
string: 这不公平。龙是凡人的威胁。

original: And you have the soul of a dragon. What's it going to cost you to slay them all? What are the Blades going to do when they don't need you anymore? Think about that.
string: 你有龙的灵魂。杀光他们要花多少钱？如果刀锋战士不再需要你了，他们会怎么做？想想吧。

original: I wish you could come with me.
string: 我希望你能和我一起去。

original: About that. Let me teach you this spell I worked up.
string: 关于这个。让我教你这个我发明的咒语。

original: This is either my most brilliant idea ever... or I'll wind up in some pit of Oblivion.
string: 这要么是我有史以来最绝妙的主意…要么我就会陷入湮灭的深渊。

original: You created a spell that summons you? And you haven't tested it?!
string: 你创造了一个召唤你的咒语？你还没测试过？

original: Yeah. With this, you should be able to bring me to wherever you are.
string: 是啊。 有了这个，你就能把我带到任何地方了。

original: Just... come get me if the second thing I mentioned happens, okay?
string: 只是…如果我提到的第二件事发生了，来接我，好吗？

original: What do you think of Sovngarde?
string: 你觉得松加德怎么样？

original: Not for me.
string: 不适合我。

original: What do you mean?
string: 你是什么意思？

original: It's just, there's got to be more than this. I've got nothing against drinking and feasting, but don't you think it gets boring after all we did? Where's the spark? Where's the challenge?
string: 只是，事情肯定不止这些。我并不反对吃喝玩乐，但你不觉得我们做了那么多之后会很无聊吗？火花在哪里？挑战在哪里？

original: You're a Nord and you're brave. Of course it's for you!
string: 你是诺德人，你很勇敢。当然是给你的！

original: Look, if I wanted to spend eternity getting shitfaced and fighting, I could have just stayed a common sailor. I'd prefer an afterlife with a little more variety. No offense, of course.
string: 听着，如果我想永生都在打打杀杀中度过，我可以一直做个普通水手。我更喜欢来世多点变化，当然，我无意冒犯。

original: We certainly agree on that.
string: 我们当然同意这一点。

original: Wait, are you saying that I'm not good enough to be here? Come on, I may be a pirate but I'm no coward.
string: 等等，你是说我不够好，不适合来这里吗？拜托，我也许是个海盗，但我不是懦夫。

original: Right? We'll find an afterlife with a little more variety, trust me.
string: 对吧？相信我，我们会找到更丰富多彩的来生。

original: Victory! We're in the realm of the dead, but I've never felt more alive! Hey listen, it was an honor to fight alongside you.
string: 赢了！我们在死人的世界里，但我从来没有觉得这么有活力！听着，和你并肩作战是我的荣幸。

original: Did the word 'honor' just come out of your mouth?
string: “荣幸”这个词是从你嘴里冒出来的吗？

original: Oh come on, that was inspiring! You with the Voice, shoulder to shoulder with heroes of legends. And I got to be a part of it. It feels good!
string: 拜托，这太鼓舞人心了！有你的吼声，与传奇英雄并肩作战。我也是其中一员。感觉真好。

original: You're the one always telling me a need a purpose in life. And well, hrm, maybe I should try saving the world a lot more often.
string: 你总是告诉我生活需要一个目标。嗯，嗯，也许我应该试着更经常地拯救世界。

original: It was an honor to stand with you, too.
string: 和你站在一起也是我的荣幸。

original: All right, all right. Look, let's just get back to civilization before I get any more wild ideas.
string: 好吧，好吧。听着，我们还是回到文明世界吧别让我再胡思乱想了。

original: I hope you're not going to turn boring and law-abiding on me.
string: 我希望你不会变得无聊又守法。

original: Hah! Yeah, we'll make the heroism a part-time gig then.
string: 哈！是啊，那我们就把英雄主义当成兼职吧。

original: Don't strain anything in your rush to heroism.
string: 不要急于逞英雄。

original: I find true meaning for the first time in my life and you're going to mock me. Hilarious.
string: 我这辈子第一次找到了人生的真谛而你却要嘲笑我。太搞笑了。

original: A toast, Val! Let's celebrate our victories!
string: 干杯，瓦尔！让我们庆祝胜利吧！

original: Let's have a drink in honor of my growing fleet. To my captains, Fathis and Velehk!
string: 让我们为我不断壮大的舰队喝一杯吧！敬我的船长，法提斯和维莱克。

original: Can you believe the College of Winterhold offered me a teaching position? I need a drink.
string: 你能相信冬堡学院给了我一个教职吗？我要喝一杯！

original: Hey, remember that time we almost got blown up by the East Empire Company while we were clearing out some pirates for them? Good times.
string: 嘿，还记得那次我们在为东帝国公司清除海盗时差点被他们炸死吗？好时光啊。

original: Do you remember that one gigantic chaurus living under the lighthouse? I do. I swear that thing was bigger than one of the Dark Rose's rowboats. I'm... gonna need something stronger than mead today.
string: 你还记得住在灯塔下面的那只巨大的查鲁斯吗？记得我发誓那东西比黑玫瑰号的划艇还大。我…今天需要比蜂蜜酒更烈的东西。

original: To my beloved partner in crime! Speaking of which, heh heh, can you imagine the look on Lucan Valerius' face if he ever figures out we switched his Golden Claw for a fake? Hahahaha!
string: 敬我挚爱的搭档！说到这里，嘿嘿，你能想象如果路坎·瓦列利乌斯发现我们把他的金爪换成了假货，他会是什么表情吗？哈哈哈。

original: Here's to the Vanquishers of the Emperor Crab! That thing could have taken the Dark Rose to the bottom of the sea, but we triumphed.
string: 为征服皇帝蟹的胜利者干杯!那东西本可以把暗玫瑰拖进海底,但我们取得了胜利。

original: Cheers to us! The Dragonborn and her charming, handsome lover!
string: 为我们干杯！龙裔和她英俊迷人的恋人！

original: Cheers to the Dragonborn and his charming, handsome lover!
string: 为龙裔和他英俊迷人的恋人干杯！

original: Cheers to the Dragonborn and the charming, handsome lover!
string: 为龙裔和英俊迷人的恋人干杯！

original: Cheers to us! The Dragonborn and... suave, sexy pirate lover.
string: 为我们干杯！龙裔和…风流倜傥的性感海盗情人。

original: Cheers to us! The Dragonborn and... dubious pirate friend.
string: 为我们干杯！龙裔和…可疑的海盗朋友。

original: Cheers to us!
string: 为我们干杯！

original: Cheers! First round's on you, hero!
string: 干杯！第一轮算你的，英雄！

original: Cheers to us, the unstoppable duo!
string: 为我们这对不可阻挡的组合干杯！

original: Cheers to us! The Dragonborn and the dashing pirate- I mean relic hunter.
string: 为我们干杯！龙裔和潇洒的海盗--我是说遗迹猎人。

original: Cheers to us! A clever, handsome, successful, swashbuckling rogue... and the Dragonborn.
string: 为我们干杯！一个聪明、英俊、成功、潇洒的流氓…还有龙裔。

original: Come slumming to the Gray Quarter, have you?
string: 来灰民区体验贫民生活吗？

original: Welcome, brother. You are always welcome here.
string: 欢迎你，兄弟。这里永远欢迎你。

original: Absolutely. There should be plenty of space. I trust you're not planning any trouble?
string: 当然可以。应该有足够的空间我相信你不会找麻烦吧？

original: Well. There's morals and then there's money. In this case, money wins.
string: 好吧有道德，就有金钱。在这种情况下，钱是赢家。

original: Ha ha ha ha! Where else am I gonna slum? Besides, I came to settle Fathis's bar tab.
string: 哈哈哈哈！我还能去哪里？贫民窟？再说，我是来给法提斯结账的。

original: Good to see you again, Ambarys.
string: 很高兴再次见到你，安巴里斯。

original: My companion and I will be passing through Windhelm periodically. Got a couple spare beds we can reserve? I'll pay in advance.
string: 我和我的同伴会定期经过风舵城。有空床吗？我可以先付钱。

original: I can't promise that, but I promise I'll keep the trouble outside.
string: 我不能保证，但我保证会把麻烦挡在外面。

original: Sigh... The problem with the Argonian's plan is that it's going to draw a lot of unwanted attention.
string: 唉… 亚龙人计划的问题是会引起很多不必要的注意。

original: Shipwrecking is the lowest form of piracy! I can't believe I got dragged into this.
string: 沉船是最低级的海盗行为。真不敢相信我也被卷进来了。

original: The next time you want something off of a ship, you know all you have to do is ask me, right?
string: 下次你想要船上的东西，只要问我就行，对吧？

original: Argh, that sniveling little- Let's find Jaree-Ra and settle the score.
string: 啊，那个哭哭啼啼的小… 我们去找加雷·拉算账吧。

original: Fucking East Empire Company bastards couldn't wait until we got off the island first?!
string: 该死的东帝国公司的混蛋们就不能等我们先离开这个岛吗？

original: Pft, all the stuff in here is worthless. I know a con man when I see one.
string: 呸，这里的东西一文不值。我一看就知道是骗子。

original: Calixto is lying about that amulet you found. I'd bet my life on it.
string: 关于你找到的护身符，卡利斯托在撒谎。我敢拿我的命打赌。

original: Well, I've never heard of this tradition to honor Kynare- I mean, Kyne. I'd like to try the scared trials.
string: 我从来没听说过这个纪念凯纳雷的传统，我是说凯恩。我想试试惊吓试验。

original: Eh, killing these beasts didn't seem much different than something Hircine or even Boethiah would require. I don't understand the difference. Ah, maybe one day I'll get it.
string: 诶，杀死这些野兽似乎和海尔辛甚至波耶希亚所要求的没什么不同。我不明白这其中的区别。啊，也许有一天我会明白的。

original: Original bed, yeah right. It's been thousands of years. Eh, at least she's not charging us extra.
string: 原始的床，是的，没错。都几千年了。嗯，至少她不会多收我们钱。

original: So Hjalti got distracted conquering his empire and forgot all about his dear old friend. That is the most believable thing I have heard about this Talos legend.
string: 于是，希雅提分心去征服他的帝国，把他亲爱的老朋友忘得一干二净。这是我听到的关于塔洛斯传说中最可信的一件事。

original: It's too bad about the Gildergreen. I'd always hoped to see it in its full glory. In this state it's kinda sad. Everyone's just... going through the motions around it.
string: 金树的情况太糟糕了。我一直希望能看到它的全貌。现在这个样子真让人难过，每个人都只是…围绕着它走走过场。

original: Deal with the hagravens for Nettlebane? Hunh, Look I'm pretty sure that's translation for, 'We're gonna kill them.'
string: 为了草木灾星和乌鸦鬼婆打交道？听着，我很确定那是“我们要杀了它们”的意思。

original: Are we really gonna be stuck with this guy all the way to the Eldergleam Sanctuary?
string: 我们真的要一直跟这家伙在一起到古藤圣所吗？

original: This place is really somethin'... I... like it here.
string: 这地方真不错… 我… 喜欢这里。

original: I hope the priestess doesn't mind blood in her tree sap...
string: 我希望女祭司不会介意她的树液里有血…

original: The new Gildergreen is small now, but, hey, nothing stays the same forever. Kind of like life, huh? Maybe that's what makes it beautiful.
string: 新的镀金树现在是小了点，但是，嘿，没有什么是永远不变的。就像生活，对吧？也许这就是它的美丽之处。

original: The restored Gildergreen is beautiful, but looking at it? It still feels dead.
string: 修复后的镀金树很漂亮，但看着它？它仍然给人死气沉沉的感觉。

original: Horse thieving?! For a small-time swindler like Louis Letrush? Oh come on! This is beneath our dignity.
string: 偷马？就为了路易士·莱特鲁什这样的小骗子？得了吧！这有失我们的尊严。

original: Alva's the kind of trouble even I wouldn't touch.
string: 阿尔瓦是那种连我都不愿意碰的麻烦。

original: I was ready to kill him on sight, but something's wrong with Hroggar. He won't be any help to us.
string: 我本想当场杀了他，但赫鲁加有点不对劲，他帮不了我们。

original: How do you feel about a little breaking and entering at Alva's place? It's for a good cause.
string: 你觉得闯进阿尔瓦家怎么样？这是出于好意。

original: Vampire hunting? With this crew? Ugh. They'll just be in the way.
string: 猎杀吸血鬼？和这些船员一起？啊。他们只会碍事。

original: Good riddance to those blood-sucking parasites.
string: 总算摆脱了那些吸血的寄生虫。

original: Good riddance to those bloodsucking parasites. No more little girls are going to die on our watch.
string: 总算摆脱了那些吸血寄生虫。不会再有小女孩死在我们眼皮底下了。

original: I'm not sure what Fastred sees in either of them. Do you really want to fix her up with one of those guys? Eh, can't blame her for wanting to leave Ivarstead, though.
string: 我不知道法斯雷德看上他们谁了 你真的想撮合她和他们中的一个吗？不过也不能怪她想离开。

original: Wow, that's pretty good stuff. Maybe I should take some notes.
string: 哇，说得真好。也许我该做一些笔记。

original: I'm gonna be honest... whenever a guard tells me not to do something, it just makes me wanna do that thing anyway.
string: 老实说…每当警卫告诉我不要做什么的时候，我都会很想去做。

original: Look at this place. It's no wonder that Skyrim is full of bandits.
string: 看看这个地方 难怪天际到处都是强盗。

original: Hey, I need to talk to you.
string: 喂，我有话跟你说。

original: Watch your back. We don't know the half of this situation.
string: 小心背后。我们还不知道事情的来龙去脉。

original: Poor bastard. All those years he had no idea he was the Silver-Bloods' pawn.
string: 可怜的家伙。这么多年来，他都不知道自己是银血家族的棋子。

original: What in Oblivion happened to not getting involved?! ...I have no idea where we're gonna hide all these bodies...
string: 你不是说不参与吗！…我不知道该把这些尸体藏在哪里？

original: 'I'm going to ignore it and hope it goes away,' he said... yeah right.
string: 他说，“我不会理会它，希望它消失”…是的，没错。

original: 'I'm going to ignore it and hope it goes away,' she said... yeah right.
string: 她说：“我不会理睬它，希望它消失”…是的，没错。

original: 'I'm going to ignore it and hope it goes away,' they said... yeah right.
string: 他们说“我不会理会它，希望它消失”…是的，没错。

original: No one escapes, huh? I guess we'll be the first.
string: 没人能逃脱，是吧？我想我们会是第一个。

original: What do you say we get the White Phial? Legend or not, this kind of job usually pays well.
string: 我们去找雪瓶怎么样？不管是不是传说，这种工作通常报酬丰厚。

original: Okay, so I was wrong about the White Phial job paying well. My bad.
string: 好吧，关于雪瓶工作报酬高的说法是我错了。我的错。

original: A self-filling potion! That's not just another trinket for the display shelf, huh?
string: 一种自我填充的药水！那可不只是陈列架上的小玩意儿啊，对吧？

original: Fralia deserves to know the truth. Come on, let's see what we can find out.
string: 法利亚应该知道真相。来吧，让我们看看能发现什么。

original: That ended surprisingly well! Heh... Hmm, I should probably write to my mother...
string: 结局出乎意料的好！呵… 嗯，我也许该给我妈妈写封信…

original: I had no idea that nirnroot came in red. That's gotta be worth money to someone!
string: 我不知道奈恩根还有红色的。这对某些人来说一定很值钱！

original: Does 'crimson' start with a C or a K?
string: 深红色是以C还是K开头？

original: I knew this bard who went by the name of Krimson, but he insisted on spelling it with a K and I've never been able to keep it straight since.
string: 我认识一个吟游诗人，他的名字听起来是克里姆森，但他坚持把名字拼成 K，从那以后我就一直没能把它拼清楚。

original: This cube's amazing! Do you think it could play back what we were doing now for the next people that find it?
string: 这个立方体太神奇了！你认为它能回放我们现在正在做的事情给下一个找到它的人吗？

original: Amateurs. Pht. No wonder their expedition didn't end well.
string: 业余爱好者。切，难怪他们的探险没有好结果。

original: Wait, someone was going to pay for this cube?! Damnit, I wish the Argonian had told us that!
string: 等等，有人要为这个立方体付钱吗！可恶，要是那个亚龙人早点告诉我们就好了！

original: Priestesses are a lot friendlier when you've been invited. This is making me very uncomfortable.
string: 当你被邀请时，女祭司会友善很多。这让我很不舒服。

original: These Forsworn are animals. Let's get the child outta here quickly.
string: 这些弃誓者都是禽兽，我们快点把孩子带走吧。

original: I've seen a lot of torture rooms in Dwemer ruins. They must have been real bastards.
string: 我在锻莫废墟里见过很多拷问室，他们一定是真正的混蛋。

original: I don't understand why these people don't burn their dead. This whole problem could have been avoided.
string: 真搞不懂这些人为什么不把尸体烧了，本来压根就不会有这些破事。

original: Let's make sure Potema stays dead like she deserves. I take her threatening you rather personally.
string: 务必让波提玛死透——她罪有应得。她胆敢威胁你，这笔账我要亲自跟她算。

original: Let's make sure Potema stays dead like she deserves. I prefer Solitdue without draugr roaming the streets.
string: 咱们得确保波提玛这疯婆娘死透透的，她配得上这待遇。我可不想在独孤大街上撞见尸鬼遛弯。

original: You know, we should probably have them burn our corpses when we die. I feel like it'll just prevent a lot of problems... What?
string: 我们死后也许应该让他们烧掉我们的尸体，我觉得这样可以避免很多问题… 什么？

original: Have you no faith in Arkay?
string: 难道你对阿凯没有信心吗？

original: No, I don't. And I don't really want to spend my afterlife shambling around until some hapless adventurer shows up to return me to my grave.
string: 不，我没有。我可不想在死后四处游荡，直到某个倒霉的冒险家出现把我送回坟墓。

original: I couldn't agree more.
string: 我完全同意。

original: Right? Look, tell you what, if you rise as any kind of undead I, sailor's promise, will decapitate you clean and quick.
string: 对吧？听着，这样吧，如果你以任何一种不死生物的身份复活，我向你保证，我会干净利落地斩了你的头。

original: I think you have issues.
string: 我想你有问题。

original: No, necromancy is just objectively creepy.
string: 不，死灵法术只是客观上令人毛骨悚然而已。

original: If you rise as undead I promise to decapitate you clean and quick.
string: 如果你变成亡灵，我保证干净利落地把你斩首。

original: Oh. Thanks, I think.
string: 哦，谢谢。

original: Well, you're not wrong.
string: 嗯，你说的没错。

original: Thank you!
string: 谢谢你！

original: I know the smell leaves something to be desired, but don't be such a milk-drinker.
string: 我知道这种味道让人欲罢不能，但别老是喝牛奶。

original: It's not so much the smell, it's the weird twitching and constant moaning that gets to me. Ugh.
string: 不是因为它的味道，而是奇怪的抽搐和不断的呻吟让我心烦。

original: What do you think of Saadia's story?
string: 你觉得萨蒂亚的故事怎么样？

original: Plausible, but vague on the details. Just enough to be compelling. You know, she's really leaning into that babe-in-the-woods act, too, in case you're into that sort of thing.
string: 似是而非，但细节模糊。但足够吸引人。你知道吗，她也很喜欢那种幼稚的行为，万一你也喜欢这种事呢。

original: Yeah, she's lying. Doesn't mean the other guy is necessarily telling the truth, of course.
string: 是的，她在撒谎。当然，这并不意味着对方说的一定是实话。

original: Honestly, who comes into these ruins not expecting Draugr? Pht, amateur...
string: 老实说，谁来这些废墟不是为了找尸鬼？业余…

original: Ah yes, the inevitable double-cross. Anyway...!
string: 啊，是的，不可避免的双重背叛。总之…！

original: Poor kid. She reminds me a bit of myself when I was younger.
string: 可怜的孩子。她让我想起了自己年轻的时候。

original: Good call on getting that map. Besides, it's not like the Daedra could actually die. Might as well get some treasure out of it.
string: 搞到那张地图真是个好主意。而且，迪德拉又不会真的死掉，还不如从中得到些宝藏。

original: These bandits are the worst sort of scum. We should kill them all and be done with it.
string: 这些强盗是最坏的人渣，我们应该杀光他们，一了百了。

original: This man is a terrible liar.
string: 这个人是一个可怕的骗子。

original: I might make today an exception from necromancy just so we could kill this bastard warlock again.
string: 我可能会把今天作为死灵法术的例外，好让我们再杀一次这个混蛋术士。

original: So much for the supernatural.
string: 超自然的东西到此为止了。

original: Oh wow! Ha ha ha ha! Wyndelius lost his mind over this claw, and the innkeeper just had it the whole time!
string: 哦，哇！哈哈哈哈哈！这只爪子让韦德留斯失去了理智，而客栈老板却一直拿着它！

original: I wouldn't mind if we just kicked in the door and started killing. I don't think Deep-Heart and his men are gonna be of much use.
string: 我不介意我们踢开门开始杀人。我觉得“深心”和他的手下没什么用。

original: We should keep in touch with Ysolda; she's goin' places.
string: 我们应该和伊索尔达保持联系，她要去很多地方。

original: Not a bad place to die, if you've got to.
string: 如果非死不可的话，死在这里也不错。

original: Ah, Oblivion... Falmer have been here. This looks bad.
string: 啊，湮灭…伐莫来过这里，看起来不妙。

original: I hope this family can rest peacefully now. I, on the other hand, will have nightmares for weeks.
string: 我希望这个家庭现在可以安息了。而我，则会做几个星期的噩梦。

original: These bandits picked a good location for highway robbery. I bet there's gold hidden around here somewhere.
string: 这些强盗选了一个好地方在路上抢劫。我打赌这附近一定藏着金子。

original: If you raise any of the dead, I'm gonna put you back where we found you.
string: 如果你复活了任何一个死人，我就把你送回我们发现你的地方。

original: Every time some guard told me to stay away from this place, I just wanted to find out what was even in here more, you know?
string: 每次有警卫叫我离这里远点，我就想再看看这里到底有什么？

original: If this is really Kvenel's Tomb, his ax Okin would be quite the prize! It's supposed to have been crafted by the legendary smith, Haman Forge-Fire.
string: 如果这里真的是基伏奈尔的坟墓，他的斧头奥金应该是一个不错的奖品！它应该是由传奇铁匠哈曼-锻火打造的。

original: Are we saving Skyrim out of the goodness of our hearts today, or is there a chance this might turn into a paying job?
string: 我们今天是出于好心拯救天际，还是有可能把它变成一份有报酬的工作？

original: I guess we can always loot the tomb after we send the dragon priest back to the afterlife.
string: 我想，在把龙祭司送回松加德之后，我们总能洗劫古墓吧。

original: Hey, it's true what they say: Two heads are better than one.
string: 嘿，俗话说得好： 两个臭皮匠顶个诸葛亮。

original: There are no heroes in the Reach. Fortune and glory, on the other hand... Well, let's put Red Eagle out of his misery and maybe they'll sing songs about us.
string: 瑞驰没有英雄。而财富和荣耀… 让我们把红鹰从痛苦中解救出来，也许他们会歌颂我们。

original: You notice 'Captain' Valmir didn't say whose war effort this was for? Or which general?
string: 你注意到“瓦尔米尔队长”没有说这是为谁而战吗？或者是哪位将军？

original: An Altmer in the service of Ulfric Stormcloak?
string: 一个为乌弗瑞克·风暴斗篷效命的傲尔特莫？

original: This is exactly why I want to be cremated.
string: 这正是我想要火葬的原因。

original: The Gauldur legend is real! Huh. We can pick up where Daynas Valen left off. Knowing he had a hundred year head start makes me feel a little better about hitting a dead end with my own research.
string: 高尔多传说是真的！哈。我们可以继续戴纳斯·瓦伦的研究了。知道他比我早了一百年，我对自己的研究陷入僵局的感觉好多了。

original: That amulet you found is connected to the Gauldur legend! I never thought we'd find it in Saarthal, but with the age of the city, it makes sense.
string: 你找到的护身符和高尔杜尔传说有关我从没想过我们会在萨尔塔尔找到它，但从这座城市的年代来看，它是有意义的。

original: That's really the Gauldur Amulet, restored to its original glory. C-can I hold it? I'll give it back, come on.
string: 那真的是高尔多的护身符，恢复了原来的光彩。能、能让我拿一下吗？我会还给你的，来吧。

original: Call it a hunch, but I trust Illia.
string: 你可以说这是直觉，但我相信伊雅。

original: The smoking ruins of Imperial property... I like it. I just wish I'd been invited.
string: 帝国财产的烟熏废墟......我很喜欢。我只是希望有人邀请我。

original: The draugr seem to have thinned out our competition.
string: 亡灵似乎已经削弱了我们的竞争对手。

original: I noticed an unopened chamber near the entrance. We should see what's in there before we leave.
string: 我注意到入口附近有一个未打开的房间。在离开之前,我们应该先看看里面有什么。

original: Call me by my name...
string: 叫我的名字…

original: Aelyn.
string: 艾琳。

original: Alannah.
string: 阿兰娜。

original: Aris.
string: 阿里斯。

original: Axarien.
string: 爱克斯瑞恩。

original: Axarien?! Oh, I can't do this! You're gonna need a nickname.
string: 爱克斯瑞恩？我不能这么做！你需要一个绰号。

original: One of my mother's friends is named Axarien, and I have some complicated feelings there which I will not be unpacking.
string: 我母亲的一个朋友叫阿克萨里安，我对她的感情很复杂，就不多说了。

original: Cyndrian.
string: 辛德里安。

original: Dahlia.
string: 达丽亚。

original: Elise.
string: 伊利丝。

original: Illia.
string: 伊利亚。

original: Inula.
string: 伊努拉。

original: Jacek.
string: 雅斯克。

original: Joseph.
string: 约瑟夫。

original: Krimson.
string: 克里姆森。

original: Oh no... Not you. Not you! You've been tormenting me ever since I left High Rock.
string: 哦，不…不是你。不是你！自从我离开高岩，你就一直在折磨我。

original: Wait... no, you can't be him. Don't tell me his shapeshifting nonsense is actually true. And yet you're gonna force me to call you Krimson the whole time, aren't you?
string: 等等…不，你不可能是他。别告诉我他的变形术是真的。你还想逼我一直叫你克里姆森，是不是？

original: Well NO. Sorry, but you're gonna have to pick a real name or a different one, and not one that spelled with a K when there should be a C there!
string: 不行。对不起，你得取个真名或另一个名字，而且不能在本该是 C 的地方拼成 K！

original: Maevynn.
string: 梅维恩。

original: Min.
string: 敏。

original: Myfanwy.
string: 米凡维。

original: Ren.
string: 仁

original: Ruby.
string: 鲁比。

original: Thelassia.
string: 瑟拉西亚。

original: Valerian.
string: 瓦雷利安。

original: (more choices)
string: （更多选择）

original: (previous choices)
string: （以前的选择）

original: I've always wanted to see the Shrine of Azura up close. I've seen it from the water, but of course, it's so much better in person!
string: 我一直想近距离看看阿祖拉祭坛。我从水上看到过它，当然，亲眼所见要好得多！

original: I hope you're wearing a water breathing enchantment. This place feels like it could sink at any moment.
string: 我希望你有水下呼吸魔法，这地方感觉随时都会沉下去。

original: What Malyn Varen did to those people was an abomination.
string: 马林·瓦伦对那些人的所作所为令人发指。

original: I keep having to restrain myself from petting Barbas like a dog. He looks so fuzzy...
string: 我一直在克制自己不要像抚摸狗一样抚摸巴巴斯。他看起来毛茸茸的…

original: I promise not to complain about necromancy... if you want to raise Sebastian Lort so we can kill him again.
string: 我保证不会抱怨死灵魔法…如果你想让赛巴斯蒂安·洛复活，我们就可以再杀他一次。

original: Ah, this is orc is one useless fetcher.
string: 啊，这个兽人真是个没用的混蛋。

original: Can we do something about the Beacon? I can still hear it from inside your backpack and it's gettin' annoying.
string: 我们能对信标做点什么吗？我还能从你的背包里听到，而且越来越烦了。

original: Meridia is pretty full of herself, but I can't fault the mission. Undeath is a curse.
string: 虽然梅瑞迪亚很自负，但这次的任务我也没意见。亡灵是一个诅咒。

original: It's tempting to think of Meridia as 'good' by our standards, but her light is unrelenting and unmerciful. It can destroy anyone who stands in it for too long.
string: 按照我们的标准，很容易把梅瑞迪亚想象成“好人”，但她的光芒是无情的、无情的。它能摧毁任何在其中伫立过久的人。

original: I'm not too proud to admit there was a time or two we ran low on rations at sea, and I would have eaten anything, possibly anyone... but I can't imagine liking it. Ugh.
string: 我不太愿意承认，有一两次我们在海上的口粮不够了，我什么都想吃，可能是任何人…但我无法想象我喜欢吃什么。唉。

original: Do you really want to go in there? Some people call Peryite the Lord of Bountiful Vomit. Bountiful. Vomit.
string: 你真的想进去吗？有些人称魄伊特为丰饶呕吐之王。丰饶。呕吐。

original: Ugh... smells like something died in here.
string: 呃…… 这里闻着像有东西烂在这儿了。

original: This reminds me of the night Fathis and I discovered Snail-Gin. Don't ask.
string: 这让我想起法提斯和我发现蜗牛杜松子酒的那个晚上。别问了。

original: Wait, do I know this woman? Why don't I know this woman? Did we ever talk about this first? How drunk were we?!
string: 等等，我认识这个女人吗？为什么我不认识她？我们先谈过这个吗？我们当时有多醉？

original: Wait, do I know this man? Why don't I know this man? Did we talk about this first? How drunk were we?!
string: 等等，我认识这个人吗？为什么我不认识这个人？我们先谈过这个吗？我们喝得有多醉？

original: As many nights as I celebrated Sanguine in my younger years, you manage to get the Prince himself with one drinking contest. Seems a little unfair!
string: 在我年轻的时候，有多少个夜晚我都在庆祝桑吉恩节，而你却只用一次饮酒比赛就搞定了魔神本人。似乎有点不公平。

original: I can't say that Silus was any great loss, but you shouldn't go around killing people just because some Daedric Prince told you to. Have some standards.
string: 我不能说希鲁斯的死有多大损失，但你不应该因为某个魔神的命令就到处去杀人，有点标准吧。

original: That one maid can't keep her eyes off you. I bet she'd give you the key.
string: 那个女仆总是盯着你看，我打赌她会把钥匙给你的。

original: I don't know what the maids are doing in here, but it's not cleaning.
string: 我不知道女佣们在这里干什么，但不是打扫卫生。

original: So help me, if you point that thing at me and turn me into a sweetroll, I will make sure you die of indigestion.
string: 帮帮我吧，如果你用那东西指着我，把我变成一个甜面包卷，我一定会让你消化不良而死。

original: What do you think I would taste like if I were turned into a sweetroll? It's only hypothetical, don't get any ideas.
string: 如果我变成了甜面包卷，你觉得会是什么味道？这只是假设，别想歪了。

original: Did I hear that right? That crazy n'wah was invoking Boethiah?
string: 我没听错吧？那个疯子尼瓦居然在召唤波耶西亚？！

original: There's strength to be found in Boethiah's teachings, but cult worship is another matter entirely. There's nothing to gain at that shrine.
string: 波耶西亚的教义中确有可取之力，但盲目崇拜就另当别论了。那座祭坛根本毫无价值。

original: So friends are that cheap to you, huh? I'd thought better of you.
string: 朋友对你来说就这么廉价？我还以为你更好呢。

original: I know Eyeballs back there is weird and Septimus makes less sense than a drunk Riekling, but don't rule this request out. There's a lot to be learned if you're careful.
string: 我知道眼球在后面很奇怪，塞普汀默斯也比喝醉的蓝客灵更没道理，但不要排除这个请求。只要你小心，就能学到很多东西。

original: Do you serve Hermaeus Mora?
string: 你为赫麦尤斯·莫拉服务吗？

original: I'm no one's servant. Bargaining with Daedra is a transaction, and yes, I've done it.
string: 我不是任何人的仆人，与迪德拉的谈判是一种交易，是的，我做过。

original: Isn't that dangerous?
string: 这不是很危险吗？

original: Of course it is. Anything worth doing has a risk.
string: 当然有风险。任何值得做的事都有风险。

original: I'm not going to help Daedra for any reason.
string: 我不会以任何理由帮助迪德拉的。

original: As long as you don't start lecturing me about it.
string: 只要你不对我说教就好。

original: Besides, fearing knowledge for it's own sake is like fearing a knife because you might cut yourself.
string: 此外，害怕知识本身就像害怕刀子一样，因为你可能会割伤自己。

original: I'll think about it.
string: 我会考虑的。

original: What's there to think about?
string: 还有什么可想的？

original: Fearing knowledge for its own sake is like fearing a knife because you might cut yourself.
string: 为了知识而害怕知识，就像害怕刀子一样，因为你可能会割伤自己。

original: I really want to know what's in that box.
string: 我真的很想知道盒子里装的是什么。

original: Daedra take me, I know right?
string: 迪德拉记住了我，我知道，对吧？

original: Fearing knowledge for it's own sake is like fearing a knife because you might cut yourself.
string: 为了知识而害怕知识，就像害怕刀子一样，因为你可能会割伤自己。

original: The appropriate reason for fear is what you might do with what you know. Or do in ignorance because of what you don't know.
string: 恐惧的适当理由是你可能会用你所知道的去做什么。或者因为不知道什么而无知地做什么。

original: What do you think we should do about Sinding?
string: 你觉得我们应该怎么处置辛丁？

original: If he were one of my sailors and he displayed that lack of control, I'd kill him. Toss his body overboard and sleep soundly. But we're not on my ship. So what do you want to do?
string: 如果他是我的水手，表现出这种缺乏控制的行为，我会杀了他。把他的尸体扔下船，然后安然入睡。但我们不在我的船上，那你想怎么做？

original: I'm going to do as Hircine asks.
string: 我要按海尔辛的要求去做。

original: Just be careful a moment of weakness doesn't turn you into the prey one day.
string: 小心一时的软弱不会让你有一天成为猎物。

original: I trust your judgement.
string: 我相信你的判断。

original: He deserves to die, but not because Hircine orders it.
string: 他死有余辜，但不是因为海尔辛的命令。

original: As long as it's your choice, and not what you think I or anyone else expects of you.
string: 只要这是你的选择，而不是你认为我或其他人对你的期望。

original: I trust your judgement.
string: 我相信你的判断。

original: He deserves a chance at redemption.
string: 他应该得到一个赎罪的机会。

original: Maybe. I'm not sure you can make up for some things.
string: 也许吧。我不确定你是否能弥补一些事情。

original: I trust your judgement.
string: 我相信你的判断。

original: I hope you aren't planning to do what Mephala wants.
string: 我希望你没打算按梅法拉的意思去做。

original: I thought you were in favor of bargaining with Daedra?
string: 我还以为你赞成与迪德拉交易呢？

original: With managed risk. Trading the blood of your allies to empower a sword that's technically a loan doesn't benefit you at all.
string: 风险可控。用盟友的鲜血来换取一把剑，从技术上说是贷款，对你一点好处都没有。

original: No, of course not.
string: 不，当然不是！

original: Good. It's a one-sided bargain anyway. The Daedra are beings of extremes, and they'll always push you to do the same.
string: 很好。反正这也是单方面的交易，迪德拉是极端的生物，他们总是会逼你做同样的事。

original: You pull enough threads out of yourself like that and eventually everything you are unravels.
string: 这样从自己身上扯出足够多的线头，最终关于你的一切都会解开。

original: You traded that man's soul for power? What made it yours to bargain with?
string: 你用那个人的灵魂换取了力量？是什么让它成为你交易的筹码？

original: I felt I had no choice.
string: 我觉得我别无选择。

original: There's always a choice. You-! ...You exist by your force of will.
string: 总有选择 你--！…你的存在靠的是你的意志力。

original: He was weak and I was strong.
string: 他是弱者，而我是强者。

original: That's how you want to live your life? A boot on the neck of anyone you can keep down?
string: 这就是你想要的生活方式？把靴子套在你能压住的人的脖子上？

original: I can't talk to you about this right now, no. Not after what Fathis went through.
string: 我现在不能跟你谈这个，不行。在法提斯经历了那样的事之后。

original: I can't talk to you about this right now.
string: 我现在没空跟你谈这个。

original: Erandur is clearly hiding something. You see that, right?
string: 伊兰杜尔显然有所隐瞒，你看到了吧？

original: He's a priest of Mara. We can trust him.
string: 他是玛拉的祭司，我们可以信任他。

original: Sigh. Even if he does have the best of intentions, our ignorance of the situation could get us killed.
string: 唉。即使他是出于好意，我们对情况的无知也会害死我们。

original: Of course he is, but I want to stop the nightmares.
string: 他当然是，但我想让噩梦停止。

original: All right. Just keep your guard up though. There could be anything in there.
string: 好吧，保持警惕。里面可能有任何东西。

original: We can always kill him later.
string: 我们可以稍后再杀了他。

original: Heh, I like your style!
string: 呵，我喜欢你的风格！

original: I like your style...
string: 我喜欢你的风格…

original: Hunh, Vilkas... another overrated, arrogant sellsword.
string: 哼，威尔卡斯…又是一个被高估了的傲慢的卖弄者。

original: Do you think Eorlund Gray-Mane would ever let me use the Skyforge?
string: 你觉得厄伦德·灰鬃会让我使用天空熔炉吗？

original: I'm sorry about Skjor. I know all the Companions looked up to him.
string: 斯科月的事我很抱歉。我知道盾友们都很尊敬他。

original: Aela's smart to send you after the Silver Hand directly. The best defense is a good offense.
string: 艾拉派你直接去找白银之手是明智之举。进攻就是最好的防守。

original: I feel like we've been called to the headmaster's office.
string: 我觉得我们好像被叫到校长办公室去了。

original: We should kill all the witches while we're here. No sense in leaving an enemy at your back.
string: 我们应该趁现在杀光所有女巫。留下一个敌人在你背后是没有意义的。

original: Kodlak really held this band of hotheads together, huh? I admire him for that. Revenge won't bring him back, but it might make you feel better.
string: 克拉科真的把这帮头脑发热的人团结在一起了？我很佩服他，复仇不会让他起死回生，但也许能让你感觉好点。

original: I see Vilkas is finally done pretending to be what he's not. I kinda like it.
string: 看来威尔卡斯终于不再装模作样了。我挺喜欢的。

original: I wonder how and when the Silver Hand learned that the Companions are werewolves. The level of brutality here? It feels personal.
string: 我想知道银手是如何以及何时得知战友团是狼人的。残忍的拷问？我感觉像是私人恩怨。

original: To be fair to Farkas, there is an egregious number of spiders here.
string: 为法卡斯说句公道话，这里的蜘蛛数量多得惊人。

original: Six months ago, if you'd told me I'd be instructing the Companions on the finer points of dragon slaying, I'd ask where you managed to find skooma that strong. But here we are!
string: 六个月前，如果你告诉我，我会指导战友团如何屠龙，我会问你在哪里可以找到作用这么强的斯库玛。但我们在这里！

original: If Hircine blesses you with any more abilities, even I might be a little scared of you.
string: 如果海尔辛再赐予你任何能力，可能连我都有点怕你了。

original: If Hircine blesses you with any more abilities, I might be a little scared of you... aaand I think I now realize I'm kinda into that.
string: 如果海尔辛再赐予你任何能力，我可能会有点怕你…啊，我想我现在意识到我有点喜欢这个了。

original: About the Companions...
string: 关于战友团…

original: Yeah? What about them?
string: 是吗？那他们呢？

original: How do you think your swordsmanship compares to Vilkas or Farkas?
string: 你认为你的剑术与威尔卡斯或法卡斯相比如何？

original: I've a few tricks up my sleeve, but men like those two? If you have any sense you kill them in their sleep or when they're drunk. Fair fights are overrated.
string: 我有一些小把戏，但像他们两个这样的男人？如果你还有点理智，就趁他们睡着或喝醉的时候杀了他们，和他们公平对决不可能。

original: What's your problem with Vilkas?
string: 你对威尔卡斯有什么意见？

original: His problem is that he uses lycanthropy as an excuse to avoid dealing with his character flaws. I'll give him the credit though for acknowledging he's in this for the money.
string: 他的问题在于，他用“狼化”作为借口，逃避面对自己的性格缺陷。不过我还是要赞扬他，因为他承认自己是为了钱。

original: You're so insightful when analyzing someone else's shortcomings.
string: 你在分析别人的缺点时，真是太有洞察力了。

original: I'm aware of my own flaws. I just choose to ignore them. There's a difference.
string: 我知道自己的缺点。我只是选择忽视它们。这是有区别的。

original: That's unfair. We all have our struggles.
string: 这是不公平的。我们都有自己的挣扎。

original: Yeah he 'struggles' with the beast blood because it suits him to. If he wasn't a werewolf, he'd have to confront the fact that his anger management issues are his own fault.
string: 是的，他与兽血斗争是因为这适合他。如果他不是狼人，他就不得不面对这样一个事实：他的愤怒和失控是他自己的错。

original: About the Dark Brotherhood...
string: 关于黑暗兄弟会…

original: Strange to be doing jobs for the Dark Brotherhood rather than fend them off like usual.
string: 为黑暗兄弟会做事，而不是像往常一样抵御他们，这很奇怪。

original: You've had the Dark Brotherhood sent after you?
string: 黑暗兄弟会派人来追杀你了？

original: I tend to have a polarizing effect on people.
string: 我对人的影响往往是两极分化的。

original: Will you join the Legion with me?
string: 你愿意和我一起加入军团吗？

original: No. In case you haven't noticed, I don't follow orders. I take suggestions. I will however, fight at your side.
string: 不，如果你没注意到，我不服从命令。我接受建议，但我会和你并肩作战。

original: Will you join the Stormcloaks with me?
string: 你愿意和我一起加入风暴斗篷吗？

original: No. In case you haven't noticed, I don't follow orders. I take suggestions. I will however, fight at your side.
string: 不，如果你没注意到，我不服从命令。我接受建议，但我会和你并肩作战。

original: Why fight at all if you don't believe in the cause?
string: 如果你不相信自己的事业，为什么还要战斗呢？

original: Because I believe in you.
string: 因为我信任你。

original: I'm fighting for you, not the Empire.
string: 我是为你而战，不是为帝国而战。

original: Because I believe in you.
string: 因为我信任你。

original: I'm fighting for you, not for Ulfric.
string: 我是为你而战，而不是为乌弗瑞克。

original: What's wrong with serving the Empire?
string: 为帝国服务有什么不好？

original: I don't have anything against the Empire, really. 'Better the Daedra you know,' as the saying goes.
string: 我并不反对帝国，真的。俗话说得好，“最好是你认识的迪德拉”。

original: The Thalmor are no friend to anyone but themselves, and none of the provinces can stand against them alone.
string: 除了他们自己，梭默人不与任何人为友，没有一个行省能单独对抗他们。

original: But I'm no soldier. I'm too used to calling my own shots.
string: 但我不是军人，我太习惯自己发号施令了。

original: What do you have against Ulfric?
string: 你对乌弗瑞克有什么不满？

original: Oh, other than him being an egotistical, short-sighted racist, you mean?
string: 哦，你是说除了他是个自负、目光短浅的种族主义者之外？

original: Oh, for all its faults, a united Empire is our probably our best bet of defeating the Aldmeri Dominion. See, Talos worship being banned was a meaningless, short-term concession that bought the Empire time.
string: 哦，虽然帝国有很多缺点，但一个团结的帝国可能是我们打败先祖神州的最好赌注。塔洛斯崇拜被禁只是一个毫无意义的短期让步，为帝国赢得了时间。

original: Ulfric was a fool to make it a real issue after Markarth.
string: 乌弗瑞克太蠢了，在马卡斯之后还把这事当真。

original: Furthermore, he could have easily just had High King Torygg in his pocket with a little tact and a little subtlety. His strategy is flawed, and this civil war only benefits the Thalmor.
string: 此外，他本可以略施小计，巧妙地将托依格国王控制在手里。他的战略是有缺陷的，这场内战只对梭默有利。

original: I'll do everything I can to deserve your trust in me, Val.
string: 我会尽我所能，不辜负你对我的信任，瓦尔。

original: All right, all right. Don't you have someone to salute or something?
string: 好了，好了。你没有人向你敬礼吗？

original: I hope I can prove you wrong about the Stormcloaks, Val. Thank you for trusting me.
string: 我希望我能证明你对风暴斗篷的看法是错的，瓦尔。谢谢你信任我。

original: All right, all right. Don't you have someone to salute or something?
string: 好了，好了。你没有人向你敬礼吗？

original: I've heard of Arkngthamz. I never did get serious about researching it, but I've always wanted to. We should check it out.
string: 我听说过阿肯塔兹。我从没认真研究过它，但我一直想研究。我们应该去看看。

original: Katria kept good notes. She certainly knew her stuff.
string: 卡提雅的笔记做得很好。她确实很在行。

original: We have to find the other pieces! I can't imagine stopping now. This is an incredible discovery.
string: 我们得找到其他碎片！我无法想象现在就停下来。这真是个惊人的发现。

original: Two shards down, two to go.
string: 两个碎片，还剩两个。

original: That's all of the shards. Location five on Katria's map is the only place we haven't been, so presumably the Forge is there.
string: 这就是所有的碎片。卡提雅地图上的第五个位置是我们唯一没去过的地方，所以锻造场应该就在那里。

original: Ah, a crown for my queen. It looks good on you.
string: 啊，给我的女王戴上皇冠，你戴着很好看。

original: Ah, a crown for my queen. It looks good on you.
string: 啊，给我的女王戴上皇冠，你戴着很好看。

original: Ah, a crown for my queen. It looks good on you.
string: 啊，给我的女王戴上皇冠，你戴着很好看。

original: Ah, a crown for my king. It certainly looks good on you.
string: 啊，给我的国王一顶王冠。你戴着真好看。

original: Ah, a crown for my king. It certainly looks good on you.
string: 啊，给我的国王一顶王冠。你戴着真好看。

original: Ah, a crown for my king. It certainly looks good on you.
string: 啊，给我的国王一顶王冠。你戴着真好看。

original: A crown for my majesty. It certainly looks good on you.
string: 给陛下戴上皇冠，你戴着真好看。

original: Hey, don't think that crown makes you the boss of me. Even if it does look good on you.
string: 嘿，别以为戴上皇冠你就能做我的老大。就算你戴着好看。

original: I wonder how that staff works? A modified Conjuration spell maybe? Hm, but if that's the case, where do the constructs come from, though?
string: 我想知道那根法杖是如何工作的？也许是一个改良的施法咒语？嗯，但如果是这样的话，这些构造物又是从哪里来的呢？

original: What happens if you drop the shield? The floor doesn't become ethereal. There must be a practical size limit... we should experiment.
string: 如果丢掉盾牌会怎样？地板不会变得虚无缥缈。一定有一个实际的尺寸限制…我们应该做个实验。

original: Hey, before you look too hard for a heart stone, come talk to me.
string: 嘿，在你苦苦寻找心石之前，先来跟我谈谈。

original: Hey, before you look too hard for a heart stone, come talk to me.
string: 嘿，在你苦苦寻找心石之前，先来跟我谈谈。

original: We're killing this fetcher Mogrul, right? Just say the word.
string: 我们要杀了这个混蛋墨古，对吧？只要你开口。

original: I'm co-owner of Severin Manor, with you right? It's only fair. Yeah, I'll consider myself an owner.
string: 我和你是塞维林庄园的共同所有人，对吧？这样才公平。我会把自己当成主人的。

original: I can't wait to see what we find in there. If I had a coin for every time I've profited by the East Empire Company's coverups- oh wait! Heh, I do!
string: 我迫不及待地想知道我们在里面找到了什么。如果每次我都能从东帝国公司的掩饰中获利，我就能得到一枚硬币--哦，等等！嘿，我知道！

original: You should get Ralis to pay for mercenaries. I've never seen a Nordic ruin without draugr.
string: 你应该让雷利思出钱雇雇佣兵。我从未见过没有尸鬼的诺德废墟。

original: Ralis is probably skimming funds or he'd have hired competent guards. You want something done right, you have to do it yourself.
string: 雷利思可能是在揩油，否则他早就雇了称职的警卫。你想把事情做好，就得自己动手。

original: Where in Oblivion is Ralis?!
string: 湮灭中的雷利思在哪里？

original: Ralis was a damned fool, but I've never seen enchantments like the ones on Ahzidal's relics. An adventure to tell stories about, right? I wonder if Neloth would pay us for this stuff?
string: 雷利思是个该死的傻瓜，但我从没见过阿兹达尔遗物上的魔法。这是一次可以讲故事的冒险，对吧？不知道内洛斯会不会付钱给我们？

original: Neloth is starting to grow on me. If no one you've met wants you dead, are you really having any fun with your life?
string: 我开始喜欢内洛斯了，如果你见过的人都不想你死，你的生活真的有乐趣吗？

original: A Serano in House Telvani... I'm... actually speechless.
string: 泰瓦尼家族的塞拉诺人… 我…真的无言以对。

original: Are you sure sober and alert guards are in our best interests?
string: 你确定清醒且警觉的警卫符合我们的最大利益吗？

original: Sigh. We should put the General out of his misery.
string: 我们应该给将军一个解脱。

original: This guy looks tougher than the rocks the fort's made of. I do not recommend fighting him head-on.
string: 这家伙看起来比堡垒的岩石还坚硬。我不建议与他正面交锋。

original: Take a bunch of Rieklings... Get 'em high on scathecraw... What could go wrong?
string: 带上一群蓝客灵… 让他们嗑药… 能出什么问题？

original: Bujold ought to stop berating her people and start inspiring them. I wouldn't follow her into battle, either.
string: 布娇应该停止斥责她的人民，开始激励他们。我也不会跟着她上战场。

original: What? You're a chief of a Riekling tribe now?! Ah- Argh! Phooo... Okay. Don't come crying to me about this pack of miscreants causing you trouble later.
string: 你现在是蓝客灵部落的酋长了？好吧。以后别来找我哭诉这群恶棍给你带来了麻烦。

original: No matter how he ended up lost, the Skaal blacksmith owing us a favor will be useful. Heh, I've never even seen forged stalhrim that wasn't ancient.
string: 不管他最后是怎么死的，斯卡尔铁匠欠我们的人情还是有用的。嘿，我还从没见过不是古代锻造的魔冰呢。

original: Not a lot of fight in this guy, is there? Hopefully he's just more scared than hurt.
string: 这家伙没什么战斗力，对吧？希望他只是害怕而不是受伤。

original: You might want to hide that amulet before someone spots it.
string: 你最好把护身符藏起来，免得被人发现。

original: I hate talking to these arrogant bastards. Just don't mention Talos and we should be fine. Should be.
string: 我讨厌和这些傲慢的混蛋说话。只要别提塔洛斯，我们会没事的。应该是这样。

original: A few Riekling heads mounted on the spears would be a nice addition. You know, really make that warning obvious.
string: 在长矛上装几个蓝客灵的头颅会是一个不错的装饰。要知道，这样才能让警告更加明显。

original: I like Tharstan. I hope I'm still out there exploring ruins when I'm his age. We should help him.
string: 我喜欢沙尔斯坦，希望我到他这把年纪还能去探索废墟，我们应该帮助他。

original: Can I wear the Deathbrand armor for a bit? No? Oh come on, you know I was really excited about it. Seriously, no? ...Ugh... Rude.
string: 我能穿一下死亡烙印盔甲吗？不行吗？哦，不，你知道我真的很兴奋。说真的，不行？真无礼。

original: So this is Death-Brand's tomb... I wonder if he has any fight left in him?
string: 所以这就是死亡印记的坟墓......我想知道他是否还有战斗力?

original: They're here again, aren't they?
string: 他们又来了，是吗？

original: What happened to you, Serano? You were feared across the high seas, once! Now look at you... playing follow the leader with a pack of blue dumpster goblins!
string: 你怎么了，塞拉诺？你曾经在公海上令人畏惧！现在看看你。 和一群蓝色的垃圾地精玩追随领袖的游戏！

original: It's not right for the tomb to be in this condition.
string: 古墓变成这样是不对的。

original: If this miner wants to drink herself to death, that's her business... But maybe it'd be better if she felt the consequences of her actions on this one?
string: 如果这个矿工想喝死自己，那是她的事… 但如果她能感受到自己行为的后果，也许会更好？

original: I know what it's like not to fit in. It's sad Torkild couldn't find a middle ground between the Skaal way and losing himself to Hircine.
string: 我知道不合群的感觉。托基尔德没能在斯卡尔的方式和迷失自我的海尔辛之间找到一个平衡点，真是可悲。

original: I'm not sure what all this fuss is about. This folio is nothing compared to the Lessons of Vivec, Sermon Fourteen.
string: 我不知道这有什么好大惊小怪的。这对开本和维威克的第14课相比，简直是小巫见大巫。

original: I'll be damned; Glover did manage to retire. Do you think there's hope for me? Heh heh. Nevermind, don't answer that.
string: 我真该死，葛罗文确实退休了。你觉得我还有希望吗？嘿嘿。算了，别回答了。

original: Those East Empire Company pendants are worth money? Damnit, I had a pile of them at one point!
string: 那些东帝国公司的吊坠值钱？该死的，我曾经有一大堆！

original: Be careful with that netch jelly; it can cause paralysis.
string: 小心那种网状果冻;它会导致麻痹。

original: I'll say this for the Skaal, they do value family. Morwen must dearly miss her parents.
string: 我会这么说,Skaal 确实重视家庭。Morwen 必定非常想念她的父母。

original: Edla reminds me a little too much of my mother. Nikulas should get out of this backwater village while he still has the chance.
string: 艾迪拉有点像我的妈妈。尼古拉斯应该趁还来得及时离开这座落后的村庄。

original: I guess 'one-ness with the land' means hiring someone else to deal with your bandit problems. Pht. The Skaal could stand to learn a few things from Boethiah.
string: 我猜‘与土地合一’意味着雇人来处理你的土匪问题。Pht,Skaal 也可以向 Boethiah 学习几招。

original: Normally I don't mind spiders, but these things are weird.
string: 通常我不介意蜘蛛,但这些东西很怪异。

original: 'Mind control spiders' is going right up there with 'mammoth-sized chaurus' on my nightmares list.
string: ‘心灵控制蜘蛛’已经和‘猛犸大小的查鲁斯’一起登上了我的噩梦清单。

original: Whatever you do, we are not telling Fathis about the spider transmutation machine. That- and I cannot stress this enough - will not end well.
string: 无论你怎么做,我们都不要告诉法提斯蜘蛛转化机的事。这点——我再强调一次——不会有好结果。

original: There's no doubt that Neloth is ambitious. But, I don't think he's aware that he's as much the fool when it comes to Hermaeus Mora.
string: 毫无疑问内洛斯有雄心。但我不认为他意识到自己在赫麦尤斯·莫拉面前同样是个傻瓜。

original: This darkness can kill and light spells don't help much. Move quickly.
string: 这片黑暗会致命,光法术也帮不上大忙。快点行动吧。

original: Keep a weather eye open. Lurkers hide in the fog or submerge underwater.
string: 保持警惕。深潜者藏身雾中或潜入水下。

original: Why name a Black Book about a talent for writing letters? Maybe it's about writing journals? Argh, it's maddening trying to make sense of it.
string: 为什么要给一本关于写信天赋的《黑书》起名?难道是关于写日记吗?呃,试图理解它真让人抓狂。

original: Did you notice this Book mentioned Ysgramor? Heh, I wonder if the Companions have the courage to come in here... Aela probably does. Not sure about the brothers.
string: 你注意到这本书提到了伊斯格拉莫吗?呵,我想知道同伴们是否有勇气进来......艾拉可能会。至于兄弟们就不确定了。

original: I wonder what Neloth wanted in here?
string: 我想知道尼洛斯在这里想要什么?

original: Azra Nightwielder's shadow magic seems more interesting than collecting old staffs, but as long as Neloth's willing to pay I'm willing to hunt relics!
string: “暗夜掌控者”阿兹拉的阴影魔法看起来比收集旧法杖更有趣,但只要内洛斯愿意付费,我就愿意去猎取遗物!

original: Hey. If I pickpocket the seed from a Briarheart, will that count for Neloth's experiments? I really want to see if I can do it.
string: 嘿。如果我从荆棘之心偷走种子,那会算作尼洛斯的实验吗?我真的想看看能不能做到。

original: Hrmph, that new stalhrim armor will look great on Kuvar while he's sitting on his ass at the mead hall.
string: 哼,那件新的魔冰盔甲在库瓦尔坐在酒馆里时看起来很棒。

original: Fetching mead from Thirsk might seem like misplaced priorities, but it's important to keep up morale.
string: 去提尔斯克取麦芽可能看似优先级不对,但保持士气很重要。

original: Studying a sample of the ash spawn should help us learn how to conjure them. Heh, maybe even Talvas can figure it out!
string: 研究灰烬孢子的样本应该能帮助我们学习如何召唤它们。呵,也许塔尔瓦斯也能搞清楚!

original: Whatever that steward job pays, Neloth probably needs to double it.
string: 无论那份管家工作报酬多少,内洛斯可能需要把工资翻倍。

original: I never imagined that growing mushrooms could be useful for property management.
string: 我从未想过种蘑菇可以用于物业管理。

original: At least our alchemy shopping list is more interesting than picking flowers.
string: 至少我们的炼金术购物清单比采花更有趣。

original: That doesn't look like any skull I've ever seen. I wonder what it's from? Some kind of giant frost troll, maybe?
string: 那看起来不像我见过的任何头骨。我想知道它来自哪里?也许是某种巨型霜土人吗?

original: (laughs) Long live the King of Rieklings.
string: (笑)愿瑞克林王永存。

original: (laughs) Long live the Queen of Rieklings.
string: (笑)愿瑞克林女王永存。

original: At least the Companions keep things civilized. I hope you're not thinking of moving in here.
string: 至少伙伴们保持了文明。我希望你不是打算搬进来。

original: I can't imagine why anyone would live in frozen cave.
string: 我无法想象有人会住在冰冻的洞穴里。

original: There's a peace on the open water you can't find anywhere else. Ask me any time you want to go sailing.
string: 在开阔的水面上，有一种其他地方找不到的宁静。想出海的话，随时问我。

original: Wait until you feel the wind in your hair on the open water. It's a feeling of peace I can't describe. I'll take you sailing any time you like.
string: 等到你在开阔的水面上感受到风吹动你的头发。那种平静的感觉，我无法形容。我随时都可以带你去出海。

original: Urgh. That's cozy.
string: 太舒服了。

original: I won't lie, I want that Deathbrand armor.
string: 不瞒你说，我想要那件死亡烙印盔甲。

original: Aren't you worried about the curse?
string: 你不担心那个诅咒吗？

original: Not in the slightest. It seems unlikely that curse could have any teeth by now anyway, even if Haknir Death-Brand did bargain with Mehrunes Dagon the way the legends say.
string: 丝毫不会。即使海科尼尔·死印真的像传说中的那样与梅鲁涅斯·大衮达成了交易，现在看来诅咒也不可能有任何残留了。

original: Are you ready to help Councilor Arano?
string: 你准备好帮助阿拉诺议员了吗？

original: Maybe. I'm not sure about us getting involved in Great House politics.
string: 也许吧。我不确定我们是否该参与大家族的政治。

original: It's the right thing to do.
string: 这样做是正确的。

original: Well now I feel guilty. No, wait... it's gone.
string: 现在我感到内疚了。不，等等…它不见了。

original: Come on, you know outwitting assassins will be fun!
string: 来吧，你知道智斗刺客会很有趣的！

original: You do know how to show a guy a good time. All right, let's go.
string: 你确实知道如何让男人开心。好了，我们走吧。

original: No risk, no reward!
string: 没有风险，就没有回报！

original: How big a reward are we talkin'?
string: 我们说的赏金是多少？

original: Ah, it's all fun and games until we're watching our backs for the Morag Tong for the rest of our lives, though.
string: 啊，这都是有趣的游戏，虽然我们下半辈子都要提防莫拉格堂了。

original: Ralis' excavation is getting expensive.
string: 雷利思的挖掘费用越来越高。

original: We've come this far. Let me help out.
string: 我们已经走到这一步了。让我来帮忙。

original: Since we're in Solstheim, I did a little research. Have a read.
string: 既然我们在索瑟姆，我做了一点调查。读一下。

original: I wouldn't mind seeing if there's any truth to this legend.
string: 我倒是想看看这个传说是否真实。

original: Brynjolf wants me to help him.
string: 布林约夫想要我帮他。

original: Interesting. Hm. He's either recruiting or looking to blackmail you.
string: 有意思。嗯。他不是在招募人手，就是想敲诈你。

original: What are you talking about?
string: 你到底在说些什么？

original: Well isn't it obvious? Heh. I don't want to spoil the fun.
string: 这不是很明显吗？哈。我不想扫大家的兴。

original: They sure aren't going to let me into the Thieves Guild for my charitable work.
string: 他们肯定不会因为我做善事就让我加入盗贼公会的。

original: Ha ha ha, fair enough. I'll pay your bounty if you get caught.
string: 哈哈哈，有道理。如果你被抓住了，我会付你的赏金的。

original: I'm not getting involved in any of this!
string: 我不会卷入这些事的！

original: Sigh, you're gonna put me into an early grave because of sheer boredom.
string: 唉，你会让我因为无聊而早早进入坟墓的。

original: Visitor's tax my ass...
string: 游客税个屁…

original: You're embarassing me. I was doing jobs like this for fun when I was nine.
string: 你让我很难堪。我九岁的时候也干过这样的活儿。

original: Yeah... do what you need to do, but I'll be glad when we're done wasting our time on small-time shopkeeps and Brynjolf gives you one of the real jobs.
string: 是啊…做你该做的吧，但如果我们不再把时间浪费在小店主身上，且布林约夫给你一份真正的工作时，我会很高兴的。

original: Hey, what do you think causes a man like Aringoth to suddenly grow a spine after years of complying with the Thieves Guild's demands?
string: 嘿，你觉得是什么原因让阿林格斯这样的人在多年来一直顺从盗贼公会的要求之后突然变得有骨气了呢？

original: Keep your eyes open. These warehouses always have smuggling routes hidden somewhere.
string: 睁大眼睛。这些仓库里总是藏着走私路线。

original: We need to talk before you go meet up with Mercer.
string: 在你去见墨瑟之前，我们得谈谈。

original: Hey, while we're here? Let's grab somethin' interesting.
string: 嘿，既然我们来了？我们去找点有趣的东西吧。

original: I never thought I'd say this, but Brynjolf is the only one around here with a level head. Best let him handle things.
string: 我从没想过我会这么说，但布林约尔夫是这里唯一头脑清醒的人。最好让他来处理。

original: Hold on. Vex slept with that guy?! Eh, I probably shouldn't judge.
string: 等一等。维克斯和那家伙上床了？！呃，我不应该妄下定论。

original: Well that's a decent map of the East Empire Company's shipping routes. Though I could probably draw a better one from memory.
string: 这是一张像样的东帝国公司航线图。不过我凭记忆还能画个更好的。

original: Hey. Talk to me when you get a moment.
string: 嘿。有空的时候跟我聊聊。

original: Whoever wants these journals is a sick bastard! To Oblivion with the reward. We should burn the books... and Arondil, too.
string: 想要这些日记的人都是变态的混蛋！带着赏金去湮灭吧！我们应该烧了这些书…还有阿荣迪尔。

original: So, we're gonna be stealing to help out an 'honest' tradesman. How noble of us!
string: 所以,我们要去偷东西帮助一个“诚实”的商人。这多么高尚啊!

original: Look at this mess. You'll never see the Dark Rose in this state, that's for sure.
string: 看看这堆乱七八糟的东西。你永远不会看到黑玫瑰处于这种状态,没错。

original: Taking out a rival operation... now this brings back memories. It's just not the same without sinking a few ships, though.
string: 消灭竞争对手...现在这让我想起了往事。但没有沉船的话就不一样了。

original: Captain Volf should have gotten some dirt on that Erikur asshole before backing out of a deal. Hrmph. Lazy s'wit.
string: 沃尔夫船长在退出交易之前应该先搞到那个混蛋艾瑞库尔的底细 。哼 。懒鬼。

original: I wonder who Arn killed? Must have been someone important, or you'd think Battle-Born would have just paid his bounty.
string: 我想知道阿恩杀了谁？一定是个重要人物，不然你以为战狂的人会把他的赏金付了。

original: Who manages to sink a rowboat in a lake?! Vald sounds worse than useless. Maven let him off easy if you ask me.
string: 谁能把小船沉到湖里？ 瓦尔德听起来比废物还废物  要我说，是玛雯让他轻易脱身的。

original: About Mercer...
string: 关于墨瑟…

original: Yeah, Mercer's explanation of Karliah's motivations makes no sense. No one spends twenty-five years planning revenge over money. They do that over blood. Mercer, or the Guild, did something personal to her.
string: 是啊，墨瑟对卡莉亚动机的解释毫无道理。没有人会花二十五年的时间为了钱而计划复仇，他们用鲜血来复仇，墨瑟或公会对她做了一些私事。

original: I have no reason to doubt Mercer.
string: 我没理由怀疑墨瑟。

original: Yes, but we also don't have all the information. That makes this situation difficult to predict.
string: 对，但我们也不知道所有的信息。因此，这种情况很难预测。

original: It's obviously a trap. We'll be ready.
string: 这显然是个陷阱。我们会做好准备的。

original: Just don't expect Mercer to have your back.
string: 只是别指望墨瑟会支持你。

original: We can always kill someone later.
string: 我们可以以后再杀人。

original: Well don't you just say the sweetest things to me.
string: 你对我说的话真好听啊。

original: Ah, thank Azura you're alive!
string: 啊，感谢阿祖拉，你还活着！

original: Mercer shut the door on my face. He's full of shit about them being easy to open without a claw. He must have slipped past me on his way out. Sigh... I'm so sorry.
string: 墨瑟当着我的面把门关上了。他说什么不用爪子就能轻松打开的屁话，他一定是出去的时候从我身边溜走了。唉… 真对不起。

original: It's okay. I'm all right.
string: 没事了。我没事。

original: Look, I- ...sigh... I still feel like I let you down. I- ah, I just don't know what I'd do without you.
string: 听着，我…叹…我还是觉得让你失望了，我-我不知道没有你我该怎么办。

original: Ah, I'm just glad Karliah's on our side.
string: 啊，很高兴卡莉亚站在我们这边。

original: I- sigh... I still feel like I let you down. I just, I don't know what I'd do without you.
string: 我…叹…我还是觉得我让你失望了。我只是不知道没有你我该怎么办。

original: I'm just glad Karliah's on our side.
string: 我很高兴卡莉亚是站在我们这边的。

original: Don't worry about it. Mercer got the drop on me, too.
string: 别担心。墨瑟也把我甩了。

original: Damn, I still feel terrible about it. How in Oblivion did Mercer manage it?
string: 妈的，我还是觉得很糟糕。墨瑟是怎么做到的？

original: I'm just glad Karliah turned out to be on our side.
string: 我很高兴卡莉亚最后站在了我们这边。

original: I'll add it to your tab.
string: 我会把它记在你的账上。

original: Hey! I carried your ass out of that ruin, I'll have you know.
string: 嘿！是我把你从废墟里救出来的，我会让你知道的。

original: I'm just glad Karliah turned out to be on our side.
string: 我很高兴卡莉亚最后站在了我们这边。

original: Looks like Karliah managed to bring two souls to Nocturnal in exchange for getting Mercer out of her way. I think she got the better of you and Brynjolf. You okay?
string: 看来卡莉亚成功地给诺克图娜尔带来了两个灵魂，作为交换，她让默瑟离开了。我觉得她打败了你和布伦约夫。你还好吧？

original: My soul belongs to Akatosh.
string: 我的灵魂属于阿卡托什。

original: Ha ha ha... I knew you had the true heart of a dragon, love!
string: 哈哈哈… 我就知道你有一颗真龙之心，亲爱的！

original: Ah, I knew you had the true heart of a dragon, my friend.
string: 啊，我就知道你有一颗真龙之心，我的朋友。

original: Nocturnal will have to get in line behind Hircine.
string: 夜行者得排在海尔辛后面。

original: I'm sure you'll have a 'sporting' chance. Good luck!
string: 我相信你会有一个“竞技”的机会。祝你好运！

original: Lucky for me I'm immortal.
string: 幸好我是不死之身。

original: I keep forgetting, yeah... I guess I prefer not to think about it.
string: 我总是忘记，是啊…我想我宁愿不去想它。

original: I'm sure I'll find a loophole.
string: 我肯定会找到漏洞的。

original: Now that's the spirit!
string: 这才对！

original: I'm actually happy to be a Nightingale.
string: 我很高兴能成为夜莺。

original: I'm surprised. Forever is a long time in the shadows.
string: 我很惊讶。永远在阴影中是很长的时间。

original: To be honest, I've lost count of how many times I've promised my soul to Daedric Princes.
string: 说实话，我已经记不清有多少次我把灵魂许诺给迪德拉君王了。

original: Ah, joke's on them! At least your afterlife won't be boring.
string: 啊，开玩笑的！至少你死后不会无聊。

original: Do you want to join the Thieves Guild?
string: 你想加入盗贼公会吗？

original: No thanks. I'll make my own luck.
string: 不，谢谢。我要自己创造运气。

original: About the Thieves Guild...
string: 关于盗贼公会…

original: I used to worry that I'd lose my edge if I ever let my guard down. You know, end up like Gallus.
string: 我曾担心如果放松警惕,我会失去锋芒。你懂的,最终像加卢斯那样。

original: Turns out I was just hanging around the wrong kind of people. I'm glad we met.
string: 原来我只是和错误类型的人在一起。我很高兴我们相遇。

original: Congratulations on becoming the Guild Master. Reminds me of the days I became the captain of the Rose. There's nothing quite like the freedom to run your own outfit.
string: 恭喜你成为公会会长。让我想起了当黑玫瑰号船长的日子。没有什么比经营自己的势力更自由的了。

original: Get rich or die trying, love.
string: 要么发财，要么死在尝试中，亲爱的。

original: Congratulations on becoming the Guild Master. Reminds me of the days I became the captain of the Rose. There's nothing quite like the freedom to run your own outfit.
string: 恭喜你成为公会会长。让我想起了当黑玫瑰号船长的日子。没有什么比经营自己的势力更自由的了。

original: Get rich or die trying, my friend.
string: 要么发财，要么死，我的朋友。

original: I wish I had known Gallus. I wonder if we could have been friends?
string: 要是认识加卢斯就好了。我想知道我们能不能成为朋友？

original: About Gallus Desidenius...
string: 关于加卢斯·迪赛德里尤斯…

original: I'd always wanted to meet Maven Black-Briar and see if she lived up to her reputation.
string: 我一直想见见玛雯·黑荆棘。看看她是否名不虚传。

original: About Maven Black-Briar...
string: 关于玛雯·黑荆棘…

original: I don't like the cut of Mercer's jib.
string: 我不喜欢墨瑟的言谈举止。

original: About Mercer...
string: 关于墨瑟…

original: Brynjolf's con-man routine in the market is pretty good. I'm not sure I could have done better.
string: 布林约夫在市场上的骗术表演相当不错。我不知道我能不能做得更好。

original: Grifting can be fun and all, but real money? That requires more planning and higher risk.
string: 偷窃可以很有趣，但真金白银？这需要更多的计划和更高的风险。

original: About Brynjolf...
string: 关于布林纽夫…

original: Don't get attached. Brynjolf won't have the time of day for you once your business is done. Trust me, I know his type.
string: 不要太执着。一旦你的事办完了，布林约夫就不会再理你了。相信我，我了解他这种人。

original: Brynjolf's growing on me.
string: 我越来越喜欢布林约夫了。

original: Delvin's a useful man to know. We've done business before.
string: 戴尔文是个很有用的人，我们以前做过生意。

original: About Delvin Mallory...
string: 关于戴尔文·马洛里…

original: Heeey, do you think Vex is interested in me?
string: 嘿嘿，你觉得威克斯对我感兴趣吗？

original: Something on your mind?
string: 你在想什么？

original: He reminds me of a lot of the men I sailed with. The better types, anyway.
string: 他让我想起了我曾与之同行的许多男人。至少是更好类型的人。

original: Still, he'd probably rob you of your last septim if it came down to it.
string: 不过,如果真的到了那一步,他可能会抢走你最后一枚塞普汀。

original: About Thrynn...
string: 关于希尔英......

original: She looks familiar, but I can't place where I've seen her.
string: 她看起来很熟悉,但我找不到在哪里见过她。

original: About Sapphire...
string: 关于蓝宝石......

original: I hope she does go to see Glover in Raven Rock. It think it'd be good for both of them.
string: 我希望她能去雷文岩见格洛弗。我认为这对两人都有好处。

original: About Sapphire and the letter from Glover...
string: 关于蓝宝石和葛洛文的信......

original: I wonder if he's tried asking any of the Daedra what they know about his pendant?
string: 我想知道他是否曾向任何达德拉询问过关于他吊坠的知识?

original: About Rune...
string: 关于符文......

original: I bet ol' Eyeballs knows a thing or two about those runes on his pendant. Maybe I should mention it?
string: 我敢打赌老眼球对他吊坠上的那些符文了解不少。也许我应该提一下?

original: About Rune...
string: 关于符文......

original: That seems harsh.
string: 这似乎太苛刻了。

original: It kills me to admit this, but me and him? We aren't that different. Don't say I didn't warn you about the guy.
string: 承认这一点真让我难受，但我和他？我们并没有那么不同。别说我没警告过你要小心那家伙。

original: You know some unfortunate types.
string: 你认识一些不幸的人。

original: Oh yeah? Guess you'd better look in the mirror.
string: 是吗？我猜你最好照照镜子。

original: You two aren't that different.
string: 你们俩并没有什么不同。

original: I had more money than was good for me and my own ship by the time I was twenty. What's his excuse?
string: 我二十岁的时候，钱多得花不完，还买了自己的船。他的借口是什么？

original: What?!
string: 什么？！

original: This can't possibly surprise you. Even I can't talk Sayma at Bits and Pieces into buying all of my more 'unusual' acquisitions.
string: 这不会让你惊讶的。就连我也无法说服零珠碎玉的塞伊玛买下我所有“不寻常”的东西。

original: Oh?
string: 嗯？

original: I prefer to have a buyer lined up, but I've had some unusual cargo to offload at times. He can move absolutely anything around Skyrim.
string: 我更希望能找到买家，但有时我也有一些不寻常的货物需要卸载。他可以搬运天际附近的任何东西。

original: (sigh) Of course you have.
string: 当然了。

original: Like you don't have friends in low places. If you're nice to me, I'll share a few more of my business contacts with you.
string: 好像你在底层没有朋友似的。如果你对我好点，我就多给你几个生意上的联系人。

original: You can't possibly be serious.
string: 你不会是认真的吧。

original: Well yeah. You do work here. I don't want to make it weird.
string: 嗯，是的。你在这里工作。我不想把事情搞得很奇怪。

original: Only one way to find out.
string: 只有一个办法能找到答案。

original: You do make a good point. Maybe I'll ask her.
string: 你说得很对。也许我该问问她。

original: Dream on.
string: 继续做梦吧。

original: Oh you of little faith.
string: 哦，你这没有信仰的人。

original: I might stab you if you don't keep your eyes front and center.
string: 如果你不盯着前方，我可能会捅你一刀。

original: Is that jealousy I hear? I thought you weren't interested.
string: 我听到的是嫉妒吗？我以为你不感兴趣。

original: Hey, snap out of it!
string: 嘿，振作起来！

original: Come on now, you're starting to worry me.
string: 得了吧，你开始让我担心了。

original: Look at me. Come on, look at me, please...
string: 看着我。来吧，看着我，求求你…

original: Damn assassins. The best defense is a good offense; what do you say we head to Solstheim?
string: 该死的刺客。进攻是最好的防守；我们去索瑟姆怎么样？

original: I swear I can feel Miraak's mind control spell at the edges of my thoughts. I'll sleep better after we put a stop to it.
string: 我发誓我能感觉到米拉克的精神控制咒语就在我思想的边缘。如果我们能阻止它，我就能睡得更好。

original: Here do we toil... That we might remember... Sorry, I lost focus for a moment there.
string: 我们在这里辛劳…这样我们才会记得…抱歉，我刚才走神了。

original: We're one step closer to putting Miraak in his place.
string: 我们离干掉米拉克又近了一步。

original: Well this is one of the more impressive ruins I've seen. I wonder how those control cubes work?
string: 这是我见过的最令人印象深刻的废墟之一。我想知道这些控制立方体是怎么工作的？

original: We should take the opportunity to explore the lower levels once we can operate the pumps. There might be some valuable things down there.
string: 一旦我们能操作水泵，就应该趁机探索下层。下面可能有些有价值的东西。

original: Miraak is Dragonborn, too.
string: 米拉克也是龙裔。

original: This guy's going to be a problem.
string: 这家伙会是个麻烦。

original: He knows shouts that I've never heard.
string: 他知道我从未听过的龙吼。

original: Now that you know his tricks, you won't fall for them a second time.
string: 现在你知道了他的伎俩，就不会再上第二次当了。

original: What if he's more powerful than me?
string: 如果他比我更强大呢？

original: Don't let him get inside your head. If he can learn a shout, so can you.
string: 别让他钻进你的脑子里。他能学会的龙吼，你也能学会。

original: I need a rematch.
string: 我需要再来一场。

original: Knowledge is power. We'll make sure you know more than he does next time.
string: 知识就是力量。我们要确保下次你比他懂得多。

original: Hermaeus Mora wants Storn's knowledge of the Skaal in exchange for the Word of Power I need.
string: 赫麦尤斯·莫拉想要斯托恩关于斯卡尔人的知识，以换取我需要的力量之语。

original: We can't force Storn, but if he's willing to do it I think we can trust his judgement.
string: 我们不能强迫斯托恩，但如果他愿意，我想我们可以相信他的判断。

original: It doesn't seem right.
string: 这似乎不太对。

original: We're meant to be tested. No one ever said it would be kind.
string: 我们注定要接受考验。没人说过这是件好事。

original: I wish there were another way.
string: 我希望有别的办法。

original: Miraak has spent centuries with access to every scrap of knowledge Apocrypha has to offer. You don't have that kind of time.
string: 米拉克花了几个世纪的时间获取异典提供的每一点知识。你可没那么多时间。

original: There might be consequences we can't foresee.
string: 可能会有我们无法预见的后果。
