original: Do you vow to stand at this man's side, to love him and to cherish him, through all life's joys and trials?
string: 你是否发誓要站在这个男人的身边，爱他，珍惜他，度过人生的所有欢乐和考验？

original: Do you vow to stand at this one's side, to love them and to cherish them, through all life's joys and trials?
string: 你是否发誓要站在这个人的身边，爱他（她），珍惜他（她），度过人生的所有欢乐和考验？

original: I do, now and forever.
string: 我愿意，直到天长地久。

original: Do you vow to stand at this man's side, to love him and to cherish him, through all life's joys and trials?
string: 你是否发誓要站在这个男人的身边，爱他，珍惜他，度过人生的所有欢乐和考验？

original: I do, now and forever.
string: 我愿意，直到天长地久。

original: Congratulations, and enjoy today as a celebration of your marriage!
string: 祝贺你们，享受今天你们结婚的日子吧！

original: The party lasts until twilight!
string: 宴会会一直持续到黄昏！

original: I'd like you to use gender neutral vows for me, please.
string: 我希望你能用中性的誓词来表达我的心声，谢谢。

original: Of course.
string: 当然。

original: Huh, that's interesting... This looks like a summoning circle! I'm dying to learn more about it when we have some time.
string: 嗯，这很有趣…这看起来像个召唤圈等有时间了，我一定要多了解一下。

original: Val, I was thinking about your Sigil Stone...
string: 瓦尔，我在想你的徽章石…

original: What's on your mind?
string: 你在想些什么？

original: Your past doesn't define your future. What do you want to do about it?
string: 你的过去并不决定你的未来。你想怎么做？

original: I want to try the spell again, but this time with your help.
string: 我想再试一次咒语，但这次要有你的帮助。

original: You can't seriously expect me to believe you'd give up so easily.
string: 你别指望我会相信你会轻易放弃。

original: Heh heh heh heh! You know me too well. I have been thinking about it.
string: 嘿嘿嘿嘿！你太了解我了，我一直在考虑。

original: I think you should let it go.
string: 我觉得你应该放手。

original: What? You want me to give up? I can't do that. You don't have to come with me but-
string: 什么？你要我放弃？我做不到！你可以不跟我走，但是--

original: With my past, failure was not an option for me. Not one that I could accept, anyway.
string: 以我的过去，失败不是我的选择。无论如何，我不能接受失败。

original: I learned to lie, cheat, and steal my way through any obstacle if it meant success.
string: 我学会了撒谎、欺骗和偷窃，只要能成功，我就能通过任何障碍。

original: Someone else always caught the blame when I screwed up.
string: 当我犯错时，总是有人替我顶罪。

original: What will you do with your new power?
string: 你将如何利用你的新力量？

original: I can't go back and change the things I regret, but I can use the strength I have to make different choices. Better choices.
string: 我无法回到过去，改变我后悔的事情，但我可以用我的力量做出不同的选择。更好的选择。

original: You're well on your way to having a pirate fleet.
string: 你就快拥有一支海盗舰队了。

original: Heh heh, I was thinking of trying to recruit Haknir Death-Brand next. I know he's dead, but think of the possibilities with a ghost ship!
string: 嘿嘿，我在考虑下一步招募海科尼尔·死亡烙印。我知道他已经死了，但想想幽灵船的可能性吧！

original: Fathis Indaryn, Haknir Death-Brand, Velehk Sain, and yours truly. These are names that people will remember!
string: 法提斯·因达伦、海科尼尔·死亡烙印、维勒克·塞恩，还有我。这些都是人们会记住的名字！

original: Did you learn what you were hoping to learn about yourself?
string: 你是否了解了你希望了解的自己？

original: Not exactly. I thought the challenge was going to be about magic. But, this was more of a reminder that my old ways of doing things aren't going to work anymore.
string: 不完全是。我以为这次挑战是关于魔法的。但是，这更像是在提醒我，我以前的做事方式已经行不通了。

original: Having power isn't the same as doing the right thing.
string: 拥有权力并不等于做正确的事。

original: If you don't have power, choices will be made for you by others. I can't live like that.
string: 如果你没有权力，别人就会替你做出选择。我不能那样生活。

original: What? Like some kind of hero?
string: 什么？像英雄一样？

original: Maybe, if the situation arises. It seems a more fitting use of power than just lining my pockets with wealth.
string: 也许吧，如果情况需要的话。这似乎是对权力的一种更恰当的运用，而不仅仅是让我的腰包鼓起来。

original: I thought you left the Dark Rose for good.
string: 我以为你永远离开了黑玫瑰！

original: I left her with Fathis. You know I'm still involved.
string: 我把她留给了法提斯。你知道我还在参与其中。

original: I can't just leave him to figure things out on his own. It wouldn't be right.
string: 我不能让他自己想办法。这样不对。

original: I left her with Fathis. You know I'm still involved.
string: 我把她留给了法提斯。你知道我还在参与其中。

original: Sure, he'll make some mistakes but it'll work out in the end.
string: 当然，他会犯一些错误，但最终会解决的。

original: I knew you'd never turn respectable and boring.
string: 我知道你永远不会变得可敬而无趣。

original: I thought maybe I'd be an actual relic hunter- Hahahaha! Who am I kidding, even I can't say that with a straight face.
string: 我想也许我会成为一个真正的遗迹猎人--哈哈哈哈！开什么玩笑，连我自己都无法坦然面对。

original: I'm worried that you're falling into old patterns.
string: 我担心你陷入旧的模式。

original: I know, and it's going to be something I struggle with. I need you to tell me when I'm not listening to my better nature.
string: 我知道，这将是我要努力解决的问题。我需要你在我没有听从我的本性时告诉我。

original: Other than your not including me from the beginning, I thought your plans worked out perfectly.
string: 除了你从一开始就没有把我包括在内，我认为你的计划非常完美。

original: That's exactly my point. I should have involved you from the start. We're better together. Partners.
string: 我就是这个意思。我一开始就应该让你参与进来。我们在一起更好。伙伴们。

original: I worry it won't ever be enough for you.
string: 我担心这对你来说永远不够。

original: You're really worried? Hey, it's me. I'm not my father
string: 你真的很担心？嘿，是我。我不是我父亲。

original: Besides, I have you to keep an eye on me.
string: 此外，我还有你照看着我。

original: Besides, I have you to keep an eye on me.
string: 此外，我还有你照看着我。

original: I agreed to help you with Conjuration magic, not help you become a pirate admiral.
string: 我是答应帮你施法，不是帮你当海盗上将。

original: Hah! You're splitting hairs. Daedra do what we require of them because we force them to do it. People on the high seas have a fighting chance.
string: 哈！你在狡辩迪德拉人做我们要求他们做的事 ，因为我们强迫他们这么做的。公海上的人有机会战斗。

original: Besides, we're not talking about innocent people. The East Empire Company is an exploitative monopoly. Any sympathy for them is misguided.
string: 此外，我们谈论的不是无辜的人。东帝国公司是一家剥削性的垄断企业。任何对他们的同情都是错误的。

original: Better still, Hammerfell is offering lucrative privateering contracts against the Thalmor. Now that will leave a legacy.
string: 更妙的是，落锤提供了丰厚的私掠合同，以对抗梭默。这可真是一举多得啊！

original: You mean things like lying, stealing, rash decisions, Daedric bargains, and outright piracy?
string: 你是说像撒谎、偷窃、轻率决定、和魔族交易和赤裸裸的海盗行为？

original: I said I was sorry!
string: 我说，我很抱歉！

original: Look, just because I'm aware of my shortcomings doesn't mean I like changing them. I've had a lot of practice ignoring my vices.
string: 听着，我知道自己的缺点并不意味着我喜欢改变它们。我有过很多无视自己恶习的经历。

original: The way I treat you is what matters most to me.
string: 我对待你的方式对我来说才是最重要的。

original: No you didn't!
string: 不，你没有！

original: I'm sorry I lied to you about my intentions with the spell. I won't do it again.
string: 我很抱歉在咒语的意图上对你撒了谎。我不会再这么做了。

original: No promises for the rest, heh.
string: 其他的就不保证了，呵呵。

original: Well say it again!
string: 那就再说一遍！

original: Sorry.
string: 对不起…

original: Damn assassins. What did you find?
string: 该死的刺客。你发现了什么？

original: Do you want a ride out of here or not?
string: 你到底要不要搭车离开这里？

original: Didn't mean to make you think I wasn't grateful.
string: 我不是故意让你觉得我不感激你的。

original: Taking on the East Empire Company is no pleasure cruise. My hands aren't clean. The things I did at sea were... what you'd imagine, but I never dealt in slaves or animal fighting rings.
string: 搭乘东帝国公司的游轮可不是一件愉快的事。我的手不干净，我在海上做的事… 和你想象的一样，但我从未贩卖奴隶或参与斗兽。

original: We live in a hard world that tests our strength, but senseless cruelty doesn't have to be a part of it. Or at least not my part of it.
string: 我们生活在一个艰难的世界里，这个世界考验着我们的力量，但无谓的残忍不一定是这个世界的一部分。或者说，至少不是我的一部分。

original: Does the ruthless pirate have a sense of honor? You almost sound like a Nord.
string: 冷酷无情的海盗还有荣誉感？你的口气几乎像诺德人。

original: Huh, I guess I never thought of it that way.
string: 呵呵，我想我从来没有这样想过。

original: Well hey, don't tell anyone; it's bad for my reputation.
string: 嘿嘿，别告诉别人，这对我的名声不好。

original: First we need to retrieve the Star of Solitude. I really do have it hidden nearby. Then we need to see a contact of mine about making a copy.
string: 首先，我们要取回独孤城之星。我真的把它藏在附近，然后我们得去找我的一个联络人，弄一个复制品。

original: Here's the key to the chest. Don't lose it.
string: 这是箱子的钥匙。别弄丢了。

original: Hello?
string: 你好？

original: You're not supposed to be in here.
string: 你不应该出现在这里。

original: That doesn't change anything.
string: 这改变不了任何事。

original: I just want information.
string: 我只想知道信息。

original: Nah. I don't think so.
string: 不要，我没兴趣。

original: Do you need help?
string: 你需要帮助吗？

original: You expect me to believe that?
string: 你以为我会信吗？

original: I just want to talk.
string: 我只是想谈谈。

original: You've done well.
string: 你干得好。

original: You're not real. You're a memory.
string: 你不是真实的。你只是记忆。

original: Hermaeus Mora! I've come to bargain.
string: 赫麦尤斯·莫拉，我是来讨价还价的。

original: You've come to die.
string: 你是来送死的！

original: Can I buy you a drink?
string: 我能请你喝一杯吗？

original: Always.
string: 一如既往。

original: Marrying you is the happiest day of my life. Except for all the days that will come after.
string: 娶你是我一生中最幸福的日子。除了之后的所有日子。

original: Marrying you is the happiest day of my life. Except for all the days that will come after.
string: 娶你是我一生中最幸福的日子。除了之后的所有日子。

original: It's the happiest day of my life, too. I love you.
string: 这也是我一生中最快乐的一天。我爱你。

original: And I love you. Now and forever.
string: 我爱你。从现在到永远。

original: It's you and me against the world. Come here.
string: 这是你我对抗世界的时刻。过来。

original: Lead the way, beautiful. I'll help you forget about the world for a while. But first...
string: 带路吧，美人。我会帮你暂时忘掉这个世界，但首先…

original: Lead the way, handsome. I'll help you forget about the world for a while. But first...
string: 带路吧，帅哥。我会帮你暂时忘掉这个世界，但首先…

original: Lead the way, gorgeous. I'll help you forget about the world for a while. But first...
string: 带路吧，美女，我会帮你暂时忘掉这个世界。但首先…

original: Until you do something to get in trouble. Again.
string: 直到你做了什么会惹上麻烦的事。

original: But then I can make it up to you!
string: 但那样我就能补偿你了！

original: Ah, but then I can make it up to ya.
string: 啊，不过我可以补偿你。

original: I have a wedding gift for you. You should look in my old cabin. You don't have to accept it, but what's mine is yours, after all.
string: 我有个结婚礼物要送给你。你应该去我以前的小屋看看。你不必接受，但我的终究是你的。

original: Let's start the next chapter of our lives together, love.
string: 让我们一起开启人生的新篇章吧，亲爱的。

original: It looks like we have some time to kill while we wait for Endarie.
string: 看来在等待恩达蕊期间，我们有时间消磨了。

original: I wouldn't put it like that. There's plenty to do around Solitude. Could I get you a drink?
string: 我可不会这么说。独孤城附近有很多好玩的。要喝点什么吗？

original: Perhaps another time.
string: 也许等下次吧。

original: You're right. It's probably best that we focus on the task at hand.
string: 你说得对。我们最好还是专注于手头的工作。

original: I'd like that.
string: 我喜欢这个。

original: Let's take a walk then.
string: 那我们出去走走吧。

original: I don't drink.
string: 我不喝酒。

original: Is that so? Fortunately, I'm charming enough without alcohol.
string: 是这样吗？幸运的是，我不喝酒也足够迷人。

original: How about I show you my favorite view?
string: 我带你看看我最喜欢的风景如何？

original: You're not my type.
string: 你不是我喜欢的类型。

original: Enh. Maybe you're just a poor judge of character.
string: 恩。也许你只是不善于判断人的性格。

original: How do you like my home?
string: 你喜欢我的家吗？

original: Oh, it's just lovely! It's luxurious, well-appointed... It has all the conveniences anyone could ask for, but did you notice that there is a chaurus nest right outside the front door?!
string: 哦，太可爱了。它豪华气派，设施齐全…各种便利设施一应俱全。但你注意到了吗，前门外有个查鲁斯窝。

original: How do you like Myrwatch?
string: 你觉得秘藏馆怎么样？

original: Sure it's luxurious, but you still live in a sewer.
string: 确实够奢华，可你终究还是住在下水道里啊。

original: What do you think of Shadowfoot Sanctum?
string: 你觉得影足圣所怎么样？

original: Well the hall itself is grand, but honestly? Eh, the bedroom is a bit cramped and lacking in privacy.
string: 大厅倒是挺气派，但说实话？呃，卧室有点挤，还缺隐私。

original: How do you like Hendraheim?
string: 你觉得亨德拉海姆怎么样？

original: Uh, it's rustic...
string: 挺有乡土气息的…

original: What do you think of Golden Hills Plantation?
string: 你觉得金丘种植园怎么样？

original: Four people were trapped in black soul gems from Molag Bal and hidden in a nightmare guarded by Vaermina. I can't wait to get out of here.
string: 四个人被莫拉格·巴尔的黑暗灵魂宝石困住,隐藏在由瓦尔迷纳守卫的噩梦中。我迫不及待想离开这里。

original: How do you like Gallows Hall?
string: 你觉得绞架堂怎样?

original: There are jobs you wouldn't do, even as a pirate.
string: 有些工作即使是海盗也不会做。

original: That's different.
string: 这不一样。

original: How is it different?
string: 有什么不同？

original: Because some things are just wrong.
string: 因为有些事情就是错的。

original: Caring about how you live and not just what you get sound like honor to me.
string: 关心你的生活方式而不仅仅是你得到了什么，这对我来说是一种荣幸。

original: Look, I- ah- huh, wait... No one's ever put it to me like that before. You've every right to be the Harbinger. I'm sorry I made light of it. And, wow, I- thank you for the guidance, I guess.
string: 听着，我… 等等… 从来没有人这样对我说过。你有资格成为先驱者。很抱歉我没把它当回事。哇，我想，谢谢你的指导。

original: How did you end up in here?
string: 你是怎么进来的？

original: Well how do you think? I read the book over your shoulder. With Miraak after you, I didn't feel right about you coming here without me.
string: 你觉得呢？我在你身后读了这本书。米拉克在追杀你，我不放心你一个人过来。

original: Would you like to come with me?
string: 你想和我一起去吗？

original: Oh, I don't know. Are we on the way to leave Serano at the bottom of the habor?
string: 哦，我不知道。我们是要把塞拉诺留在港口底部吗？

original: Even if my services were for sale, you couldn't afford me.
string: 即使我的服务可以出售，你也请不起我。

original: Oh, no... I'm busy.
string: 哦，不…我很忙。

original: I would, but I question your taste in companions.
string: 我会的，但我怀疑你对同伴的品味。

original: Aren't you Serano's friend? Ugh.
string: 你不是塞拉诺的朋友吗？啊？

original: Do you ever think about you and me?
string: 你有没有想过你和我？

original: Hmph. I'm not into scales.
string: 哼哼。我不喜欢天平。

original: You smell like swamp water.
string: 你闻起来像沼泽水。

original: Why are you her? Isn't it past time for your shift at the docks?
string: 为什么是你？你不是该去码头值班了吗？

original: I don't like fur on my clothes.
string: 我不喜欢衣服上有毛。

original: I'm allergic to cats.
string: 我对猫过敏。

original: Ugh, not with a Nord barbarian!
string: 诺德野蛮人可不行！

original: Oh, save it. A fur-clad simpleton wearing an Amulet of Mara is more your type.
string: 哦，省省吧。戴着玛拉护符的皮毛憨子才是你喜欢的类型。

original: I wish I had a Septim for every mead-swilling, knuckle-dragging, ignorant, provincial brute of a Nord who's tried that line today.
string: 我真希望今天每一个喝得烂醉，笨手笨脚，无知的诺德乡巴佬都能有个塞普汀币。

original: Heh. Do I look like I'd want to be your third wife?
string: 嘿，我看起来像是想做你的地下情人吗？

original: What was that? I couldn't understand you around those Horker tusks you call teeth.
string: 那是什么？我听不懂你在说什么，你把那些獠牙叫做牙齿。

original: Puh-lease. Your feet can't even reach the ground from your chair.
string: 拜托。你坐在椅子上，脚都够不着地。

original: Go hug a tree.
string: 去抱抱树吧。

original: Why don't you conjure yourself a pair of boots with heels so you can see over the counter, half-breed.
string: 你为什么不给自己变一双有跟的靴子，这样你就能看到柜台那边了，混血儿。

original: You remind me of someone... Ah! Oh, that's right, they were a Justiciar snitch.
string: 你让我想起了一个人…啊对了，他们是正义的告密者。

original: (laughs) Oh, look at you! You think you're the gods' gift to us all! Get lost.
string: 哦，看看你！你以为你是上帝赐予我们的礼物？滚吧！

original: I dislike the color gray. It's so... tedious.
string: 我不喜欢灰色。它太…乏味了。

original: Don't you have someone to sacrifice to the Daedra or something?
string: 你没有人要献祭给大魔王吗？

original: Ugh. Let me guess, next you're going to ask if I've read the Lusty Argonian Maid.
string: 唉。让我猜猜，接下来你会问我是否读过《元气满满的亚龙人女仆》。

original: Yes, I've seen the Imperial City. No, I was not impressed.
string: 是的，我见过皇城。不，我印象不深。

original: Does your commander know you're at a bar instead of playing soldier?
string: 你的指挥官知道你在酒吧而不是在当兵吗？

original: (laughs) Oh, if I wanted to be disappointed by someone's performance? I'd go down the street to the Bard's College.
string: 哦，如果我想对某人的表演感到失望？我会去街上的巴德学院。

original: I do think about us... far apart.
string: 我确实想过我们…相隔甚远。

original: This is a place of rest and fellowship for when your battles are done.
string: 这里是你们战斗结束后休息和团聚的地方。

original: Huh. I guess I'm just not ready to die then.
string: 哼。看来我还没准备好去死。

original: Bend Will or not, I don't think that dragon's going to carry both of us. Don't worry about me, you just come back victorious.
string: 不管有没有强迫意志， 我不认为那条龙能驮起我们两个。 别担心我，你只要胜利归来就行。

original: Really, Glover? This is the pot calling the kettle black if I've ever heard it.
string: 真的吗，葛罗文？依我看，这是五十步笑百步。

original: Oh about as much as usual. What are you even doing in Raven Rock?
string: 哦，和平时一样多。你来乌鸦岩干什么？

original: You're not seriously trying to make a living as a blacksmith, are you?
string: 你不是真的想以铁匠为生吧？

original: Yeah sure, and you'll fill your spare time by trading trinkets with the Skaal.
string: 是的，当然，你还可以通过与斯卡尔人交易饰品来打发业余时间。

original: Ha! Well hey, if you ever get too bored you come find me for some excitement.
string: 哈！如果你觉得太无聊，就来找我找点乐子。

original: Well, look who it is. Been keeping out of trouble much?
string: 好吧，看看是谁来了。没惹什么麻烦吧？

original: Oh, well. You know. A bit of this, a bit of that. Don't look at me like that.
string: 哦，好吧。你知道的。一点这个，一点那个。别那样看着我。

original: But, it's certainly better than not working at all.
string: 但是，这肯定比不工作要好。

original: Everyone has his weakness. It gets boring here sometimes.
string: 每个人都有自己的弱点。这里有时会很无聊。

original: We'll have to have a pint together sometime, you and me.
string: 我们有时间一定得喝一杯，就你和我。

original: Cutting this tree is an act of self-serving... I don't know, sigh, d-desecration? Don't do it.
string: 砍伐这棵树是一种自私的行为… 我不知道，叹气，亵渎？别这么做。

original: I agree. We'll find another way.
string: 我同意，我们会找到其他办法的。

original: Thank you. Look, I know this sounds foolish, but I always felt a kind of peace out on the open water that I never found anywhere else. With the wind in my hair I could almost feel connected to something bigger than myself.
string: 谢谢。听着，我知道这听起来很傻，但我总能在开阔的水面上感受到一种平静，这是我在其他任何地方都找不到的。风吹着我的头发，我几乎能感觉到自己与比自己更大的东西相连。

original: I get the same feeling when I look at the Eldergleam.
string: 当我看到古老圣光树的时候，我也有同样的感觉。

original: Maybe Maurice will finally prove himself useful and have a suggestion?
string: 也许莫里斯最终会证明自己是有用的，并提出建议？

original: It's just a tree.
string: 只是一棵树而已。

original: Don't you feel anything in this place? I do. It's the same feeling I get when I'm out on the open water and it's nothing but the wind and the sky. The Eldergleam is not just any tree.
string: 你在这里没有感觉到什么吗？我感觉到了，就像我在开阔的水面上，除了风和天空什么都没有一样的感觉，这树不是普通的树。

original: The presence of Kynareth? Since when do you care about the Divines?
string: 凯纳瑞丝的存在？你什么时候开始关心神学了？

original: Yeah. Surprisingly, I don't like the idea of going out of my way to insult the patron goddess of sailors.
string: 是啊，出乎意料的是，我并不喜欢去侮辱水手的守护神。

original: Why are you doing this?
string: 你为什么要这么做？

original: We were hired to do a job.
string: 我们是被雇来做事的。

original: There's got to be another way. What if we could get Danica the result she needs by some other means?
string: 肯定还有别的办法。如果我们能用其他方法让丹妮卡得到她需要的结果呢？

original: Spriggans! Godsdamnit, I knew this would happen!
string: 是树精！该死的，我就知道会这样！

original: Do what you want, but I'm not gonna help you sell to the Thalmor.
string: 随你便，但我不会帮你卖给梭默的。

original: Why not? Their money still spends.
string: 为什么不呢？他们的钱还是要花的。

original: For starters, I've run enough arms and supplies into Hammerfell that my face is eventually gonna get recognized.
string: 首先，我已经在落锤运送了足够多的武器和补给，我的脸最终会被认出来的。

original: Then let's add the fact that they hate anyone who isn't them. You want to help them carve up the Empire? Maybe if we're lucky they'll keep us around on leashes, like a pet.
string: 再加上一个事实，他们讨厌所有不是他们的人。你想帮他们瓜分帝国吗？如果我们幸运的话，他们可能会把我们像宠物一样拴起来。

original: You said you'd help me with anything, for any reason. You owe me.
string: 你说过你会帮我做任何事，不管什么原因。你欠我的。

original: Godsdamnit, you're twisting my- ugh sigh... Oblivion's sake, fine.
string: 该死的，你在扭曲我的--唉… 看在湮灭的份上，好吧。

original: Hey, I also said I had some standards.
string: 嘿，我还说过我有一些标准呢。

original: You're right; It is Nightingale business. I'll find you when it's done.
string: 你说得对，这是夜莺的事。事成之后我会找你的。

original: Eh, I'll make sure to stay out of your way then.
string: 那我就不妨碍你们了。

original: Eh, I'll make sure to stay out of your way then.
string: 嗯,我会尽量避开你的路的。

original: It's best I go alone. I'll find you when it's done.
string: 最好我一个人去。我完成后再来找你。

original: I feel surprisingly good after Neloth cast his experimental spell.
string: 内洛斯施展他的实验咒语后，我感觉出奇的好。

original: That's a relief. Neloth does seem like one of the more competent mages we've met.
string: 那我就放心了，内洛斯确实是我们见过的比较能干的法师之一。

original: I feel terrible all of a sudden.
string: 我突然感觉很糟。

original: You do look kinda worn down. Would a rest help?
string: 你看起来确实有点疲惫。休息一下会有帮助吗？

original: No. I think it's the water interacting with Neloth's spell.
string: 不，我认为是水与内洛斯的咒语相互作用造成的。

original: Damn. I'm just glad the side-effects aren't worse. Take it easy on the way back to Neloth, okay?
string: 该死。我很高兴副作用没有恶化，回去找内洛斯的路上放轻松，好吗？

original: About Neloth's experimental silence spell...
string: 关于内洛斯的实验性沉默咒语…

original: Please do not ever agree to something like that again. I will literally have nightmares for the rest of my life, and I've seen some shit.
string: 请不要再同意这种事了。我这辈子都要做噩梦了，我还见过一些鬼东西。

original: You look thoughtful since Vahlok's Tomb. What's on your mind?
string: 从瓦洛克的坟墓回来后，你看起来若有所思。你在想什么？

original: I'd speculate Vahlok led the forces that took down Miraak at his temple. Knowing what we do now, I wouldn't mind looking at the temple ruins again one of these days.
string: 我猜测是瓦洛克率领军队在米拉克的神庙里打倒了他。以我们现在的了解，我不介意哪天再去看看神庙遗址。

original: You're starting to sound like a respectable researcher.
string: 你开始听起来像个值得尊敬的研究者了。

original: Well, Tharstan offered to teach me more of the dragon language script if I could get him some good notes.
string: 嗯，如果我能给他一些好的笔记，沙尔斯坦愿意教我更多的龙语。

original: It's hard to find experts like him who are willing to share what they know. Maybe... maybe I'll write a book myself someday.
string: 很难找到像他这样愿意分享自己知识的专家。也许…也许有一天我会自己写一本书。

original: We've already looted the place. What else would you hope to find?
string: 我们已经洗劫过了。你还希望找到什么？

original: Not sure. Uh, we won't really know until we look. Tharstan did offer to pay for any notes we brought back.
string: 不确定，要看了才知道。而且沙尔斯坦愿意付钱。

original: What, are you some kind of historian now?
string: 怎么，你现在成历史学家了？

original: Don't laugh, but Tharstan offered to list me as a contributor if I brought him some good notes, okay? I thought maybe that- well, it's not important.
string: 别笑，如果我给他带来一些好的笔记，沙尔斯坦就会把我列为撰稿人，好吗？我想，也许 - 嗯，这并不重要。

original: Thought you could set your upstart little boots on my island, and now look at you! Decorating my habor as crab-bait. Hah hah hah hah!
string: 还以为你能在我的小岛上趾高气扬，现在看看你把我的小屋装饰成螃蟹诱饵，哈哈哈哈。

original: Here's your share of the gold. Fitting compensation for your 'service to the Empire.' Heh heh heh!
string: 这是你那份金子。这是对你“为帝国服务”的补偿。嘿嘿嘿。

original: Of course. Can't let those knife-eared grayskins and their associates think they're welcome here. Filthy pirates wouldn't even pay me.
string: 当然不能让那些刀耳灰人和他们的同伙以为这里欢迎他们。肮脏的海盗甚至不会付钱给我。

original: The rightful pirates- ah, citizens of Stros M'kai thank you.
string: 合法的海盗们--啊，斯特罗斯·迈凯的公民们，谢谢你们。

original: Wait, you don't belong here!
string: 等等，你不属于这里。

original: This is the street where I was a child. Well, my memory of it, anyway. We're in Apocrypha.
string: 这是我小时候住过的街道。反正是我的记忆。我们在异典里。

original: I used to serve Hermaeus Mora. This place is made from the memories I sometimes bargained for knowledge.
string: 我曾为赫麦尤斯·莫拉服务。这个地方是用我有时讨价还价得来的知识的记忆造就的。

original: Most of if really happened. Some of it's lies I told myself.
string: 大部分都是真实发生的。有些是我对自己撒的谎。

original: None of it's friendly.
string: 没有一个是友好的。

original: Eyeballs does not... appreciate... lying, even when you don't realize you're doing it. I learned to tell all that apart with Mora's 'gift.'
string: 眼球不会…欣赏…撒谎，即使你没有意识到自己在撒谎。我学会了用莫拉的“天赋”来分辨这一切。

original: When I decided I was done being Hermaeus Mora's lackey, I burned these books and more just to piss him off. Great way to get his attention, if you need to.
string: 当我决定不再做赫麦尤斯·莫拉的走狗时，我烧掉了这些书和更多的书，只为激怒他。如果需要的话，这是引起他注意的好办法。

original: I believe you saw my drawing of the incident?
string: 我相信你看到了我画的那幅画？

original: You won't be rid of me that easily.
string: 你没那么容易摆脱我。

original: Hahahahaha!
string: 哈哈哈哈哈！

original: Is that all you've got?
string: 你就只有这点本事？

original: You don't scare me.
string: 你吓不倒我。

original: You hit like a Breton!
string: 你打得像布莱顿人！

original: Nobody makes me bleed my own blood!
string: 没人能让我流血！

original: Well, well, here's the snowback pretty boy. The prodigal son.
string: 好了，好了，雪背美少年来了。浪子！

original: You think you can just stroll back here like you never left? After a year away in the godsdamned Imperial Navy just to piss Tarek off?
string: 你以为你可以像没离开过一样漫步回来？在该死的帝国海军呆了一年之后，就为了惹恼塔里克？

original: Well congratulations, he's thrilled. Everyone's thrilled for you to honor us with your presence.
string: 祝贺你，他很激动。大家都为你的到来感到高兴。

original: To Oblivion with you. You always had all the choices! What did I have? The blame, the beatings, the suffering for your mistakes!
string: 一起下湮灭吧！你总是拥有所有的选择，我有什么？责备、殴打、为你的错误受苦。

original: This is the way it happened, though. The beginning of our end.
string: 但事情就是这样发生了。我们末日的开始。

original: That is a lie and lies will not be catalogued in Apocrypha, insolent Seeker!
string: 那是谎言。谎言不会被编入异典，无礼的探索者！

original: Rarrrrrrr!
Now we're getting somewhere... but you're still holding out on us.
string: 现在我们有进展了…但你还在瞒着我们…

original: Tarek kicked me off the ship. I didn't exactly have a choice-
string: 塔里克把我赶下了船。我别无选择。

original: You have no right. You-!
string: 你没有权利。没有！

original: You aren't real. You're just a memory. I didn't come here for this.
string: 你并不真实。你只是我的记忆，我不是为此而来。

original: No. It wasn't always like this. We were like brothers once. It didn't have to happen this way. It doesn't have to keep happening.
string: 不，不是一直这样的。我们曾经情同手足，没必要非得这样。也不必一直这样。

original: You're just a creature wearing my brother's face. I don't owe you anything.
string: 你只是个披着我哥哥的脸的怪物。我不欠你什么。

original: Damn you, then. I'll tell you what you want to know.
string: 你真该死！我会告诉你你想知道的。

original: We are brothers. Tarek refused to acknowledge it. We have different mothers, but that has never mattered to me.
string: 我们是兄弟。塔里克拒绝承认。我们有不同的母亲，但这对我来说并不重要。

original: I should have stood up for you, should have done things differently.
string: 我应该为你出头，应该采取不同的做法。

original: But you're not him, and I'm not going to give up on Fathis this time.
string: 但你不是他，这次我不会放弃法提斯。

original: Hold on! I need to explain before you see what's out there.
string: 等一下！在你们看到外面的东西之前，我需要解释一下。

original: That is one big centurion! Stay behind Katria; she's already dead.
string: 这可是个大百夫长！跟在卡提雅后面，她已经死了。

original: Uh, this whole place is unstable. Watch your step.
string: 呃，这整个地方都不稳定，小心脚下。

original: Something's happening! Get back!
string: 有情况！退后！

original: How can I find you if we get separated?
string: 如果我们走散了，我怎么才能找到你？

original: Just whistle like I taught you on the rowboat, remember? I'll find you.
string: 就像我在划艇上教你的那样吹口哨，记得吗？我会找到你的

original: Erandur means well. The Skull is dangerous and we should continue to help him.
string: 依兰杜尔是好意。骷髅头很危险，我们应该继续帮助他。

original: The sooner we get rid of the Skull of Corruption, the better.
string: 我们越早摆脱腐骨之仗越好。

original: I think Erandur was the person in the memory. We can't trust him.
string: 我认为依兰杜尔就是记忆中的那个人。我们不能相信他。

original: Hold on, hold on. Are you saying he might have actually risked his own memories to get you through the Dreamstride?
string: 等等，等等。你是说他可能真的冒着失去记忆的危险，帮你穿越了梦境之桥？

original: He still isn't telling us everything, but... no one would do that lightly. Maybe he really is trying to help people.
string: 他还是没有告诉我们一切，但是…没有人会轻易这么做。也许他真的是想帮助别人。

original: You don't want the Skull for yourself, do you?
string: 你不会想把骷髅头据为己有吧？

original: Mind if we head to Windhelm soon? I have some business with Niranye in the market.
string: 介意我们马上去风舵城吗？我和妮兰雅在市场上有些生意要做。

original: Sure, we can stop by the market.
string: 可以，我们可以去市场看看。

original: Thanks. There's no rush, but I'd rather not wait too long.
string: 谢谢。不急，但我不想等太久。

original: About raising children...
string: 关于养育孩子…

original: Yeah... What about them?
string: 是啊… 他们怎么了？

original: It's okay. I don't want children.
string: 没关系。我不想要孩子。

original: That's a relief. It'll just be the two of us, then.
string: 那我就放心了，那就只有我们两个了。

original: I never thought I'd make a good parent either.
string: 我也从没想过自己会成为一个好家长。

original: Well, I disagree. But I'm glad we can agree on not having kids. I was slightly terrified.
string: 我不同意。但我很高兴我们能在不要孩子的问题上达成一致。我有点害怕。

original: Okay, a lot terrified.
string: 好吧，是非常害怕。

original: My child will come to see you as a father, whether you think you're ready or not.
string: 不管你是否准备好，我的孩子都会把你当成父亲。

original: How do we even start to get ready for that kind of responsibility? It's overwhelming.
string: 我们该如何开始为这种责任做好准备？这是难以承受的。

original: I'd really like to be a mother someday, especially with you. Could we talk about it?
string: 我真的很想有一天能成为母亲，尤其是和你一起。我们能谈谈吗？

original: How do we even start to get ready for that kind of responsibility? It's overwhelming.
string: 我们该如何开始为这种责任做好准备？这是难以承受的。

original: I'd really like to be a father someday, especially with you. Could we talk about it?
string: 我真的很想有一天当爸爸，尤其是和你一起。我们能谈谈吗？

original: How do we even start to get ready for that kind of responsibility? It's overwhelming.
string: 我们该如何开始为这种责任做好准备？这是难以承受的。

original: I'd really like to be a parent someday, especially with you. Could we talk about it?
string: 我真的很想有一天能成为父母，尤其是和你一起。我们能谈谈吗？

original: How do I even start to get ready for that kind of responsibility? It's overwhelming.
string: 我该如何开始为承担这样的责任做好准备？这让我不知所措。

original: How do I even start to get ready for that kind of responsibility? It's overwhelming.
string: 我该如何开始为承担这样的责任做好准备？这让我不知所措。

original: My children will come to see you as a father, whether you think you're ready or not.
string: 不管你觉得自己准备好了没有，我的孩子们都会把你当成父亲。

original: It's okay. I don't want children.
string: 没关系。我不想要孩子。

original: That's a relief. It'll just be the two of us, then.
string: 那我就放心了，那就只有我们两个了。

original: Between the two of us, though, maybe we'd do all right as parents...
string: 不过，在我们俩之间，也许我们会做得很好的父母…

original: Wait, what? Have you thought about this? About what our lives are like? We could be both be dead tomorrow from any number of our enemies.
string: 等等，什么？你想过这个问题吗？想过我们的生活吗？我们俩明天就会死于任何敌人之手。

original: Wait, what? Have you thought about this? About what our lives are like? We could be both be dead tomorrow from any number of our enemies.
string: 等等，什么？你想过这个问题吗？想过我们的生活吗？我们俩明天就会死于任何敌人之手。

original: I'd like to see them try. We've always been stronger together.
string: 我希望他们能试试。我们在一起总是更强大。

original: What if something happened to you? I can't do this alone.
string: 如果你出了什么事怎么办？我一个人做不来。

original: You're not alone, not anymore.
string: 你并不孤单，不再孤单了。

original: Love, how are we gonna keep a child safe?
string: 亲爱的，我们该如何保证孩子的安全？

original: I believe you once wrote, 'A ship in harbor is safe, but that's not why ships are made.'
string: 我相信你曾经写道：“停在港湾里的船是安全的，但这并不是制造船的原因。”

original: You remember that from my journal, huh? I read it a long time ago, and it stuck with me.
string: 你还记得我日记里的那句话吧？我很久以前读过这句话，它深深地印在我的脑海里。

original: It gave me the courage to keep going when I coulda just gone back to Cyrodiil and lived a quiet life. That was a life someone else wanted for me, and it never felt like mine.
string: 它给了我继续前进的勇气，而我本可以回到赛罗迪尔过平静的生活。那是别人想要我过的生活，而我却从来没有过这种感觉。

original: It's different, though, when you think about someone you love taking risks.
string: 不过，当你想到你爱的人在冒险时，情况就不一样了。

original: No one is ever ready, not really. We'll love them and do our best.
string: 没有人准备好，真的没有。我们会爱他们，尽我们最大的努力。

original: What if they don't like me?
string: 万一他们不喜欢我怎么办？

original: Are we thinking about the same person? I adore you, and so will our kids.
string: 我们想的是同一个人吗？我喜欢你，我们的孩子也会喜欢你。

original: What if I'm like my father, and I can't love them?
string: 如果我像我的父亲一样，不能爱他们怎么办？

original: I know you better than that. If you were like Tarek, you wouldn't be so worried.
string: 我更了解你。如果你像塔里克一样，你就不会这么担心了。

original: Well, you stuck with me. That's gotta count for something, right?
string: 好吧，你坚持和我在一起。这总该算点什么吧？

original: Is it true that you were a pirate?
string: 你真的当过海盗吗？

original: People in town.
string: 镇上的人。

original: Aw...
string: 噢…

original: Yes! I knew it! Oh wow, that is awesome! I can't wait to tell my friends!
string: 是的！我就知道！哇，太酷了！我等不及要告诉我的朋友了！

original: Where'd you hear that?
string: 你从哪听来的？

original: People say a lot of things, most of them wrong.
string: 人们会说很多话，其中大部分都是错的。

original: But that one's true.
string: 但这个是真的。

original: What? No! Why do you even think I would know that?
string: 什么？我不知道！你为什么觉得我会知道？

original: Uhh, your mother's gonna kill me...
string: 呃，你妈妈会杀了我的…

original: Urgh. your father's going to kill me...
string: 呃，你父亲会杀了我的…

original: Let's say, for the sake of discussion, that I know a few things. What are you going to do if I teach you?
string: 为了便于讨论，假设我知道一些事情。如果我教你，你会怎么做？

original: That's my girl! Now, I noticed you because I saw your shadow. You have to pay attention to where the sun is. Got it?
string: 这才是我的女孩！我注意到你是因为我看到了你的影子。你必须注意太阳在哪里。明白了吗？

original: Yes, I understand. Thanks, Papa!
string: 是的，我明白。谢谢你，爸爸！

original: Will you teach me how to pick pockets?
string: 你能教我怎么偷东西吗？

original: You caught me in the market. I'm actually pretty good, but you knew right away!
string: 我在市场被你逮到了。我其实很厉害，但你一看就知道了！

original: I will definitely not get caught stealing things from people.
string: 我绝对不会被抓到偷别人的东西。

original: I think you'd be a good father if you gave yourself a chance.
string: 我觉得如果你给自己一个机会，你会是个好父亲。

original: Are we talkin' about the same person here? My whole life has been a series of selfish decisions.
string: 我们说的是同一个人吗？我的一生都是由一系列自私的决定组成的。

original: You looked out for the people on your ship.
string: 你照顾船上的人。

original: They're all terrible people, that doesn't really count- well, maybe it does.
string: 他们都是可怕的人，这不算数--好吧，也许算数。

original: Look, what I'm trying to say is that I've messed up a lotta things in my life, but the one I worry about is disappointing you.
string: 听着，我想说的是，我这辈子搞砸了很多事，但我最担心的是让你失望。

original: This person I've become since I've met you? I like him a lot better than the guy I used to be.
string: 自从遇见你之后我变成的这个人？比起以前的我，我更喜欢他。

original: I'm open to the idea of being a father. It's something that, with you in my life, I feel like I could even do... but let's not rush it?
string: 我对做父亲的想法持开放态度。有了你，我觉得我甚至可以做这件事…但我们不要操之过急。

original: Of course. We'll see what the future brings, together.
string: 当然。我们一起拭目以待未来。

original: I suppose we could always send the kids to stay with their Uncle Fathis on the Rose if we needed a break.
string: 我想，如果我们需要休息一下的话，我们可以把孩子们送到法提斯叔叔家住。

original: That's a terrible idea!
string: 这主意糟透了！

original: (laughs) I'm kidding, I'm kidding... mostly.
string: 哈哈哈哈！我在开玩笑，我在开玩笑…主要是开玩笑。

original: That's a brilliant idea!
string: 真是个好主意！

original: Wait, I was kidding! Don't tell me I'm going to have to be the voice of reason here!
string: 等等，我在开玩笑！别跟我说我得在这里说理！

original: Sometimes I can't tell when you're joking.
string: 有时候我都分不清你在开玩笑。

original: It's part of my charm. Anyway, I thought you'd be happy I was feeling more relaxed about fatherhood.
string: 这是我魅力的一部分。总之，我想你会很高兴我对做父亲感到更放松了。

original: Will you be my new dad?
string: 你会成为我的新爸爸吗？

original: You know I tried to make a toy dragon but the wings kept breakin. Maybe we can find some leaves or somethin where there's not so much snow. Snow can be fun though because me and my friends used to make snowmer. Did you make snow-mer when you were little?
string: 我想做一条玩具龙，但翅膀老是折断。也许我们可以在没有那么多雪的地方找些树叶什么的。不过雪也挺好玩的，因为我和我的朋友们经常做雪人。你小时候会做雪人吗？

original: You don't look quite like a Nord.
string: 你看起来不太像一个诺德人。

original: That's because I'm not. I'm half-Dunmer. Wha- wait, hold on a second... Dad?!
string: 因为我不是，我是半个丹莫人。等等，等一下… 爸爸？

original: My papa was half-Dunmer!
string: 我爸爸有一半丹莫血统！

original: Not my dad that lived with my mom, but my real dad. I never met him. but Mama told me about him some. I guess that makes me three-quarters Dunmer and something else.
string: 不是和妈妈住在一起的爸爸，而是我真正的爸爸。我从没见过他，但妈妈跟我说过他的一些事。我想这让我有四分之三的丹莫血统和其他血统。

original: Maybe I'm one-quarter dragon! That would be awesome.
string: 也许我是四分之一的龙！那就太棒了。

original: Then you're the tiniest dragon I've ever seen.
string: 那你就是我见过的最迷你的龙了。

original: Come on, Dragonfly, let's meet my wife.
string: 来吧，小龙，让我们见见我的妻子吧。

original: Then you're the tiniest dragon I've ever seen.
string: 那你就是我见过的最迷你的龙了。

original: Come on, Dragonfly, let's meet my husband.
string: 来吧，小龙，让我们见见我的丈夫。

original: I'm still growing!
string: 我还在成长！

original: Wait... you've seen a dragon?! You have to tell me about it!
string: 等等…你见过龙？你得告诉我！

original: Hi, Mama.
string: 嗨，妈妈。

original: Hi, Papa.
string: 嗨，爸爸。

original: Hello!
string: 你好 ！

original: Hi!
string: 嗨！

original: Bye!
string: 拜拜！

original: Bye now!
string: 下回见 ！

original: See ya!
string: 再见！

original: Okay, bye!
string: 好的，再会！

original: It's time for you to go to bed.
string: 你该去睡觉了。

original: Morning already?
string: 已经早上了？

original: Time to wake up, Dragonfly.
string: 该醒醒了，小龙。

original: Five more minutes...
string: 再等五分钟…

original: Time to wake up, Dragonfly.
string: 该醒醒了，小龙。

original: Good morning, Mama.
string: 早上好，妈妈。

original: Time to wake up, Dragonfly.
string: 该醒醒了，小龙。

original: Good morning, Papa.
string: 早上好，爸爸。

original: Time to wake up, Dragonfly.
string: 该醒醒了，小龙。

original: Good morning.
string: 早安。

original: Time to wake up, Dragonfly.
string: 该醒醒了，小龙。

original: Okay, fine...
string: 好吧，好吧…

original: (yawn) But I'm not even tired! (yawn)
string: 但我一点都不累！

original: Aww...
string: 喔呜…

original: Good night, Mama.
string: 晚安，妈妈。

original: Good night, Papa.
string: 晚安，爸爸。

original: Good night.
string: 晚安。

original: Hello, Dragonfly.
string: 你好，小龙。

original: Look what I found! Can I keep him? Pleeeease??
string: 看我找到了什么！我能留着它吗？求你了？

original: Papa told me you were really a dragon! Is it true?
string: 爸爸说你真的是龙！是真的吗？

original: I want to have adventures like you and Papa when I grow up! But... I'm not sure where to start.
string: 我希望长大后能像你和爸爸一样去冒险，但是… 我不知道从何开始。

original: I found this for you. It's a present!
string: 我为你找到了这个。这是个礼物！

original: Yes, I'm a dragon in mortal form.
string: 是的，我是一条凡人形态的龙。

original: WOW! I wish I were a dragon, but I guess this is the next best thing!
string: 哇！我真希望我是一条龙，但我想这是次要的！

original: Sort of. I have the soul of a dragon, but I'm mortal like anyone else.
string: 算是吧。我有龙的灵魂，但我和其他人一样是凡人。

original: Ohhh, so that's what 'Dragonborn' means.
string: 哦，原来这就是“龙裔”的意思。

original: I need to have a talk with your father about his stories.
string: 我要和你父亲谈谈他的故事。

original: (giggle)
string: 嘿嘿嘿嘿！

original: It's time for us to move.
string: 我们该搬家了。

original: I like our new home.
string: 我很喜欢我们的新家。

original: Here's where we'll be staying.
string: 这就是我们要住的地方。

original: I'm going to go play right now!
string: 我现在要去玩了！

original: Here's where we'll be staying.
string: 这就是我们要住的地方。

original: I hope the other kids here are nice.
string: 我希望这里的其他孩子都是好人。

original: Here's where we'll be staying.
string: 这就是我们要住的地方。

original: Are you sure? I don't see any dragons here.
string: 你确定？我没看到龙啊。

original: Here's where we'll be staying.
string: 这就是我们要住的地方。

original: Oh, how fun! Now I can visit the museum any time I like.
string: 有意思！这下我想在时候参观都行了。

original: We'll be living at the Dragonborn Museum.
string: 我们会住在龙裔艺术馆里。

original: Okay, I'll follow you.
string: 好吧，我跟着你。

original: I hope we get to fight some bandits along the way!
string: 我希望我们能在路上和一些强盗战斗！

original: Yes, Mama.
string: 好，妈妈。

original: Of course, Mama.
string: 好，妈妈。

original: Yes, Papa.
string: 好的，爸爸。

original: Who's this with you?
string: 你是谁啊？

original: A street urchin I caught picking my pocket. Said her name's Ravani.
string: 我抓到一个偷我口袋的街头小混混，她说她叫拉瓦妮。

original: She didn't have anywhere else to go, so...
string: 她没有别的地方可去，所以…

original: You brought her with you?
string: 你把她也带来了？

original: Well, uh, I couldn't leave her on the streets; she's terrible at stealing!
string: 我不能让她流落街头，她不擅长偷东西！

original: We should adopt her.
string: 我们应该收养她。

original: Are you sure about this? I mean, I've sort of committed us, haven't I?
string: 你确定吗？我是说，我已经对我们的关系做出了承诺，不是吗？

original: You're not teaching our daughter how to steal things.
string: 你不能教我们的女儿怎么偷东西。

original: Our daughter?
string: 我们的女儿？

original: You didn't think we should talk about this first?
string: 你不觉得我们应该先谈谈这件事吗？

original: I am literally talking to you about it at the first available opportunity. I've hardly been able to get a word in. Me! Hardly a word!
string: 我一有机会就跟你说这件事。我几乎连一句话都插不上。我！几乎一个字也没有！

original: You'll be a wonderful father.
string: 你会是个很棒的父亲。

original: I'm gonna do my best. You should go talk to her yourself. I think you'll like her; She's a lot of fun.
string: 我会尽力的。你应该亲自去跟她说。我想你会喜欢她的；她很有趣。

original: Isn't she? It sure looks like she's decided already. I like her spark.
string: 不是吗？看来她已经决定了！我喜欢她的品质。

original: Me too. Although, am I going to get a say in anything ever again?
string: 我也是。不过，我以后还能在任何事情上有发言权吗？

original: I'm clearly outnumbered, and out-maneuvered. Why don't you talk to the kid yourself?
string: 我明显寡不敌众，而且被耍得团团转。你为什么不自己跟那孩子谈谈？

original: Seems like you've met your match, and now I'm outnumbered.
string: 看来你遇到对手了，现在我寡不敌众了。

original: I think we've both been out-maneuvered. Why don't you talk to the kid? I think you'll like her.
string: 我想我们都被耍了。你为什么不跟那孩子谈谈？我想你会喜欢她的。

original: Hello, Ravani. I'm <alias=player>.
string: 你好，拉瓦妮。我是 <alias=player>。

original: Hello! Val told me a lot about you.
string: 你好！瓦尔跟我说了很多你的事。

original: Did he now?
string: 是吗？

original: Hehe heh! It was all good things!
string: 嘿嘿！都是好事！

original: ...What's a 'better half?'
string: …什么是“更好的另一半”？

original: That would be me, I suppose. So you're all on your own?
string: 那就是我吧，就你一个人吗？

original: Yes, sera.
string: 什么事，瑟拉。

original: Val and I could adopt you, if you want.
string: 如果你愿意，我和瓦尔可以收养你。

original: OH WOW! Really? I am SO EXCITED!
string: 哦，哇！真的吗？我太激动了！

original: Come with me; I'll take you to our home.
string: 跟我来吧，我带你去我们的家。

original: Okay! I'll stick close and won't be any trouble. Promise!
string: 好，我会跟紧点，不会给你添麻烦的，我保证！

original: Welcome to your new home! I hope you'll be happy with us.
string: 欢迎来到你的新家！我希望你和我们在一起会快乐。

original: I already love it here! Thank you... Mama.
string: 我已经爱上这里了！谢谢… 妈妈。

original: I already love it here! Thank you... Papa!
string: 我已经爱上这里了！谢谢… 爸爸。

original: I already love it here! Thank you!
string: 我已经爱上这里了！谢谢！

original: Okay! I always thought it would be fun to live at an inn.
string: 好吧！我一直觉得住在客栈里会很有趣。

original: Here's where we'll be staying for now.
string: 这就是我们现在要住的地方。

original: If we're going to be College Mages, you need to look the part.
string: 如果我们要成为学院法师，你就得有这个样子。

original: If I'd known the wardrobe was this good, I'd have joined the College a while ago!
string: 早知道衣柜这么好，我早就加入学院了！

original: Fake it until you make it, Val...
string: 假戏真做，瓦尔…

original: Fake it until you make it, Serano...
string: 塞拉诺，你就装吧。

original: Of course, why wouldn't it?
string: 当然，为什么不呢？

original: Ah, I don't have the heart to tell you. Just be careful who you trust around here, okay?
string: 我不忍心告诉你。小心你在这里相信的人，好吗？

original: I doubt it.
string: 我对此表示怀疑。

original: Yeah, I didn't think so either. Was a nice thought for a moment, though.
string: 是啊，我也没想到。不过，这也是个不错的想法。

original: Is that all you care about? We helped people!
string: 你只关心这些吗？我们帮助过人们！

original: I care. I just happen to care more about staying out of Cidhna Mine!
string: 我在乎。我只是碰巧更关心如何远离希讷矿坑！

original: Age is a privilege, orc. But it's your funeral.
string: 年龄是一种特权，兽人。但这将是你的葬礼！

original: Farkas is cured of lycanthropy.
string: 法卡斯的狼人病治好了。

original: Farkas is a good man. Vilkas is lucky to have a brother like him watching his back.
string: 法卡斯是个好人。维尔卡斯很幸运，有他这样的兄弟在背后照应。

original: Did you hear that?
string: 你听到什么了吗？

original: Look, no one is more surprised than me that I'm still alive, but I think we have it covered.
string: 听着，没有人比我更惊讶我还活着，但我想我们已经搞定了。

original: What if trouble finds us?
string: 如果麻烦找到我们怎么办？

original: Yeah, people are really lining up for Orgnar's skeever stew and flat ale.
string: 是啊，人们都在排队等着吃奥格那的恶鼠炖肉和苍蝇啤酒。

original: Haaah... If I followed my old habits, she'd be finding out just how far she can swim.
string: 哈啊…如果我按照以前的习惯，她就会发现自己到底能游多远。

original: The All-Maker
string: 万能制造者

original: Oh? Were you raised among the Skaal?
string: 你是在斯卡尔人中间长大的吗？

original: Y'ffre
string: 伊弗里啊

original: The Singer, right? When I was a boy, I read an old fairy tale that said his first song was so beautiful that even the stars danced.
string: 歌手，对吗？我小时候读过一个古老的童话故事，说他的第一首歌是如此美妙，连星星都为之起舞。

original: The Nine Divines
string: 九圣灵

original: I gotta warn ya, on a good day I'm barely following three out of ten on the Commands of the Divines.
string: 我得警告你，在好的日子里，我勉强能遵守神谕中的十条命令中的三条。

original: I worship the Eight Divines.
string: 我崇拜八圣灵。

original: I think you forgot one.
string: 我想你忘了一个。

original: The Aedra. This world is a prison and one day we will be free!
string: 艾德拉这个世界是一座监狱，总有一天我们会获得自由！

original: A fanatic? Lovely.
string: 狂热分子？真可爱！

original: A whole city underground... Incredible, and a depressing place to live. No wonder Dwemer were cruel bastards.
string: 整个城市都在地下。不可思议，也是个令人沮丧的地方。难怪锻莫都是残忍的混蛋。

original: A whole city underground... Incredible, and a depressing place to live. No wonder Dwemer were cruel bastards.
string: 整个城市都在地下。不可思议，也是个令人沮丧的地方。难怪锻莫都是残忍的混蛋。

original: The fountains are a nice touch, though. Can we get one for the house?
string: 喷泉倒是个不错的点缀。能给我们家也弄一个吗？

original: Feel free to sit when I sit.
string: 我坐的时候，请随意坐。

original: Don't sit unless I ask you to.
string: 除非我让你坐，否则别坐。

original: Don't sit unless I ask you to.
string: 除非我叫你坐下,否则不要坐。

original: I won't stand on ceremony, then.
string: 那我就不客气了。

original: What a horrible way to die! I think I'd bargain anything to avoid that poor bastard's fate.
string: 多么可怕的死法为了避免那个可怜虫的命运，我想我会讨价还价的。

original: Any advice?
string: 有什么建议吗？

original: Keep pulling levers until we run out. What's the worst that could happen? Uh, don't stand on those spikes, though.
string: 继续拉杠杆，直到用完为止。最坏的情况会怎样？不过别站在那些钉子上。

original: You've read 'Fjori and Holgeir,' right? I must've read it a hundred times! It's kinda romantic really. Ahem- um, anyway. It's eagle-snake-whale-snake, just like the story.
string: 你读过《佛乔里和霍吉尔》吧？我肯定读过上百遍了。真的挺浪漫的。总之是鹰 -蛇 -鲸 -蛇，就像故事里一样。

original: Pht... Want me to sit in the chair?
string: 啧…要我坐在椅子上吗？

original: There's no need to guess which lever. The solution is always hidden somewhere in the crypt. Just look around.
string: 无需猜测是哪根杠杆。答案总是藏在地窖的某个地方。环顾四周即可。

original: Remember, these puzzles are to keep the draugr in, not keep people out. Be ready.
string: 记住，这些谜题是为了防止尸鬼进来，而不是把人挡在外面。做好准备

original: This one's tougher than average, but there're only so many possibilities. Just be logical, and don't overthink it.
string: 这个问题比一般问题更难，但也只有那么几种可能性。只要符合逻辑，不要想太多。

original: It does make me wonder what's on the other side, though.
string: 不过，这确实让我想知道另一面是什么。

original: Don't start pulling levers at random. That's how you get killed.
string: 别随便拉杠杆,那样你就会被杀死。

original: Let's keep searching for the carving. There's gotta be one nearby.
string: 继续寻找雕刻吧,附近一定有一处。

original: There are two walls of carvings and two walls of pillars. Seems like a match to me.
string: 墙上有两面雕刻墙和两面柱子墙,对我来说这像是配对。

original: It's a riddle. The answer will give us the order of the totems and handles to pull.
string: 这是个谜语,答案会告诉我们图腾的顺序以及需要拉动的把手。

original: Any advice?
string: 有什么建议吗？

original: I've never seen a tonal lock before, but based on the notes we found I'd guess it's a pattern from left to right, then center.
string: 我以前从未见过音调锁，但根据我们找到的音符，我猜它是一个从左到右，然后再到中间的图案。

original: Heh heh... Don't fuck up.
string: 嘿嘿…别搞砸了。

original: Any advice?
string: 有什么建议吗？

original: Move the pillars to show snake-snake-whale, just like the carvings. There's always a carving.
string: 移动柱子，就像雕刻一样，显示出蛇-蛇-鲸。总会有雕刻的。

original: These puzzles really aren't really meant to keep anyone out. They're meant to keep the draugr in the tombs.
string: 这些谜题并不是为了把任何人挡在外面，而是为了把尸鬼留在墓穴里。

original: Let's take it anyway. We're not here to sightsee, and I'm sure we can handle whatever trap it springs.
string: 我们还是走吧我们不是来观光的，我相信我们能应付它的任何陷阱。

original: I couldn't agree more!
string: 我完全同意！

original: I can't read enough to translate, but this looks like a memorial wall. It says something about the wrath of a storm, too. What do you make of it?
string: 我不识字，无法翻译，但这看起来像是一面纪念墙。上面还写着暴风雨的愤怒。你怎么看？

original: What happened? You get cold feet?
string: 怎么了？你临阵退缩了？

original: Yes, actually. This isn't right.
string: 是的，事实上。这是不对的。

original: Oh, it's simply transparent. The 'honorable and noble' Companions take money to settle grudges all the time, and they don't ask questions. The Thieves Guild doesn't pretend to be something it's not.
string: 哦，这简直是透明的。光荣而高尚的同伴们总是拿钱来解决恩怨，他们不会过问。盗贼公会不会装腔作势。

original: Now ask yourself which of the two is more honest.
string: 现在扪心自问，哪一个更诚实？

original: No! I just... uh...
string: 不！我只是…呃…

original: Ha ha ha ha! Choked under pressure, huh? Don't let anyone intimidate you. Watch, let me give you a few tips...
string: 哈哈哈哈！在压力下窒息了，是吧？别让任何人吓到你看好了，让我给你支几招…

original: I have things to do.
string: 我还有事情要做。

original: Like what? I'm all for takin' the piss out of Brynjolf for laughs, but there are more creative ways to get on his bad side if that's what you have in mind. This is just sad.
string: 比如说什么？我很喜欢拿布林约夫开涮，但如果你想这样做的话，可以用更有创意的方法来对付他。这太可悲了。

original: Let's soak in the hot springs.
string: 我们去泡温泉吧。

original: All right.
string: 好吧。

original: We should get going.
string: 我们应该走了。

original: This was nice. We should come back another time.
string: 这里很不错。我们应该下次再来。

original: We should get going.
string: 我们应该走了。

original: So soon?
string: 这么快？

original: We should get going.
string: 我们应该走了。

original: Sounds relaxing! Let's find a good spot.
string: 听起来很轻松！我们找个好地方吧。

original: I'd love that. Will you sit next to me?
string: 我很乐意你能坐在我旁边吗？

original: I was hopin' you'd say that! Let's get away from the crowd a little bit.
string: 我就希望你会这么说。让我们远离人群吧。

original: Aislinn.
string: 阿斯林。

original: Bree.
string: 布里。

original: Cyr.
string: 希尔。

original: Luna.
string: 露娜。

original: Maximillian.
string: 马克西米利安。

original: Rathas.
string: 拉萨斯。

original: So, this is the famous White River. What do you say we take a closer look at the waterfall? I think I see a place we could sit on the rocks.
string: 原来这就是著名的白水河啊。要不要去瀑布那儿看看？那边好像有能坐的石头。

original: So, this is the famous White River. What do you say we take a closer look at the waterfall? I think I see a place we could sit on the rocks.
string: 原来这就是著名的白水河啊。要不要去瀑布那儿看看？那边好像有能坐的石头。

original: I really am more of a dog person!
string: 我真的是个狗派！

original: Shame.
string: 遗憾。

original: What a shame.
string: 太遗憾了。

original: I knew I shoulda killed you for your boat on the island.
string: 早知道在岛上就该为你的船把你干掉。

original: This is where it ends.
string: 这里就是终点。

original: Power won't save you.
string: 力量救不了你。

original: You're just dirt to be cleaned off my boot.
string: 你不过是沾在我靴子上的一粒土，擦掉就行。

original: So much for true love.
string: 这就是所谓真爱啊。

original: Turns out my father was right about you.
string: 看来我父亲对你的评价没错。

original: Say, where did Fathis die exactly? I, ah, ought to give him a decent cremation.
string: 法提斯到底死在哪里？我啊，应该给他来个体面的火葬。

original: It was near the abandoned rowboat. I'm not sure what happened to his body, actually.
string: 就在那艘废弃的划艇附近。我不知道他的尸体后来怎么样了。

original: Oh. I wish- ahem. I uh, guess the guards cleaned up the mess, then (forced laugh). An unmarked grave somewhere was probably inevitable for both of us, and the best we could hope for.
string: 哦。我希望-我猜守卫已经清理干净了。对我们俩来说，在某个地方埋个无名墓也许是不可避免的，也是我们所能希望的最好结果。

original: I love you, Val, and this doesn't change anything for me... but I don't want to get married. EVER.
string: 我爱你，瓦尔，这不会改变我的任何事…但我不想结婚。永远。

original: Okay, okay. My momentary insanity has passed. As long as I have your heart, I'm content. You certainly have mine, love.
string: 好了，好了。我一时的疯狂已经过去了，只要有你的心，我就满足了。你当然也拥有我的心，亲爱的。

original: Mistakes. My mistakes?! I've covered for your fuck-ups more times than I can count!
string: 错误。我的错误？我为你的失误包庇的次数都数不过来了。

original: Oh, and there it is. I'm just the unwanted bastard who only gets noticed when you and Tarek need someone to blame!
string: 就是这样。我只是个没人要的混蛋。只有在你和塔里克需要人指责的时候才会被注意到。

original: You were always his favorite. You sound just like him!
string: 你一直是他的最爱。你说话跟他一模一样。嗯。

original: Just like... in Solitude. Go on, 'brother,' kill me! It's the only choice.
string: 就像…在独孤城里一样。来吧，“兄弟”，杀了我！这是唯一的选择！

original: Very well. Look in the hold, Seeker.
string: 很好。看看船舱，探索者。

original: No. There is always a choice. We fought often, but we always made it right. It was so much more good than bad.
string: 不，总有选择。我们经常吵架，但我们总能化干戈为玉帛。好的比坏的多得多。

original: I never told Hermaeus Mora about that, but I'm done hiding it. I love my brother, and I will find him.
string: 我从没跟赫麦尤斯-莫拉说过 但我不想再隐瞒了。我爱我的哥哥，我会找到他的。

original: Now... what couldn't Fathis tell me?
string: 现在…法提斯有什么不能告诉我的？

original: Any thoughts about this person?
string: 对这个人有印象吗？

original: He seems to have retired as a successful, wealthy merchant captain. That wouldn't be the case if we were acquainted.
string: 他看起来是功成身退的富商船长。若与我打过照面，可就没这好事了。

original: Have you ever met Captain Lonely-Gale?
string: 你遇见过“孤风”船长吗？

original: Do you need healing?
string: 你需要治疗吗？

original: No. It had to be one of us, heh.
string: 不…不…肯定是我们中的一个。

original: Fathis? You look like shit.
string: 法提斯？你看起来糟透了！

original: You should see the other guy... ha ha ha...
string: 你应该，嗯…去看看另一个人…哈哈。

original: This damned amulet. I wish I'd never found it. I can't seem to take it off!
string: 这个该死的护符！真希望我从来没发现过它。我怎么也摘不下来…

original: No! I already gave you Zirik. I know Val tried to stop us, but you can't have him! I won't do it!
string: 不…我已经把齐里克交给你了。我知道瓦尔想阻止我们，但你不能得到他！我不会这么做的。

original: No! Not that either! I'll- I'll think of something else. What more do you want from me?!
string: 不！也不是那个！我…我会想别的办法。你还想要我怎样？

original: Get out of my head! I've given you enough! You can have my soul if you can pry it from my corpse!
string: 滚出我的脑袋！我给你的已经够多了！你可以拥有我的灵魂，只要你能从我的尸体上撬开它！

original: I'm not dead yet...
string: 我还没死呢…

original: Filthy rodent!
string: 肮脏的老鼠！

original: Overgrown grasshopper!
string: 长不大的蚂蚱！

original: The flying ones are the worst!
string: 会飞的是最糟糕的！

original: Die, you ankle-biting blue vermin!
string: 去死吧，你们这些咬人脚踝的蓝色害虫！

original: I've got the cure for your curse.
string: 我有治疗你诅咒的方法。

original: I'll make a trophy out of your fangs!
string: 我要用你的尖牙做个战利品！

original: Piece of junk!
string: 垃圾！

original: I'll sell you for parts!
string: 我要把你当零件卖了！

original: You're gonna be dinner.
string: 你会成为晚餐。

original: Time to put you down.
string: 是时候把你放下来了。

original: You'll wish you were never born!
string: 你会希望自己从未出生过！

original: Shut your mouth or I'm gonna shut it for you.
string: 闭上你的嘴，不然我帮你闭上。

original: You a Dark Elf lover? Don't think I can take you?
string: 你是黑暗精灵的姘头？觉得我收拾不了你？

original: As a matter of fact, I don't.
string: 老实说，我帮不了。

original: That wasn't a fair swing!
string: 刚才那招不算数！

original: No, it sure wasn't. I did enjoy it, though!
string: 才不是呢！不过嘛，我玩得挺开心！

original: I catch you running your mouth again you're gonna lose teeth.
string: 再让我听见你满嘴跑火车，小心牙给你打掉！

original: Don't look at me like that. I was on good behavior. Let's go.
string: 别这么看着我。我可一直规规矩矩的。走吧。

original: You picked the wrong mark, thief.
string: 你选错目标了，小偷。

original: So much for true love.
string: 这就是所谓真爱啊。

original: Turns out my father was right about you.
string: 看来我父亲对你的评价没错。

original: What a shame.
string: 太遗憾了。

original: Ha ha ha! Val, I can't believe your plan worked! The port's ours! Let's meet up with Tarek and tell him the good news!
string: 哈哈哈！瓦尔，真不敢相信你的计划成功了！港口是我们的了；让我们去见塔里克，告诉他这个好消息！

original: Do you think father is proud of me? I was brave. I didn't cry.
string: 你觉得父亲会为我感到骄傲吗？我很勇敢，我没有哭。

original: Lookin' out to sea! This will be a grand adventure!
string: 眺望大海！这将是一次伟大的冒险。

original: I'll be... ruthless! A corsair! The master of the ocean!
string: 我会…冷酷无情！一个海盗海洋的主人！

original: Captain!
string: 船长。

original: Hey there. Have we met? You're great, too!
string: 你好啊。我们见过面吗？你也很棒。

original: How did you find me?
string: 你是怎么找到我的？

original: I screw up and nearly get you killed, and somehow you're gonna make it all about you. Val, you s'wit, you're worse than Tarek!
string: 我搞砸了，差点害死你，你却要把一切都归咎于自己。瓦尔，你个机灵鬼，你比塔里克还坏。

original: Oh, I feel like shit. You had good timing. They had just healed me up to start again on-
string: 我感觉…呃，像屎一样。你来得正好，他们刚把我治好，准备重新开始。

original: I don't think I want to talk about that.
string: 我不想谈这个。

original: (sigh) I wish I'd told you. You'd have been an insufferable ass about it, though.
string: 真希望我告诉了你不过，你会成为一个难以忍受的混蛋。

original: Undoubtedly, brother. I couldn't even sacrifice you to the Daedra properly.
string: 嘿嘿。毫无疑问，兄弟，我甚至没能好好地把你献祭给大魔王。

original: I always wondered which one of us would win in a real fight. Kinda hoped it would be you.
string: 我一直在想，如果真打起来，我们谁会赢。我有点希望是你。

original: I'm glad I wasn't wrong.
string: 我很高兴我没有错。

original: You're still a snowback pretty boy, though.
string: 不过，你还是个雪背美少年。

original: Eh, well, 'plan' is a strong term. I was, uh, caught up in the moment. You know, improvising! Heh heh heh! I was trying to kill you... until I wasn't.
string: 呃，“计划”这个词用得太重了。我只是，呃，一时兴起，你知道吗？即兴发挥。嘿，我本来想杀了你…但我没有。

original: Val, I know he's your father - I guess he's mine too - but, to Oblivion with him!
string: 瓦尔，我知道他是你的父亲--我想他也是我的父亲--但是，和他一起去湮灭吧！

original: I don't know what I expected, but I never should have gone looking for him.
string: 我不知道自己在期待什么，但我真不该去找他。

original: I should have trusted you. I'm sorry.
string: 我应该相信你的，对不起。

original: You're sorry, I'm sorry. Everybody's a sorry fetcher!
string: 你对不起我，我对不起你。每个人都是可怜人。

original: You don't have anything to be sorry for, do you?
string: 你没有什么可遗憾的，不是吗？

original: I'm sorry for what you went through.
string: 我为你所经历的一切感到难过。

original: How kind of you to say so! Not to worry; I forgive you.
string: 你这么说真是太好了。别担心，我原谅你了！

original: Not at the moment.
string: 现在什么也没得。

original: Ah, I thought you looked like a smart one. Never confess to anything.
string: 我觉得你看起来很聪明。从不承认任何事。

original: Once, when I was a child, I took a sweetroll without paying. Another time I-
string: 有一次，我还是个孩子，没付钱就拿了一个甜面包卷。还有一次…

original: Oh, will you look at the time! We should get to the ship. The tide and good weather wait for no one.
string: 你看看时间我们该上船了。潮水和好天气是不会等人的。

original: Wait- I think I remember you. You were on the road by Solitude.
string: 等等…我想我记得你。你在孤独路边。

original: I was there.
string: 我当时在场。

original: What a way to meet. I'm not sure how you got mixed up in all of this, but I know you didn't have to come here.
string: 多好的见面方式啊。我不知道你是怎么卷进这一切的，但我知道你没必要来这里。

original: Thank you for helping me.
string: 谢谢你的帮助。

original: Would you like a healing potion?
string: 你需要治疗药水吗？

original: Oh, that would hit the spot. Thanks again.
string: 这可真是一针见血。再次感谢。

original: Would you like me to use a healing spell?
string: 你想让我用治疗咒语吗？

original: I'll drink a healing potion back on board the Rose. I've had enough magic thrown at me to last a lifetime, no offense.
string: 我会在黑玫瑰号上喝下治疗药水。我这辈子受的魔法够多了。无意冒犯。

original: Are you going to be alright?
string: 你还好么？

original: I honestly don't know. But I'm alive and I'm free, so it's a start. That's something Val always used to say when we were in a tough spot.
string: 我真的不知道。但我还活着，我自由了，这是个开始。当我们陷入困境时，瓦尔总是这么说。

original: What's the plan?
string: 计划是什么？

original: What? You can't be serious- no, you are. You wouldn't joke about this.
string: 什么？你不是认真的吧？不，你是认真的。你不会拿这个开玩笑的。

original: But what about you? I can't even buy out your share properly right now.
string: 那你呢？我现在连你的股份都买不起。

original: Well in that case, of course I'll take her! I'm honored.
string: 这样的话，我当然会带她走！我很荣幸。

original: Hey, ahem... Do you mind if I ask you something? Are you two, together?
string: 你介意我问你一件事吗？你们俩在一起吗？

original: Yes, I think we might have something special.
string: 是的，我想我们可能有一些特别的东西。

original: Someone finally got that rake thinking about settling down. Never thought I'd see the day! He looks happy.
string: 终于有人让那浪子想安定下来了。我从没想过有这么一天，他看起来很开心。

original: Yes, it happened quickly, but we're in love.
string: 是的，事情发生得很快，但我们相爱了。

original: Well, I'll be damned! Someone finally tied him down. I never thought I'd see the day. He must have fallen hard for you; he looks happy.
string: 我真该死，终于有人把他绑住了。没想到我会看到这一天。他一定很喜欢你，他看起来很开心。

original: Well, yes, but it's complicated.
string: 嗯，是的，但这很复杂。

original: Hah! It doesn't surprise me that idiot would make things harder than they need to be. He must have fallen hard for you; he looks happy.
string: 哈，我一点也不惊讶这个白痴会把事情搞得比他们需要的还要难。他一定很喜欢你，他看起来很开心。

original: Take good care of him for me. I wasn't much of a friend to him the last few years.
string: 替我好好照顾他。过去几年，我对他来说不是个好朋友。

original: Hay- Do you mind if I ask you something? Are you two, close?
string: 介意我问你个问题吗？你们俩关系好吗？

original: We've been through a lot together and become friends. Why do you ask?
string: 我们一起经历了很多，并成为了朋友。为什么这么问？

original: It's just- he seems happy! I haven't seen him like that in a long time. I'm glad for him.
string: 啊，只是他看起来很高兴。我很久没见他这样了。我为他感到高兴。

original: And- (sigh) I hope you'll be a better friend to him than I was these last few years.
string: 我希望你能做一个比过去几年的我更好的朋友。

original: Don't be so hard on yourself. You're Val's brother and he loves you.
string: 别对自己太苛刻。你是瓦尔的弟弟，他爱你。

original: It's funny, all those years and Tarek would never say if I was his son. Val and I decided a long time ago that it didn't matter. He's the only family I've got.
string: 真有趣，这么多年来塔里克从没说过我是他儿子。瓦尔和我很久以前就认为这不重要了。他是我唯一的亲人。

original: You're stronger than you think. You never gave Molag Bal what he wanted.
string: 你比自己想象的要坚强。你从未给过莫拉格·巴尔他想要的东西。

original: Maybe you're right. Val's the only family I've got, and that was something I held on to when I didn't have anything else.
string: 也许你是对的瓦尔是我唯一的家人，在我一无所有的时候，这是我唯一的依靠。

original: Take some time to get your thoughts together. You've been through a lot.
string: 花点时间整理一下思绪。你们经历了很多。

original: I'll, uh, try to take your advice. Val's the only family I've got but we let a lot of things get in the way.
string: 我会尽量采纳你的建议。瓦尔是我唯一的家人，但我们让很多事情挡住了去路。

original: And now I have a pirate ship! If you ever need anything - and I do mean anything - you let me know. You're always welcome on the Dark Rose.
string: 现在我有一艘海盗船！

original: Fair winds and following seas.
string: 顺风顺水。希望有缘再见。

original: You don't scare me!
string: 你吓不倒我。

original: I'll run you through!
string: （笑声）

original: Is that all you've got?
string: 你就只有这点本事？

original: Nobody makes me bleed my own blood!
string: 没人能让我流血！

original: You hit like a Breton!
string: 你打得像布莱顿人！

original: I've been thinkin' about that. Look, uh, I want you to have the ship. The Dark Rose is yours, if you'll take her.
string: 我一直在考虑这个问题。听着，我想把船给你。如果你愿意，黑玫瑰号就是你的了。

original: Who said anything about selling my share?
string: 谁说要卖掉我的股份了？

original: You'll need a factor on land. I'll help you with connections, make some... 'introductions.'
string: 你需要在陆地上的一个因素。我会帮你建立关系，做一些…“介绍”。

original: I'll come out even - or better - so don't worry about it.
string: 我的成绩会持平，甚至更好，所以不用担心。

original: Just don't do anything I wouldn't do.
string: 只要不做我不会做的事。

original: Now, let's get out of here.
string: 我们走吧。

original: Just Val, please. We saw your journal. Fathis, brother... I had no idea. I'm- I'm so sorry.
string: 请叫我瓦尔，求你了。法提斯，兄弟… 我很抱歉。

original: Damnit. I wish I'd known what you were going through. I wish I'd known about a lot of things.
string: 真希望我知道你的经历，该死的，我真希望我知道很多事情。

original: Heh heh. Knock it off, already. Are you all right? You look like shit.
string: 嘿嘿。别闹了。你还好吗？你看起来糟透了。

original: Probably. But, you'd have deserved it!
string: 也许吧，嘿嘿嘿… 但你活该。

original: Hunh... You knife-eared, ash-skinned bastard! You wanted me to kill you? That was your plan?!
string: 你这个刀耳灰皮肤的混蛋！你想让我杀了你？这就是你的计划？

original: ...What would Tarek say if he saw us now?
string: …如果塔里克现在看到我们，他会怎么说？

original: We really are brothers, you know. Our father wanted us to be rivals. I shouldn't have let my ambition come between us. I was wrong. I'm sorry, too.
string: 我们真的是兄弟。我们的父亲希望我们成为对手。我不该让我的野心介入我们之间。我错了，我也很抱歉。

original: (cheers)
string: （欢呼声）

original: (cheers)
string: （欢呼声）

original: (cheers)
string: （欢呼声）

original: (cheers)
string: （欢呼声）

original: (cheers)
string: （欢呼声）

original: This was the day the Dark Rose earned a place in Stros M'Kai.
string: 这一天，黑玫瑰在斯特罗斯·迈凯赢得了一席之地。

original: Fathis and I used to be inseparable. I should have taught him more, should have taken him under my wing.
string: 法提斯和我曾经形影不离。我应该多教他一些东西，应该把他放在我的羽翼下。

original: But, I was too concerned with what my father thought back then.
string: 但是，那时我太在意父亲的想法了。

original: Ah, he's back! Welcome aboard, son! Glad to see you made something of yourself while you were away.
string: 啊，他回来了！欢迎上船，孩子！很高兴看到你在离开的这段时间有所成就。

original: Did your old man proud in the Imperial Navy of all places! (laughs)
string: 你父亲在帝国海军中为你感到骄傲！

original: We got a lot to plan now, meet me in my cabin once your gear is stowed.
string: 我们现在有很多事要计划。你们的装备放好后，到我的船舱来找我。

original: I can't begin to guess how his journal ended up in here, but this is Fathis' handwriting.
string: 我不知道他的日记怎么会在这里，但这是法提斯的笔迹。

original: He wrote about finding a relic cursed by Molag Bal. Wait, wait- I know that place. We went there years ago, but I had no idea what he'd found!
string: 他在信里说找到了被莫拉格·巴尔诅咒的遗迹。等等，我知道那个地方。我们几年前去过，但我不知道他找到了什么。

original: I could take us there with the Dark Rose whenever you give the word. Let's get out of here. There's nothing further to be learned.
string: 只要你一声令下，我就能带着黑玫瑰去那里。我们走吧，没什么好学的了。

original: Filthy n'wah...
string: 肮脏的贱种…

original: Son of a-
string: 婊子…养的-

original: Uh- ahh... Why?
string: 呃…为什么？

original: Took you long enough to get here, boy. Where's Fathis? Did you lose him? (laughs)
string: 你来得可够久的，小子法提斯呢？跟丢了吗？

original: Is that any way to talk to your old shipmate? How about some honest piracy? It's who you really are.
string: 你就这么跟你的老船友说话？来点诚实的海盗行为怎么样？这才是真正的你。

original: You want to know what happened to poor Fathis. I'd like to know why, considering he died a traitor... the first time.
string: 你想知道可怜的法提斯怎么了？我想知道为什么，因为他死于叛徒…第一次。

original: A bargain is a bargain, Seeker. Knowledge for knowledge.
string: 讨价还价就是讨价还价，探索者知识换知识。

original: (laughs) It's written plain on your face that you pity him. What a puzzle you are, boy.
string: 从你的脸上可以看出，你很同情他。你真是个谜，孩子。

original: All the while Fathis lives and dies, only to live and die again.
string: 在这期间，法提斯生了又死，死了又生。

original: Your answers have always been here, in the realm that your life built.
string: 你的答案一直都在这里，在你的生命所构建的领域里。

original: My gift to you. Seek your answers beyond with my blessing.
string: 我给你们的礼物。带着我的祝福，到更远的地方寻找答案吧。

original: You can drop the act. I'm here for information.
string: 你可以不用演戏了。我是来打听消息的。

original: You don't know me, creature. Is that what you'd like to bargain? Knowledge for knowledge.
string: 你不了解我，这就是你想讨价还价的吗？知识换知识。

original: The first time? What do you mean?
string: 第一次？什么第一次？

original: Have it your way. I killed Fathis. It was in self defense, but I didn't have to do it. There's always a choice... I didn't have to fight him, but... I didn't have the strength not to.
string: 随你便。我杀了法提斯那是自卫，但我没必要那么做。总有选择的…我没必要跟他打，但是…我没有力量不这么做。

original: Why did you stop me?
string: 你为什么阻止我？

original: What's your problem with Val, anyway?
string: 你跟瓦尔到底有什么过节？

original: How much time do you have?
string: 你有多少时间？

original: Where to begin? He does have so very many problems.
string: 从何说起呢？他确实有很多问题。

original: Why spoil the surprise? Eventually, he'll disappoint you, too.
string: 为什么要破坏惊喜呢？最终，他也会让你失望的。

original: You shouldn't bargain with Daedra. They're evil.
string: 你不应该和迪德拉讨价还价，他们很邪恶！

original: You don't understand. Nothing in Apocrypha is free. There's always strings attached, and I'd rather know what they are!
string: 你不明白。异典里没有免费的东西。总是有附加条件的。我宁愿知道是什么条件。

original: You don't have to take all the risks in this partnership.
string: 在这种合作关系中，你不必承担所有风险。

original: Hahahahahahahahahaha! You were worried? Oh come on, it's me. I got this.
string: 哈哈哈哈哈哈哈！你担心了？哦，来吧，这是我的。我有这个。

original: You're smart, Serano, but you have no damn sense sometimes.
string: 你很聪明，塞拉诺，但有时却很不理智。

original: When I make a Daedric Prince angry, I'd like to have a plan first. Let's hear yours. I'll wait.
string: 当我惹怒一个迪德拉王子时，我想先制定一个计划。说来听听，我等着。

original: Val, Look at this place. It's designed to manipulate you.
string: 瓦尔，看看这个地方。它就是用来操纵你的。

original: I'm aware. It was built from the contents of my mind that I chose, remember?
string: 我知道。它是由我选择的思想内容构建而成的，还记得吗？

original: I'm sorry it looks like this.
string: 很抱歉，它看起来是这样的。

original: I didn't come back here for your pity. I came here to help Fathis.
string: 我回来不是为了你的同情。我是来帮助法提斯的。

original: I haven't seen the worst of it, have I?
string: 我还没看到最糟糕的情况，不是吗？

original: No, you haven't.
string: 不，你没有。

original: It's horrible here.
string: 这里太可怕了。

original: Thanks. Do you have a point?
string: 谢谢。你说的有道理吗？

original: You're incredibly hard on yourself.
string: 你对自己太苛刻了。

original: I have to be.
string: 我必须这样。

original: Why? Where does it lead?
string: 为什么？它通向哪里？

original: It leads to strength. Weak captains get killed.
string: 它能带来力量。弱小的船长会被杀死。

original: I know there's more to you than that.
string: 我知道你不止这些。

original: I've had to hide who I am for so long, I'm not sure I trust who's in there anymore.
string: 我不得不隐藏自己的身份，已经太久了，我不确定自己是否还相信里面的人。

original: You don't have to be ashamed of who you are.
string: 你不必为自己的身份感到羞愧。

original: Hah ha ha ha. Look around you. Who, exactly, do you think I am?
string: 哈哈哈哈。看看你周围你以为我是谁？

original: Like you almost were?
string: 就像你差点儿那样？

original: Yeah. Just like that. I should have known better.
string: 是啊，就是这样。我早该知道的。

original: I trust you.
string: 我相信你。

original: Heh! Well, you'd be the first.
string: 嘿，你是第一个。

original: I think you're a good man who was able to forgive his brother. You could forgive yourself, too.
string: 我觉得你是个好人，能够原谅自己的哥哥。你也可以原谅自己。

original: Maybe... When we find him... I'll be able to.
string: 也许…等我们找到他…我就能…

original: You're wrong. There's strength in compassion, too.
string: 你错了，同情也是一种力量。

original: Huh. Maybe I never would have found myself on that road outside Solitude.
string: 咦？也许我永远也不会发现自己走在独孤城外的那条路上。

original: What if, instead of your worst moments, this place was built from your best memories?
string: 如果这个地方不是你最糟糕的时刻，而是你最美好的回忆，那会怎样？

original: You mean... What, if I revealed things I was proud of?
string: 你是说…如果我揭露了我引以为傲的事呢？

original: Exactly. How would that feel?
string: 没错。那会是什么感觉？

original: It would feel... better. Good, even.
string: 感觉会…更好。甚至最好。

original: Daedric Princes push us towards the extremes... you'll tell me if my head gets too big, right?
string: 迪德拉王子把我们推向极端…如果我的头太大了，你会告诉我的，对吗？

original: What did you need to tell me?
string: 你需要告诉我什么？

original: I told you once that my hands aren't clean. My father said kill, you killed. There are no spectators on a pirate ship.
string: 我说过我的手不干净。父亲说杀，你就得杀。海盗船上没有观众。

original: I served under his command for a lot of years. Then, I was the one in command. We were still corsairs. You understand?
string: 我在他手下干了很多年。后来，我成了指挥官。我们还是海盗你明白吗？

original: This is a memory of a time you killed someone?
string: 这是你杀人时的记忆？

original: This is where it started. My first... real... raid.
string: 这是它开始的地方。我第一次真正意义上的突袭。

original: It was a merchant ship, and the captain's son was on board. He couldn't have been more than thirteen; about the same age as me, at the time.
string: 那是一艘商船，船长的儿子也在船上。他不超过 13 岁，当时和我差不多大。

original: The kid was brave. Grown men fighting all around on the deck and he still held a sword.
string: 这孩子很勇敢。大男人们在甲板上四处厮杀，他却还拿着一把剑。

original: He didn't even know how to use it.
string: 他甚至不知道如何使用它。

original: And you killed him.
string: 你杀了他？

original: Yes. I killed that boy.
string: 是的，我杀了那个男孩。

original: But... You were just a kid yourself. Tarek made you do it.
string: 但是…你当时还是个孩子，是塔里克让你这么做的

original: I still did it.
string: 我还是做了。

original: You're not the person you used to be. You've changed for the better.
string: 你已经不是过去的你了。你变了，变得更好了。

original: I swore to myself I wouldn't take another innocent life. And I failed at that promise for years before I learned to keep it.
string: 我对自己发誓，不会再夺走一条无辜的生命。在我学会信守诺言之前，我已经失败了很多年。

original: I'm not sure what to say.
string: 我不知道该说什么。

original: You don't have to say anything. I just appreciate that you're still here.
string: 你什么都不用说。我只是感激你还在这里

original: We should go on deck.
string: 我们该上甲板了。

original: I won't lie to you about the things I did. I- I'll understand if you think differently about me.
string: 我不会对你撒谎的。如果你对我有不同的看法，我会理解的。

original: Well, this is it. We're miles off shore, and birds don't land here, so it's hard to find if you don't know what you're looking for.
string: 就是这里了。我们离海岸有几英里远，鸟儿也不在这里降落。所以如果你不知道自己在找什么，就很难找到它。

original: Fathis was the only one who actually researched the location. At the time, I thought it was a good sign he was finally taking interest in the, ah, exploratory side of the business.
string: 法提斯是唯一一个真正研究过地点的人。当时，我觉得这是个好兆头，说明他终于对业务的探索方面感兴趣了。

original: Be on your guard. This place was deserted the last time I came here; I have a feeling that won't be the case this time.
string: 提高警惕。我上次来的时候，这里冷冷清清；我有预感，这次不会了。

original: My companion would like a moment of your time, please. He's a big fan.
string: 我的同伴想占用您一点时间，谢谢。他是我的忠实粉丝

original: Yes?
string: 什么？

original: Hello! Uh, it's, ah, nice to meet you. Sir.
string: 你好！呃，很高兴见到你。先生。

original: Seen them? I've read all three of your books on the Dwemer! You have a groundbreaking, rational perspective.
string: 见过吗？我读过你关于锻莫的三本书你有开创性的理性观点。

original: I wanted to ask you a question about the mathematics of Dwemer architecture, if that would be alright.
string: 如果可以的话，我想问你一个关于锻莫建筑数学的问题。

original: Uhrhm. Well, uh, you describe the mathematics of calculating curves as imprecise and risky, but spherical geometry is quite precise, even over long distances. I've had... some... direct experience with this in navigation.
string: 呃嗯，你说计算曲线的数学方法既不精确又有风险。但球面几何学是相当精确的。即使是在长距离范围内我在导航方面有过…一些…直接经验。

original: Have you considered that Dwemer construction could have been limited more by the lack of precision in their masonry tools than their mathematical skills?
string: 你有没有想过，锻莫的建筑技术可能更多的是受限于他们的砖石工具不够精确，而不是他们的数学技能？

original: Of course it's not just an academic theory. I've made quite a few direct observations over the years. You never find calipers in ruins this far north, for example.
string: 当然，这不仅仅是一种学术理论。这些年来，我已经进行过多次直接观察。比如，在这么北的废墟里，你永远找不到卡尺。

original: My colleague and I were able to make celestial observations from Mzulft recently.
string: 我和我的同事最近得以在姆祖伏特进行天体观测。

original: The machinery is incredibly well-preserved and still functional!
string: 这些机器保存得非常完好，而且仍然可以正常使用！

original: I was thinking about making it my thesis for the College, actually...
string: 事实上，我正考虑把它作为我的毕业论文…

original: Heh. Thanks! I'm glad you think so. Nice talkin' with ya.
string: 呵。谢谢！很高兴你这么想。很高兴和你聊天。

original: Ah, hm. Have you by chance seen my research notes?
string: 啊，嗯。你看过我的研究笔记吗？

original: Enthusiasm, good! Another opportunity to learn.
string: 热情，很好！又一个学习的机会。

original: Please, please! This is exactly what I'm talking about. Who am I to stand in the way of curiosity?
string: 拜托，拜托。这正是我要说的。我有什么资格妨碍你的好奇心？

original: (laughs) I'm not certain how many scholars you're accustomed to dealing with...
string: 我不确定你习惯与多少学者打交道…

original: Well, this is highly unusual... maybe... if we can find out...
string: 嗯，这很不寻常…也许…如果我们能找到的话。

original: I certainly wasn't expecting this. You've just made an important contribution to the advancement of our Dwemer scholarship. Wonderful!
string: 我当然没想到会这样。你刚刚为我们锻莫的学术进步做出了重要贡献。太好了！

original: A most pleasant chat! Until the next.
string: 一次最愉快的聊天！下次再见。

original: I can't seem to get anywhere. Maybe if you talked to Calcelmo...
string: 我好像什么都做不了也许你可以和卡尔塞莫谈一下…

original: I do have a way with people...
string: 我确实有办法与人…

original: Calcelmo, are you sure you can't allow us a preview of your Falmer translations?
string: 卡塞莫，你真的不能让我们预览一下你的伐莫译文吗？

original: We're getting ready for an expedition and you know how things are once you get into the field. We'll be away for months.
string: 我们正准备进行一次远征，你知道一旦进入野外，情况会是怎样的。我们要离开几个月。

original: We're years away from publication of course, but, well, I'd be honored if you'd write the foreward to the book. After all, our work is only possible with the groundwork you've laid.
string: 当然，我们还有很多年才能出版，但是，如果您能为我们的书写前言，我会感到非常荣幸。毕竟，我们的工作离不开您打下的基础。

original: Of course! What kind of a mentor would I be if I didn't give a potential student a glimpse of his master's ingenuity?
string: 当然！如果我不给潜在的学生展示一下他师傅的聪明才智，那我还算什么导师呢？

original: What would you do without me? Now we can walk right in and inspect Calcelmo's notes at our leisure.
string: 没有我你们该怎么办？现在我们可以径直走进去，随意查看卡塞莫的笔记了。

original: What's the meaning of this interruption? We're invited guests of Calcelmo, and are doing important research!
string: 这次中断是什么意思？我们是卡西莫公司邀请的客人，正在做重要的研究！

original: You picked the wrong mark, thief.
string: 你选错目标了，小偷。

original: We should keep moving.
string: 我们得继续前进。

original: I'm with ya.
string: 我支持你。

original: Lead on, my friend.
string: 请继续，我的朋友。

original: I'm always with you.
string: 我永远与你同在。

original: Lead the way, love.
string: 带路吧，亲爱的。

original: Trust me.
string: 相信我。

original: Eh, we'll talk later.
string: 我们以后再谈吧。

original: Hm.
string: 嗯。

original: You're lucky you got me around.
string: 你很幸运，有我在身边。

original: I'm with you.
string: 我和你一起。

original: If you need me, I won't be far.
string: 如果你需要我，我就在不远处。

original: What would you do without me?
string: 没有我，你该怎么办？

original: We've got this.
string: 我们得到了这个。

original: I've got your back.
string: 我来殿后。

original: I'll be right behind you.
string: 我就在你身后。

original: I'm just going to say it. Vilkas? Kind of a dick.
string: 我就直说了。威尔卡斯？有点混蛋。

original: I'm surprised you're concerned about Derkeethus.
string: 我很惊讶你居然会关心德吉图斯。

original: Eh well don't tell anyone; it'll be bad for my reputation.
string: 好吧，别告诉别人，这会有损我的名声。

original: No really, I'm glad.
string: 不，说真的，我很高兴。

original: All right, fine, I'll tell you the reason.
string: 好吧，好吧，我来告诉你原因。

original: We don't even know him.
string: 我们甚至都不了解他。

original: I know, and he's probably dead already so it's not like we'd get paid, but still...
string: 我知道，他可能已经死了，所以我们也拿不到钱，但还是…

original: He's an Argonian.
string: 他是个亚龙人。

original: Dunmer, Nord, Argonian... that doesn't matter to me. I've been shipmates with all of them.
string: 丹莫人、诺德人、亚龙人…对我来说都无所谓。我和他们都是船友。

original: Of course.
string: 当然。

original: This is going to sound foolish, but-
string: 这听起来很傻，但是-

original: That depends on how funny you're going to be.
string: 那得看你的幽默程度了。

original: Just know, if you do laugh, there's gonna be payback when you least expect it.
string: 只要知道，如果你笑了，就会在你最意想不到的时候得到回报。

original: I absolutely do not promise.
string: 我绝对不能答应。

original: Hunh. Well then you might as well laugh. It's a ridiculous sentiment on my part.
string: 唉。那你还是笑吧。我的想法太可笑了。

original: Promise not to laugh?
string: 你能保证不笑吗？

original: Don't look so surprised. I could have lived my whole life in Morrowind and they'd still call me 'Outlander.'
string: 别这么惊讶。我可以在晨风中生活一辈子，他们还是会叫我“外乡人”。

original: Things are simpler at sea.
string: 在海上事情就简单多了。

original: When I was a boy... (sigh)... my father used to threaten that if I misbehaved, the Falmer would come and get me in my sleep.
string: 当我还是个孩子的时候…我父亲经常威胁说，如果我行为不端，伐莫就会在我睡觉的时候来抓我。

original: Because, you know, they hate Nords. And they really do abduct people. I mean I had nightmares about this for years.
string: 因为，你知道，他们讨厌诺德人。他们真的会绑架人。我的意思是，这几年我一直做噩梦。
