original: These mountains are Falmer country. I just don't like the idea of anyone ending up in their hands.
string: 这些山是伐莫的国度。我只是不希望有人落到他们手里。

original: Cheers! To new friendships... and my survival!
string: 干杯！为新的友谊干杯…也为我活了下来！

original: I'd like to show you one of my favorite spots. It's on top of the city walls. You can see for miles on a clear day, although that's rare for the Sea of Ghosts.
string: 我带您去看看我最喜欢的一个景点。在城墙顶上天气晴朗的时候，你可以看到几英里外的景色，虽然这在幽灵之海是很少见的。

original: I have a gift for you.
string: 我有个礼物给你。

original: Oh, what is it? What did you bring me?
string: 是什么东西？你带给我什么？

original: It's a toy.
string: 这只是个玩具。

original: I made a warm outfit for you.
string: 我给你做了一套暖和些的衣服。

original: A tasty treat.
string: 美味小食。

original: I brought you a book.
string: 我给你带了本书。

original: You're old enough to have your own dagger.
string: 是时候给你一把属于自己的匕首了。

original: Nevermind.
string: 算了。

original: Aww...
Aww...
I hope it's an adventure story with dragons and mages and daedra and treasures!
string: 希望这是个有龙有法师有魔族还有宝藏的冒险故事！

original: I've never gotten to wear anything this nice before. It's so cozy and warm!
string: 我还从没穿过这么漂亮的衣服呢，又舒服又暖和！

original: I'm not sure I should have this... but, I- I'm sure it will be just fine!
string: 我不该拿这个的…不过，肯…肯定没问题的！

original: I'll practice every day and I promise to only stab people who really deserve it!
string: 我会每天练习，而且保证只捅那些罪有应得的家伙！

original: I'm going to start right now.
string: 我准备开始啦。

original: Um. The practicing part. Not the stabbing part!
string: 我是说练习那部分！不是捅人那部分啊！

original: Eh. I guess this is good for me.
string: 呃…我猜这个对我有好处。

original: Yummy! Thank you.
string: 真不错！谢谢你。

original: Ooh, thank you! I love him!
string: 谢谢你！我爱他！

original: I don't think papa is going to like it, though. Hehe!
string: 我不觉得爸爸会喜欢。

original: I'm going to dress her up to be... Oh! An adventurer, just like you and Papa!
string: 我要把她打扮成…啊！就跟你和爸爸一样的冒险家！

original: Let me see your things, please.
string: 麻烦让我看看你的东西。

original: Okay, have a look.
string: 好，给你看。

original: Before you get upset, let me explain. Not that there's anything in there to be upset about.
string: 在失望之前，你先别急，听我解释。虽然里头其实也没什么好急的。

original: If I'm not supposed to have it, then I have no idea how it got into my pockets.
string: 如果这东西不该归我，那我也不知道它是怎么跑进我口袋的。

original: Let's see. If I stick the soul gem inside the plushie, that ought to do the trick.
string: 让我想想……如果把灵魂宝石塞进玩偶里，应该就能搞定了。

original: I don't think it'll catch on fire.
string: 我觉得这东西应该不会着火。

original: Now I draw the rune- oops! That one means 'exaggerate.' I'll just scratch it out.
string: 现在我来画这个符文——哎呀！这个符号是“夸大”的意思…算了，涂掉重来。

original: What was the rune for 'animate?'
string: “活化符文”是哪个？

original: There. I think it's working!
string: 这里。我想奏效了！

original: Gah!
string: 啊！

original: I- Is that... ah, a chaurus?
string: 那…那个是，一个查鲁斯？

original: It's a toy! That's uh, great, Dragonfly. Ah, it sure is lifelike.
string: 是个玩具啊！呃，不错嘛…小龙。哈，做得还挺逼真。

original: Wha- wait, enchanted? Where did you get a soul gem? Please tell me there's not an actual chaurus soul in your toy.
string: 什——等等，附魔的？你从哪儿搞来的灵魂石？别告诉我你那玩具里真塞了个查鲁斯之魂啊…

original: How do you like my new toy, Papa?
string: 你喜欢我的新玩具吗，爸爸？

original: It sure is! I enchanted my plushie to run around, and I did it all by myself.
string: 那当然！我给玩偶附了魔，让它能到处跑，而且全是我一个人搞定的！

original: Oh Papa, don't be silly! It came from a chicken. It was going to be dinner anyway.
string: 爸爸，别犯傻啦！这可是从鸡身上来的。反正它本来也要被吃掉的！

original: But maybe you could get a proper chaurus-filled soul gem for me on your next adventure?
string: 不过，下次冒险时能帮我弄块正经的查鲁斯充能灵魂石吗？

original: Have you ever tried the Spiced Wine here? It's one of my favorites.
string: 您品尝过这里的五香葡萄酒吗？这是我的最爱之一。

original: They say it warms the blood. Some days when the wind blows hard from the north, even I feel the cold.
string: 据说它能温暖血液。有些时候，北风呼啸，连我自己都会感到寒冷。

original: Hold on, not so fast. I still want to know how you got your hands on a soul gem.
string: 等等，先别急。我还是想知道，你从哪儿搞到那颗“灵魂宝石”的？

original: Heh, you've got me there. I did say that.
string: 被你逮着了。我确实说过这话。

original: But no more unsupervised experiments. I'm getting you a magic tutor.
string: 但以后不准再一个人瞎捣鼓实验了。我给你找个魔法导师。

original: Ah-ah! You told me that I shouldn't give up my sources.
string: 可是你明明说过，我不能出卖线人的呀。

original: I can study magic for real? Oh thank you, Papa!
string: 我可以学习真正的魔法？谢谢你，爸爸！

original: And I'm sorry I scared you with my plushie.
string: 我也很抱歉我的玩偶吓到了你。

original: If you say so, but you jumped in the air, your voice went high-pitched, and your eyes got all big - like this!
string: 你要这么说也行，可你刚才直接蹦起来了，声音都吓尖了，眼睛瞪得老大…就像这样！

original: It was funny! Hehehe, hm.
string: 真的很好玩！

original: Scared? I wasn't scared. I was just startled is all.
string: 害怕？我才没害怕。只是被吓了一跳而已。

original: Argh. Let's hope I don't 'accidentally' cast a lightning bolt at that thing.
string: 但愿我不会“不小心”朝那玩意儿甩个闪电箭。

original: Filthy n'wah! Pick on someone your own size!
string: 肮脏的贱民！有种挑个跟你一样大的打！

original: Mama! How could you?!
string: 妈妈！你怎么能这样！

original: I am so mad!
string: 我要抓狂了！

original: Papa! How could you?!
string: 爸爸！你怎么能这样！

original: I am so mad!
string: 我要抓狂了！

original: How could you?!
string: 你怎么能这样！

original: I am so mad!
string: 我要抓狂了！

original: How do you like the view?
string: 你喜欢这里的风景吗？

original: I like it a lot.
string: 我非常喜欢。

original: I could show you a few more sights sometime, if you're interested.
string: 如果你有兴趣，我可以带你多看几个景点。

original: It's not bad.
string: 还不错。

original: Hah! Not easily impressed, I see. Well, give me half a chance and I might be able to surprise you later.
string: 哈看来你不容易被打动啊好吧，给我半点机会，我以后也许能给你惊喜。

original: I've seen better.
string: 我见过更好的。

original: Heh, tough crowd. Why don't you pick the destination next time?
string: 呵，难缠的家伙。下次为什么不选目的地呢？

original: I'm interested.
string: 我的确有兴趣。

original: What a coincidence, so am I. Let's do this again sometime.
string: 真巧，我也是。

original: I could be persuaded...
string: 我可以被说服…

original: I'll keep a weather eye out for opportunities to be... persuasive.
string: 我会注意天气变化，寻找机会…说服别人。

original: I doubt you can impress me, pirate.
string: 我怀疑你是否能打动我，海盗。

original: Heh heh, is that a challenge?
string: 嘿嘿，这算是挑战吗？

original: Let's keep things STRICTLY business.
string: 让我们严格遵守公事公办的原则。

original: Of course. Ahem. I understand.
string: 当然。我明白。

original: It always amazes me the places you could go if you just walk in like you own the place.
string: 如果你能像对待自己的主人一样走进去，你能去的地方总是让我大吃一惊。

original: Here we are...
string: 我们到了。

original: I hope you don't mind a few stairs? I like to stretch my legs when I'm on shore.
string: 我希望你不介意走几级楼梯？我喜欢在岸上伸伸腿。

original: Papa! How could you?!
string: 爸爸！你怎么能这样！

original: I am so mad!
string: 我要抓狂了！

original: The innkeeper's starin' at us. She's being subtle about it, but something's off. Watch what you say around her.
string: 旅馆老板在盯着我们看。她很含蓄，但有点不对劲。在她面前说话注意点。

original: I read those Emblems along the Seven Thousand Steps. The Greybeards' leader, Paarthurnax? He has the same name as an ancient dragon.
string: 我在七千阶梯上读到了那些徽记，灰胡子的首领，帕斯鲁纳斯？他的名字和一条古龙一样。

original: It is.
string: 是啊。

original: You're not a pushover; I like that. The game's not as much fun if you go easy on me.
string: 你不是个好欺负的人，我喜欢。如果你对我太客气，游戏就没那么好玩了。

original: Absolutely not... right now.
string: 绝对不是…现在。

original: I can toe the line. All work and no play it is... for now.
string: 我可以趾高气扬。只工作不玩耍…暂时如此。

original: Hello! I'm Ravani. What's your name?
string: 你好！我是拉瓦妮。你叫什么名字？

original: I'm sorry, Aventus. My parents died, too.
string: 我很抱歉，阿文图斯。我的父母也都去世了。

original: Me too. I've been awfully lonely.
string: 我也是，一直孤独得要命。

original: You know what? We are gonna be a real family. We have parents to look out for us, and- and I'm your sister now.
string: 你知道吗？我们会成为真正的家人。有父母照顾我们，而且——而且我现在是你姐姐了。

original: We'll always have each other.
string: 我们会一直相伴彼此。

original: Do you promise?
string: 你保证吗？

original: It's Aventus.
string: 这是阿文图斯。

original: My father is gone. My- my mother died. I don't know what to do.
string: 亲走了。母…母亲也去世了。我不知道该怎么办。

original: I want to have a real family.
string: 我想要一个真正的家庭。

original: This is- oh, this is everything I could have asked for. This is great!
string: 这简直是——噢，这就是我梦寐以求的一切！太棒了！

original: Of course! How can I argue with that? It's comforting.
string: 那当然！这还有什么好说的？听着就舒服。

original: Is it true that you did the Black Sacrament to contact... the Dark Brotherhood?
string: 你真的做了黑暗仪式来召唤…黑暗兄弟会吗？

original: And I'd do it again. Grelod got meaner than ever. I really thought she was going to kill one of us.
string: 而且我还会再来一次！桂罗那老妖婆变本加厉，我差点以为她真要杀了我们中的谁…

original: Is that your pet?
string: 这是你的宠物吗？

original: Wow, he looks tough.
string: 看起来怪凶的。

original: Rawrrawr!
string: （大牙哼哼声）

original: Yes, and his name is Chompy. He was a present from our Uncle Fathis.
string: 没错，他叫“大牙”，是舅舅法提斯送的礼物。

original: Say hello, Chompy.
string: 打个招呼，大牙。

original: He's very sweet and doesn't bite - much - once you get to know him.
string: 他其实很温柔，熟了之后就不怎么咬人了——嗯，基本不咬。

original: Aventus? Where are you?
string: 阿文图斯？你在哪里？

original: Aventus! There you are. I have the most, best, incredible idea ever but I need your help.
string: 阿文图斯！可算找到你了！我有个超级绝妙的主意，但得你帮忙才行！

original: I'm gonna turn you... INVISIBLE!
string: 看我把你…变成透明人！

original: The spell should be only temporary. Here goes nothing!
string: 法术效果是暂时的。不管了，拼一把！

original: That's because you're not. (sigh) I'll have to keep practicing.
string: 那是因为你确实不行。看来我还得继续练啊。

original: Okay, okay! You've talked me into it.
string: 好了，好了！算你说服我了。

original: What is it?
string: 什么事？

original: I can't wait to be invisible!
string: 我已经等不及要变成透明人啦！

original: I still feel like I'm here. I don't feel invisible.
string: 我明明就在这儿啊。感觉不到消失了耶。

original: Aww. And here I thought you could do it.
string: 我还以为你可以搞定呢。

original: I'm ready to try making you invisible again, Aventus.
string: 我准备好再试一次让你隐形了，阿文图斯。

original: Trust me! I have it all figured out this time.
string: 相信我！这次我全都计划好了。

original: I'm going to cast... FADE OTHER!
string: 我要施法啦…消隐他人！

original: I don't know...
string: 我不知道…

original: Well... if you say so.
string: 嗯……既然你这么说。

original: Wow! I'm see through!
string: 喔！我透明了！

original: My new pranks are gonna be the best ever. Boo! Hahaha!
string: 我的新恶作剧绝对会是史上最棒的！吓到了吧！

original: Oh! You startled me.
string: 你吓了我一跳！

original: I finished learning a new spell. I wrote it all down so I wouldn't forget.
string: 我学会了一个新法术，全记下来了，免得忘掉。

original: I made a copy for you, too.
string: 我也给你做了份备案。

original: Um, that reminds me. Have you seen Aventus recently?
string: 呃，说到这个...你最近见过阿文图斯吗？

original: Yes.
string: 没错。

original: Well that's a relief! Ha ha ha ha, hah! Ahem. I mean, that's good!
string: 这下可算踏实了！哈哈…咳咳，我是说，挺好！

original: No. Why do you ask?
string: 不。你为什么问这个？

original: Oh, no reason! Uh, just curious.
string: 没啥理由。就是纯粹好奇。

original: I have the mother of all hangovers. Ugh, Oblivion...
string: 我宿醉得厉害。呃，湮灭…

original: Hah! Let's drink this lightweight under the table!
string: 哈！让我们把这杯清淡的酒喝下去吧！

original: I liked the outfit you wore on our boating date.
string: 我喜欢你在我们划船约会时穿的那套衣服。

original: I like that one, too. It has good memories.
string: 我也喜欢这个。它有着美好的回忆。

original: In that case, I'm glad to wear it for you again.
string: 既然如此，我很高兴能再次为您佩戴。

original: I'm gonna need you to wear a helmet without complaining.
string: 我需要你戴上头盔，不要抱怨。

original: I already told you, I hate hats.
string: 我已经告诉过你，我讨厌帽子。

original: How about we compromise and I get your a circlet?
string: 要不我们妥协一下，我给你买个圆环？

original: You're gonna get me a gift? Aw, you don't have to do that.
string: 你要送我礼物？你不必这么做的。

original: Be practical; you're passing up an enchantment slot.
string: 实际一点，你错过了一个施咒的机会。

original: Haah... Gods, you sound like my mother...
string: 哈…天哪，你说话的口气真像我妈…

original: I'd hate to see your handsome face get a scratch.
string: 我可不想看到你英俊的脸被刮伤。

original: Hah hah hah, All right, how can I argue with that?
string: 哈哈哈，好吧，我怎么能反驳呢？

original: I promise not to complain about how long it takes you to fix your hair.
string: 我保证不会抱怨你整理头发花了多长时间。

original: What? I do not take that long with my hair!
string: 我做头发可没那么久！

original: The saying is safety first, not safety third.
string: 俗话说，安全第一，而不是安全第三。

original: And yet, I've survived this long. Consider that I know what I'm doing.
string: 然而，我却活了这么久。我知道自己在做什么。

original: Since you insist, I will sacrifice my hairstyle for your safety concerns.
string: 既然你坚持，为了你的安全考虑，我可以牺牲我的发型。

original: (offer a hug)
string: （给予拥抱）

original: Let's discuss the werewolf situation later, when we don't have these Silver Hand fanatics breathing down our necks.
string: 我们以后再讨论狼人的情况吧，等我们没有这些白银之手的狂热分子盯着我们的脖子的时候。

original: Get ready. All Oblivion could break loose as soon as you move that fragment.
string: 准备好。只要你移动那块碎片，所有的湮灭都可能爆发。

original: Do you know anything about this gem? (show Unusual Gem)
string: 你了解这种宝石吗？（展示不寻常的宝石）

original: Oh wow, never thought I'd see one of these! I think it's a jewel from the Crown of Barenziah.
string: 哇，没想到我还能看到这样的东西！我觉得这是巴伦西亚王冠上的一颗宝石。

original: Supposedly a thief stole the crown and dispersed the gems. Someone at the Thieves Guild or maybe one of the Khajiit traders would know more.
string: 据说是一个盗贼偷走了王冠并散失了宝石。盗贼公会的人或者卡吉特商人会知道更多。

original: I'd like that.
string: 我喜欢这个。

original: Let's take a walk then.
string: 那我们出去走走吧。

original: And you should have told me the truth about the Star, but here we are.
string: 你应该告诉我关于独孤之星的真相的，现在说什么都没用了。

original: Ha ha ha, all right, let's call it even. Ask your questions.
string: 行吧，算扯平了。你想问什么就问。

original: Ask a liar for his story? Hardly. I wanted to read it for myself.
string: 问骗子要他的故事？免了。我想亲眼看看真相。

original: I guess I deserved that. Well, now you know. What are your questions?
string: 行，算我活该。现在你知道了，想问什么？

original: Do you want to be a werewolf?
string: 你想变成狼人吗？

original: It's tempting. Things are nice and simple when you're just trying to keep breath in your lungs and kill the person in front of you.
string: 这很诱人。当你只想保持肺部呼吸，杀死面前的人时，一切都会变得美好而简单。

original: Fighting, and if I'm being honest other physical distractions, are about the only way I can get out of my own head.
string: 战斗，以及其他身体上的干扰，是我唯一能让自己清醒的方式。

original: But... no. I'd lose myself in the Hunt. I don't have your strength.
string: 但是…不行。我会在狩猎中迷失自我。我没有你的力量。

original: About the boy...
string: 关于那个男孩

original: Not now. We'll talk later, I promise.
string: 现在不行。我们以后再谈，我保证。

original: Heh. Offer refused.
string: 想得美。

original: No one's dying on my watch.
string: 有我罩着，谁都不准死！

original: Paarthurnax isn't named after a dragon, he is a dragon!
string: 帕图纳克斯不是以龙的名字命名的，它就是一条龙！

original: We already know she's Dragonborn. You'll be enlightened soon enough.
string: 我们已经知道她是龙裔了，你很快就会明白的。

original: We already know he's Dragonborn. You'll be enlightened soon enough.
string: 我们已经知道他是龙裔了，你很快就会明白的。

original: We already know they're the Dragonborn. You'll be enlightened soon enough.
string: 我们已经知道他们是龙裔了，你很快就会明白的。

original: It was just a misunderstanding? That's... tragic.
string: 只是个误会？那可真是…悲哀啊。

original: Is this a paying job, or are we just killing the undead for fun and relaxation?
string: 这是份有报酬的活儿，还是我们单纯在打亡灵找乐子解闷？

original: That's adorable. Can we name him Krabrenac?
string: 真可爱！要不咱们叫他克拉布雷纳克吧？

original: A pet skeever?! These things carry diseases, and I think this one's addicted to skooma.
string: 宠物雪鼠？！这些家伙可带着病菌呢，而且我看这只是嗑斯库玛上瘾了吧！

original: Aw, look how cute that rabbit is... I bet he tastes delicious! (laughs) I'm kidding!
string: 哇，看那只兔子多可爱……我打赌它肯定很好吃！开玩笑的啦！

original: At least it's not a chaurus. The blue color is, um... nice?
string: 至少不是查鲁斯。这蓝色嘛…还不错？

original: I don't care what that farmer in Rorikstead says; Hilda is a much better goat than Gleda.
string: 才不管洛里克镇那个农民怎么说；希妲可比格莱达强多了！

original: I don't mind sharing my sweetrolls with you, Sweetroll.
string: 我不介意和你分享甜卷们，小甜卷。

original: Oh, what a gorgeous fox you are!
string: 天哪，你这只迷人的小狐狸！

original: Who's the most beautiful redhead I know? Why, it's you, Sweetroll!
string: 我认识的最美的红发姑娘是谁？当然是你啦，小甜卷！

original: Do you think Thistle is safe out here? I'd actually feel terrible if something happened to him.
string: 你觉得小蓟在这里安全吗？要是他出点什么事，我真的会难受死的…

original: We should put that bone wolf thing out of it's misery.
string: 还是让那头骨狼解脱了吧。

original: That bone wolf smells. And I'm not talking 'a bit doggy' or anything like that. No, I'm talking decayed, rotting corpse.
string: 那头骨狼臭得要命。我说的可不是什么“有点狗味”之类的小事。不，是那种腐烂尸体的恶臭。

original: Your nix-hound needs a name. How about 'Marshmerrow?'
string: 你的尼克斯猎犬该有个名字了，“泽灯草”怎么样？

original: You know, nix-hounds are related to kwama. I wouldn't try eating any of the eggs, though.
string: 知道吗，尼克斯猎犬其实跟卡马虫是近亲。不过它们的蛋嘛……我劝你还是别尝为妙。

original: A loyal nix-hound is the only blood-drinker I trust at my side.
string: 唯一值得我信任的吸血家伙，就是身边这只尼克斯猎犬了。

original: A loyal nix-hound is the only blood-sucker I trust at my side. Present company excepted, of course.
string: 忠诚的尼克犬是我唯一信任的吸血鬼伙伴,当然除非有在场的人陪伴。

original: Fish are food, not friends... well except for that tiny mudcrab. That little fella is pretty cute.
string: 鱼是食物，不是朋友…唔，那只小泥蟹除外。那小家伙还挺招人疼的。

original: (sigh)
string: （叹气）

original: (sigh)
string: （叹气）

original: We're not in Solitude anymore, Sweetroll.
string: 咱们可不在独孤城了，小甜卷。

original: I hope whoever got their ship stuck in this cave is still around haunting the place, because I have a few words for them about proper treatment of a sailing vessel!
string: 希望把船卡住在这座洞穴里的人仍然在此徘徊,因为我有几句话要对他们说,关于如何正确处理航行中的船只!

original: If Fathis got the Dark Rose stuck in a cave, I'd kill him.
string: 如果法提斯把暗玫瑰卡在洞里,我会杀了他。

original: Let's not panic. We're smart enough to find our way out if we keep our heads clear.
string: 不要慌张。我们足够聪明,只要保持清醒就能找到出路。

original: This necromancer was a cruel master to his apprentices. They were his victims.
string: 这位死灵法师对他的学徒很残忍。他们是他的受害者。

original: I know Skyrim's in danger and all, but a machine that can control the weather? That fascinates me! I can't wait to see how it works.
string: 我知道天际正处于危险之中,但能控制天气的机器?那让我着迷!我迫不及待想看看它怎么运作。

original: Why is everything so far apart and convoluted?
string: 为什么一切都如此分散而复杂?

original: This dry air is going to ruin my skincare routine.
string: 这干燥的空气会毁了我的护肤程序。

original: Don't eat anything in here. The Dwemer blinded the ancient Falmer, and we don't know how they did it.
string: 别在这里吃任何东西。锻莫让古老的伐莫失明,我们不知道他们是怎么做到的。

original: I want a closer look at this Drone Fly. I've never even heard of a machine like that.
string: 我想更仔细地看看这台无人机飞行器。我甚至没听说过这样的机器。

original: It's so cold in here it hurts to breathe. I should have kept my beard.
string: 这里太冷,呼吸都痛。原本我应该留着胡子。

original: A Dwemer horse is an interesting machine, but it's no Windward.
string: 锻莫马是一台有趣的机器,但它不等于迎风。

original: Can't say I have much concern about the heretics, but maybe there's an interesting relic to be found. Let's see what we can find.
string: 我并不太担心异端,但也许能找到一件有趣的遗物。让我们看看能发现什么。

original: Hold on. These people are fanatics. We'll be attacked unless we play the part.
string: 等一下。这些人是狂热分子。除非我们扮演好角色,否则会被攻击。

original: I wonder if any of these guards live up to the reputation of the old Ordinators?
string: 我想知道这些守卫是否配得上旧秩序者的声誉?

original: I'm not one to be superstitious, but Sotha Sil's mask gives me the creeps.
string: 我不是那种迷信的人,但索塔·西尔的面具让我毛骨悚然。

original: Let me have a look at the priest's letter. I should be able to read it.
string: 让我看看牧师的来信。我应该能读懂它。

original: Hold on. I have an idea.
string: 等一下,我有个主意。

original: I must be getting soft. Captain Serano, taking payment in bug parts for delivering goldfish to kids.
string: 我可能变软了。塞拉诺船长,用虫子零件收取金鱼送给孩子们的报酬。

original: Fishing for a ring? Why can't just find it with our eyes, or better yet a Clairvoyance scroll? How is a ring going to take a bite out of fish bait?
string: 寻找戒指?为什么不直接用眼睛找到,或者更好的是使用先知卷轴?戒指怎么能咬住鱼饵呢?

original: There's gratitude for you. I hope he gets a spike trap to the face.
string: 我要感谢你。我希望他脸上被钉子扎个洞。

original: Don't go in yet.
string: 先别进去。

original: My money's on the Nord. What? She's got the reach on him.
string: 我赌诺德赢。怎么啦？她已经抓到他了。

original: Speak for yourself, Delphine. I don't plan on dying today, and neither does my friend.
string: 你自己说吧，戴尔芬。我今天不打算死，我的朋友也不打算死。

original: Speak for yourself, Delphine. I don't plan on dying today, and neither does my partner.
string: 你自己说吧，戴尔芬。我不打算今天就死，我的搭档也不打算。

original: You think Esbern will know something?
string: 你觉得伊思本会知道些什么吗？

original: Well, I know you didn't want to talk about it, but- but can you remember exactly what was happening the moment Alduin first appeared?
string: 我知道你不想谈这个，但是-- 但是你还记得奥杜因第一次出现时到底发生了什么吗？

original: Hmm. Tell me again exactly what was happening the moment Alduin appeared at Helgen.
string: 嗯。再给我说一次，奥杜因出现在海尔根的那一刻到底发生了什么。

original: Think back to Helgen. I know you said it was chaos, but what was happening at the exact moment Alduin appeared?
string: 回想一下海尔根。我知道你说当时一片混乱，但奥杜因出现的那一刻究竟发生了什么？

original: I think he's the best lead we've had yet. The return of the dragons being connected to you, a Dragonborn, seems more plausible than anything related to politics and warfare.
string: 我觉得他是目前最好的线索。龙族的回归与你这个龙裔有关，这似乎比任何与政治和战争有关的事情都更靠谱。

original: I was about to be executed. The ax was poised.
string: 我即将被处死。斧头即将落下。

original: You specifically? Not Ulfric?
string: 是你么？不是乌弗瑞克？

original: That's right. Why do you ask?
string: 没错。为什么这么问？

original: It's just a hunch, but what if you're the important one?
string: 这只是一种预感，但如果你才是重要的那个人呢？

original: What are the odds of the first dragon anyone's seen in centuries laying waste to an insignificant fort, an act which just happened to save your life?
string: 几个世纪以来，人们看到的第一条龙毁掉了一个微不足道的堡垒，而这一行为恰好救了你的命，这样的几率有多大？

original: Divine intervention, perhaps?
string: 也许是天意？

original: Akatosh is the Dragon God and the God of Time. Does make you wonder.
string: 阿卡托什是龙神和时间之神。这确实让人好奇。

original: It seems strange to think of myself that way.
string: 这样想我自己似乎有点奇怪。

original: Well you might need to get used to it, hero. Hm. Don't worry though, I'm not gonna let that get to your head.
string: 你可能需要适应一下，英雄。嗯 不过别担心，我不会让它影响你的。

original: I think the gods are out to get me, and it's amazing I've lived this long.
string: 我觉得上天要捉弄我，我能活到现在已经很了不起了。

original: Ha ha ha ha! Well hey, at least with Daedra you know they're out to get you and you can plan accordingly.
string: 哈哈哈哈！好吧，嘿嘿，至少在迪德拉这里，你知道他们会来找你，你可以制定相应的计划。

original: The return of the dragons being connected to you, a Dragonborn, seems more plausible than anything related to politics and warfare.
string: 龙的回归与你这个龙裔有关，这似乎比任何与政治和战争有关的事情都更可信。

original: Even if Esbern can't tell us anything useful, maybe there are others out there who can.
string: 即使伊思本不能告诉我们任何有用的信息，也许还有其他人能告诉我们。

original: Here's the story...
string: 事情是这样的…

original: And now you're caught up in all this. Well, in any case, I'm glad we met.
string: 现在你也被卷进来了。好吧，无论如何，我很高兴我们认识了。

original: Haha, wow! If I'd known you wanted to get married that badly, I might have asked you myself!
string: 哈哈，哇！如果我知道你这么想结婚，我可能会亲自问你的！

original: Hagraven. Riiight. This is a first, even for me.
string: 乌鸦鬼婆。没错。这对我来说也是第一次。

original: It's beautiful here - the kind of place where you could forget about everything that troubles you. Or for that matter, forget about everything entirely.
string: 这里很美——在这里，你可以忘记一切烦恼。或者说，完全忘记一切。

original: Oh it's not for me, it's for Sweetroll. Look at her; she's hungry.
string: 那不是给我的，是给小甜卷的。看看她，饿得不行了。

original: Those really aren't healthy for her.
string: 那些东西对她的健康真的没有好处。

original: You worry too much. At least I'm not givin' her coffee.
string: 你担心过度了。起码我不会叫她喝咖啡。

original: Oh, that's fine then. Carry on.
string: 哦，那没问题。继续吧。

original: So what you're saying is, you agree theft is acceptable when it's for a good cause. My thoughts exactly.
string: 所以你的意思是，只要目的正当，偷窃也是可以接受的？——正合我意。

original: You're going to make her fat.
string: 你这样会让她长胖的。

original: That's all fur. She's... just... fluffy.
string: 那都是毛啦。她就是……特别蓬松。

original: (offended fox noises)
string: （狐狸不满地闹腾）

original: (happy fox noises)
string: （狐狸快乐地闹腾）

original: (happy fox noises)
string: （狐狸快乐地闹腾）

original: Let's see what you found today, Sweetroll. A flawless diamond, nice! A key to... something... a gold ring with a- wow. A human finger. Huh.
string: 来瞧瞧咱们小甜卷今天捞到什么好东西——嚯！无瑕钻石，不错嘛！一把…某东西的钥匙…金戒指，上面还挂——哇哦，是截人手指。

original: Was that really necessary? Bad fox.
string: 这真的有必要吗？坏狐狸。

original: All right, all right. There's no need to get upset... We'll work on your pickpocketing skills tomorrow.
string: 好了好了，犯不着生气…明天再教你摸包的手艺。

original: (angry fox noises)
string: （狐狸愤怒地闹腾）

original: Come here, girl. You want a snack?
string: 过来这里，女孩。你想要点零食？

original: (happy fox noises)
string: （狐狸快乐地闹腾）

original: Fuck me! This is the biggest chaurus I've ever seen!
string: 我操！这是我见过的最大的查鲁斯！

original: I like Roggi. He's a drunk, but I like him. Plenty of good sailors are drunks, too.
string: 我喜欢罗吉，他是个酒鬼，但我喜欢他。很多好水手也是酒鬼。

original: I'd like to go look for Darkwater Crossing's missing Argonian. I think I saw a cave entrance above the falls. It might be worth checkin' out.
string: 我想去寻找在黑水岔口失踪的亚龙人。我好像在瀑布上方看到一个洞口，也许值得去看看。

original: If Derkeethus isn't already dead we'd better find him fast. The Falmer aren't kind to their captives.
string: 如果德吉图斯还没死，我们最好快点找到他。伐莫们不会善待它们的俘虏的。

original: I'm glad we got here when we did. I actually feel good about helping the guy. Too bad he wasn't as wealthy as he was grateful.
string: 我很高兴我们能及时赶到。帮了他，我感觉很好。可惜的是，他并不像他所感激的那样富有。

original: Too bad we didn't hear about the delay before the shipment got to the docks. Would have been problem solved if the spiced wine were still at sea, just sayin'.
string: 真可惜，我们没有在货物运到码头之前就得知延误的消息。如果香料酒还在海上，问题就迎刃而解了，只是说说而已。

original: I told you Siddgeir was crooked, now we get to clean up his mess. On the bright side, at least we could blackmail him later if we need to.
string: 我告诉过你西德盖尔是个骗子，现在我们要收拾他的烂摊子了。往好的方面想，至少我们以后可以在必要时勒索他。

original: Whatever you do, don't use the newly departed's ashes in a potion by accident. People will not be happy. I'm speaking from experience here.
string: 无论如何，都不要把逝者的骨灰用在药水里。人们会不高兴的。我说的都是经验之谈。

original: Can I sit this one out? Aldis doesn't need a reminder of my existence.
string: 我能不参加吗？艾迪斯不需要我的提醒。

original: Is it just me or is Sybille Stentor having us take out the competition?
string: 是我的错觉，还是希比利·斯丹特让我们干掉了竞争对手？

original: I like Malur's style. Ha hah, heh! Hey, we should go help him out. Winterhold's jarl couldn't tell a hedge mage from Saint Vivec himself.
string: 我喜欢马鲁尔的风格。哈 哈，呵！嘿，我们应该去帮帮他。冬堡的领主分不清绿篱法师和圣维威克本人。

original: I'll kill draugr for free to get a chance to loot whatever's in there before anyone else does. Let's show these spineless fetchers how it's done!
string: 我会免费杀死尸鬼，以便有机会抢先一步洗劫里面的东西。让我们给这些没骨气的混蛋点颜色看看！

original: Well, I'm pleasantly surprised by Free-Winter. Maybe his payment to us for this job will be as big as his heart.
string: 好吧，逸冬让我感到惊喜。也许他给我们的报酬会像他的心一样大。

original: I can't believe I'm risking arrest to return stolen property. First time for everything, I guess.
string: 真不敢相信我冒着被捕的危险来归还赃物，凡事都有第一次吧。

original: You realize this guy's going to get himself killed if we don't help him, right?
string: 你知道如果我们不帮他，这家伙会送命的，对吧？

original: Heh! Now your outfit looks almost as good as mine!
string: 呵！现在你的衣服看起来和我的差不多了！

original: Faith in the Divines didn't save her brother. I don't know what comfort she expects to find within that Temple.
string: 对神灵的信仰并没有拯救她的哥哥。我不知道她还指望在神殿里找到什么安慰。

original: 'Captain' Wayfinder needs to take action himself if he wants to earn that respect from his crew.
string: “船长”，寻路者如果想赢得船员的尊重，就必须亲自采取行动。

original: I swear... those Thieves Guild amateurs would steal a crust of bread out of your starving hands. That farmer over there has little enough to spare. Besides, rich people have better stuff!
string: 我发誓…那些盗贼公会的外行会从你饥饿的手中偷走一块面包皮。那边的农夫都快饿死了。再说，有钱人的东西更好。

original: I think Camilla wants a taste of adventure and excitement, not some pointless rivalry between two village idiots. Those fetchers know nothing about getting a woman's attention.
string: 我觉得凯米拉想要的是冒险和刺激，而不是两个乡巴佬之间毫无意义的争斗，那些混蛋根本不懂如何吸引女人的注意。

original: You should do Camilla a favor and sweep her off her feet yourself! It doesn't have to be forever...
string: 你应该帮卡米拉一个忙，让她为你神魂颠倒！不一定要永远…

original: Ha ha ha! Stallion's Potion, wow! Poor guy. This knowledge is better than gold if we ever need leverage on the Steward, though.
string: 哈哈哈！种马药水，哇哦！可怜的家伙。不过，如果我们需要拿管家做筹码的话，这些信息比金子更有用。

original: A hundred septims says I could take that high-born fetcher in a fight without drawing my sword.
string: 一百个先令赌我不用拔剑就能和那个出身高贵的混蛋打一场。

original: Klimmek seems a little young to have bad knees. Ah well, I guess it's not the years, it's the mileage.
string: 科林麦看起来有点年轻，膝盖就不好了。好吧，我想这不是岁数的问题，而是里程的问题。

original: Damn... I don't think this is gonna make Ranmir feel much better.
string: 该死… 我觉得这不会让兰米尔好受多少。

original: I wouldn't mind keeping one of those snow bear pelts. It'd make a nice rug, especially in front of a fireplace.
string: 我不介意留一块雪熊皮毛，它可以做一块漂亮的地毯，尤其是放在壁炉前。

original: This is why ya take up piracy when you desert a ship; it makes ya much harder to find.
string: 这就是为什么当你抛弃一艘船时会去做海盗，因为这样你就更难被找到了。

original: Are we sure that Lisbet actually has the money to pay us for this statue retrieval job?
string: 我们能确定利斯拜特真的有钱付给我们这个找回雕像的工作吗？

original: Killing spiders is easy, but don't get any ideas about loading me up with ore samples.
string: 杀蜘蛛很容易，但别想给我装原矿石。

original: Let's kill that giant spider and get paid! Afterward, maybe we could grab an early dinner at the Silver-Blood Inn? My treat.
string: 我们去杀了那只大蜘蛛拿钱吧。之后，也许我们可以去银血旅馆吃个早饭？我请客。

original: The Silver-Bloods can't even do their own dirty work and send in their boot-licking mercenaries. I say we run these n'wahs out of town.
string: 银血家族连自己的脏活都干不好，还派来他们的马屁精雇佣兵。我说，我们要把这些废物赶出镇子。

original: Robbing a broke stablehand... typical Thieves Guild trash. What is Brynjolf running these days, a day camp for Honorhall Orphanage?
string: 抢劫一个破产的马夫…典型的盗贼公会垃圾。布林约夫最近在经营什么，荣耀堂孤儿院的日间训练营吗。

original: Justice in Riften, let's see... A thief who got on Brynjolf's last nerve, an innocent shopkeeper, and a rich woman's son in time-out... about what I expected.
string: 裂谷城的正义，让我们来看看… 一个惹恼了布林约夫的小偷，一个无辜的店主，一个富家女的儿子被关禁闭…和我预想的差不多。

original: The Jarl has the only key to the warehouse, and I can't believe Maven Black-Briar's not getting a cut from this skooma operation. What are we getting ourselves into?
string: 领主有仓库唯一的钥匙，我真不敢相信玛雯·黑荆棘没有从这次行动中分一杯羹，我们这是在干什么。

original: I guess the current could have brought Reyda's remains near the bridge from the island, but I don't know... something doesn't add up.
string: 我猜水流可能把瑞亚达的遗体从岛上带到了桥附近，但我不明白…有些事情不对劲。

original: Narfi seems harmless, but I'm not so sure about that innkeeper.
string: 纳菲看起来没什么恶意，但我不太确定那个旅馆老板。

original: The problem with this mead smuggling scheme is the scale. We can only carry so much mead ourselves, you know? Ah, some days I miss havin' a ship.
string: 蜂蜜酒走私计划的问题在于规模。我们自己只能带这么多蜂蜜酒？啊，有时候我怀念没有船的日子。

original: Why would you use a Daedra heart to cool metal? Gotta be just an expensive gimmick.
string: 为什么要用大魔王的心脏来冷却金属？肯定只是个昂贵的噱头。

original: Dengir might have been a competent Jarl once. But now? He's jumping at shadows.
string: 丹吉尔以前可能是个称职的领主。但现在呢?他在阴影中跳跃。

original: I'm once again wondering why no one in the province burns their dead. Hey, maybe we should mention this to Dengir for his own funeral?
string: 我又想知道为什么省里没人焚烧他们的死者。嘿,也许我们应该把这事告诉丹吉尔,让他自己办葬礼吧?

original: According to his own journal, Runil was a Thalmor Battlemage. My mother's family was from Cheydinhal. Makes me wonder.
string: 根据他自己的日记,鲁尼尔是一名梭默战斗法师。我的母亲的家族来自夏丁赫尔。这让我很奇怪。

original: Hand-delivering mead to the Jarl! I can't decide if that's a power move on his part or just an easy way for us to get on his good side.
string: 手递麦酒给酋长!我无法决定那是他的权力举动还是我们获得好感的简单方式。

original: Hard work, hope, and prayers to Zenithar... Look what that gets you. Nothing. Life doesn't play fair, and neither should anyone else.
string: 辛勤工作、希望和向泽尼塔尔祈祷......看看这能得到什么。没有任何收获。生活不公平,别人也不应该公平。

original: I never expected that a blacksmith could afford to hire relic hunters. Then again, wartime is good for business.
string: 我从未想到铁匠会负担得起雇佣遗迹猎人。再说,战争时期生意不错。

original: Leotelli... he wrote that book about the Falmer. I wouldn't mind a sneak peak of his latest work since we're carrying it for him.
string: 莱奥特利... 他写了关于伐莫的书。我不会介意偷看他最新作品,因为我们正在为他携带它。

original: Small favors, like delivering this nightshade potion, are a good way to get people to like you. People who like you can be persuaded to do big favors.
string: 小恩惠,比如递送这瓶夜影药剂,是让人喜欢你的好方法。有了你的人可以被说服做大事。

original: The Argonians here get only a handful of septims for breaking their backs. There's no such thing as 'honest pay,' so why bother with honest work?
string: 这里的阿古隆只因背负而得到少量塞普特币。没有所谓‘诚实报酬’,那为什么要去做诚实工作?

original: If the Ring of Pure Mixtures is as good as the stories say, even I might be less of a hazard with Alchemy while wearing it.
string: 如果纯混合之戒真的如传闻般好,连我在佩戴它时使用炼金术也会更安全一点。

original: Ha ha ha ha, Rustleif's not much of a reader, is he? His heart's in the right place.
string: 哈哈哈,鲁斯特雷夫并不是个多读书的人,对吧?他的心在对的地方。

original: I've never had a problem with giants personally, but I guess one man's giant is another man's Riekling.
string: 我个人从未遇到过巨人问题,但我猜一个人的巨人就是另一个人的 Riekling。

original: I guess Ahtar's bandit found my exit from Solitude Jail. There's nothing quite like murder-for-hire to make your problems go away.
string: 我想阿塔尔的土匪发现了我从索利多监狱逃出的路。没有什么比雇佣杀人更能让你摆脱麻烦了。

original: I couldn't care less about that old man with the gambling problem, but his daughter doesn't deserve to inherit his debts. What do you say we deal with Irnksar for her sake?
string: 我根本不在乎那个有赌博问题的老头,但他的女儿不配继承他的债务。我们要不要为了她的缘故去和伊恩卡萨尔打交道?

original: Let me tell you about Aldis. He'll accept the first thing that makes his job easier, whether it's letting me go so I'm out of his hair or pawning off the inevitable bad news for us to handle.
string: 让我告诉你阿尔迪斯。他会接受任何能让他工作更轻松的事物,无论是放我走,让我离开他的麻烦,还是把不可避免的不幸转嫁给我们来处理。

original: What a waste. Torygg could have been Ulfric's strongest ally.
string: 多么浪费啊。托依格本可以成为乌弗瑞克最强大的盟友。

original: If the simple gift of a book gets us off Aldis's shit list, I'm all for it.
string: 如果一本书能让我们摆脱阿尔迪斯的黑名单,我完全赞同。

original: We could keep the rum for ourselves. Things get lost in shipping all the time. Falk would never notice and just order more.
string: 我们可以自己留着朗姆酒。运输过程中总是会丢失东西。法克永远不会注意到,只会再订一批。

original: About the Orcs of Largashbur...
string: 关于拉加施布尔的兽人…

original: They're not cursed. Bad things happen to everyone, especially when you follow Malacath.
string: 他们没有被诅咒，每个人都会遭遇不幸，尤其是当你追随玛拉凯斯的时候。

original: That's awful.
string: 太糟了。

original: No one ever said life was fair. If you fail Malacath's test, you stay a victim. Just like the Orc chief.
string: 没人说过生活是公平的。如果你没通过玛拉凯斯的测试，你就会一直是受害者，就像兽人酋长一样。

original: Good thing you and I can handle a few giants.
string: 好在你我都能对付几个巨人。

original: Damn right. We'll kill them before they kill us and be stronger and more experienced from doing it well. That's a lesson from Boethiah, though.
string: 说得太对了。我们要在他们杀了我们之前杀了他们。而且这样做会让我们变得更强大、更有经验。不过，这也是波耶希亚给我们上的一课。

original: Sometimes you were the bad thing that happened to people.
string: 有时候，你就是发生在别人身上的坏事。

original: That's a different kind of test. And I don't need you to tell me I failed it.
string: 那是另一种测试。我不需要你告诉我我失败了。

original: I always knew you had a soft spot for damsels in distress. Come on, hero, let's aid the 'fair' lady.
string: 我就知道你对落难的少女情有独钟。来吧，英雄，让我们帮助这位“美丽 ”的女士。

original: Ha ha! You know, sometimes I think I follow you just to see what's gonna happen next.
string: 哈哈！有时候我觉得我跟着你就是想看看接下来会发生什么。

original: Watch it, Golldir. I've killed plenty of Nords... some even happened to have been necromancers.
string: 小心点，高迪尔，我杀过很多诺德人…有些甚至是死灵法师。

original: No offense... I mean, I'm sure you're not into that kind of stuff.
string: 无意冒犯… 我是说，你肯定不喜欢那种东西。

original: What's wrong?
string: 怎么了？

original: I'll be honest; I hate fishing. I mean I can do it if I have to. But I became a ship captain so I could have other people do these things. For me.
string: 老实说，我讨厌钓鱼。非要我钓也不是不行。但我当上船长，就是为了能让别人替我干这些活儿。

original: Don't worry about it. I already know enough to be dangerous.
string: 别担心，我懂的已经够多了——多到能惹麻烦的地步。

original: I had a feeling your were gonna say that. No shortcuts.
string: 我就知道你会这么说。没捷径可走。

original: Kill the necromancer first! The undead will fall with her!
string: 先杀了死灵法师，亡灵会和她一起倒下。

original: Their helms - look! They're different from one another!
string: 它们的头盔--看！它们彼此不同！

original: I have a better plan. I'll be the bait. And you stay hidden and kill the witch as soon as she's distracted.
string: 我有个更好的计划，我来当诱饵，你藏起来，等女巫分心后就杀了她。

original: I don't want you taking the risk.
string: 我不希望你冒这个险。

original: And I don't want you taking the risk either. We can either stand here arguing until we're attacked, or you can agree with me.
string: 我也不想你冒这个险，我们可以站在这里继续争论。直到被攻击，或者你同意我的观点。

original: This isn't the time to change the plan.
string: 现在还不是更改计划的时候。

original: Damnit, you're right. Argh, We'll do it Illia's way, but if I get bored during this ritual I'm killing someone.
string: 该死，你说得对。我们可以按伊雅的方式来，但如果我在仪式中感到无聊，我就要杀人了。

original: Or, we can skip the theater and kill her immediately.
string: 或者，我们可以跳过战区，立刻杀了她。

original: Oh. I like that plan. I guess I was just overthinkin' it.
string: 哦。我喜欢这个计划。我想是我想多了。

original: Hey... If you ever have doubts about me like that couple did for each other, I want you to promise me that you'll be able to talk to me about it. Okay?
string: 听着…如果有一天你也像那对情侣一样对我产生怀疑，我要你答应我，一定要亲口告诉我。好吗？

original: Now that we have a map, I could sail the Spring Rain directly to Blackbone Isle if you like. Just give the word.
string: 现在我们有了地图,如果你愿意,我可以直接用春雨号航行去布莱克本岛。只要一句话就行。

original: It's nice to try on a piece of history, but fortunately fashions have improved significantly since the Second Era.
string: 试穿历史的一段很不错,但幸运的是,自第二纪以来时尚已经大幅提升。

original: Legend has it that Cyrus slew the dragon Nahfahlaar with this very sword. I hope you don't want it back, because I'm keeping it.
string: 传说塞鲁斯用这把剑斩杀了纳法拉尔龙。我希望你不想收回它,因为我打算保留它。

original: Is it just me, or does the Curate remind you of Wylandriah?
string: 是我一个人觉得吗,还是牧师让你想起了维兰德里亚?

original: I have an interesting spell I'd like to teach you.
string: 我有个有趣的法术想教给你。

original: That sounds great! What is it?
string: 听起来不错！是什么？

original: What carnival of idiots summoned an entire horde of zombies?
string: 是哪个白痴马戏团召唤了一整群僵尸？

original: I'll handle the hostile automatons and flame atronachs; you manage the repair spiders.
string: 我来处理敌对自动机和火焰阿特罗纳克;你负责修理蜘蛛。

original: This is exactly why I hate necromancy!
string: 这正是我讨厌死灵术的原因!

original: Just. Let it. Go!
string: 就这样吧,放手去吧!

original: Elemental Flare.
string: 元素炽焰。

original: I really appreciate your help. You're a good teacher, you know?
string: 衷心感谢你的帮助。你是个不错的老师，知道吗？

original: Actually, I need to learn Elemental Flare myself before I can teach you.
string: 事实上，在教你之前我自己得先学会元素炽焰。

original: Elemental Bolt.
string: 元素之箭。

original: I'll do my best not to hit you with this by accident, but, uh, my apologies in advance.
string: 我会尽量不误伤到你，不过嘛…先提前道个歉了。

original: Actually, I need to learn Elemental Bolt myself before I can teach you.
string: 其实我得先自己学会元素之箭，才能教你。

original: Actually, I need to improve my Destruction skill before I can teach Elemental Bolt.
string: 事实上，我的毁灭系法术造诣不够，还教不了你元素之箭。

original: Elemental Burst.
string: 元素爆发。

original: I see it now... fire is easier to evoke when you start the spell framework with lightning.
string: 原来如此...以闪电构筑法术框架时，火焰反而更容易被唤起了。

original: Heat is just a byproduct. I think I'm getting smarter!
string: 热量不过是附带产物。看来我的思路更清晰了！

original: Actually, I need to learn Elemental Burst myself before I can teach you.
string: 其实我得先自己学会元素爆发，才能教你。

original: Actually, I need to improve my Destruction skill before I can teach Elemental Burst.
string: 事实上，我的毁灭系法术造诣不够，还教不了你元素爆发。

original: Elemental Blast.
string: 元素冲击。

original: This is an incredibly powerful spell. I don't think I could have understood the nuances of casting it without your insight.
string: 这法术威力惊人。没有你的指点，我恐怕永远搞不明白施法的精妙之处。

original: When you explain things to me, they just make sense.
string: 你一说，我就懂了。

original: Actually, I need to learn Elemental Blast myself before I can teach you.
string: 其实我得先自己学会元素冲击，才能教你。

original: Actually, I need to improve my Destruction skill before I can teach Elemental Blast.
string: 事实上，我的毁灭系法术造诣不够，还教不了你元素冲击。

original: Actually, you're going to need additional study at the College to learn Elemental Blast.
string: 事实上，你需要去冬堡学院深造一段时间，才能学元素冲击。

original: Unbounded Storms.
string: 无尽风暴。

original: I feel like I'm on my way to being master of the sea and sky. Maybe I can learn some wind-based spells next...
string: 我仿佛正迈向天空与海洋的主宰之路……或许，该学点驭风之术了。

original: Actually, I need to learn Unbounded Storms myself before I can teach you.
string: 其实我得先自己学会无尽风暴，才能教你。

original: Actually, I need to improve my Destruction skill before I can teach Unbounded Storms.
string: 事实上，我的毁灭系法术造诣不够，还教不了你无尽风暴。

original: Actually, you're going to need additional study at the College to learn Unbounded Storms.
string: 事实上，你需要去冬堡学院深造一段时间，才能学无尽风暴。

original: That's all for now.
string: 就到此为止吧。

original: Already? Heh, I'd be glad to study with you again sometime.
string: 这就走了？下次再一起切磋倒也不错。

original: It's nice to meet a fellow worshipper.
string: 很高兴见到一个信徒。

original: Well, I don't claim to be devout.
string: 呃。我可没说自己是虔诚的信徒。

original: That's odd... there doesn't appear to be anything dug here recently. There're no fresh graves at all.
string: 奇怪…这里最近似乎没有挖过什么东西。根本没有新坟。

original: This can't be right... can you show me exactly where he died?
string: 这不可能…你能告诉我，他到底死在哪里吗？

original: So this is the spot. I guess there are worse places to die.
string: 原来是这里。我想还有比这更糟的死法。

original: Wait, something's happening!
string: 等等，有情况。

original: We knew you'd be back. Surrender your soul to Molag Bal!
string: 我们知道你会回来的。把你的灵魂交给莫拉格·巴尔吧。

original: Did you find anything on the body?
string: 尸体上有什么发现吗？

original: I found this soul gem fragment. Also, they had unusually muddy boots for a Daedric minion.
string: 我找到了这块灵魂宝石碎片。此外，他们的靴子也异常泥泞，不像是迪德拉爪牙的靴子。

original: A soul gem fragment, that's odd. May I see?
string: 灵魂宝石碎片，真奇怪。我能看看吗？

original: When I hold it, I get this uncomfortable feeling like something is in there... I don't think it's empty...
string: 当我拿着它时，我有一种不舒服的感觉，好像有什么东西在里面…我觉得它不是空的…

original: As far the muddy boots go, Daedra don't summon themselves. Someone nearby must have done it when we tripped a detection spell.
string: 至于那双沾满泥巴的靴子，大恶魔不会自己召唤自己。一定是附近的人在我们触动侦测咒语时做了手脚。

original: There is an old smuggler's cave not too far from here that's pretty damp. I'll mark the location on your map.
string: 离这里不远有一个古老的走私者洞穴，非常潮湿。我会在你的地图上标出位置。

original: That explains why no one has been using this place for smuggling lately!
string: 这就解释了为什么最近没有人利用这个地方走私！

original: The death hound had another soul gem fragment. (show fragments)
string: 死亡猎犬还有一块灵魂宝石碎片。（显示碎片）

original: When I look at them I get the worst feeling in the pit of my stomach... and I think about Fathis...
string: 当我看到他们时，我的胃里有一种最糟糕的感觉…我想到了法提斯…

original: This place seems like a dead end, and whatever cultist was here is long gone. Any thoughts?
string: 这个地方似乎是个死胡同，而且这里的邪教徒早已不复存在。有什么想法吗？

original: I have a bad feeling about this.
string: 我有不好的预感。

original: Same. I know you saw Fathis die, but I have a feeling he's not at peace.
string: 我也一样。我知道你看到法提斯死了，但我感觉他并不安宁。

original: I wonder if Fathis was involved with Molag Bal in some way.
string: 我想知道法提斯是否与莫拉格·巴尔有某种关系。

original: I think you're right. However it started, I can't imagine Fathis wanted it to end this way.
string: 我想你是对的。不管事情是如何开始的，我无法想象法提斯希望以这种方式结束。

original: Something isn't right. You should trust your instincts.
string: 事情不对劲。你应该相信自己的直觉。

original: Servants of Molag Bal... Broken soul gems that don't seem entirely empty... What did you get yourself into, Fathis?
string: 莫拉格·巴尔的仆人们破碎的灵魂宝石似乎并不完全是空的…你这是怎么了，法提斯？

original: He used to go to Serpent Isle when he wanted to spend some time alone. It's out of the way, but has a great view of the Statue of Azura. He liked the place. My gut tells me we might find something there.
string: 他想独处的时候就会去蛇岛。那里虽然偏僻，却能看到蔚蓝雕像的美景。他喜欢那个地方。我的直觉告诉我，我们可能会在那里找到些什么。

original: The gargoyle had a third broken soul gem. (show fragments)
string: 妖怪有第三块破碎的灵魂宝石。（显示碎片）

original: These fragments aren't empty at all. I hear something... screaming... I see... it's Fathis! Some part of him is in there.
string: 这些碎片一点都不空，我听到…尖叫声…我看到了…是法提斯！他的一部分在里面！

original: What do we do now?
string: 我们现在要做什么？

original: I don't bring this up lightly, but how do you feel about dealing with Daedric Princes?
string: 我不是随便提的，但你觉得和迪德拉王子打交道怎么样？

original: I don't think I like where this is going.
string: 我可能不太喜欢现在的情况。

original: I'll be the one to take the risk of any bargain that's necessary.
string: 必要时，我会承担任何讨价还价的风险。

original: What do you have in mind?
string: 你想要我做什么？

original: We're dead in the water right now. We need information.
string: 我们现在是水深火热之中。我们需要信息。

original: Oh gods, here we go again.
string: 天哪，又来了。

original: Do you have a better idea?
string: 你有更好的主意吗？

original: You saw Fathis die. Only I don't think he's dead..
string: 你看到法提斯死了。只有我觉得他没死。

original: If there's a chance to save him from whatever's chipping away at his soul, I have to find out now! I let him down for years; I won't do it again.
string: 如果有机会把他从侵蚀他灵魂的东西中解救出来，我现在就必须找到答案！我让他失望了这么多年，我不会再让他失望了。

original: I've... dealt with Hermaeus Mora before. While unpalatable, there's no better, or faster, source of information.
string: 我… 以前和赫麦尤斯-莫拉打过交道。虽然不讨人喜欢，但没有比这更好更快的信息来源了

original: I know where a Black Book is that can help us. I'll read it and bargain with old Eyeballs to find out how Fathis got himself entangled with Molag Bal.
string: 我知道有一本黑暗经书可以帮助我们。我要读读它，然后和老眼珠讨价还价，看看法提斯是怎么和莫拉格·巴尔纠缠在一起的。

original: What's a Black Book?
string: 什么是黑暗经书？

original: It's a Daedric artifact from the Prince of Knowledge. They serve as gateways to Apocrypha, Hermaeus Mora's realm of Oblivion.
string: 这是知识王子的魔神器。它们是通往异典的大门，也就是赫麦尤斯·莫拉的湮灭王国。

original: You can learn almost anything in there, if you're willing to pay the price.
string: 只要你愿意付出代价，你几乎可以在那里学到任何东西。

original: How do you know about this book and where is it now?
string: 您是如何知道这本书的？

original: I originally found it in a cave on a godsforsaken island offshore from Solstheim. A story for another time.
string: 我最初是在索尔斯特海姆离岸的一个荒岛上的洞穴里发现它的。下次再说吧。

original: I left the book in my cabin with everything else on the Dark Rose. With luck, no one's sold it or thrown it overboard yet.
string: 我把这本书和其他东西一起留在了“黑玫瑰”号的船舱里。幸运的是，还没有人把它卖掉或扔到海里。

original: I could take us to the ship when you give the word, or we could use the abandoned rowboat.
string: 只要你一声令下，我就能带我们上船，或者我们可以用那艘废弃的划艇。

original: You had something you wanted to say?
string: 你看上去有事要说？

original: I have something for you - it's a gift! Before you ask, yes, I paid for it. It has a Certificate of Authenticity and everything.
string: 给你个惊喜——礼物！别担心，我可是真金白银买的！认证证书、包装，一样不少！

original: You do a lot of things for me, and I wanted to do something for you, too. I appreciate you keeping me around.
string: 你为我做了太多，我也想为你做点什么。谢谢你一直留我在身边。

original: It feels good to see Daenella and Simon reunited. It's the kind of bittersweet love story you'd read in a book...
string: 看着达奈拉和西蒙重逢，真是让人欣慰。这样的爱情故事，苦涩中带着甜蜜，就像书里写的那样…

original: If this delusional Nord wants to die at your hand, fine, but don't expect me to stand around and watch.
string: 如果这个疯疯癫癫的诺德人非要找死，随他便。但可别指望我会在这儿傻站着看戏。

original: It's a matter of honor. I need you to stand aside when I challenge her.
string: 事关荣誉。我挑战她的时候，你不要插手。

original: Make sure it's not a close fight, then. I might not have much, but watching you die goes against my honor.
string: 那至少别打成命悬一线的险局。我虽一无所有，但看着你送命——有违我的尊严。

original: I don't expect you to. We'll take her down together.
string: 不劳你出手。她由我们亲自收拾。

original: I'm glad we're on the same page.
string: 很好，我们意见统一了。

original: I don't need your help, Serano. Promise not to interfere.
string: 我不需要你帮忙，塞拉诺。保证别插手。

original: All I'm willing to promise is that she won't die quickly if you turn out to be wrong.
string: 我唯一能保证的是——如果你错了，她不会死得太痛快。

original: Would you like to be a farmer with me? We can retire.
string: 你愿意和我一起当农民去吗？我们就退休了。

original: Me? A farmer?! (laughs) That's the funniest thing you've ever said! Wait, were you serious?
string: 我？农民？！这真是你说过的最搞笑的事情！等等，难不成你是认真的？

original: Of course I was serious!
string: 我当然是认真的！

original: You want me... to do... an honest day's work? I'm- I'm not actually sure I know how.
string: 你是想让我…老老实实…干一天活？我……我还真不确定自己会不会。

original: (laugh) I was joking. You should see the look on your face!
string: 我开玩笑的！你真该看看自己刚才的表情！

original: Haha! Thank Azura! You had me worried for a minute there.
string: 感谢阿祖拉！刚才可真是让我捏了把汗啊！

original: What do you have against farming?
string: 种田生活招你惹你了？

original: Nothing. You trying to pick a fight? I'm simply aware I would be a terrible farmer.
string: 不是，你是在找茬吗？我只是很清楚——我当农民绝对会糟透了。

original: You sound like a romantic at heart.
string: 你听起来骨子里是个浪漫主义者。

original: (chuckles) I guess I am. It just, ah, brings back some memories.
string: 可能真是。只是……勾起了些回忆。

original: Is the fearsome pirate a bit misty-eyed?
string: 怎么，令人闻风丧胆的海盗也要掉眼泪了？

original: You have a heart of stone.
string: 你可真是铁石心肠。

original: I think you have a story. I'd like to hear it.
string: 我想你有不少故事。乐于听听。

original: You'll be the first person I've ever told this to.
string: 你将是第一个知道这件事的人。

original: I used to know a spell knight back in High Rock. His name was William, and we were... close.
string: 我曾在高岩认识一位咒法骑士，名叫威廉，我们曾…关系密切。

original: Of course, like anything else for me back then, it didn't last long. I never made any promises, and... I left.
string: 当然，就像那时我身边的一切一样，都没能长久。我从未许下任何承诺，然后…我离开了。

original: He never told me, but I found out later that he was a Knight of Iron. They swear an oath to serve Zenithar and to protect lawful commerce from, well, people like me.
string: 他从未提起，但我后来才知道，他是铁之骑士团的一员。他们立誓侍奉泽尼塔尔，守护正当贸易——防的就是我这种人。

original: I'm not sure what else was going on in his life, but his order found out about us and I guess they didn't approve.
string: 我不清楚他生活中还发生了什么，但他的教团发现了我们的事，想必他们并不赞同。

original: He was killed while I was away at sea.
string: 我不在海上时，他被人害了。

original: He left me his armor. Since I left the Dark Rose, I finally felt like I had the right to wear it.
string: 他留给了我他的战甲。自从离开黑玫瑰号之后，我终于觉得自己有资格穿上它了。

original: A Ring of Disrobing? You just couldn't resist, huh?
string: 脱衣戒指？你果然把持不住是吧？

original: A Ring of Disrobing? You just couldn't resist, huh?
string: 脱衣戒指？你果然把持不住是吧？

original: Just when you start to think 'Uncle Sheo' isn't so bad, you find an eyeball in a box.
string: 就在你刚觉得“疯神大叔”没那么糟的时候，盒子里冒出一颗眼球。

original: We're not in Solitude anymore, Meeko.
string: 咱们可不在独孤城了，米科。

original: I would have thought there would be more cheese.
string: 我还以为会有更多奶酪呢。

original: At least I have my pants on this time.
string: 至少这次我裤子穿好了。

original: You know, this hat isn't so bad. I think it suits me. W-Wait, wait what am I saying?!
string: 呃，这帽子其实还不错... 还挺适合我的？——等等，我在说什么啊？！

original: Madness is a lifeboat...
string: 疯狂是救生艇…

original: Maybe I do take myself too seriously.
string: 是啊，可能真的绷太紧了。

original: When was the last time I just took a day off?
string: 你上一次纯粹休息一整天是什么时候？

original: I can't believe there's no cheese here.
string: 难以置信，这儿居然连奶酪都没有。

original: Why do I keep saying these things out loud?
string: 我怎么老把心里话念叨出来？

original: Staada... Gaslight, gatekeep, girlboss personified.
string: 斯塔达…简直是煤气灯、把持门路、女王本王的化身。

original: Dylora and Staada hate each other? Well, there goes that fantasy. Why do I keep saying these things out loud? Awkward...
string: 黛萝拉和斯塔达互相讨厌？好吧，这下幻想要破灭了。我怎么又把心里话喊出来了？尴尬…

original: More like Drinks-the-Skooma.
string: 更像是喝多了斯库玛。

original: Something about this guy's terrible fashion sense seems familiar.
string: 这家伙糟糕的时尚品味莫名有种熟悉感。

original: I'm suffering for the art all right.
string: 我这是为艺术献身啊。

original: You're weird, little buddy. You're weird!
string: 你真是个怪家伙，小不点儿。怪得很！

original: It's all purple butterflies and cheesy hats until you find someone's intestines woven into a chair.
string: 一开始还满是紫蝴蝶和俗气的帽子，直到你发现某人的肠子被编进了椅子里。

original: I wonder what would happen if I ate a soul tomato?
string: 我在想如果我吃下一个灵魂番茄会发生什么？

original: These tunnels are moving. It feels like I'm on a ship.
string: 这些隧道仿佛在流动，如同置身摇晃的船腹。

original: Is it just me, or does this place make your teeth feel weird?
string: 不知是否只有我如此，这地方总让人觉得牙齿怪怪的。

original: Why am I so happy? There is no reason for me to be smiling.
string: 为何我如此快乐？明明没有值得微笑的理由。

original: I'm not entirely sure what we accomplished here.
string: 我不确定我们到底达成了什么。

original: I wouldn't want to be stabbed with a spoon. It's dull; that would hurt more.
string: 我可不想被勺子捅。钝器伤人更疼。

original: That's the kind of sword that kills you by alphabetizing your internal organs.
string: 这把剑的厉害之处在于，它能按字母表顺序排列你的内脏，让你一命呜呼。

original: Hey there, little dog! Do you want a snack? The only tax I pay is the cheese tax.
string: 嘿，小狗！想吃零食吗？我唯一缴的税就是芝士税。

original: About Staada and Dylora...
string: 关于黛萝拉和斯塔达…

original: Sorry about my earlier comment. This place is giving my intrusive thoughts an unfair advantage.
string: 没关系的。幽暗之地总会放大那些不受控的念头——但你知道吗？连迪德拉的永恒牢笼都会在晨风的风中留下裂痕。

original: I wasn't gonna act on it!
string: 我当然不会真做什么！

original: Anyway, don't let these two 'guards' and their superior attitude get to you.
string: 总之，别让这两个“守卫”和他们那高高在上的态度影响你。

original: Sure, they're immortal, but they're just Daedra. They can only be what they already are.
string: 是啊，他们确实永生不死——但他们终究只是迪德拉。他们永远被困在自己的本质里，无法成为别的什么。

original: You and me? We have choices. We can always change. Our time might be short, but it's time that matters.
string: 你和我？我们仍有选择。我们总能改变。生命或许短暂，但重要的正是这短暂的光阴。

original: Some people just wanna watch the world burn. Hm. Those people are us.
string: 有些人就爱看世界燃烧。呵，那些人正是我们。

original: (gasp) Thank you! Now, I just have to think of a name for him.
string: 谢啦！现在嘛…就差给他想个名字了。

original: Would you like to visit the Dragonborn Museum?
string: 你想去参观龙裔艺术馆吗？

original: Absolutely! We should go there right now. I'll be right behind you!
string: 当然！一起去吧。你在前，我会一直跟在身后。

original: So soon? Oh, all right. Can we come back to the museum tomorrow?
string: 这么快？好吧……我们明天能再来博物馆吗？

original: It's time to go home, Dragonfly.
string: 该回家了，小小龙。

original: Ravani, I need to talk to you about your brother.
string: 拉瓦妮，我要和你谈谈你的兄弟。

original: Heh. That's exactly why we're talking.
string: 所以我才要跟你谈这个。

original: He looks up to you. You're older and and he's gonna follow where you lead. That comes with responsibility.
string: 他崇拜你。你比他年长，他会跟着你走——这意味着责任。

original: Kind of. When I was around your age, I used to think it was funny to let the other kids take the blame for my mischief.
string: 差不多吧。我像你们这么大的时候，也觉得让别的孩子替我背黑锅特别好玩。

original: But once I got to the Dark Rose, things were more serious. Your Uncle Fathis and I had to stick together.
string: 但上了黑玫瑰号之后，情况就不同了。我和你法提斯叔叔必须互相照应。

original: That's right. If he's always the one who gets in trouble while you're the one laughing, why would he trust you?
string: 没错。如果他总是闯祸而你总在笑，他凭什么信任你？

original: One day your mother and I will be gone, but you two will still have each other.
string: 总有一天，你妈妈和我都会离开，但你们还有彼此相伴。

original: One day your father and I will be gone, but you two will still have each other.
string: 总有一天，你爸爸和我都会离开，但你们还有彼此相伴。

original: One day your other parent and I will be gone, but you two will have each other.
string: 总有一天，我和你另一位至亲都会离开，但你们俩会彼此相伴。

original: Hehe! What has Aventus done now?
string: 嘿嘿！阿文图斯这次又搞了什么名堂？

original: It was all his idea. I only helped a little.
string: 这都是他的主意，我只是稍微帮了点忙。

original: I know it's you that keeps putting him up to things. There's no point in lying to me
string: 我知道是你一直在背后指使他。骗我也没用。

original: Oh, Papa, I'm sorry. It's just that he can be so guill- gulie- gull- easy to trick, and it's funny.
string: 哦，爸爸，对不起。只是他太容易上当了，这很有趣。

original: Aventus already wants to do the pranks, he just can't figure out the plan on his own.
string: 阿文图斯早就想搞恶作剧了，他自己就是琢磨不出计划来。

original: Like when you were the captain on your ship?
string: 就像你当船长指挥船那时候一样？

original: But if it were me, I wouldn't get caught! Wait. Do you mean I should be looking out for Aventus, too?
string: 但如果是我的话，才不会被抓到！等等...你是说我也该留意阿文图斯吗？

original: Sometimes he can be annoying when I want to play with my other friends or read my books, but do I want Aventus to like me.
string: 有时候我想和其他朋友玩或者看书时，他会有点烦人…但我还是希望阿文图斯能喜欢我。

original: I'm glad he came to live with us, Papa.
string: 我很高兴他来和我们一起生活，爸爸。

original: It doesn't look like much now, but hopefully we can assemble the fragments into something useful.
string: 现在看起来不怎么样,但希望我们能把碎片组装成有用的东西。

original: I wonder what life was like all those centuries ago when the dragons ruled?
string: 我想知道几百年前龙族统治时的生活是什么样子?

original: Don't tell my mother we did this. She'd faint at the thought my digging up her ancestors.
string: 别告诉妈妈我们这么做了,她一想到我挖掘她祖先就会晕倒。

original: It's amazing that the metal is still shiny after so many years. It makes the relics easy to find in the dirt.
string: 金属在多年后仍保持光亮,真是太神奇了。这让遗物在泥土中更容易找到。

original: Advanced and expensive! My kind of treasure.
string: 先进又昂贵!正合我的口味的宝藏。

original: I wonder what the Dwemer used for hair care? Think we'll find anything?
string: 我想知道杜姆人用什么来护理头发?我们会发现些什么吗?

original: That doesn't look like any Falmer construction I've ever seen.
string: 这看起来不像我见过的任何法尔梅尔建筑。

original: The snow elf architecture was beautiful... what a shame.
string: 雪精灵建筑真是美极了......多可惜。

original: It's hard to imagine what these people left behind compared to what they are now.
string: 很难想象这些人留下的与现在相比有何不同。

original: I really hope the chaurus were a recent development and not inherent to their culture.
string: 我真的希望查鲁斯只是最近出现的,而不是他们文化的一部分。

original: A few more years and they're gonna find me in one of these dig sites.
string: 再过几年,他们就会在某个挖掘现场找到我。

original: These fragments are so delicate. I'm always worried I'll break one by accident.
string: 这些碎片太脆弱了,我总担心不小心把它们弄坏。

original: I wonder if anyone will be digging up the wreck of the Dark Rose some day?
string: 不知道将来有人会去发掘暗玫瑰残骸吗?

original: Do you think Auryen's good for all the money? This job sounds too good to be true.
string: 你觉得阿瑞恩值得所有的钱吗?这份工作听起来好得不像真的。

original: People pay this well for something perfectly legal? Huh. Who knew? Feels wrong somehow.
string: 人们为完全合法的东西付这么多钱?嗯,谁能想到?感觉有点不对劲。

original: Can I please have a dragon model? Please, please, please, please, please please, please, please?
string: 我可以要一个龙模型吗？求求了，求求了，求求了，求求了，求求了，求求了，求求了？

original: Wow! I've never been inside a real museum before!
string: 哇！我还从来没进过真正的博物馆呢！

original: Wow!
string: 喔！

original: Can we go to the Natural Sciences wing? That's my favorite.
string: 我们能去自然科学大厅吗？那是我最爱的部分。

original: I wish I was allowed to touch the exhibits.
string: 真希望可以摸一摸这些展品啊。

original: This building is so big! Do you think we can see everything in one day?
string: 这座建筑真大！你觉得我们一天能看完所有东西吗？

original: Maybe Chompy can have a display, too?
string: 也许乔比也能有个展示区？

original: When I grow up, I want to be a relic hunter for a museum, just like you and Papa!
string: 等我长大了，我要像你和爸爸一样，当个为博物馆工作的遗迹猎人！

original: That boy, Henry, seems nice. I wonder if he'd like to play?
string: 那个叫亨利的男孩看起来人不错。不知道他愿不愿意一起玩？

original: I've never seen Red Mountain. My birth mum was an Ashlander, though.
string: 我从未见过红山。不过我的生母是灰原之民。

original: Don't worry, Papa. That chaurus display isn't real.
string: 别担心，爸爸。那只查鲁斯标本不是真的。

original: I dreamt once that all the mannequins were walking around! It was kind of spooky.
string: 我曾梦见所有人偶都在四处走动！有点毛骨悚然。

original: This room is enormous! I bet it could hold every suit of armor that ever existed!
string: 这房间可真大！说不定能装下世界上所有的盔甲呢！

original: I love the aquarium. I feel like I'm underwater, too.
string: 我喜欢水族馆。感觉自己也置身水下。

original: Maybe when I grow up, there will be a museum displaying my adventures.
string: 也许等我长大了，会有一座博物馆展出我的冒险经历。

original: Can I look in the restricted section? Papa said that's where all the most interesting books are kept.
string: 我能看看禁书区吗？爸爸说那里收藏着最有趣的书。

original: I think that inside me there are two dragons! One hoards knowledge and the other hoards shiny things. Both of my dragons are very excited to be here.
string: 我觉得我体内住着两条龙！一条囤积知识，另一条沉迷亮闪闪的东西。此刻它们都兴奋极了！

original: The Daedric section is very interesting. Papa said I needn't be scared of them, but I must be 'respectful and cautious.'
string: 这魔神的部分很有趣。爸爸说我不必怕他们，但必须“保持尊敬和谨慎”。

original: Look at all these valuable displays! You're gonna have to keep me on a leash in here.
string: 看看这些珍贵展品!你得把我关在这里的绳子上。

original: I noticed Auryen has a portrait of Old Eyeballs hanging in his office. I've got a bad feeling about that.
string: 我注意到Auryen办公室里挂着一幅老眼球的画像,我对此有种不好的预感。

original: Flip a coin. Heads says this place was Eyeballs's idea, tails say Auryen has bigger ambitions than even me.
string: 掷硬币。正面说这是眼球的主意,反面则说奥瑞恩比我还有更大的抱负。

original: There's practically a shrine to Hermaeus Mora down here.
string: 这里几乎可以算是赫尔马埃乌斯·莫拉的神龛。

original: I guess from a certain perspective, every museum is a shrine to the Prince of Knowledge.
string: 从某个角度看,每座博物馆都是知识君王的祭坛。

original: Look at this place! Let's go have a drink to celebrate our adventures.
string: 看看这地方!我们去喝一杯庆祝我们的冒险吧。

original: Let me know if you want me to reach something on the high shelves for you.
string: 如果你想我帮你拿到高架上的东西,告诉我一声。

original: All the good stuff's in the restricted section. I consider a lock to be no obstacle.
string: 所有好东西都在受限区。我认为锁不是什么障碍。

original: A treasure trove of books, and no Seekers to keep at bay.
string: 书籍的宝库,没有探求者可以阻挡。

original: In time, this library could rival the Arcaneum. I'm just imagining the look on Urag's face when I kick him out of here.
string: 随着时间推移,这座图书馆可能会与奥卡尼姆媲美。我只是在想当我把乌拉格赶出去时,他脸上的表情。

original: I love tidal pools. It feels like I'm looking through a secret window into the ocean.
string: 我喜欢潮汐池。感觉就像透过一扇秘密窗户看海一样。

original: Fuck... they just had to put a chaurus in here...
string: 该死......他们居然非得在这里放个查鲁斯...

original: I should start my own gemstone collection.
string: 我应该开始自己的宝石收藏。

original: Vvardenfell. I wonder how many fire resistance potions it would take to get close to Red Mountain?
string: 瓦尔登费尔。我想知道需要多少瓶抗火药剂才能接近红山?

original: It's lucky the Vigilants of Stendarr don't have a guild hall in Solitude.
string: 幸运的是,斯坦达的守望者在索利图德没有行会大厅。

original: So many bargains... so many nightmares...
string: 这么多交易......这么多噩梦......

original: This is an ambitious exhibit to fill. Fortunately, we're the best.
string: 这是一个雄心勃勃的展览要填满。幸运的是,我们是最棒的。

original: Finally, a place big enough to house my wardrobe!
string: 终于有足够大的地方来放我的衣柜!

original: I'd hate to be the poor bastard that has to carry around all the items in here.
string: 我不想成为那个不得不把这里所有物品背着走的可怜家伙。

original: This place is not like my ship.
string: 这个地方不像我的船。

original: I could get used to this kind of luxury.
string: 我可能会习惯这种奢华。

original: What's your policy on housing crewmates?
string: 你们对待船员住宿有什么政策?

original: What's your policy on housing crewmates?
string: 你们对船员住房的政策是什么?

original: Nobody asks, nobody tells... I like this Altmer more every time we talk.
string: 没人问,没人说......每次我们谈话,我就越发喜欢这位傲特莫。

original: This collection is sketchy even by my standards, which are admittedly low.
string: 这套收藏连按我的标准来看都很可疑,而我的标准可谓低得令人惊讶。

original: Look, it's not as if I've never put someone's head on a spike before, but that was to send a message. Keeping skulls on display in private seems... unhealthy.
string: 听着,我并不是从未把某人的头放在尖刺上,但那是为了传达信息。在私下展示骷髅似乎......不健康。

original: Being part of an operation like this ought to finally get Aldis off my back!
string: 参与这样一次行动,应该能让艾迪斯斯终于摆脱我的困扰!

original: Remi's here too, I see. Excellent! Now we can get down to some real planning.
string: 我看到里米也来了,太好了!现在我们可以开始真正的计划了。

original: This place is a mess. Remi has projects spread out everywhere.
string: 这个地方一团糟。里米把项目散布到各处。

original: This place is pretty. Too pretty.
string: 这地方太美了。美得叫人害怕。

original: Dreams can become nightmares. This is an illusion.
string: 梦境会化为梦魇。这是幻象。

original: I'll never think about tomato soup the same way again.
string: 我再也不会以同样的方式看待番茄汤了。

original: I feel just like Boethiah!
string: 我感觉自己就像波耶西亚！

original: I'm not sure why I ate that.
string: 我也不确定自己为什么要吃那个。

original: You know, I always thought I could pull off any look, but this armor is the exception.
string: 要知道，我一直以为自己能驾驭任何造型。但这套盔甲是个例外。

original: I admire the bold fashion statement, but I'm not sure you're pulling it off.
string: 我欣赏这种大胆的时尚宣言，但不确定你是否驾驭得了。

original: Well, hello to you, too! You can wear that around me any time you like.
string: 哎呀，你也好啊！你随时都可以在我面前穿成这样。

original: You're chopped cheese!
string: 你算哪根葱！

original: Why so serious?
string: 这么严肃干什么？

original: Riddle me this, n'wah.
string: 猜猜看啊，蠢货。

original: All it takes is one bad day.
string: 只需一个糟糕的日子。

original: And here we go.
string: 我们开始吧。

original: I am the night!
string: 我即是黑夜！

original: We're not locked in here with you; you're locked in here with us!
string: 不是你困住了我们，而是我们困住了你！

original: Have you ever danced with the daedra in the pale moonlight?
string: 你可曾在苍白的月光下与迪德拉共舞？

original: How about a magic trick? I'm gonna make this cutlass disappear!
string: 想看个魔术吗？我要让这把弯刀凭空消失！

original: All right let's do this. Valllllll Seraanoooooooo!
string: 好吧，开干。瓦尔——塞拉诺——！

original: If you're good at somethin', never do it for free.
string: 看家的本领最好别白给。

original: I could go for some chicken.
string: 突然有点想吃鸡肉了。

original: I guess it's true what they say about being your own worst enemy.
string: 看来老话说得对，人最大的敌人是自己。

original: I'd like you to follow Val.
string: 我希望你跟随瓦尔。

original: (sad fox chirp)
string: （狐狸悲鸣）

original: Stop following Val.
string: 停下，不需要跟随瓦尔了。

original: (happy fox chirp)
string: （狐狸欢叫）

original: Is it just me, or do those plants have eyes?
string: 是我眼花了，还是那些植物真长了眼睛？

original: This tunnel looks natural. It's more like tree than a sewer.
string: 这隧道看着是天然形成的，倒更像棵老树，哪像是下水道。

original: Hahahahahaha, What an idiot.
string: 哈哈哈哈哈，真是个白痴。

original: I can't say that I enjoyed this side trip, but it was necessary. I'd do it again, if we had to.
string: 虽然这趟跑腿算不上痛快，但该干还是得干。要是再来一次，我也照砍不误。

original: There's hardly anything here. These parasites were just scrounging from the weak for worthless junk. Pathetic.
string: 这儿屁都没有。这群寄生虫就只会从弱者那儿搜刮些破烂玩意儿…真够恶心的。

original: These people were blinded and worse, then left for dead by Falmer. I'm killing every last one of these bottom-feeding n'wahs.
string: 这些人被伐莫弄瞎了眼睛，甚至更惨…然后像垃圾一样被丢在这里等死。我要宰光这群阴沟里的杂种，一个不留。

original: It looks like we weren't the only ones looking for trouble around here. The camp seems undisturbed at least.
string: 看来不止我们在这儿惹上麻烦…不过营地至少没被动过。

original: Hey, if we're lucky this crew already took care of the Falmer and we can be on our way. Urgh, still, we should check.
string: 要是运气好，这帮人说不定已经解决了那些伐莫，咱们就能直接溜了…不过还是得检查下。

original: Hold on. This doesn't look like an ordinary bandit attack. Let's look around.
string: 等等…这不像普通的强盗袭击。我们最好侦查下。

original: These are Falmer arrows. There must be a hive nearby.
string: 这些是伐莫箭矢…附近肯定有他们的巢穴。

original: Gah, the last thing I want to do is go near it, but those monsters might have taken prisoners.
string: 我一点都不想靠近那鬼地方，但那些怪物可能抓了俘虏。

original: That's not a fate I'd wish on anyone.
string: 这种下场，谁都不该遭。

original: We should scout the area.
string: 我们得先侦查一下这片区域。

original: We're going to see combat. Gear up.
string: 我们将会看到战斗。准备好。

original: This armor's seen me through a lot of battles.
string: 这套盔甲让我经历了许多战斗。

original: I got this armor from a knight in High Rock. Quite the story.
string: 这套盔甲是我从高岩的一位骑士那里得到的。故事真不错。

original: You might have guessed Arrr, but it's C. As in... sea... get it? (laughs)
string: 你可能已经猜到了，但它是C，就像…海…明白了吗？

original: Godsdamnit. Just kill me. End it now.
string: 该死的，杀了我吧，现在就结束吧！

original: What was your brother talking about when he mentioned the Imperial Navy?
string: 你哥哥说的帝国海军是指什么？

original: Did you know I spent a year in the Imperial Navy?
string: 你知道我在帝国海军呆过一年吗？

original: I'd like to hear the story of your Black Book, Sailor's Bargain.
string: 我想听听你的黑皮书《水手的交易》的故事。

original: I once told you that why I found a Black Book was a story for another time.
string: 我曾经告诉过你，我为什么会找到一本黑暗经书，那是后话了。

original: About what I saw in Sailor's Bargain...
string: 关于我在《水手的交易》中看到的…

original: Ah. That. Now I really don't have anything to hide. Not from you.
string: 啊，那个，现在我真的没什么好隐瞒的。不瞒你说。

original: I'm not sure how I feel about it.
string: 我不确定我是怎么想的。

original: Heh, that makes two of us. I'm not asking you to give me a blank slate.
string: 嘿，我们都是这样。我不是要你给我一张白纸。

original: Your past doesn't dictate your future.
string: 你的过去并不决定你的未来。

original: It feels like it's part of me forever, though. Like... I'll never be free of it.
string: 但感觉它永远是我的一部分。就像…我永远也摆脱不了它。

original: You have a lot to make up for.
string: 你要弥补的还有很多。

original: I know.
string: 我知道。

original: It doesn't bother me.
string: 我并不在意。

original: I feel like it should.
string: 我觉得应该这样。

original: You're making different choices now. You've changed for the better.
string: 你现在做出了不同的选择。你已经变好了。

original: Right. There's always a choice, even if it's not easy.
string: 对选择总是有的，即使并不容易。

original: I've done things I'm not proud of, too.
string: 我也做过不光彩的事。

original: Sometimes we do what we have to do to survive.
string: 有时候，为了生存，我们不得不这样做。

original: I'm glad you're still here, love.
string: 我很高兴你还在这里，亲爱的。

original: Sometimes we do what we have to do to survive.
string: 有时候，为了生存，我们不得不这样做。

original: I'm glad you're still here, my friend.
string: 我很高兴你还在这里，我的朋友。

original: It's a hard world. We do what we have to to survive.
string: 这是一个艰难的世界。为了生存，我们只能尽力而为。

original: And we're both still standing. I guess that counts for something.
string: 我们都还活着。我想这也是有意义的。

original: I just need some time to think.
string: 我只是需要一些时间来思考。

original: I... I understand. I hope you'll still want me around on the other side of it.
string: 我…我明白了。愿你还希望我留在你身边。

original: Will you tell me about the hawk tattoo on your back?
string: 你能告诉我你背上的鹰纹身吗？

original: It's an image of Sister Hawk. She represents Kynareth.
string: 这是霍克嬷嬷的形象。她代表着凯娜瑞丝。

original: So... you have any tattoos I missed?
string: 那么…你有我漏掉的纹身吗？

original: Maybe a few... how closely have you looked?
string: 也许有几个…你仔细看过吗？

original: I believe that's a sea turtle on your ankle?
string: 你脚踝上应该是只海龟吧？

original: I got it my first year on the Dark Rose. It's from an old sailor's tradition for crossing the Blue Divide the first time.
string: 这是我第一年在黑玫瑰号上得到的。这是老水手第一次穿越蓝色分水岭的传统。

original: There's this ridiculous ceremony that involves drinking too much, getting dunked in the ocean... hm, things like that. It keeps morale up on a long voyage.
string: 有一种可笑的仪式，包括喝太多酒，被灌进海里…嗯，诸如此类的事情。在漫长的航行中能保持士气。

original: About that panther...
string: 关于那只豹子…

original: Ha ha ha ha! I think I'm entitled to one questionable tattoo, without any explanation.
string: 哈哈哈哈！我想我有权纹一个有问题的纹身，不需要任何解释。

original: Ha ha ha ha! I think I'm entitled to one questionable tattoo, without any explanation.
string: 哈哈哈哈！我想我有权纹一个有问题的纹身，不需要任何解释。

original: There's a hint of something at your waist...
string: 你的腰间有一丝东西…

original: That makes sense, with you being a sailor and Kynareth being the goddess of the wind.
string: 这就说得通了，你是个水手，而凯娜瑞丝是风之女神。

original: A sailor lives or dies at the mercy of the wind.
string: 水手的生死取决于风向。

original: I thought you followed the New Temple Faith.
string: 我以为你信奉新圣殿信仰。

original: I do, but I'm also a sailor. Kynareth is the Goddess of the storm, the wind, and the sky. Surviving your first storm will turn anyone into a believer.
string: 是的，但我也是个水手。凯娜瑞丝是风暴、风和天空的女神。从第一次风暴中幸存下来，任何人都会成为她的信徒。

original: Since when have you cared about the Nord pantheon?
string: 你什么时候开始关心诺德神殿了？

original: Heh. I know, right? My mother used to drag me to the Temple of the Divines every week. You could say that Kynareth was the only who left an impression.
string: 我知道，对吧？我知道，对吧？我妈妈以前每周都拉我去神殿。可以说，只有凯娜瑞丝给我留下了深刻的印象。

original: I don't know if I have the words to describe it, but I still remember the first time I was out of sight of land, with nothing but blue as far as I could see.
string: 我不知道自己是否能用语言来描述这种感觉，但我仍然记得第一次离开陆地的情景，在我的视线所及之处，只有一片蔚蓝。

original: I climbed to the top of the main mast on the Dark Rose, the wind filled her sails, and I felt like I could fly.
string: 我爬上了 "黑玫瑰 "号的主桅杆顶端，风吹满了她的船帆，我感觉自己可以飞翔。

original: I got the tattoo of the hawk years later. I wanted to remember how I felt that day.
string: 多年后，我纹上了鹰的图案。我想记住那天的感受。

original: I'm not a tattoo person myself, but I like how each one has meaning for you.
string: 我自己不喜欢纹身，但我喜欢每个纹身对你的意义。

original: Yeah, they do. I'm glad you asked about them. Not many people take the time to really get to know each other.
string: 是的很高兴你问起他们没有多少人会花时间去真正了解对方。

original: I've always liked your tattoos. They tell your story.
string: 我一直很喜欢你的纹身。它们讲述了你的故事。

original: I guess I am a bit sentimental about the milestones in my life. Ever think about getting a few tattoos, or maybe a few more, on yourself? They'd look good on you!
string: 我想我对生命中的里程碑有点多愁善感。有没有想过在自己身上纹几个，或者多纹几个？它们在你身上会很好看！

original: With all that ink, I can't believe you're able to convince anyone that you aren't a pirate.
string: 就凭这些墨水，我不相信你还能让别人相信你不是海盗。

original: Hahaha! Misdirection and distraction, love. Most people just see what they want to see.
string: 哈哈哈！误导和分散注意力，亲爱的。大多数人只看到他们想看到的。

original: You're the one who's always seen right through my act. I love that about you.
string: 你总是能看穿我的把戏。我爱你这一点。

original: Hahahaha! Misdirection and distraction, my friend! Most people just see what they want to see.
string: 哈哈哈！误导和分散注意力，我的朋友！大多数人只是看到了他们想看的东西。

original: Turns out you're not like most people. I've always liked that about you.
string: 原来你和大多数人不一样。我一直很喜欢你这一点。

original: Sure, anyone can extinguish a lighthouse, but it takes skill to run down a ship and take her at sea. I guess this is gonna be amateur hour.
string: 当然，任何人都可以熄灭灯塔，但要把船弄沉并把它带到海上需要技巧。我猜这只是业余的家伙。

original: Please call me...
string: 请称我…

original: She/Her
string: 她。

original: He/Him
string: 他。

original: They/Them
string: Ta们。

original: Let's talk about something else.
string: 我们谈点别的吧。

original: About that boat ride on Lake Ilinalta...
string: 关于在伊琳娜塔湖上乘船的事…

original: I'd love to go.
string: 我很想去。

original: That's great! There's a spot near the Guardian Stones where the locals keep their fishing boats. I'll arrange to rent one for the day.
string: 好极了守护石附近有个地方 当地人会把渔船停在那里我会安排租一艘一天。

original: Maybe another time.
string: 下次再说吧。

original: Well, let me know if you reconsider.
string: 如果你重新考虑，请告诉我。

original: This isn't a good time for boat rides.
string: 现在不适合乘船。

original: I understand.
string: 我明白了。

original: I was wondering, why did you rescue me?
string: 我在想，你为什么要救我？

original: What do you mean?
string: 你什么意思？

original: You didn't have go to that island. You didn't have to get involved. But you went out of your way... for me. Why?
string: 你没必要去那个岛，你没必要卷进来。但你为了我… 不顾一切。为什么？

original: You seemed like you were in trouble.
string: 你好像有麻烦了。

original: And you went looking for trouble?
string: 你去找麻烦了？

original: Curiosity, I suppose. I wanted to see what you were like.
string: 我想是好奇吧。我想看看你是什么样的人？

original: How do I measure up so far?
string: 我目前的表现如何？

original: I really needed a ship. People said you were a captain.
string: 我真的需要一艘船。人们说你是船长？

original: Hah! Joke was on you then.
string: 哈，那你还真会开玩笑。

original: I had a score to settle with the captain of the Dark Rose. I thought that was you.
string: 我和黑玫瑰号的船长有一笔账要算。我以为是你。

original: It wouldn't be the first I've had to pay my father's debts. What did he do?
string: 我又不是第一次为父亲还债了他做了什么？

original: To be honest, I hoped there was a bounty for you.
string: 说实话，我还希望能有赏金找你呢。

original: Hah! And yet, here we are... not much of a bounty hunter, are you?
string: 哈！然而，我们在这里…不是做为赏金猎人，是吗？

original: I went looking to help. It was the right thing to do.
string: 我去寻求帮助。这样做是对的。

original: You've lived your life well, then. And... I'd say you've made better use of yours than I have with mine.
string: 那你这一生过得不错。而且…我得说你比我更好地利用了你的生命。

original: I like what I see. Never a dull moment!
string: 我喜欢我所看到的。从来没有沉闷的时刻！

original: Heh! Well, if nothing else, I can promise you won't lack for excitement around me.
string: 嘿好吧，如果不出意外的话，我保证你在我身边不会缺少刺激。

original: Some pirate you are. Captain of a rowboat!
string: 你真是个海盗划艇船长。

original: Hey! I've moved up in the world compared to when we met. Stick with me; who knows where we'll end up.
string: 嘿，和我们认识时相比，我的地位已经提高了。跟着我，谁知道我们会走到哪一步呢？

original: He sank my ship and left me for dead.
string: 他击沉了我的船，让我自生自灭。

original: I'm sorry that happened. I... don't do those things anymore.
string: 很抱歉发生这种事，我…不再做那些事了。

original: I haven't decided if I'm turning you in yet.
string: 我还没决定要不要告发你呢？

original: Having all that money's no fun if you don't have anyone to spend it with. Besides... I've got enough for both of us.
string: 如果没有人陪你一起花钱，那就没意思了。再说…我的钱够我们两个花了。

original: What do you know, there is a shipwreck here! The water's so clear I can just about see to the bottom. Want to go for a swim and check it out?
string: 你知道吗，这里有一艘沉船！海水清澈见底想游泳去看看吗？

original: The water's too cold. Let's stay in the boat.
string: 水太冷了，我们留在船上吧。

original: Is it? I hadn't noticed. I guess I forget about that Nord cold resistance sometimes.
string: 是吗？我没注意到。我想我有时会忘了诺德的耐寒性。

original: Absolutely!
string: 当然！

original: I knew you couldn't resist an adventure. Let's see what we can find down there.
string: 我就知道你不会拒绝冒险的。看看我们能在下面找到什么吧。

original: The current's not too strong; we could just climb back in the boat when we're finished swimming.
string: 水流不是很急，我们游完就可以爬回船上。

original: I prefer to stay dry, but don't let me stop you.
string: 我更喜欢保持干燥，但别让我阻止你。

original: Pht, suit yourself, but if I find any sunken treasure? Don't expect me to share it.
string: 随便你，但如果我找到什么沉没的宝藏？别指望我会分享。

original: It's beautiful here.
string: 这里真美。

original: How does it compare to the ocean?
string: 它与海洋相比如何？

original: Well, the company's much better! As for the view? I'd rather look into your eyes than stare over the horizon.
string: 嗯，公司的情况好多了！至于风景？我宁愿看着你的眼睛，也不愿盯着地平线。

original: I was just thinking that I'd like to kiss you.
string: 我只是在想，我想吻你。

original: Oh! Um... I...
string: 哦！嗯…我…

original: Haha, you could say no.
string: 哈哈，你可以说不。

original: What a coincidence; I'd like for you to kiss me, too.
string: 真巧，我也想让你吻我。

original: I wish I'd asked you sooner...
string: 我真希望早点问你…

original: I'm not that easy, pirate.
string: 我没那么简单，海盗。

original: I'm not planning on taking any 'liberties' here on the bridge.
string: 我不打算在桥上做任何“自由发挥”。

original: Just a kiss.
string: 只是一个吻

original: You can kiss me.
string: 你可以吻我。

original: Maybe later.
string: 可能晚些。

original: All you'll have to do is ask.
string: 你要做的就是问一问。

original: NO.
string: 不。

original: Oh, sorry. Uh, I won't bring it up again.
string: 哦，对不起，我不会再提了。

original: All right, but behave yourself!
string: 好吧，但请注意你的行为。

original: I'm a gentleman!
string: 我是个绅士。

original: My answer is no... for now.
string: 我的回答是…暂时没有。

original: As you wish.
string: 如你所愿。

original: Not happening. EVER.
string: 不可能。永远不会。

original: Sorry. I won't bring it up again.
string: 对不起，我不会再提了。

original: I did find something in the wreck. Here; it's for you.
string: 我在残骸里找到了一些东西。给你。

original: Just make sure it's quick, okay? My partner over there gets the payment.
string: 一定要快点，好吗？我的搭档拿到了钱。

original: Hey, Athis. I was wondering, why did you sign on with the Companions anyway?
string: 嘿，阿蒂斯。我在想，你为什么要加入战友团？

original: Well there's plenty of that to be had all over. What are you doing here, specifically?
string: 这里到处都有这种东西。你来这里做什么？

original: I don't mean any offense, I was just hoping to understand.
string: 我没有任何冒犯的意思，我只是希望能够理解。

original: Heh, or as in my case, a Nord can be born with the heart of an elf. I'm glad you found a place you belong.
string: 就像我一样，诺德人也可能生来就有一颗精灵的心。我很高兴你找到了属于自己的地方。

original: Fortune and glory, friend. Fortune and glory. Honor, battle, all that.
string: 财富与荣耀，朋友。财富和荣耀。荣誉，战斗，一切。

original: Indeed. I may be dark elf by birth but, 'Even an elf can be born with the heart of a Nord.' Honor is in our blood.
string: 的确如此。我可能天生就是黑暗精灵，但即使是精灵，也可能天生拥有诺德人的心，荣誉是我们的血脉。
