original: Ugh, my partner's gonna kill me...
string: 唉，我的搭档会杀了我的…

original: There's just something about finding a map like this that makes me happy. 'X' marks the spot after all!
string: 找到这样一张地图让我很开心。毕竟，“X”标志着地点！

original: When you follow me...
string: 当你跟随我时…

original: Stick close.
string: 跟紧点。

original: I'll be right beside you.
string: 我就在你身旁。

original: Give me some space.
string: 给我一点空间。

original: I'll give you some room to maneuver.
string: 我给你留点回旋的空间。

original: Use Clear Skies!
string: 使用净天！

original: About this Golden Claw replica...
string: 关于这个黄金龙爪复制品…

original: Yeah? Heh heh. It's a pretty good copy, isn't it?
string: 是吗？嘿嘿，抄得不错吧？

original: What were you planning to do with it?
string: 你打算用它做什么？

original: I'm betting that Lucan Valerius in Riverwood won't be able to tell the difference between this copy and the real thing.
string: 我敢打赌，河木镇的路坎-瓦列利乌斯一定分辨不出这个复制品和真品的区别。

original: I have an idea...
string: 我有个主意…

original: Does it involve Lucan Valerius and the Riverwood Trader?
string: 是否与路坎-瓦列利乌斯和河木商人有关？

original: Please don't tell me you were going to do something illegal with this.
string: 请不要告诉我你想用这个做违法的事。

original: All right, in that case I won't tell you that I was planning to switch this copy for the real thing the next time we're at the Riverwood Trader.
string: 好吧，既然如此，我就不告诉你，我打算下次去河木贸易商行时，把这本换成真货。

original: Oh, I did kind of want to keep the real Golden Claw...
string: 哦，我确实有点想保留真正的金爪…

original: Say no more, love. Just keep Lucan distracted the next time we're in the shop. I'll take care of the rest.
string: 别说了，亲爱的。下次去店里的时候，让路坎分心就行，剩下的交给我。

original: Val, you know I don't like it when you steal.
string: 瓦尔，你知道我不喜欢你偷东西。

original: All right... this must be true love, because I'm actually agreeing to not steal something.
string: 好吧…这一定是真爱，因为我真的同意不偷东西了。

original: It does! Do you think he could tell the difference between this copy and the real thing?
string: 确实如此你觉得他能分辨出复制品和真品的区别吗？

original: I sure hope not! Next time we're in his shop, I'll switch the real one for the copy if you can distract him.
string: 希望不会下次我们去他店里的时候，如果你能转移他的注意力，我就把真品换成复制品。

original: Yes, and I don't trust that look in your eye.
string: 是的，我不相信你的眼神。

original: Oh come on, he would have never caught me!
string: 得了吧，他根本抓不到我！

original: I said don't tell me! Do what you have to do, okay? I just want the real claw.
string: 我说了别告诉我。做你该做的，好吗？我只想要真正的爪子。

original: Oh you're well past plausible deniability, love. Don't worry, your wish is my command.
string: 亲爱的，你已经不再似是而非了。别担心，你的愿望就是我的命令。

original: That's what I was afraid of. You're incorrigible!
string: 这就是我担心的。你真是无可救药。

original: It's part of my charm! Come on, this kind of thing can't possibly be a surprise to you by now.
string: 这是我魅力的一部分。拜托，这种事你现在不可能不知道吧？

original: Here's the replica. I'll keep Lucan distracted.
string: 这是复制品。我会分散路坎的注意力。

original: About Meeko...
string: 关于米科…

original: The dog that's been following us? I really like him. He's a good boy, don't you think?
string: 那只一直跟着我们的狗？我很喜欢它它是个好孩子，你觉得呢？

original: He is a good boy, but I think we should find a suitable home for him.
string: 他是个好孩子，但我认为我们应该为他找个合适的家。

original: Oh. I suppose it is dangerous for him to travel with us. Hmph. Well, as long as we find him the right person.
string: 哦。我想他和我们一起旅行是很危险的。哼。好吧，只要我们给他找对人。

original: He's the best boy. We should keep him.
string: 他是最好的孩子。我们应该留下他。

original: I was hopin' you'd say that. What are your thoughts about dogs on the furniture...?
string: 我就希望你会这么说你对家具上的狗有什么看法…？

original: I'm more of a cat person, but since you like him we can keep him around.
string: 我更喜欢猫，但既然你喜欢它，我们可以把它留在身边。

original: I have to admit I've gotten attached. I'd miss the big guy if he weren't with us.
string: 我得承认我对它有感情了。如果他不在我们身边，我会想念这个大家伙的。

original: He smells and has fleas. That stray dog has got to go.
string: 它又臭又有跳蚤！那只流浪狗必须离开！

original: If you find 'strays' so objectionable, maybe I ought to go, too.
string: 如果你觉得“流浪者”如此令人讨厌，也许我也该走了。

original: Why do I get the feeling this used to involve living people and the fire pit...
string: 为什么我觉得这是活人和火坑…

original: References to the wind- that's always Kynareth, the hawk symbol.
string: 提到风--那总是凯娜瑞丝，鹰的象征。

original: It's beautiful up here.
string: 这里太美了。

original: No! I'll kill every last one of you!
string: 不，我要杀光你们所有人！

original: No, no! This can't be happening!
string: 不，不！这不可能…

original: This can't be happening... Aelyn...
string: 这不可能…艾琳…

original: This can't be happening... Aislinn...
string: 这不可能…阿斯林！

original: This can't be happening... Alannah...
string: 这不可能…阿兰娜…

original: This can't be happening... Aris...
string: 这不可能…阿里斯…

original: This can't be happening... Bree...
string: 这不可能…布里…

original: This can't be happening... Cyndrian...
string: 这不可能…辛德里安…

original: This can't be happening... Cyr...
string: 这不可能…希尔…

original: This can't be happening... Dahlia...
string: 这不可能…达丽亚…

original: This can't be happening... Elise...
string: 这不可能…伊利丝…

original: This can't be happening... Illia...
string: 这不可能…伊利亚…

original: This can't be happening... Inula...
string: 这不可能…伊努拉…

original: This can't be happening... Jacek...
string: 这不可能…雅斯克…

original: This can't be happening... Joseph...
string: 这不可能…约瑟夫…

original: This can't be happening... Luna...
string: 这不可能…露娜…

original: This can't be happening... Maevynn...
string: 这不可能…梅维恩…

original: This can't be happening... Maximillian...
string: 这不可能…马克西米利安…

original: This can't be happening... Min...
string: 这不可能…敏…

original: This can't be happening... Myfanwy...
string: 这不可能…米凡维…

original: This can't be happening... Rathas...
string: 这不可能…拉萨斯…

original: This can't be happening... Ren...
string: 这不可能…仁…

original: This can't be happening... Ruby...
string: 这不可能…鲁比…

original: This can't be happening... Thelassia...
string: 这不可能…瑟拉西亚…

original: This can't be happening... Valerian...
string: 这不可能…瓦雷利安…

original: Bastards! You'll wish you were never born!
string: 狗东西！你们会希望自己从未出生过！

original: When I'm through you'll beg for death, you son of a whore!
string: 等我杀了你，你这个婊子养的就等着求死吧！

original: When I'm through you'll beg for death, you worthless bitch!
string: 等我弄死你，你这贱人婊子！

original: Ah! Val, you're back. Been waiting to have a word with you. Just got some more clients.
string: 啊！瓦尔，你回来了，我一直在等着跟你说话呢，又有客户来了。

original: What kind of business? Na- Don't answer, I don't want to know.
string: 什么生意？别回答，我不想知道。

original: Pull up a seat, have a drink. We can talk later.
string: 请坐，喝一杯，我们稍后再谈。

original: Oh, I see. You're making friends all over.
string: 哦，我明白了。你在到处交朋友。

original: Why don't you just formally join up? We could use someone with your skills.
string: 你为什么不正式加入呢？我们需要像你这样的人。

original: You're right. Probably a waste of your time anyway, and you'll be rich enough to retire before you know it.
string: 你是对的。不管怎样，这可能是在浪费你的时间，在你意识到之前，你就会变得足够富有，可以退休了。

original: I am here on business, but not my usual business today.
string: 我今天是来办事的，但不是平常的事。

original: Relax, I'm just helping my partner here for a bit. Any trouble that gets started is on their account.
string: 放心吧，我只是在帮我的搭档一会儿。任何麻烦都是他们造成的。

original: Ahh, you know me. I'm not really a 'joiner.' Independent contracting is more my line of work. Profitable work.
string: 啊，你知道我的。我不是一个真正的“加入者”。独自干活儿更适合我的工作。有利可图的工作。

original: See you around, Delvin.
string: 再见了，戴尔文。

original: Sure, but doesn't she seem a little confused at times?
string: 当然，但她有时看起来是不是有点困惑？

original: I guess even the brilliant types can be absent-minded. Ha ha ha ha! Eh, no one's perfect.
string: 我想，即使是才华横溢的人也有心不在焉的时候。哈哈哈哈，人无完人。

original: It's a miracle she hasn't accidentally destroyed the city.
string: 她没有不小心毁掉这座城市已经是个奇迹了。

original: It's too soon to be certain; give her some time! (laughs)
string: 现在还不能确定，给她一些时间吧！

original: Anyway, I do feel more confident about my abilities to study. Thank you.
string: 无论如何，我确实对自己的学习能力更有信心了。谢谢你们。

original: I'd assumed she'd be competent. Clearly, I was wrong.
string: 我以为她能胜任。显然，我错了。

original: Oh, I don't know about that. She's still in once piece!
string: 哦，这我可不知道。她还完好无损。

original: I probably have been too hard on myself about getting everything perfect with my magic.
string: 我可能对自己太苛刻了，总想把魔法做到尽善尽美。

original: Nice armor.
string: 漂亮的盔甲

original: Thanks! I got it off of a Riekling tribe for two pieces of moldy cheese and bucket with a hole in it.
string: 谢谢我用两块发霉的奶酪和一个有洞的桶从里克林部落买的。

original: I had to wash a some, well a lot of bloodstains out of it, but it was a good deal!
string: 我不得不洗掉一些血迹，但这是笔好买卖！

original: I'm not really sure why Val has such a problem with the little blue guys. They seem reasonable.
string: 我不太明白瓦尔为什么对这些蓝色小家伙有这么大的意见。他们看起来很通情达理。

original: I'm glad we got to spend some time together that wasn't all business. I really like your company.
string: 我很高兴我们能在一起，而不是只谈公事。我真的很喜欢你的陪伴。

original: They say a bad day sailing is better than a good day working. Pht! All the same, let's go back to business.
string: 俗话说，航海的坏日子胜过工作的好日子。是啊还是那句话，我们言归正传。

original: I wanna do this again soon. Just you and me; no distractions.
string: 我想很快再来一次。只有你和我，心无旁骛。

original: How do you like the ships at the docks?
string: 你喜欢码头上的船只吗？

original: Those are boats, not ships.
string: 那些是船，不是船。

original: What do you think of the harbor?
string: 您觉得港口怎么样？

original: The boats are... fine. A bad day sailing is better than a good day working, as the saying goes. But it's not the same as a ship at sea.
string: 船…很好。俗话说 “干一天活不如开一天船”。但这和海上的船是不一样的。

original: I'm staying out of it.
string: 我要置身事外。

original: It's not that simple. They'll drag you in if they can. You might figure you can swim, but there's always a price. Places like this use people.
string: 没那么简单。如果可以，他们会把你拖下水。你可能觉得自己会游泳 但这是有代价的。这种地方需要人。

original: Why not?
string: 为什么不呢？

original: A ship is more than just wood and ropes nailed together.
string: 船不仅仅是木头和绳索钉成的。

original: I think I understand...
string: 我想我明白了…

original: Then you understand that feeling of freedom! That feeling like anything is possible if you just cross the horizon.
string: 然后你就会明白那种自由的感觉！那种只要跨过地平线，一切皆有可能的感觉。

original: A ship is more than that.
string: 一艘船不仅仅是这样。

original: She's your shelter against all the reckless wild of the sea. She'll carry your heart and soul over the horizon, and if you treat her right...
string: 她是你的避风港，抵御大海的肆意狂野。她将带着你的心和灵魂飞越地平线，如果你能正确对待她…

original: She'll always bring you home.
string: 她总会带你回家。

original: What do you say we go to bed early?
string: 我们早点上床睡觉怎么样？

original: Ah, you say the sweetest things to me.
string: 啊，你对我说了最动听的话。

original: Lead the way, love.
string: 带路吧，亲爱的。

original: As you wish, love.
string: 如你所愿，亲爱的

original: Oh, I like that plan!
string: 哦，我喜欢这个计划！

original: Oooh... I like your style, love!
string: 哦…我喜欢你的风格，亲爱的！

original: Good, I like a challenge!
string: 很好，我喜欢挑战！

original: Keep that up, and I'm gonna tie your hands behind your back.
string: 再这样，我就把你的手绑在背后。

original: You can call me 'Captain.'
string: 你可以叫我“船长”。

original: What do you say we pick a safety word, too?
string: 我们也选一个安全词怎么样？

original: Depends on how you want it...
string: 这要看你怎么想了…

original: Glad to be of service...
string: 很高兴能为你服务......

original: I knew I should have worked on learning some fire spells!
string: 我知道我应该努力学习一些火系法术！

original: All right everyone, just wanna make a quick announcement with me and my good friend here. We're gonna get you a whole batch of free drinks, and the reason why is my good friend there happens to be...
string: 好了各位。我和我的好朋友要宣布一件事，我们将为大家准备一大批免费饮料，原因是我的好朋友正好…

original: ... Drumroll? Anyone? No volunteers? Where's the bard when you need him. Sigh. They're the Dragonborn!
string: … 鼓声？有人知道吗？没有志愿者吗？当你需要吟游诗人的时候，他在哪里。叹息。他们是龙裔！

original: Maybe a little...
string: 也许有点…

original: How do I measure up so far?
string: 我目前的表现如何？

original: It's a good arrangement when the Thieves Guild isn't getting in their own way, that is. It's been all asses and elbows with them lately.
string: 在盗贼公会不碍事的情况下，这是个不错的安排。最近跟他们的关系一直很暧昧。

original: I kinda like her, uh except for the part where she might stab me.
string: 我挺喜欢她的除了她可能会捅我的那部分。

original: We might get separated so be ready for anything.
string: 我们可能会走散，所以做好一切准备。

original: I'm still a wanted man in Solitude. We'd better talk to Captain Aldis first thing before I get arrested again.
string: 我仍然是独孤城的通缉犯。在我再次被捕前，我们最好先找艾迪斯队长谈谈。

original: I could have used that shout on deck during a few storms I've been in.
string: 在我经历过的几次风暴中，我本可以在甲板上用这句话的。

original: About the house fire in Morthal...
string: 关于莫索尔的房屋失火…

original: If that man burned his family on purpose, I say we skip the Jarl and administer our own justice.
string: 如果那个人是故意烧死他的家人，我建议我们跳过领主，自己主持公道。

original: The girl who died reminds me of Ravani. If we hadn't found her in Windhelm when we did- Well, I don't like to think about it.
string: 那个死去的女孩让我想起了拉瓦妮，如果我们当时没有在风舵城找到她，我不愿意去想这件事。

original: Helgi doesn't have anyone on her side.
string: 海尔吉没有人站在她那边。

original: Helgi doesn't have anyone on her side.
string: 海尔吉没有人站在她那边。

original: It's time to wake up.
string: 该醒醒了。

original: Please tell me you made coffee...
string: 请告诉我你煮了咖啡…

original: It's time to wake up.
string: 该醒醒了。

original: Thank Azura there's coffee...
string: 感谢阿祖拉，这里有咖啡…

original: It's time to wake up.
string: 该醒醒了。

original: Five more minutes...
string: 再等五分钟…

original: It's time to wake up.
string: 该醒醒了。

original: I'm up! I'm up. Kind of.
string: 我起来了！我起来了！算是吧…

original: It's time to wake up.
string: 该醒醒了。

original: I'll rise but I won't shine.
string: 我会崛起，但我不会发光…

original: It's time to wake up.
string: 该醒醒了。

original: Uargh...
string: 呃…

original: It's time to wake up.
string: 该醒醒了。

original: Time to stand up.
string: 该起来了。

original: I believe it's your turn to buy the drinks.
string: 轮到你买酒了吧。

original: Gladly! Pick your poison...
string: 很高兴选择你的毒药…

original: All you had to do was ask!
string: 你只需开口！

original: Let me know if I can get you anything else...
string: 如果还需要什么，请告诉我…

original: You sure about that? It might cost you.
string: 你确定吗？这可能会让你付出代价。

original: What can I get you, handsome?
string: 要喝点什么，帅哥？

original: What can I get you, handsome?
string: 要喝点什么，帅哥？

original: What'll it be, gorgeous?
string: 会是什么呢，美女？

original: What'll it be, gorgeous?
string: 会是什么呢，美女？

original: What'll it be, gorgeous?
string: 会是什么呢，美女？

original: Buy you a drink, sailor?
string: 请你喝一杯，水手？

original: Planning to show me a good time, are you?
string: 你打算让我爽一把吗？

original: That's one way to get my attention!
string: 这也是引起我注意的一种方法！

original: That's one way to get my attention!
string: 这也是引起我注意的一种方法！

original: Only if I can return the favor later.
string: 除非我以后能回报你。

original: Are you sure you know what you're getting yourself into?
string: 你确定你知道自己在做什么吗？

original: Okay, but only because you're handsome.
string: 好吧，但只是因为你长得帅。

original: Okay, but only because you're handsome.
string: 好吧，但只是因为你长得帅。

original: Of course, beautiful!
string: 当然，很漂亮！

original: Of course, beautiful!
string: 当然，很漂亮！

original: Mead.
string: 蜜酒。

original: Let's try this one; I haven't had it in a while.
string: 让我们试试这个，我有一段时间没吃了。

original: I wonder how long it would take to sample all the types of mead in Skyrim?
string: 我想知道要花多长时间才能尝遍天际所有类型的蜂蜜酒？

original: Ale.
string: 啤酒。

original: What do Winterhold and this ale have in common? They're both really close to water. Let me know if you want somethin' stronger.
string: 冬堡和这种麦酒有什么共同点？它们都非常接近水。如果你想喝更烈的，就告诉我。

original: Here you go; it's just strong enough to notice but weak enough to keep us out of trouble.
string: 给你；它强到足以引起注意，但弱到足以让我们远离麻烦。

original: Wine.
string: 葡萄酒。

original: It's hard to find a decent vintage in Skyrim, but this should do.
string: 在天际中很难找到像样的年份酒，但这个应该可以。

original: Hopefully this is drinkable! We are in Skyrim after all.
string: 希望这能喝！毕竟我们是在天际。

original: Doesn't matter as long as it's strong!
string: 只要结实就行！

original: Time for some serious drinking!
string: 是时候痛饮一番了！

original: One of those days, huh?
string: 也有这样的一天，是吧？

original: Doesn't matter as long as it's strong...
string: 不要紧，只要它是强大的…

original: Milk.
string: 牛奶。

original: Oh, that's right; you don't drink.
string: 对了，你不喝酒。

original: You realize we're in Skyrim, right?
string: 你知道我们在天际吧？

original: Surprise me.
string: 随你便吧。

original: You trust me that much, huh?
string: 你就这么信任我？

original: The night is young; anything might happen.
string: 夜色尚早，一切都有可能发生。

original: I changed my mind.
string: 我改变主意了。

original: Don't say I didn't offer.
string: 别说我没提议。

original: (Val is smiling at you)
string: （欣赏音乐）

original: Would you care to dance?
string: 你想跳舞吗？

original: I'd love to!
string: 我很乐意！

original: I promise not to step on your toes if you let me lead.
string: 如果你让我带队，我保证不会踩到你的脚趾。

original: I don't really know how...
string: 我真的不知道如何…

original: Not to worry; just follow my lead.
string: 别担心，跟着我就行。

original: You can dance?!
string: 你会跳舞？

original: I'm full of surprises, what can I say?
string: 我充满了惊喜，我能说什么呢？

original: I learned in High Rock. Spent a lot of time there when I was younger.
string: 我是在高岩中学的。我年轻时在那里待过很长一段时间。

original: I do NOT dance.
string: 我不跳舞。

original: That's a shame; I was looking forward to steppin' on your toes.
string: 真遗憾，我还想踩踩你的脚趾呢。

original: Did you find anything while we were exploring?
string: 我们探险的时候，你有什么发现吗？

original: I found this unusual pearl.
string: 我发现了这颗不寻常的珍珠。

original: Ah, it's beautiful! Looks like it's a day for rare finds.
string: 啊，太美了！看来今天是难得一见的好日子。

original: I suppose you could trade it for somethin' else, or turn it into a fancy piece of jewelry, but if it were mine...
string: 我想你可以把它换成别的东西，或者把它变成一件精美的首饰，但如果它是我的…

original: I wouldn't change a thing.
string: 我不会改变任何东西。

original: I've heard about a hunter's camp where it's safe to relax and enjoy the warm water. What do you say we explore the famous hot springs of Eastmarch?
string: 我听说过一个猎人营地，在那里可以放松身心，享受温暖的泉水。我们去探索一下东征著名的温泉怎么样？

original: Sounds relaxing! Let's do it.
string: 听起来很轻松。开始吧。

original: Lead the way, love. I'll mark the spot on your map.
string: 带路吧，亲爱的。我会在你的地图上做记号。

original: We're kind of busy right now. Maybe later.
string: 我们现在有点忙。以后再说吧。

original: Fiiiiine. I'll mark the spot on your map in case you decide 'all work and no play' is no way to live.
string: 好吧，我会在你的地图上标出这个地方，以防你认为“只工作不玩耍”是不可能的生活方式。

original: Are you joking? The water smells terrible.
string: 你在开玩笑吗？这水真难闻！

original: That's just sulfur; it's supposed to be good for your skin. Come on, live a little.
string: 那只是硫磺，应该对皮肤有好处。来吧，活得精彩点。

original: I am NOT bathing with you.
string: 我不会和你一起洗澡的。

original: Pht, as long as you take a bath somewhere... or at the very least keep downwind of me.
string: 啧，只要你在某个地方洗个澡…或者至少保持在我的下风处。

original: I could give you the obvious line about staying warm... but, I was hoping you'd sit close to me whether you're cold or not.
string: 我可以给你说一句保暖的话…但是，我希望不管你冷不冷，都能坐在我身边。

original: Lead the way, handsome.
string: 带路吧，帅哥。

original: That's exactly what I was hoping you'd say.
string: 这正是我希望你说的话。

original: Are you sure you know where you're going?
string: 你确定你知道你要去哪里吗？

original: You'll just have to trust me.
string: 你就相信我吧。

original: I've changed my mind. Maybe some other time.
string: 我改变主意了。改天吧。

original: Your loss, sweetheart.
string: 你的损失，亲爱的。

original: It's not often I feel so at ease.
string: 我很少感到如此自在。

original: I'm glad we got away from the crowd!
string: 我很高兴我们远离了人群！

original: I can't imagine what it's like to be on edge all the time.
string: 我无法想象一直提心吊胆是什么滋味。

original: It's a balance, really. Too much comfort and I'd worry about gettin' soft and winding up in an early grave.
string: 这是一种平衡，真的。太安逸了，我会担心自己变得软弱无力，然后早早地进入坟墓。

original: Too little? Well, I've tried that long enough, I think.
string: 太少？我想我已经试了很久了。

original: I know what you mean, but I can relax around you.
string: 我知道你的意思，但在你身边我可以放松。

original: I've never really had this before. With anyone.
string: 我以前从未有过这种感觉。和任何人。

original: Don't get complacent, pirate. I'll keep you on your toes!
string: 不要自满，海盗。我会让你时刻保持警惕的。

original: Don't threaten me with a good time.
string: 别用好日子来威胁我。

original: Why do you say that?
string: 为什么你会这么说？

original: Heh, I've had a few dreams about you that started this way.
string: 我做过几个关于你的梦，都是这样开始的。

original: Kiss me.
string: 吻我。

original: I did find the best seat available...
string: 我确实找到了最好的座位…

original: That's gonna cost you at least one kiss.
string: 这至少会让你失去一个吻。

original: Don't get ahead of yourself. I just... needed a place to sit.
string: 别自以为是了。我只是…想找个地方坐坐。

original: You keep telling yourself that. I just needed a place to put my hands.
string: 你一直这么对自己说。我只是想找个地方放把手。

original: Kiss me. I don't bite.
string: 吻我，我不咬人。

original: All you had to do was ask...
string: 你只需要问…

original: Oh! Um, no thanks? This is kind of a surprise...
string: 不，谢谢？这真是个惊喜…

original: Ahem. In that case, this might be a good time to find another seat... unless you want another surprise...
string: 咳咳。既然如此，现在也许是另找座位的好时机…除非你还想再来个惊喜…

original: That's a bargain I can't resist.
string: 这可是我无法抗拒的便宜货。

original: Paid in full...
string: 全额支付…

original: I'll sit somewhere else.
string: 我去别的地方坐。

original: Oh. I'll just be here then. Trying to locate my dignity.
string: 哦，哦。那我就在这里试图找回我的尊严。

original: What if I bite you first?
string: 如果我先咬你呢？

original: Only one way to find out...
string: 只有一个办法可以知道。

original: ...wait, you're not a vampire are you?
string: 等等，你不是吸血鬼吧？

original: This was a bad idea...
string: 这是一个坏主意…

original: I'm happy to be your next bad decision, but only if you want to. Why don't you sit next to me instead?
string: 我很乐意成为你下一个错误的决定，但前提是你愿意。你为什么不坐在我旁边呢？

original: This isn't what I expected. TIME TO GO.
string: 这和我预想的不一样。该走了。

original: (long-suffering sigh)
string: （长长的叹息）

original: I don't know WHAT I was thinking. I'm getting up.
string: 我不知道自己在想什么。我起来了

original: (long-suffering sigh)
string: （长长的叹息）

original: I seem to have gotten your mail again, Valerius.
string: 我好像又收到你的信了，瓦列利乌斯。

original: Heh heh. My mother is not pleased to have missed the ceremony, but she is truly happy for us.
string: 嘿嘿。我母亲并不高兴错过了仪式，但她真的为我们感到高兴。

original: At least she hasn't started going on about grandchildren yet...
string: 至少她还没有开始谈论孙子孙女…

original: Ah... My mother is very happy for us, and is now safely very far away.
string: 啊…妈妈很为我们高兴，她现在很安全。在离这里很远的地方。

original: Along with any more ideas about grandchildren...
string: 还有更多关于孙辈的想法…

original: I would like to meet her sometime.
string: 有机会我想见见她。

original: We should visit. As long as we stay out of Anvil, I shouldn't have too many problems in Cyrodiil.
string: 我们应该去看看。只要我们远离铁砧城，我在赛瑞迪尔就不会有太多问题。

original: Sometimes our loved ones are best loved from far away.
string: 有时，远方的亲人最值得我们去爱。

original: Oh that was nothing, you should hear her when she's really mad. The crew on the Dark Rose used to tell stories about her when my father was out of earshot.
string: 哦，那没什么，你应该听听她真正生气时的样子。当我父亲不在的时候，黑玫瑰号上的船员们经常讲她的故事。

original: Grandchildren?!
string: 孙辈？

original: Maybe we could... get a dog...
string: 也许我们可以…养条狗…

original: Your mother loves you. I'm glad I got to meet her.
string: 你妈妈很爱你。我很高兴能见到她。

original: I know. She thinks you're amazing, by the way. She and I finally agree on something... although, I'm just hoping you don't realize you can do better than a scoundrel like me!
string: 我知道顺便说一句，她觉得你很棒。我和她终于在某些事情上达成了一致…不过，我只是希望你不要意识到，你可以比我这个无赖做得更好！

original: We're doomed.
string: 我们注定要失败。

original: One day you're sailing the high seas, the next thing you know you're running a shop in Whiterun.
string: 前一天你还在公海上航行，转眼间你就在白漫城经营一家商店。

original: Let's go do somethin' dangerous before anything else goes wrong.
string: 趁现在还没出什么岔子，我们去干点危险的事吧。

original: Aw, is Valerius scared of his mommy?
string: 啊，瓦列利乌斯害怕妈妈吗？

original: Of course I am! Gods, even my father was scared of her.
string: 我当然害怕！上帝啊，连我父亲都怕她。

original: Have you ever bargained with Clavicus Vile?
string: 你和卡拉威库斯·维尔交易过吗？

original: Well... once. I tried anyway.
string: 嗯…有一次。反正我试过。

original: He told me that my bargain didn't leave him any loopholes and if I ever summoned him again, he'd grant me the insight I wanted by literally turning me inside out.
string: 他告诉我，我的交易没有给他留下任何漏洞，如果我再召唤他，他就会把我从里到外翻个底朝天，让我获得我想要的洞察力。

original: Blessings of Mara upon you. (Give pamphlet)
string: 玛拉祝福你。（给小册子）

original: Haha! Yeah, you do you, my friend.
string: 哈哈！是的，你会的，我的朋友。

original: But it's a little late for you to be judging me.
string: 但现在你来评判我有点晚了。

original: Haha! I thought you knew what you were getting into with me, love.
string: 哈哈！我以为你知道你要和我做什么，亲爱的。

original: But it's a little late for you to be judging me.
string: 但现在你来评判我有点晚了。

original: Oh for the love of- This again? No, no thank you.
string: 看在爱的份上-又来了？不，不，谢谢。

original: I don't want to interfere with your religion, but please leave me out of it.
string: 我不想干涉你们的宗教信仰，但请不要把我扯进来。

original: Repent my sins, start fresh, blah blah blah. You're worse than my mother.
string: 忏悔我的罪孽，重新开始，等等等等。你比我妈还糟糕。

original: When you finish handing out these pamphlets, you can find me at the local den of iniquity. Sinning.
string: 等你发完这些小册子，你就能在当地的罪恶窝点找到我了。罪过。

original: I'm sorry about the pamphlet.
string: 关于小册子的事，我很抱歉。

original: Ah, it's all right. I shouldn't have walked off like that.
string: 啊，没事了。我不该就这么走了。

original: I meant well.
string: 我是出于好意。

original: You and I have very different standards for what counts as a 'misdeed.'
string: 对于什么是“不端行为”，你我的标准大相径庭。

original: I thought it would be funny.
string: 我觉得这样很有趣。

original: My mother's devout. Trying to make up for her past, I guess. Mmhah... At any rate, the Temple of Mara is a sore subject between us.
string: 我妈妈很虔诚，我猜是想弥补她的过去吧。嗯… 无论如何，玛拉神庙是我们之间的一个痛点。

original: Did you read it?
string: 你读过它吗？

original: Don't push your luck.
string: 别得寸进尺了。

original: I don't care who you worship as long as you don't lecture me about it. Deal?
string: 我不在乎你崇拜谁，只要你不劝我也信就行。成交？

original: I'm not getting in that water.
string: 我才不下水呢！

original: Oh come on, it's not that deep and we need the Star.
string: 得了，没那么深，我们需要 “星星”。

original: I'll freeze to death!
string: 我会冻死的！

original: All right, all right, when you put it that way... Give me the key.
string: 好吧，好吧，你这么说…把钥匙给我。

original: Worried you'll mess up your hair? Quit being dramatic; we have work to do.
string: 担心会弄乱头发？别再夸夸其谈了，我们还有工作要做。

original: You're a Nord, you'll be fine.
string: 你是诺德人，你会没事的。

original: Ah, you're lucky you're cute. Give me that key.
string: 啊，你很幸运，你很可爱。把钥匙给我。

original: So are you. Quit complaining and get in the water.
string: 你也一样。别抱怨了，快下水吧。

original: But you're the one with a change of clothes.
string: 但你才是有换洗衣服的人。

original: (puppy eyes)
string: （小狗的眼睛）

original: Ah, don't look at me like that... Give me the key!
string: 啊，别这样看着我…把钥匙给我。

original: Cute, but it'll take more than that to convince me to get my only clothes wet.
string: 很可爱，但要说服我把唯一的衣服弄湿，还需要更多的努力。

original: What's the matter, princess? Afraid to mess up your hair?
string: 怎么了，公主？怕弄乱你的头发？

original: Ha ha ha! You know I'll still look good. Now, give me the key.
string: 哈哈哈！你知道我还是很帅的。现在，把钥匙给我。

original: As a matter of fact, yes.
string: 就事实来说，是的。

original: You just want an eyeful when I go for a swim!
string: 你只是想在我去游泳的时候大饱眼福！

original: Guilty as charged... We do have work to do, so stop flirting already and hand back the key.
string: 罪名成立…我们还有工作要做，所以别再调情了，把钥匙还给我。

original: (laughs) What I want is your help staying out of prison. We'll call the other part a fringe benefit.
string: 我想要的是你帮我远离监狱。我们把另一部分称为附带福利。

original: Ho! Woahaa!
string: 呼！哇哈！

original: This water is colder than I expected!
string: 这水比我想象的要冷！

original: Don't say I never did anything for ya. Here, keep this safe while I dry off.
string: 别说我从没为你做过什么。给你，我擦干的时候把这个保管好。

original: Baked goods, course. What else would I be talking about?
string: 当然是烘焙食品。我还能说什么呢？

original: That's a relief, I thought you were going to complain about that time I pinched  your a- Anyway, I know absolutely nothing about your missing sweetroll.
string: 那我就放心了，我还以为你会抱怨那次我捏你屁股的事-- 总之，我对你丢失甜面包卷的事一无所知。

original: You're looking especially handsome today...
string: 你今天看起来特别帅…

original: Flattery will get you almost anything, love... but I plundered that pastry fair and square!
string: 奉承几乎可以让你得到任何东西，亲爱的…但我光明正大地掠夺了那块糕点！

original: Don't think you can distract me from your crimes.
string: 别以为你能转移我对你罪行的注意力。

original: All's fair in love, war, and sweetrolls, darling.
string: 亲爱的，爱情、战争和甜面包卷都是公平的。

original: I'm gonna report you to the city guard.
string: 我要把你报告给城市卫队。

original: You gotta have evidence before you can report a crime, love.
string: 你得先有证据才能报案，亲爱的。

original: (distract Val and retrieve your sweetroll)
string: （分散瓦尔的注意力，拿回你的甜面包卷）

original: I'm hungry. Now where I did I leave that sweetroll? Coulda sworn I had it here somewhere...
string: 我饿了。我把甜面包卷放哪儿了？我发誓就在这里…

original: I could have sworn I had a sweetr- Ohhahahahaha ! Oh, you are good at this! I didn't even notice.
string: 我发誓我有一个甜面包卷--哦哈哈哈哈！你真厉害！我都没注意到。

original: I was saving that for later.
string: 我是想留到以后再说。

original: I guess I had that coming.
string: 我想这是我自找的。

original: You're not playing fair.
string: 你这样做不公平。

original: I'm not joking. STOP TAKING THEM.
string: 我不是在开玩笑。别再吃了。

original: Fiiine. I guess I do owe you my life. I can't believe you're gonna take this one, harmless joy away from me.
string: 好吧，我想我欠你一条命。真不敢相信你要夺走我这无伤大雅的快乐。

original: Have a sweetroll!
string: 吃个甜面包卷。

original: Thanks, love.
string: 谢谢，亲爱的。

original: A sweetroll from my sweetheart.
string: 我的爱人送的甜面包卷！

original: If you're trying to bribe me, it's working.
string: 如果你是想贿赂我，那就成功了。

original: Careful! The way to a man's heart is through his stomach.
string: 小心；通往男人心脏的路要通过他的胃。

original: I hope you brought enough for everyone.
string: 我希望你给每个人都带了足够的食物。

original: Sharing is caring.
string: 分享就是关爱。

original: Thanks; I love these!
string: 谢谢；我喜欢这些！

original: If you're trying to bribe me, it's working.
string: 如果你是想贿赂我，那就成功了。

original: Do you have a napkin? These things are kinda sticky.
string: 你有餐巾纸吗？这些东西有点粘。

original: I was kinda hoping I'd have to steal one...
string: 我还挺希望能偷一个呢…

original: I guess these come in other flavors, but the original is my favorite.
string: 我猜还有其他口味，但我最喜欢原味的。

original: I don't suppose you have a coffee to go with this?
string: 我想你没有咖啡配这个吧？

original: It is only fair.
string: 这才公平。

original: Don't mind if I take two...
string: 不要介意我拿两个…

original: The museum curator wants me to retrieve the shards of Mehrunes' Razor for him.
string: 博物馆馆长想让我帮他找回梅鲁涅斯·大衮剃刀的碎片。

original: Mehrunes Dagon? You might as well try to bargain with a wildfire. Why bother with this dagger?
string: 梅鲁涅斯·大衮吗？你还不如跟野火讨价还价呢。为什么要用这把匕首？

original: Mehrunes Dagon? You might as well try to bargain with a wildfire. Why bother with this dagger?
string: 梅鲁涅斯·大衮吗？你还不如跟野火讨价还价呢。为什么要用这把匕首？

original: This museum curator in Dawnstar wants me to retrieve the shards of Mehrunes' Razor for him.
string: 晨星的博物馆馆长想让我帮他找回梅鲁涅斯·大衮剃刀的碎片。

original: The Razor is a dangerous artifact and will be safer in my hands.
string: 剃刀是一件危险的神器，在我手里会更安全。

original: Argh, by Azura. Of all the self-righteous-
string: 啊，阿祖拉在上。你真自以为是——

original: I should have expected this with your faith. Hanh. I guess it's better off with you than in some farmer's sock drawer.
string: 以你的信念，我早该预料到这一点。行。我想它和你在一起总比放在某个农夫的袜子抽屉里好吧。

original: Argh, by Azura. Of all the self-righteous-
string: 啊，阿祖拉在上。你真自以为是——

original: All right, hero. Lead the way.
string: 好吧，英雄。带路吧。

original: Simple. Silus is going to pay us.
string: 很简单。希鲁斯会付钱给我们的。

original: All right, but make sure we get paid before Dagon turns him into a smoking crater.
string: 好吧，但要确保我们在大衮把他变成一个冒烟的弹坑之前拿到钱。

original: Reassembling the pieces will please Mehrunes Dagon.
string: 重新组合这些碎片会让梅鲁涅斯·大衮高兴的。

original: We could save time and just set a bunch of things on fire... possibly some people, too. Dagon loves that stuff.
string: 我们可以节省时间，直接点燃一堆东西…也可能点燃一些人。大衮喜欢那东西。

original: Seriously though, have you ever read a history book? This can't possibly end well.
string: 说真的，你读过历史书吗？这不可能有好结果。

original: What would you do without me?
string: 如果没有我，你该怎么办？

original: Careful you don't get any marriage proposals while wearing that thing!
string: 小心别在你戴着那玩意儿的时候有人向你求婚！

original: Anything good up there? I can carry some stuff; don't be shy!
string: 上面有什么好东西吗？我可以拿一些东西；别害羞！

original: Do you normally have assassins after you?
string: 通常会有刺客追杀你吗？

original: Not from my own family, no. But otherwise it's not the first time, and it probably won't be the last.
string: 不是来自我自己的家庭，不是。但除此之外，这不是第一次，可能也不会是最后一次。

original: Occupational hazard.
string: 职业危害。

original: Sounds dangerous. How do you live like that?
string: 听起来很危险。你怎么能这样生活？

original: Tomorrow is never guaranteed to anyone. That doesn't make today any less beautiful.
string: 任何人都无法保证明天。但这并不影响今天的美好。

original: I know the feeling. Everything you think you have can change in an instant.
string: 我知道这种感觉。你自以为拥有的一切都可能在瞬间改变。

original: I try to appreciate the good moments, when I find them. Put enough of those together, and it's something like happiness...
string: 当我发现美好的时刻时，我会努力去珍惜。把足够多的美好时光放在一起，就像幸福一样…

original: Oh, for the love of-
string: 哦，看在…

original: I never said I was everyone's cup of tea... but I could be your shot of whiskey.
string: 我从没说过我是每个人的那杯茶…但我可能是你的那杯威士忌。

original: Do you know anything about Black Books that could help us?
string: 你对黑暗经书了解多少，能帮到我们吗？

original: Like a lot of things, I know just enough about them to be dangerous. We need a real expert to help us with this one.
string: 就像很多事情一样，我对它们的了解只够让它们变得危险。我们需要一个真正的专家来帮我们解决这个问题。

original: I should turn you in to the guards and collect your bounty myself.
string: 我应该把你交给守卫，自己去领赏金。

original: Hunh! You won't because I'm worth more to you as a free man. And, I'll owe you a favor.
string: 哼！你不会的。因为我作为自由人对你来说更有价值。而且，我还欠你个人情

original: Come on, this will be fun.
string: 来吧，这会很有趣的。

original: Maybe later.
string: 可能晚些。

original: That's a shame; I was lookin' forward to stepping on your toes.
string: 太可惜了，我正期待着踩你的脚趾头呢。

original: I suppose we should get going.
string: 我想我们该走了。

original: This was nice. We should come back another time!
string: 这里很不错。我们应该下次再来！

original: We should get going.
string: 我们应该走了。

original: How about you? Anyone you miss?
string: 你呢？你想念谁吗？

original: How about you? Is there a trail of broken hearts in your past?
string: 你呢？你的过去是否有心碎的痕迹？

original: How about you? Any old flames I need to worry about?
string: 你呢？有我需要担心的旧情人吗？

original: I'm honestly surprised. I expected I'd have to fend off a small army of rival suitors!
string: 老实说，我很惊讶。我还以为我得抵挡住一小队追求者呢！

original: Heh, I didn't expect we'd have that in common.
string: 我没想到我们会有这样的共同点。

original: Oh. I'm sorry about that. Definitely their loss.
string: 哦，对不起，真遗憾。肯定是他们的损失。

original: I'm so sorry.
string: 太对不起了。

original: Hey, if there's someone out there that you miss? We don't have to be rivals. There's plenty of me to go around!
string: 嘿，如果你想念某个人？我们没必要成为对手，我有的是时间！

original: Of course... I didn't mean to pry. You don't owe me any explanations.
string: 当然…我不是故意打听的你不欠我任何解释

original: No, there's never been anyone.
string: 不，从来没有人。

original: Hah, no. There's never been anyone.
string: 没有。从来没有人。

original: Very funny. But no, I don't have any ex-lovers for you to challenge.
string: 很好笑。不过，我可没有前情人让你挑战。

original: Not really. There's never been anyone serious.
string: 并没有从来没有人是认真的。

original: You could say that. I never had much interest in settling down.
string: 可以这么说，我从来没有兴趣安定下来。

original: Ha ha heh! I didn't expect we'd have that in common.
string: 哈哈哈！我没想到我们会有这样的共同点。

original: Too many to count. You'd better be on your toes, Serano!
string: 数不清了。你最好小心点，塞拉诺。

original: There was someone special, but it didn't end well.
string: 有一个特别的人，但结局并不美好。

original: Just mine.
string: 只有我的。

original: Maybe once, but it didn't end well.
string: 也许有一次，但结局并不好。

original: Every day. They... died.
string: 每一个。他们…死了。

original: Not exactly. They... died.
string: 不完全是。他们…死了。

original: Not anymore. They... died.
string: 不再是了。他们…死了。

original: I'd rather not discuss it.
string: 我不想讨论这个问题。

original: I prefer to keep my air of mystery.
string: 我更喜欢保持神秘感。

original: That's none of your concern.
string: 那不用你操心。

original: I'm not sure I could choose just one person for life.
string: 我不确定自己能否选择一个人度过一生。

original: Not broken hearts so much as people who are still very dear to me.
string: 与其说是心碎，不如说是我仍然非常珍爱的人。

original: Is that jealously, Captain? You're not the only one who's close to me.
string: 你这是嫉妒吗？船长？又不是只有你跟我亲近。

original: Oh, Sweet Mara, you really are alive! Have you lost your mind from loneliness? The state of your beard makes me think, 'Yes.'
string: 哦，亲爱的玛拉，你真的还活着！你是不是因为孤独而失去了理智？你的胡子让我觉得，“是的”。

original: Val. I am Remiel. I'd prefer you to call me Remi, though. So... Are you a murderer?
string: 瓦尔，我叫蕾米尔。不过我更喜欢你叫我蕾米。那么… 你是杀人犯吗？

original: Heh heh. Yes, of course.
string: 嘿嘿。是的，当然。

original: I told you! I knew this would happen! We're going to wake up murdered in the morning.
string: 我就说嘛。我就知道会这样。我们早上醒来就会被谋杀了。

original: I- Well. That... Does make sense... Yes, alright, I suppose I will... trust you.
string: 好吧那…有道理…是的，好吧，我想我会… 相信你。

original: Well, that's good- M-mostly?!
string: 嗯，这很好，大部分？

original: I'm feelin' better by the minute. A bath, a shave, a decent meal, and most importantly some distance between me and this island... and I'll be good as new!
string: 我现在感觉好多了洗个澡、刮个胡子、吃顿像样的饭，最重要的是拉开我和这座岛之间的距离…我就能恢复如初了！

original: Say, what's your name? You can call me Val, by the way.
string: 你叫什么名字？对了，你可以叫我瓦尔。

original: If I were, I'd deny it, of course. You'll just have to trust me.
string: 如果是我，我当然会否认。你就相信我吧。

original: Heh heh heh haha! If I wake up next to either of you, it's not gonna be with murder on my mind.
string: 嘿嘿嘿，哈哈！如果我在你们俩旁边醒来，我可不会想着杀人。

original: Look, if I wanted to I coulda killed you both, taken the rowboat, and no one would ever find your bodies. But I didn't.
string: 听着，如果我想的话，我可以杀了你们俩，把小船开走。没人会发现你们的尸体。但我没有。

original: I'm mostly harmless.
string: 我基本上是无害的。

original: Oh thank the Divines, I thought you were actually going to return the Star of Solitude, and I was contemplating how to make off with it before then. It sounds shiny. Is it shiny?
string: 哦，感谢神灵，我还以为你真的要归还独孤之星，我还在考虑如何在那之前把它拿走呢。听起来很闪亮它闪亮吗？

original: Ooooh! 'Exquisitely shiny,' he says. What do you take me for? Of course I want to see it!
string: 他说“精致闪亮”。你把我当成什么了？我当然想看看。

original: If you end up selling it, your buyer will be terribly disappointed when it goes missing again.
string: 如果你最终把它卖掉，当它再次失踪时，你的买家会非常失望。

original: In all honesty, even if it will net me a pretty coin, I struggle to part with lovely things. It's why I always have so much to carry around. I wouldn't blame you if you kept it.
string: 老实说，即使能换来一枚漂亮的硬币，我也舍不得丢弃可爱的东西。这就是为什么我总是带着那么多东西。如果你留着，我也不会怪你。

original: You're speakin' my love language! Maybe I could figure something out...
string: 你说的我爱听！也许我能想出办法…

original: Oh, it's exquisitely shiny. Would you like to see it?
string: 哦，它闪闪发光。你想看看吗？

original: I do have a buyer lined up, but honestly? I'm not sure I can part with it.
string: 我确实有一个买家，但说实话？我不确定我是否能放弃它。

original: Is it just me, or did that sound like chaurus moving around? I'm gonna go stand by Remi... to uh, make sure she's okay.
string: 是我的错觉，还是听起来像查鲁斯在动？我去看看蕾米…确保她没事。

original: Wait, wait, wait. Kill Val and any companions?! I'm 'any companions!'
string: 等等，等等，等等。杀了瓦尔和其他同伴？我是任何同伴！

original: I don't mind a nibble...
string: 我不介意…

original: Papa, you're back! I missed you. Did you bring me anything?
string: 爸爸，你回来了！我想你了。你给我带东西了吗？

original: Well, I haven't gotten in trouble.
string: 嗯，我还没惹上麻烦。

original: If you haven't heard about it yet, I don't think it's going to be a problem!
string: 如果你还没听说过的话，我觉得应该不成问题！

original: Oh wow... It's so pretty! I've never even seen something like this, and now it's mine?
string: 哦哇…它太漂亮了！我从来没见过这样的东西，现在是我的了？

original: Where did it come from?
string: 它是从哪里来的？

original: Thank you, Papa! I promise I'll take good care of it.
string: 谢谢你，爸爸！我保证我会好好照顾它的。

original: That depends. Have you been staying outta trouble for a change?
string: 那得看情况。你这段时间不惹事了吗？

original: Is this something I'm going to hear about later, as in from the neighbors, a shopkeeper, or the city guard?
string: 这是我以后会从邻居、店主或城市警卫那里听到的事情吗？

original: Azura help me... I guess this is payback.
string: 阿祖拉帮帮我…我猜这是报复。

original: I missed ya too, Dragonfly.
string: 我也想你了，小龙。

original: And I do have something for you. It's a model ship, like the one I used to sail.
string: 我确实有东西要给你。这是一艘模型船，就像我以前开过的那艘一样。

original: Now, If you're careful, you can lower the masts and take it out of the bottle. It'll even float. I'll show ya how the sail works tomorrow.
string: 现在，如果你小心的话，你可以放下桅杆，把它从瓶子里拿出来。它甚至会浮起来。明天我给你演示一下帆是怎么用的。

original: Your mother made it for me; I'd like you to have it now.
string: 你妈妈为我做的；我想现在就给你。

original: Your father made it for me; I'd like you to have it now.
string: 你父亲为我做的；我想现在就给你。

original: Someone very special made it for me; I'd like you to have it now.
string: 有个特别的人为我做的；我想现在就给你。

original: Remember, the only difference between tomb-robbing and archaeology is writing it down. With Tharstan along, we're reputable scholars!
string: 记住，盗墓和考古的唯一区别就是把它写下来。有沙尔斯坦在，我们就是有名望的学者！

original: Our faith in the Temple is often tested, but that's how we become stronger.
string: 我们对圣殿的信心经常会受到考验，但这正是我们变得更加强大的方式。

original: You're right about that. What doesn't kill you makes you stronger, just like the priests say...
string: 你说得对，杀不死你的东西会让你变得更强大，就像牧师说的那样…

original: As far as worship goes, I always felt like my actions mattered more than attending Temple.
string: 至于礼拜，我总觉得我的行动比参加寺庙活动更重要。

original: I listen for the wisdom of the Hist.
string: 我聆听历史的智慧。

original: I didn't know that was possible for a non-Argonian. I'd like to hear more about that sometime.
string: 我不知道非亚龙人也能做到这一点。有机会我想听听你的看法。

original: Ah, I shoulda guessed that. I hope it's not difficult for you to be so far from Black Marsh.
string: 啊，我早该猜到的。离黑沼泽这么远，希望你不会感到困难。

original: I follow the Crown and Forebear gods.
string: 我追随王冠神和先民神。

original: I always liked the idea of the Far Shores for an afterlife. May the Keeper of the Hall find you worthy one day.
string: 我一直很喜欢“彼岸”这个来世的想法。愿守卫者有朝一日能发现你的价值。

original: It's complicated, let me explain...
string: 这很复杂，让我来解释一下…

original: I see. I'm... not sure I understand, but thanks for sharing that with me.
string: 我明白了我…不太明白，但还是谢谢你和我分享这些。

original: Where did you find that outfit anyway?
string: 你在哪里找到这身衣服的？

original: Enthir. He knows a guy; Good tailor, works fast.
string: 恩希尔他认识一个人，裁缝不错，干活麻利。

original: I was gonna wear the standard issue College robes, but they were tight in the shoulders and loose in the middle. It was not a good look.
string: 我本来想穿标准的学院长袍，但肩部紧，中间松。看起来不太好。

original: Your mother sent a letter for you.
string: 你妈妈给你寄了一封信。

original: Am I invisible? I don't understand why the courier doesn't just hand them to me. It just- it's got my name on it!
string: 我是隐形人吗？我不明白快递员为什么不直接递给我？上面有我的名字。

original: Oh, she must have gotten my letter about enrolling at the College of Winterhold!
string: 哦，她一定是收到了我关于在冬堡学院入学的信！

original: I think it's sweet how supportive your mother is.
string: 我觉得你母亲对你的支持很贴心。

original: Heh heh. Yeah, I guess I didn't appreciate her enough when I was younger... I should probably tell her that.
string: 嘿嘿。是啊，我想我年轻的时候没有好好珍惜她…我应该告诉她这一点。

original: My family was thrilled with the news that I enrolled, too.
string: 我入学的消息让我的家人也非常激动。

original: As they should be! I'm really proud of you, too.
string: 他们本该如此！我也为你感到骄傲。

original: I think my family would be proud, too, if they could see me.
string: 我想，如果我的家人能看到我，他们也会为我感到骄傲。

original: I know it could be tough to face life's milestones without a crew.
string: 我知道，没有团队的陪伴，面对人生的里程碑可能会很艰难。

original: You have me though, and I'm proud of you.
string: 但你有我，我为你骄傲。

original: My family doesn't support my interest in magic.
string: 我的家人不支持我对魔法的兴趣。

original: I'm sorry for that. For what it's worth, I'm really proud of you.
string: 我很抱歉。不管怎么说，我真的为你感到骄傲。

original: I'm proud of you, too, Val. I know you'll work hard.
string: 我也为你感到骄傲，瓦尔。我知道你会努力的。

original: All right, all right! Thank you, my friend. I'll do my best.
string: 好的，好的。谢谢你，我的朋友，我会尽力的。

original: But don't start going on about how one of us could be the next Arch Mage, okay?
string: 但不要说我们中有人会成为下一个大法师，好吗？

original: Thank you, love. It means a lot to hear that from you.
string: 谢谢你，亲爱的。能听到你这么说，意义非凡。

original: Please tell me she sent a care package. I would kill for a strawberry danish.
string: 请告诉我她寄了一个关怀包裹。我真想吃个草莓饼。

original: Unfortunately not. And I agree, her pastry baking skills are legendary. A coffee and a danish would hit the spot!
string: 可惜没有。我同意，她的糕点烘焙技艺堪称传奇。一杯咖啡和一个丹麦面包会让你满意的！

original: Can I call you 'Valerius?'
string: 我能叫你“瓦列利乌斯”吗？

original: I. Like. Val.
string: 我。喜欢。瓦尔。

original: Here's a letter for you. Looks like your mother is very happy to be a grandmother!
string: 这是给你的一封信。看来你妈妈当外婆当得很开心！

original: I'm still getting used to the idea of us being parents. It feels like a dream.
string: 我还在适应我们为人父母的想法。感觉就像在做梦。

original: I'm really happy with our life together, love.
string: 我真的很满意我们在一起的生活，亲爱的。

original: I think 'Valerius' is a much better name for a mage than 'Val.'
string: 我觉得“瓦列利乌斯”这个名字比“瓦尔”更适合法师。

original: Ugh, godsdamnit, not you, too. Tolfdir insists on calling me by my full name, and our whole class has already picked up on it.
string: 唉，该死的，连你也这样。托夫迪尔坚持叫我的全名，我们全班都知道了。

original: I'm really happy with our life together, too, Val.
string: 我也很满意我们在一起的生活，瓦尔。

original: I'll never leave your side.
string: 我永远不会离开你。

original: You and Ravani are nothing but trouble, but I wouldn't want it any other way.
string: 你和拉瓦妮只会带来麻烦，但我也不想这样。

original: That reminds me. Now's probably as good as a time as any to tell you about the latest prank I caught her pulling on your housecarl.
string: 这倒提醒我了。现在也许是告诉你，我抓到她对你的管家做的恶作剧的好时机。

original: But the good news is that Ravani's magical studies are coming along very well!
string: 但好消息是，拉瓦妮的魔法学习进展得非常顺利！

original: Someone hand me a trophy, because I've settled the infamous Captain Serano into peaceful, domestic bliss!
string: 谁给我一个奖杯，因为我已经把臭名昭著的塞拉诺船长安顿好了，让他安享家庭幸福！

original: I'd hardly call it peaceful. We killed a dragon on the roof of the last inn we stayed at!
string: 我不认为这是和平。我们在上一家旅馆的屋顶上杀了一条龙！

original: But I think I make a good trophy husband all the same.
string: 但我觉得我还是个不错的花瓶丈夫。

original: Don't hesitate; you got this!
string: 不要犹豫；你能行的！

original: Cyrus and the Restless League! I read that old tale countless times when I was a kid! It was one of my favorites.
string: 赛勒斯与不安联盟!我小时候读过那段古老传说无数次!它是我最喜欢的之一。

original: That book was one of the first things I ever stole. Hm, I'd hate to imagine what my late fees to the Imperial Library are by now.
string: 那本书是我偷来的第一件东西之一。嗯,我真想不到现在我的帝国图书馆逾期费会是多少。

original: This unlucky bastard was almost my cellmate. Let's get what we need and get out of here before Captain Aldis reconsiders his options.
string: 这位倒霉的混蛋几乎是我的同牢。我们先拿到需要的东西,然后在艾迪斯队长重新考虑他的选择之前离开这里。

original: Do you think those relics really belonged to Cyrus the Restless?
string: 你认为那些遗物真的属于不安的赛勒斯吗?

original: Or, more importantly, do you think we could convince someone that they're authentic and sell them for a substantial profit?
string: 或者,更重要的是,你觉得我们能说服别人它们是真品并以可观利润出售吗?

original: Looks like he's got something jammed in there real good.
string: 看起来他那里卡了件东西,挺紧的。

original: That's convenient. At least we know the way out.
string: 真方便。至少我们知道出口在哪里。

original: Did you year that? It sounded like thunder, not machinery.
string: 你听见那声音了吗?听起来像雷鸣,而不是机器声。

original: I'll shield us from the lightning. I've done it many times to protect the Dark Rose from storms.
string: 我会为我们挡住闪电。我已经多次这样做来保护黑玫瑰免受风暴侵袭。

original: Go on, I'll be right behind you.
string: 继续,我就在你身后。

original: Only an idiot wears a metal helmet in a lightning storm. Typical mage; all book smarts and no common sense.
string: 只有傻瓜才会在雷雨中戴金属头盔。典型的法师;全靠书本知识,没点常识。

original: I'm glad that's done. I'm willing to risk my life for treasure, not harvesting crops.
string: 我很高兴那件事完成了。我愿意为宝藏冒生命危险,而不是收割庄稼。

original: The air's getting thick. (cough) Let's hope that Drone Fly still works.
string: 空气越来越闷。(咳嗽)希望蜂蝇仍然能用。

original: It's raining mercenaries. That is not the weather malfunction I expected.
string: 雨点像佣兵一样落下。这不是我预料中的天气故障。

original: Ah, it feels warmer already!
string: 啊,已经感觉更暖和了!

original: This is one storm that won't be raging on.
string: 这场风暴不会再继续肆虐。

original: What do you think about the peddler and the Rieklings?
string: 你觉得商贩和瑞克灵怎么样?

original: How have these bottom-feeding runts survived this long? Eating netch parts causes paralysis!
string: 这些靠底部进食的小家伙怎么能活这么久?吃网虫的部分会导致麻痹!

original: Hey, you know... that gives me an idea. If we play this right, we could put an end to the Riekling menace on this island.
string: 嘿,你知道吗......这给我一个主意。如果我们玩得好,可以结束岛上的Riekling威胁。

original: We are not letting the Rieklings poison themselves.
string: 我们不会让瑞克灵自毒。

original: You never let me have any fun.
string: 你从不让我享受乐趣。

original: I can't imagine anyone would miss them.
string: 我无法想象有人会怀念他们。

original: We'll be celebrated as heroes, maybe even saints.
string: 我们将被视为英雄,甚至可能成为圣人。

original: What in Oblivion the matter with you, Serano?
string: 塞拉诺,你到底他妈有什么事?

original: Oh, so Jiub is a saint for killing every cliff racer in Morrowind, but I suggest thinning the blue vermin horde just a little, and suddenly I'm a monster!
string: 哦,鸠步是因为在晨风杀死所有峭壁行者而成名的圣人,但我建议稍微削弱蓝色虫群,一下子我就变成怪物!

original: Let's see how you look in the Painted Netch Leather Armor.
string: 让我们看看你穿上涂漆气母皮革护甲后的样子。

original: Ha ha ha ha. I'm not wearing that Riekling trash.
string: 哈哈哈,我不穿那种瑞克灵垃圾。

original: That armor smells like unwashed Dunmer and dead horker. No.
string: 那套盔甲闻起来像没洗过的达姆人和死掉的霍克。不是吧。

original: I really think the Painted Netch Leather would look good on you.
string: 我真觉得涂漆气母皮革会很适合你。

original: Is my sense of style a joke to you? You know what- It's fine. I'll wear it, it's fine.
string: 你觉得我的时尚感是个笑话吗?你知道什么——没关系。我会穿上,没问题。

original: I need a drink.
string: 我需要喝点东西。

original: Come on, Valerius! Wear the Netch Leather. What happened to, 'I always look good'?
string: 来吧,瓦勒瑞斯!穿上气母皮。'我总是看起来不错'怎么了?

original: Is my sense of style a joke to you? You know what- It's fine. I'll wear it, it's fine.
string: 你觉得我的时尚感是个笑话吗?你知道什么——没关系。我会穿上,没问题。

original: I need a drink.
string: 我需要喝点东西。

original: Come on, Serano! Wear the Netch Leather. What happened to, 'I always look good'?
string: 来吧,塞拉诺!穿上气母皮。'我总是看起来不错'怎么了?

original: I'd like you to wear the Explorers Society uniform.
string: 我希望你穿上探险家协会的制服。

original: You know I had this custom tailored, right?
string: 你知道我这件衣服是定做的,对吧?

original: Fortunately, I like the color scheme.
string: 幸运的是,我喜欢这种配色方案。

original: Three words: Painted. Netch. Leather.
string: 三句话:涂漆。气母。皮革。

original: I'm not sure which I hate more right now. My full name, this armor, or you.
string: 现在我不确定更讨厌哪一个:我的全名、这套盔甲还是你。

original: I'm not sure which I hate more right now. My full name, this armor, or you.
string: 现在我不确定更讨厌哪一个:我的全名、这套盔甲还是你。

original: Okay, fine but I'm gonna complain the whole time.
string: 好的,行,但我会一直抱怨。

original: I'm your corner club's new mascot. What's it look like?
string: 我是你们角落俱乐部的新吉祥物。它长什么样?

original: I'm regrettably sober.
string: 我可惜地保持清醒。

original: See, I owe my companion here my life, and this fashion travesty is how they choose for me to repay my debt.
string: 看,我欠这位同伴我的性命,而这种穿着失误正是他们让我偿还债务的方式。

original: Geldis my friend, pour me something strong enough to forget my current situation and leave the bottle.
string: 吉迪斯,我的朋友,给我倒点足够烈的,让我忘却目前的情况,把酒瓶丢掉。

original: Are you kidding me? What in the name of Azura are you?
string: 你在逗我玩吗?阿祖拉之名,你到底是谁?

original: Well, well... amusing. I've seen plenty of drunks in me day. Typical Nord.
string: 哎呀,真是好笑。我一生中见过许多酒鬼。典型的诺德人。

original: Right then. Here you go. Here's a bit more. If you need another drink, I'll be right here.
string: 好吧,拿去吧。这多一些。如果还想喝,我就在这儿。

original: Wow, sounds like you've had a rough day. You look like you could use a drink.
string: 哇,听起来你度过了艰难的一天。看起来你正需要一杯饮料。

original: Good enough.
string: 够了。

original: Well, look at you. That's some good armor you've put together. Ha ha ha ha!
string: 好吧,看着你啊。你组装的盔甲真不错。哈哈哈!

original: Hard not to. Heh heh heh! Looking good. Wish I could learn some of that charm. Want to improve your armor?
string: 很难不这么说,呵呵呵!看起来真好。真想学习你这份魅力。想改进你的盔甲吗?

original: Rieklings? Those filthy vermin. They're pests.
string: 瑞克灵?那群肮脏的害虫,它们真是个麻烦。

original: You're serious, aren't you?
string: 你是认真的吗？

original: Nevermind, I don't want to know.
string: 算了,我不想知道。

original: Laugh it up, you scurvy, wannabe brigand.
string: 笑着吧,你这个胆小鬼、冒牌土匪。

original: Heh, what's to improve? This ensemble is hand-painted by the finest Reikling artisans!
string: 呵,哪里需要改进?这套服装是由最顶尖的瑞克灵工匠手绘而成!

original: (sigh) Glover, even I don't believe my own bullshit this time. I'm wearing this getup because I owe a life debt to someone determined to make a mockery of my dignity.
string: (叹息) 葛洛文,即使我也不相信自己的胡说八道。这件打扮是因为我欠了某人一条命,那个家伙决心嘲笑我的尊严。

original: What a waste. He died for a false god.
string: 真浪费。他为虚假的神祇而死。

original: What is it?
string: 什么意思？

original: I picked up a hooded robe in Raven Rock. You should wear Kenro's things.
string: 我在Raven Rock买了一件带兜帽的长袍。你应该穿Kenro的装备。

original: That's dishonorable. We'll enter as we are.
string: 那不光荣。我们就这样进入。

original: (sigh) I had a feeling you'd say that. I guess we're doing this the hard way.
string: (叹息) 我就知道你会这么说。我想我们还是走这条艰难的路吧。

original: Good thinking. We'll disguise ourselves.
string: 好主意。我们将伪装自己。

original: I expect we'll have to prove our loyalty all the same. Remember, we're just playing a part.
string: 我预料到我们仍需证明忠诚。记住,我们只是在扮演角色。

original: Never. We will cleanse this place of the heretics.
string: 绝不。我们要把异端者从这里清除干净。

original: You do realize that Azura, Boethiah, and Mephala can take care of themselves, right? I hope this brings you what you're looking for.
string: 你知道阿祖拉、波耶西亚和梅法拉能自理吧?我希望这能给你想要的。

original: These heretics are wanted by the Temple. We should just kill them now.
string: 这些异教徒被神殿通缉。我们现在就该杀了他们。

original: Well, if we don't die taking on an unknown number of religious zealots ready to die for their cause, maybe the Temple will give us a reward.
string: 如果我们不在面对未知数量的宗教狂热者、他们愿意为信仰而死时丧命,或许神殿会给我们奖励。

original: Maybe we should join them.
string: 也许我们应该加入他们。

original: Ha ha ha ha! You're joking, right? The entire Dunmer race suffered direct and personal Daedric retribution - for worshipping false gods!
string: 哈哈哈!你在开玩笑吧?整个丹莫种族因崇拜假神而遭受直接且个人化的迪德拉报复!

original: Does heresy bother you?
string: 异端让你困扰吗?

original: No, I'm not devout. It just seems foolish in the face of events. I'm sure you'll come around.
string: 不,我并不虔诚。面对这些事件,它只显得愚蠢。我相信你会改变主意。

original: Any advice?
string: 有什么建议吗？

original: Remember the code from Kenro's note? It's the initials of the Tribunal. The same symbols are on the pillars.
string: 记得肯罗笔记里的暗号吗?那是审判席的首字母缩写。相同的符号也刻在柱子上。

original: See the banners? The pattern matches the layout of the mannequins.
string: 看那些旗帜吗?图案与人偶的布局相匹配。

original: I'm sure you remember the meaning of the symbols from the puzzle by the entrance.
string: 我相信你还记得入口处谜题中符号的含义。

original: What did I say about Daedric retribution, huh? Now we have ash zombies.
string: 我刚才说过关于迪德瑞克报复的话,没错吧?现在我们有了灰烬僵尸。

original: Can you read this Dunmer writing?
string: 你能读懂这段丹莫文字吗?

original: 'You are not lost... the Reclamation is a lie... theTribunal will rise once more... blah, blah, whatever, ALMSIVI.'
string: ‘你并未迷失......复兴是谎言......审判席将再次崛起......呃,等等,阿姆希维。’

original: Hmph. Well, there's your translation.
string: 哼。好吧,这就是你的翻译。

original: You're not actually gonna give these to people, are you?
string: 你不会真的把这些给别人,对吗?

original: I'm embarrassed to be seen with you right now.
string: 我现在和你在一起真让人尴尬。

original: If anyone's going profit off of heretical artifacts, it's gonna be us.
string: 如果有人要从异端神器中获利,那就是我们了。

original: What's your idea?
string: 你的想法是什么?

original: A reincarnated Nerevar, the Champion of Azura, defeated Dagoth Ur and freed the Dunmer from the Tribunal.
string: 一个重生的尼瑞瓦,阿祖拉的勇士,打败了达格斯·乌尔,并将丹莫从审判席中解救出来。

original: If we really are going up against a priest of Dagoth Ur, we should ask for Azura's blessing.
string: 如果我们真的要面对达戈斯·乌的祭司,我们应该请求阿祖拉的祝福。

original: I agree.
string: 我同意。

original: Azura�s blessing - her love, really - is fierce, possessive, even cruel. But it is loyal and true.
string: 阿祖拉的祝福——她真正的爱——是激烈、占有欲强,甚至残酷。但它忠诚而真实。

original: Maybe, but I thought you weren't devout.
string: 也许吧,但我以为你不虔诚。

original: I like to think I have a realistic perspective. The Daedric Princes are very real and present in our lives. There's no avoiding them.
string: 我喜欢认为自己有现实的视角。达德里克王子们在我们的生活中非常真实且存在,无法逃避他们。

original: I'm not doing that.
string: 我不会这么做的。

original: It's all fun and games until a Daedric Prince decides to smite you personally.
string: 一切都很欢乐,直到一个达德里克王子决定亲自惩罚你。

original: Another pointless death for another false god.
string: 又一次无意义的死亡,为另一个虚假的神祇。

original: About Hopesfire...
string: 关于希望之火......

original: Hopesfire was a wedding gift to Almalexia, and Nerevar got Trueflame.
string: 希望之火是送给阿玛莱西亚的婚礼礼物,而尼瑞瓦得到了真理之焰。

original: Matching swords sounds romantic until you remember that she used hers to kill her husband.
string: 匹配的剑听起来浪漫,直到你记起她用自己的剑杀了丈夫。

original: That's not exactly what I'd consider 'relationship goals.'
string: 这并不完全是我所说的“恋爱目标”。

original: I don't mind a good fight, and a chance to make up, but uh, maybe talk to me first if it looks like history's gonna repeat itself?
string: 我不介意一场好战,也愿意和解,但呃,如果看起来历史要重演,先跟我说说吧?

original: About Trueflame...
string: 关于真理之焰......

original: You ever wonder if the Nerevarine is out there somewhere? You know, just living the good life. Maybe taking some mercenary jobs now and then to keep their skills sharp.
string: 你有没有想过尼瑞瓦因是否在某处?你懂的,过着好日子。也许偶尔接点佣兵工作来保持技能锋利。

original: Huh, this looks like part of a mechanical horse. I wonder if we can find all the pieces?
string: 嗯,这看起来像是机械马的一部分。我想知道我们能否找到所有零件?

original: I have watched you, mortals, as I have watched these arrogant pretenders to false gods.
string: 我一直在观察你们凡人,就像我观察这些傲慢的伪神冒名顶替者一样。

original: As before, Dagoth Ur corrupted. The Tribunal seduced. My champion betrayed and reborn, victorious.
string: 如以前,达戈斯·乌尔堕落。议会诱惑。我之冠军背叛并重生,获胜。

original: Their fates have been written and you are my hands. Go with my blessing and destroy the ash priest who would profane my works.
string: 他们的命运已被写下,你是我的手。带着我的祝福去摧毁那个玷污我作品的灰烬祭司。

original: I wanna find out what's inside that box as much as you do, but be careful of what you promise to Hermaeus Mora.
string: 我和你一样想知道盒子里是什么，但要小心你对赫麦尤斯·莫拉的承诺。

original: I wasn't cautious once. I'm still paying the price.
string: 我曾一度不谨慎。 导致现在还在为此付出代价。

original: I can't believe you didn't save any of that cheese for me. Rude.
string: 我真不敢相信你没有为我留一点奶酪。太粗鲁了。

original: This might sound cheesy, but this is a 'grate' treasure hunt!
string: 这听起来可能很奶酪味,但这是一次“刮”宝藏寻踪!

original: Life is 'cheddar' when we collect cheese together.
string: 当我们一起收集奶酪时,生活就是“切达”。

original: Sweet dreams are made of cheese...
string: 甜蜜的梦都是用奶酪做成的......

original: Want it. Need it. Cheese it.
string: 想要。需要。奶酪吧。

original: That's every cheese in Skyrim. I feel like something's missing. Serano cheese? Or was that ham? Or maybe it was peppers?
string: 那是所有在天际的奶酪。我觉得缺了点什么。塞拉诺奶酪?还是火腿?或者可能是辣椒?

original: Hey. Why was the cheese unhappy? It was feeling a little 'blue.'
string: 嘿,奶酪为什么不高兴?它有点儿‘蓝’。

original: Cheesecake? You can't eat an entire cheesecake by yourself! We're sharing.
string: 芝士蛋糕?你不能一个人吃完整个!我们一起分享。

original: Cheesecake? You can't eat an entire cheesecake by yourself! We're sharing.
string: 芝士蛋糕?你不能一个人吃完整个!我们一起分享。

original: Hey. Why did the skeever cross the road? It was the only 'whey' to get to the other side.
string: 嘿,为什么小土狼要过马路?它是唯一的‘乳清’去到另一边。

original: Gourmet Maggot Cheese? That reminds me too much of the ship's biscuits on a long sea voyage. You can 'enjoy' that cheese by yourself.
string: 高档蛆虫奶酪?这让我想起长途航行中的船饼。你可以‘享受’那块奶酪。

original: Well, on the bright side we were probably going to kill at least ten bandits on the road to our next destination anyway.
string: 好吧,光明面是我们在去下一个目的地的路上可能本来就要杀了至少十个强盗。

original: I don't want Forky getting any ideas from the Hat. That thing is an unreliable narrator.
string: 我不想让福基从帽子那里得到任何主意。那东西是个不可靠的叙述者。

original: So, about all the cheese...
string: 那么,关于所有奶酪......

original: That might be the weirdest Daedric bargain I've ever heard of. Do you have any idea how many kinds cheeses there are? We might die of old age before we 'find them all.'
string: 那可能是我听过的最奇怪的迪德里克交易。你知道有多少种奶酪吗?我们可能会在“找到所有”之前因衰老而死。

original: Damn, uh, maybe that was Sheogorath's point.
string: 该死,呃,也许那就是希奥戈拉斯的观点。

original: It sounds really bad when you put it that way.
string: 这样说真的很糟糕。

original: Just promise me that I'll get to eat some of this cheese instead of carrying it all in my backpack?
string: 只要答应我能吃点这奶酪,而不是把它们全都背在背包里就行?

original: There was mention of a powerful artifact.
string: 提到了一个强大的神器。

original: The things I'm willing to do for treasure...
string: 我愿意为宝藏做的事...

original: I promise to share the cheese next time.
string: 下次我会分享奶酪的。

original: Oh? In that case, I'm in!
string: 哦?那样的话,我就加入了!

original: Well, let's get started stealing- ah, liberating every cheese we can lay eyes on!
string: 好了,开始偷——啊,解放我们能看到的每一块奶酪吧!

original: If they didn't want me to eat the cheese, they shouldn't have called it, 'forbidden.'
string: 如果他们不想让我吃奶酪,他们本不该称之为‘禁忌’。

original: Val, no!
string: 瓦尔,不!

original: (sigh) You're right, you're right... You're no fun, but you're right.
string: (叹息) 你说得对,你说得对......你没意思,但你是对的。

original: I know, right?
string: 我知道,对吧?

original: We should, uh, probably test it first in case something bad happens.
string: 我们应该,呃,最好先测试一下,以防万一发生坏事。

original: Your funeral, Serano.
string: 你的葬礼,塞拉诺。

original: Down the hatch!
string: 下去吧!

original: I'm fine... I have... a strong... stomach...
...I don't suppose you have a healing spell or a potion handy?
string: ...我猜你手边没有治疗法术或药剂吧?

original: Does eating a bandit turned into a cheese wheel count as following the Green Pact?
string: 吃把变成奶酪轮的强盗算是遵守绿约吗?

original: Does eating a bandit turned into a cheese wheel count as Namira or Sheogorath worship?
string: 吃变成奶酪轮的强盗算是崇拜娜米拉还是谢尔格拉?

original: See the hawks circling? It looks like we'd have a clear shot at jumping into the White River from up there. What do you say we have a little fun?
string: 看那些盘旋的鹰吗?看来我们可以从那里跳进白河。你说我们来点乐子吧?

original: I'm taking the short way down. See you at the bottom!
string: 我走捷径下去。等你在底部见!

original: Heh heh heh ehhh- This is a little higher than the Dark Rose's main mast.
string: 呵呵呵呃——这比黑玫瑰主桅杆高一点儿。

original: It's a fine day for a swim!
string: 今天是游泳的好日子!

original: Fuck!
string: 操!

original: Now this is a view!
string: 现在这才是一幅景色!

original: I can see the Spring Rain from here!
string: 我可以从这里看到春雨!

original: Shadow of Possibility
string: 可能之影

original: It looks like Nocturnal has sent her representative to re-negotiate our bargain.
string: 看起来诺克图娜尔派她的代表来重新谈判我们的协议。

original: I chose not to become a Nightingale. Instead, Val and I have become Agents of Nocturnal of a different variety. We are less powerful than Nightingales, but our souls remain our own.
string: 我选择不成为一名夜莺。相反,Val和我成了不同类型的诺克图娜尔代理人。我们比夜莺弱小,但我们的灵魂仍是自己的。

original: It looks like Nocturnal has sent her representative to negotiate a bargain with Val.
string: 看起来诺克图娜尔派她的代表来与瓦尔谈判一个交易。

original: While I have chosen to accept Karliah's invitation to become a Nightingale, Val has chosen his own, similar path. He has become an Agent of Nocturnal and is less powerful than the Nightingales, but his soul remains his own.
string: 虽然我已接受卡莱亚邀请成为一名夜莺,Val却选择了他自己的相似道路。他成了一名诺克图娜尔代理人,比夜莺弱小,但他的灵魂仍是自己的。

original: I chose not to become a Nightingale. Instead, Val and I have become Agents of Nocturnal of a different variety. Val chose Shadow Veil and is nearly undetectable when sneaking. If I wish to change shadow magic abilities, I can summon Gray the Fox once per day. We are less powerful than Nightingales, but our souls remain our own.
string: 我选择不成为一名夜莺。相反,Val和我成了不同类型的诺克图娜尔代理人。Val 选用了影幕,并在潜行时几乎无法被发现。如果我想改变阴影魔法能力,我可以每天召唤灰狐一次。我们比夜莺弱小,但我们的灵魂仍是自己的。

original: While I have chosen to accept Karliah's invitation to become a Nightingale, Val has chosen his own, similar path. He gained the Shadow Veil ability and is nearly undetectable when sneaking. He has become an Agent of Nocturnal and is less powerful than the Nightingales, but his soul remains his own.
string: 虽然我已接受卡莱亚邀请成为一名夜莺,Val却选择了他自己的相似道路。他获得了影幕能力,并在潜行时几乎无法被发现。他成了一名诺克图娜尔代理人,比夜莺弱小,但他的灵魂仍是自己的。

original: Speak with the fox
string: 与狐狸交谈

original: Wait while Val selects his boon
string: 等待瓦尔选择他的恩赐

original: Horse Functions
string: 马的功能

original: Debt to the Crow
string: 对乌鸦的债务

original: My decision to keep the Skeleton Key has drawn the wrath of Nocturnal. Until I relinquish the Key, I will be hunted by one of her Daedra, a Wraith-of-Crows.
string: 我保留骨钥匙的决定招来了诺克图娜尔的愤怒。在我放弃钥匙之前,我将会被她的一位德拉那——乌鸦幽魂追捕。

original: My decision to keep the Skeleton Key has drawn the wrath of Nocturnal. The Wraith-of-Crows cannot be permanently slain, only temporarily banished. It will continue to hunt me until I relinquish the Key.
string: 我保留骨钥匙的决定招来了诺克图娜尔的愤怒。乌鸦幽魂无法永久杀死,只能暂时驱逐。它会继续追踪我,直到我放弃钥匙。

original: I've relented and given the Skeleton Key to the Wraiths-of-Crows sent by Nocturnal. This appeased Nocturnal and her Daedra no longer hunt me.
string: 我已让步,将骨钥匙交给了诺克图娜尔派来的乌鸦幽魂。这安抚了诺克图娜尔,她的德拉那不再追捕我。

original: Defeat the Wraith-of-Crows
string: 击败乌鸦幽魂

original: Beware the return of the Wraith-of-Crows
string: 小心乌鸦幽魂的归来

original: Survive the Wraith-of-Crows or give up the Skeleton Key
string: 在乌鸦幽魂下生存下来或放弃万能钥匙

original: Automatic Functions
string: 自动传送功能

original: Between the Daedra and the Deep Blue Sea
string: 在迪德拉和深蓝大海之间

original: I found some letters near the bandit encampment at White River Watch.
string: 我在白河观察哨的土匪营地附近发现了一些信件。

original: Someone named Serano has gotten on Hajvar Iron-Hand's bad side over a smuggling job. I should be able to learn more in the port cities to the north.
string: 一个叫塞拉诺的人因为走私惹上了哈瓦尔·铁手。我应该能在北边的港口城市了解到更多情况。

original: A sailor told me about an anchorage near Broken Oar Grotto used by pirates and smugglers. Captain Serano's ship is called the Dark Rose and has been known to use the anchorage from time to time.
string: 一个水手告诉我，断桨洞窟附近有一个海盗和走私犯常用的锚地。塞拉诺船长的船名叫黑玫瑰号，据说时常使用这个锚地。

original: There was no sign of Serano, but I found a journal entry from the first mate of his ship. It seems he was unhappy with Serano's leadership and may have been planning a mutiny. A rival captain was last seen in Solitude. I could ask around at the Winking Skeever.
string: 没有塞拉诺的踪迹，但我找到了他船上大副的一篇日记。似乎有些船员对塞拉诺的领导能力不满，可能正在策划叛变。有人最后一次见到他是在独孤城。我可以去眨眼雪鼠那里打听一下。

original: I've met a shady character in the Winking Skeever who might give me some information if I do her a favor first.
string: 我在眨眼雪鼠那里遇到了一个可疑人物，如果我先帮她一个忙，她可能会告诉我一些信息。

original: The woman I met at the Winking Skeever seems to have come out the loser in a past dealing with Captain Serano and has nothing else to say about the subject. The scene of the brawl at the base of the Solitude Arch is my best lead to investigate right now.
string: 我在眨眼雪鼠遇到的那个女人似乎在过去与塞拉诺队长的交涉中吃了亏，她对这件事没有别的可说的了。我现在最好的线索是在独孤城拱门的底部发生的争吵。

original: I found evidence of a mutiny on the Dark Rose. There are signs of a fight. Serano has been here.
string: 我在黑玫瑰号上发现了叛变的证据，有打斗的痕迹，塞拉诺来过这里。

original: Fathis died of his wounds before I could finish questioning him. I should search his body for clues to Serano's whereabouts.
string: 法提斯在我审问完他之前就因伤势过重而死了。我应该在他的尸体上寻找塞拉诺下落的线索。

original: I found a map to an offshore island. Fathis said Serano was left at sea. Perhaps he meant this island?
string: 我找到了一张离岸小岛的地图。法提斯说塞拉诺被丢在海上了。也许他指的就是这座岛？

original: I've reached the offshore island. Time to look around.
string: 我到达了离岸岛屿。是时候四处看看了。

original: I've met Captain Serano. He was marooned on an offshore island and is eager to leave. He's promised to tell me everything when we reach Skyrim.
string: 我见过塞拉诺船长。他被困在一个离岸小岛上，急着离开。他保证到了天际后会告诉我一切。

original: I've rescued a man named Val Serano from a deserted island. He's rumored to be a ruthless pirate. He claims he's not.
string: 我从荒岛上救了一个叫瓦尔·塞拉诺的人，传闻他是个残忍的海盗，他声称自己不是。

original: Read the letters
string: 阅读信件

original: Ask merchant captains in Dawnstar, Solitude, or Windhelm about Captain Serano
string: 向晨星、独孤城或风舵城的商船船长询问有关塞拉诺船长的情况。

original: Locate the smugglers' anchorage northwest of Solitude and search for clues
string: 在独孤城西北方找到走私者的锚地并寻找线索

original: (Optional) Travel by ferry to Broken Oar Grotto
string: 在独孤城西北方找到走私者的锚地并寻找线索

original: Find someone in the Winking Skeever to ask for information
string: 找到眨眼雪鼠中的某个人询问信息

original: Get the lady a drink
string: 给这位女士来一杯

original: Search near the base of Solitude Arch
string: 在独孤城拱门底部附近搜索

original: Follow the blood trail
string: 追踪血迹

original: Search Fathis' corpse
string: 搜索法提斯的尸体

original: Travel to the offshore island
string: 前往离岸岛屿

original: Explore the island
string: 探索小岛

original: Leave the island with Serano
string: 和塞拉诺一起离开小岛

original: He Runs a Tight Shipwreck
string: 他遭遇了严重的海难

original: Now that he's been rescued, Serano has promised to answer my questions.
string: 既然他已经获救，塞拉诺答应回答我的问题。

original: Val is wanted in Solitude for theft of a valuable relic. We need to straighten things out with the guard before he is arrested again. I should meet Captain Aldis at Castle Dour.
string: 瓦尔因盗窃一件珍贵文物而被独孤城通缉。在他再次被捕前，我们得把守卫的事处理好。我应该去阴郁堡见艾迪斯队长。

original: Val has promised to return the relic he stole.
string: 瓦尔已经答应归还他偷走的文物。

original: Val has no intention of returning the real relic to Solitude. Instead, he plans to substitute a forgery.
string: 瓦尔无意将真正的遗物归还给独孤城。相反，他打算用赝品代替。

original: I've persuaded Val to get the Star of Solitude from it's location in freezing water by himself while I wait on shore.
string: 我已经说服了瓦尔，让他自己把独孤之星从冰冷的水中取出来，而我则在岸上等着。

original: After some debate on who was going for a swim, Val and I have recovered the Star of Solitude. I should talk to Val to hear the details of the next part of his plan.
string: 经过一番关于谁去游泳的争论，我和瓦尔找回了独孤之星。我应该和瓦尔谈谈，听听他下一步计划的细节。

original: I have recovered the Star of Solitude. I should talk to Val to hear the details of the next part of his plan.
string: 我找到了独孤之星。我应该和瓦尔谈谈，听听他下一步计划的细节。

original: There is a mystery forger in Solitude who is capable of copying the Star of Solitude. I am to meet them at Radiant Raiment with Val.
string: 独孤城有一个神秘的伪造者，他能够复制独孤之星。我要和瓦尔一起去锦衣服饰店见他们。

original: Endarie at Radiant Raiment in Solitude is creating a fake version of the relic Val stole. I hope it's good enough to fool the Blue Palace.
string: 独孤城锦衣服饰店的恩达蕊正在制作瓦尔偷走的遗物的赝品。我希望它能骗过蓝宫。

original: Endarie at Radiant Raiment should have the forgery completed by now.
string: 锦衣服饰店的恩达蕊现在应该已经完成了伪造工作。

original: I have the fake Star of Solitude. Now I need to take it to Captain Aldis and hope he believes it's authentic. Actually, why isn't Val doing this? It was his idea.
string: 我拿到了假的“独孤城之星”。现在我得把它交给艾迪斯队长希望他相信它是真的。事实上，为什么瓦尔不这么做？

original: I've helped Val clear his name in Solitude, but at what cost to my own reputation?
string: 我在独孤城帮瓦尔洗清了罪名，但我自己的名誉又付出了什么代价呢？

original: Talk to Captain Aldis in Solitude with Val
string: 与瓦尔一起在独孤城与艾迪斯队长交谈

original: Return the Star of Solitude to Captain Aldis
string: 把独孤城之星还给艾迪斯队长

original: Retrieve the Star of Solitude
string: 找回独孤城之星

original: Talk to Val
string: 与瓦尔交谈

original: Meet with the forger
string: 与伪造者会面

original: Wait one day
string: 等待一天

original: Retrieve the forgery
string: 取回伪造品

original: Give the fake Star of Solitude to Captain Aldis
string: 把假的独孤城之星交给艾迪斯队长

original: Talk to Val about trust
string: 与瓦尔谈谈信任的事

original: The Seafaring Mage
string: 航海法师

original: Val has come a long way from his start as a hedge mage. Now that he's effectively graduated from the College, it would be nice to get him a gift to celebrate the occasion.
string: 瓦尔从最初的边缘法师走过了很长一段路。现在他已经正式从学院毕业,送上一份礼物来庆祝这一时刻会是件不错的事。

original: Val has come a long way from his start as a hedge mage. To celebrate him completing his studies at the College of Winterhold, I crafted and gave him a set of mage robes. He can equip this outfit in the future if I ask him about it.
string: 瓦尔从最初的边缘法师走到了如今的地位。为了庆祝他完成冬堡学院的学业,我为他制作并赠送了一套魔法长袍。他将来如果我问起这件装备,他可以穿上它。

original: Craft the Seafaring Mage Robes and Boots at a tanning rack
string: 在制皮架上制作航海法师的长袍和靴子

original: Give the Seafaring Mage outfit to Val
string: 给瓦尔赠送航海法师的服装

original: Romancing the Rogue
string: 浪子迷情

original: Val has become very interested in the legend of the Pale Lady. Two people exploring a common interest often leads to them growing closer...
string: 瓦尔对苍白女士的传说产生了浓厚的兴趣。两个人对共同兴趣的探索往往会让他们变得更加亲密…

original: The visit to Frostmere Crypt and witnessing the death of a bandit leader seems to have left Val second-guessing things between us. I should talk to him once we leave the vicinity of the Crypt.
string: 幽空地穴之行以及目睹一个强盗头目的死亡似乎让瓦尔开始怀疑我们之间的关系。我应该在我们离开地穴附近后和他谈谈。

original: After we talked, Val seems to understand that I'm interested in him despite - or because of - his checkered past. I should see what he has planned at Lake Ilinalta.
string: 在我们交谈之后，瓦尔似乎明白了我对他感兴趣，尽管——或者正是因为——他曲折的过去。我应该看看他在伊琳娜塔湖有什么计划。

original: Val and I have been spending a lot of time together, but I'm not sure if he's serious or if I'm just another temporary distraction for him. I might have to do something drastic, like wearing an Amulet of Dibella, to encourage him- or at least get his attention. I should wait until we've stopped for the night in a safe location.
string: 瓦尔和我经常在一起，但我不确定他是认真的，还是我只是他暂时的消遣。我可能不得不做一些极端的事情，比如戴上迪贝拉护符，来鼓励他——或者至少引起他的注意。我应该等到我们在一个安全的地方过夜后。

original: While he initially got the wrong idea, Val seems genuinely interested in becoming closer.
string: 虽然瓦尔一开始的想法是错误的，但他似乎真的很想和我更进一步。

original: I think a daytime outing to Whiterun's Market would be a nice change of pace. I hope Val can manage to stay out of trouble. He thinks I don't notice him scowling at Nazeem.
string: 我觉得白天去白漫市场逛逛会是个不错的改变。希望瓦尔别惹麻烦。他以为我没注意到他在鄙视纳奇姆。

original: Val calls me 'love,' but it seems like just a pet name. I wonder if he's ever even been in love? I might ask him when we've stopped somewhere safe for the night.
string: 瓦尔称我为“亲爱的”，但这似乎只是个爱称。我不知道他是否恋爱过？等我们找个安全的地方过夜时，我也许会问问他。

original: Val and I have been dancing around the idea of commitment to each other. I'd like to know where we stand. He doesn't seem too keen on marriage, but equipping an Amulet of Mara should get the message across all the same.
string: 我和瓦尔一直在为彼此的承诺而纠结。我想知道我们的进展如何。戴上玛拉的护身符应该能传达这个信息。

original: I spent the night with Val. Maybe that was a bit impulsive, but life is short.
string: 我和瓦尔春风一度，也许有点冲动，但人生苦短。

original: I think a daytime outing to Whiterun's Market would be a nice change of pace. However, I've seen Val scowling at Nazeem. I wonder what he's up to?
string: 我认为白天去白漫市场逛逛将是一个不错的突破。然而，我看到瓦尔对纳奇姆怒目而视。不知道他在做什么？

original: Val calls me 'love,' but it seems like just a pet name. He seems to have had no shortage of lovers, but I wonder if he's ever even been in love? I should ask him when we've stopped somewhere safe for the night.
string: 瓦尔叫我“亲爱的”，但这似乎只是个宠物的称呼。他似乎不乏情人，但我不知道他是否曾经恋爱过？等我们在安全的地方过夜后，我应该问问他。

original: Val and I have been dancing around the idea of commitment to each other. I'd like to know where we stand. He doesn't seem too keen on marriage, but equipping an Amulet of Mara should get the message across all the same.
string: 我和瓦尔一直在为彼此的承诺而纠结。我想知道我们的进展如何。戴上玛拉的护身符应该能传达这个信息。

original: Val got the wrong impression entirely. I'm not sure what he expected, but what an arrogant ass!
string: 瓦尔完全误会了。我不知道他期待的是什么，但真是个傲慢的混蛋！

original: I think a daytime outing to Whiterun's Market would be a nice change of pace. But I swear, if Val starts trouble with Nazeem...
string: 我认为白天去白漫市场逛逛将是一个不错的突破。但我发誓，如果瓦尔找纳奇姆的麻烦…

original: Val calls me 'love,' but he can't possibly mean it. He seems to have had no shortage of lovers; I wonder if he'd discard me as easily? I'll have to ask him when we've stopped somewhere safe for the night.
string: 瓦尔称我为“亲爱的”，但他不可能是真心的。他似乎并不缺少情人，不知道他会不会轻易抛弃我？等我们找个安全的地方过夜，我一定要问问他。

original: Val and I have been dancing around the idea of commitment to each other. I'd like to know where we stand. He doesn't seem too keen on marriage, but equipping an Amulet of Mara should get the message across all the same.
string: 我和瓦尔一直在为彼此的承诺而纠结。我想知道我们的进展如何。戴上玛拉的护身符应该能传达这个信息。

original: Val and I are just friends.
string: 瓦尔和我只是朋友。

original: Val and I have decided to chart our course together.
string: 瓦尔和我决定一起规划我们的未来。

original: Val and I are facing rough waters ahead.
string: 瓦尔和我正面临着波涛汹涌的未来。

original: Val and I have decided to chart our course together.
string: 瓦尔和我决定一起规划我们的未来。

original: Val and I are facing rough waters ahead.
string: 瓦尔和我正面临着波涛汹涌的未来。

original: Val and I have decided to chart our course together.
string: 瓦尔和我决定一起规划我们的未来。

original: Val and I are facing rough waters ahead.
string: 瓦尔和我正面临着波涛汹涌的未来。

original: Investigate Frostmere Crypt
string: 调查幽空地穴

original: Speak with Val after leaving Frostmere Crypt
string: 离开幽空地穴后与瓦尔交谈

original: Explore Lake Ilinalta with Val
string: 与瓦尔一起探索伊琳娜塔湖

original: Get Val's attention by wearing an Amulet of Dibella this evening
string: 今晚戴上迪贝拉的护符，引起瓦尔的注意

original: In the morning, talk to Val about last night
string: 早上，和瓦尔谈谈昨晚的事情

original: Visit Whiterun Market
string: 参观白漫城的市场

original: Ask Val about past loves
string: 向瓦尔询问过去的爱情故事

original: What about us?
string: 我们呢？

original: In the morning, talk to Val about last night
string: 早上，和瓦尔谈谈昨晚的事情

original: Visit Whiterun Market
string: 参观白漫城的市场

original: Ask Val about past loves
string: 向瓦尔询问过去的爱情故事

original: What about us?
string: 我们呢？

original: In the morning, talk to Val about last night
string: 早上，和瓦尔谈谈昨晚的事情

original: Visit Whiterun Market
string: 参观白漫城的市场

original: Ask Val about past loves
string: 向瓦尔询问过去的爱情故事

original: What about us?
string: 我们呢？

original: Stand by Me
string: 伴我左右

original: Val carries an old journal with him everywhere, but I never see him write in it.
string: 瓦尔到哪儿都带着一本旧日记本，但我从来没见他在日记本上写字。

original: Val has allowed me to read his private journal. It's filled with entries from his life at sea.
string: 瓦尔允许我看他的私人日记。里面写满了他在海上生活的点滴。

original: Val is starting to open up, although he's not the type to just spill his life story all at once. I should spend some time getting to know him better in various locations.
string: 瓦尔开始敞开心扉，尽管他不是那种一下子就把自己的人生故事都说出来的人。我应该花点时间在不同的地方更好地了解他。

original: Val seems to have a talent for magic despite his lack of formal study. Maybe he just needs some encouragement.
string: 尽管瓦尔缺乏正规的学习，但他似乎有魔法天赋。也许他只是需要一些鼓励。

original: I've helped Val gain the confidence to take his magical studies more seriously. I can continue to get to know him as we adventure together.
string: 我帮助瓦尔获得了更认真对待魔法学习的信心。在我们一起冒险的过程中，我可以继续了解他。

original: It will be hard for Val to move on without resolving the events of the mutiny on the Dark Rose. I should help him with that before pursuing anything else with him.
string: 如果不解决黑玫瑰号叛变事件，瓦尔将很难继续前进。我应该先帮他解决这个问题，然后再跟他做其他事。

original: I wonder if Val misses his ship? He hides it well, but...
string: 不知道瓦尔会不会错过他的船？他藏得很好，但是…

original: Val was betrayed by the man he thought was his best friend and had to fight for his life. That has to weigh on him, no matter that he pretends otherwise.
string: 瓦尔被他认为是他最好的朋友的人背叛了，他不得不为自己的生命而战。这对他来说很重要，不管他怎么假装。

original: Val and I have become close friends and resolved the lies he told me at our first meeting. I hope in time he can forgive himself for Fathis' death.
string: 瓦尔和我已经成为了亲密的朋友，并消除了他在我们第一次见面时对我说的谎言。我希望假以时日，他能原谅自己对于法提斯的死。

original: Read Val's Journal
string: 阅读瓦尔的日记

original: Talk to Val about his journal
string: 与瓦尔谈论他的日记

original: Ask Val to sit and talk sometime
string: 找时间请瓦尔坐下来聊聊

original: Talk to Val while in a store
string: 在商店里和瓦尔聊天

original: Sit and talk with Val at any tavern or meadery
string: 在任何酒馆或草地上和瓦尔坐下来聊天
